They have a myriad of interesting coffee and hot chocolate drinks which are worth scoping out, though prices are really steep and I definitely get the jitters from their coffee after a few hours.  Friendly, scatterbrained service and happy smiles all around!  Decent street parking is available in the early mornings.

Pretty sure I am "supposed to" like this place.  Hip environment (for Brentwood anyway) with lots of minimalist steel and warehousy looking decor.  Hamburgers taste good...but the place doesn't do anything new or unprecedented.  I don't think you'll be disappointed, although its location invites big crowds, many from BHS -- so you can weigh the crowd against the not terribly creative menu which steals from Burger Up, Pharmacy and so on, albeit with a bit smaller patties.  What does The fi mean?

Lowered this.  We won't be back.  We tried to order takeout twice and twice (out of four times total), they forgot part of our order.  Normally unforgivable, but when some young kid is completely indifferent and unapologetic, it really, really makes you furious.  You at least need a manager who apologizes and tries to do something to make up for the incompetence.  But all we got was indifference and the second time we even got attitude because they were trying to close.  I am sure the high school kids will keep you guys going, but it will only last until the next trendy burger joint shows up.

This is my 2nd time here over the past couple years. Last time we saw a mouse running around through the bricks... no big deal I guess considering the layout. Anyway, we just find this place to be overpriced for what you get...the food is good but not great. The menu is extremely limited and really doesn't take advantage of the local farms etc.. I had the duck which was good but also slightly bland. The mushroom soup was great for $9... the mac and cheese was watery and just sloppy..c minus. Service was good but nothing memorable. Not going back....

Service was on point. We were seated quickly even though it was busy. The server came promptly to drop off water and menus. We got a basket of chips and were directed to the salsa bar. We placed our food order and our dinner came out very quickly. I would say under  15 minutes or so. The food itself wasn't very good. It was more like bland American-Mexican food. The service was good, but I wouldn't eat here again.

Pho here is good, but not as good as some other places we've been. The Key is the broth. This one doesn't have much flavor, it's okay though. The only reason I gave three stars is for the calamari and the bubble teas (which are great). The staff is friendly enough. They do have a TV, and comfortable seating. The bathroom is in what I think an awkward spot (in the back, down a hall, past the kitchen) It's an okay experience, if you are in Cherry Hill and want Pho.

I decided to stop and try this place yesterday.  I ordered a Gyro and ice tea to go.  When I got home I see that the pita is burned.  I live on the east side so going back to have it redone seemed worthless. (I should have read the reviews before I went.)

Went in with low expectations. Better than we thought it would be.  Not as good as it could be.  Not a place we would revisit on our own.  If suggested by others as destination there are at least three other Chinese food places we'd suggest first but we wouldn't refuse to go back here either if they insisted.  So, two stars it is.

VIBE:  The interior is pleasant enough for kitschy old-style-American-idea of Chinese décor.  Although it won't win any sparkle clean awards, it was passable.  Appreciated there were tables and booths for seating; we choose the latter.  

MENU & FOOD:  Extensive menu  full of standard American idea of Chinese food like beef broccoli or sweet and sour this-or-that and Mongolian whatsit so if those kind of choices are your Chinese food thing you'll find lots to consider.  If you like "combo plates" they offer those here too at certain times of day including lunch hour.  Food quality was "B-minus-ish".  Generous serving sizes but  we didn't ask for a to-go box for remainder for what its' worth. 

SERVICE:  The server was solo at our lunch time visit and while there were few diners, maybe just five, service was very slow...for water, for tea, for order taking, for food to table, for follow up on check and so on.  Not unfriendly, just not efficient. 

TAKE OUT - NO DELIVERY:  Several people came in for take out while we were there, most seemed like regulars based on the greeting received, and all talked about how they wished delivery were an option while they waited on their food.  This was obviously a discussion had with the server...who also manned the take out desk...before.  She said she too wished they would deliver, but the owners will not do that ever.

PARKING:  Small private lot in front shared with other businesses but always seems to have space available.  Like many parking lots in Eagle, even ones constructed well after ADA rules like this one, the accessible parking (AKA ADA) is laid out incorrectly. That is the strip mall owner's issue not the restaurant's.

ACCESSIBILITY:  Level in the door and throughout.  Standard height seating options.  Loo would be accessible but they had stored furniture in the ladies' which makes it inaccessible for wheelchair users; against the law for 27 years now to have these barriers in place so they must know better.

Nice atmosphere, but had better beer. Ordered a flight and they all seemed to taste the same. Most of the time, flights in my opinion should appeal to different people of the party. This didn't appeal to any one of us. It's possible that I might not know how to appreciate it.

Amazing ambiance and solid service. The menu is slightly more on the traditional side (I appreciate innovative brunch menus!) but everything was tasty.

Had the Brie & Onion omelet as well as the Monkey French Toast to split. The French Toast was really tasty- perfect for all those sweet tooths out there- and the omelet was a standard vegetarian omelet, though I did love the use of brie as layers on top of the omelet (see photo).

Again, nothing SPECTACULAR or out of the ordinary with the dishes but it's a cute spot (love the "diner" feel of the place) that is worth trying at some point.

Ambiance was absolutely wonderful, and the coffee quality matched it. I ordered the Mocha, and was immediately pleased with the china choice and the coffee design. Although it was extremely bitter upon my first taste of it (I'm used to mochas that are extremely sweet upon first sip), once I added about three packs of sugar it was absolutely divine. My sister ordered the Latte, which was also excellent! 

I would definitely come back for the Mocha, as well as to take advantage of the atmosphere to get some work done (though I do feel like it would be difficult since the place is usually packed and thus noisy). I love exploring coffee shops, so it was great to finally experience La Colombe!

Yes, I'm reviewing a fast food restaurant. Yes, I'm talking about a Taco Bell. But after three strikes, I've decided this place is one of the worst fast food restaurants ever.

They consistently forget about the Drive Thru. Multiple times I have had an employee to "hold on a second" and then sat for between 5-10 minutes to place my order with one car in front of me at the window. That is unacceptable to me at a fast food restaurant. 

Food comes out at cold/lukewarm temperatures. 

The last time I went through, I asked for Fire sauce when I ordered, and again at the window. There were no sauce packets in my bag so I asked again. The window attendant handed me mild sauce and shut the window in my face. 

You're better off going to the Taco Bell at 24th and Meridian or just going to another food chain all together. I'm done with this one.

This review is based on the dinning experience. I was invited to this location for a birthday brunch. The party consisted of 13 people. It was a Sunday around noon, the restaurant was pretty much empty aside from one other table that looked like they had ate and had already moved on to the games- seemed like a kids birthday party. Now I know better than to expect a good brunch at an arcade but truthfully there was no reason (at all) for their food to be so bad! Our server was overwhelmed and no one stepped in to help her despite just standing around. The kitchen also looked overwhelmed with 2 chefs initially, a 3rd jumping in and a guy who was in a dress shirt (probably a manager) jumping into help. 

Lets start with my honeys drink, we saw a picture for a fancy bloody mary with bacon and shrimp (the works, etc.) we ordered one and confirmed with our waitress it would bring everything pictured. It did not. In fact 3 others ordered bloody marys afterwards and it got worst- they came with no ice- we had to ask for a cup of ice which didn't help it was like room temperature tomato soup. Third time has to be the charm right? No! Honey asked about the picture bloody mary (again) and this time were informed its an upgrade- he ordered it. This drink took forever to come- turns out they had to cook the bacon- despite the fact there was tons of bacon in almost every other dish ordered which had been served at this point (he ordered his second bloody mary at the same time he ordered his food). The shrimp was disgusting we both spit it out and the bacon was a sad little piece. On to the food, I got chicken and waffles- chicken was okay but the waffles were pancakes cooked in a waffle maker, this was confirmed when i sampled my honeys dish which was the pancakes, they were horrible! How do you mess up pancakes? There were a lot of let overs. I did not get pre meal photos since it took forever to get our food and we were starving. 

Finally our checks took about 30-40 mins to get from the time we asked for them. The manager was close by and seemed unbothered. The benefit to eating here was that we did the eat and play so we got $15 game cards with our food, unfortunately everything took so long that most of our party was unable to use their free game cards.

Finally I will mention that one of the individuals in our party found it very unfair that all these issues affected someones birthday so she addressed it with the manager, anyhow this resulted in our remaining party (about 6 people) getting a round of shots (or sugar water?).

*The arcade was cool and only ran into 1or 2 out of service signs
*Much cheaper than Dave & Busters

It was okay. We sat outside but the wind knocked over a couple of drinks, so we moved inside. Glad we did, because the waitress we had outside wouldn't give us separate checks, while the new waitress we had inside was happy to.

Raw oysters were huge and fresh, but they didn't come with crackers and I forgot to ask. I was just grateful to receive them at all after a 30 minute wait.

Wedge salad was terrific. When I ordered it, the waitress said "It's $1 more than what's on the menu; they just haven't changed the menu." I'm glad she told me, but isn't it the restaurant's responsibility to keep the menu updated? Seems lazy and cheap to me. 

Chargrilled oysters were the WORST I have ever had in my life. Small, hard, dry as a bone, not a drop of butter or olive oil to dip the French bread in. Simply awful! I ate one of someone else's order, or else this would have been the second dish I ever sent back to the kitchen in my entire life.

Atmosphere is extremely chaotic.

Loved, loved, loved. Those brussel sprouts were divine!! I didn't want to stop eating them!! Such a creative mix of flavors that went together perfectly: brussel sprouts, pumpkin, pomegranate and jalapeno. Can't wait to go back just for that dish!

(Note - this was listed under "salads" so I thought it was a cold salad. It's not, it's a full, hot, plate. It would be good if they could offer a half portion as a side dish.)

The masa cake was unbelievable, I've never had anything like it. It was like a cross between custard and tres leches. I loved the citrus garnish and also the little scoop of sorbet served with it.

The pork belly tacos were just okay. They did not have enough filling and seemed very skimpy. Surprised that it didn't have cabbage or slaw in the taco to give it some volume. Was just a tortilla with a small smear of filling.

I also got the horchata cocktail. It was very strong, which some people may like, but I was expecting it to have a stronger flavor of horchata.

My friend had queso fundido and the goat tacos, which she said were fabulous.

The complimentary chips and salsa were okay.

Can't wait to go back!

When I was younger, I loved going to steak places like this.  I would crave cutting into a juicy steak with those big steak knives.  But as I get older and have a greater appreciation for my money, I am just not as impressed with these steak places for the amount of money that is spent.
I use to go to S&W in NYC and enjoyed my meals there; probably because it was paid by my work.  I just had dinner here with my wife at her company party.

We were served Beef Wellington, crabcake, lobster on a cracker, caprese and chicken canapes.  All were very tasty.  
For the main meal, I had the Wollensky salad, filet mignon with side servings of mash potatoes and broccoli.  The salad was very tasty, the steak was succulent and the mashed potatoes were creamy and buttery.  The broccoli was steamed - enough said for that.  
For dessert, I had the cheesecake.  I usually don't eat dessert (but it's Christmas time) and the cake was velvety and melted in your mouth - yum.

The service for the party was actually pretty good.  They were attentive filling drinks and served us quickly and politely.

So the question is, "Is it worth the money?"  For a free meal, hell yeah.
When you price out the salad, filet, sides and dessert for $70 (no drinks or apps) plus tip and tax - that is why I give it 3 stars.  It was good, but not great for the money (unless you have it coming out your butt).

My wife and I just had dinner there.  We split the rosemary and parmesan crispbread.  It was ok, not great not bad.  However, I wish it were warmer.  
My wife had the plank salmon and I had the rainbow trout.  Both dishes were accompanied with potatoes, asparagus and carrots.  Once again, both dishes were ok.
My wife had the carrot cake and she said it was good.
I know I've been reading rave reviews and this was the second time I've eaten here.  I know there is a lot of "buzz" around this place; but for the money, I won't be rushing back.
Also, on this Saturday evening, I think there was a live singer in the bar and she was bad.  Also, it's very loud.  I was sitting very close to my wife and I could hardly hear her.  
To me, if your friends want to go you will think it's ok.  But if you want to go on your own to a nice place, I would look elsewhere.
Wow, this place smelled bad.  But they do serve alcohol.  Just sit outside.

No idea how the pizza is, it looks decent.  I'm assigning one star to this place because the dude taking out the garbage more or less physically assaulted me while I was looking at the pizza, ramming the garbage can into the side of my body, and then - instead of apologizing or at least being neutral about it - gave me a look so dirty that I have to assume it was racial or homophobic or something. It was just hateful. I was about to be a paying customer and instead was physically assaulted.  All the dude had to do was say sorry or excuse me.

Unfortunately, I did not have a positive experience here. My party and I went to HopCat because of the many advertisements around town for their patio. That was the first issue we had - when we arrived, we asked to be seated on the patio and the hostess told us in somewhat of a snarky manner that it was closed - as if we should have known. It rained earlier in the day, but the forecast wasn't calling for any more so I'm not sure what was up with that. 

Anyway, we sat inside and checked out some menus and the surroundings. A nice interior, lots of wood details and some cute decor. The beverage menu was extensive, although they were out of a few options which they use a stamp to convey. 

As we were looking, a server approached us and aggressively told us that we weren't supposed to have cupcakes in the restaurant (there were 3 cupcakes, it was for my friend's birthday) and that we were lucky to even have brought them inside, but that we definitely were not allowed to eat them. We didn't really know what to say because the manner in which we were approached was so brash and again, were spoken to as if we should have known better. I have brought in cakes and cupcakes to restaurants for birthdays many, many times and have never heard this rule before. So her husband asked the lady if we could at least light a candle in one of the cupcakes to take a birthday photo. At first she replied no and then said she'd have to talk to a manager about that because it wouldn't be allowed either, followed by saying that she might be okay with it as long as her manager doesn't see it happen.

A little rattled, we decided to stay and check out the food - we heard about their french fries being nationally ranked by the Food Network. Our actual server was polite and friendly. He got us samples of drinks and worked quickly. We did try the Cosmik fries - they were pretty good, beer battered with pepper and other seasonings with a cheese sauce on the side - but I don't know about living up to the hype (I actually like Schlafly Bottleworks' fries better). Food was fine but a little expensive for the typical bar food that it was. Portions seemed rather small.

So we chose HopCat out of the million places in STL to celebrate my friend's birthday and were pretty disappointed, I do not think any of us will return.

Bardot Cafe is so super sexy! Definitely put it very high on your list for a date-night! I kept looking around at the velvet paisley wallpaper, ornate lighting fixtures, beveled mirrors, and all of the twinkling candles! There were so very many! Oh, and of course you will get your fill of photos of that blonde bombshell the place is named after too! This place has all the cozy, intimate vibes. Ambiance on point 1,000%. 

We came here with a group of 6 women on a Friday at 7pm. We made reservations but the place was fairly empty when we arrived. After tasting what Bardot had to offer I couldn't imagine why. 

Our oh so adorable and handsome waiter (can't remember his name) was very attentive and extremely helpful while I looked over the menu. I had so many questions regarding ingredients and what he didn't know off the top of his head, he found out immediately for me from the kitchen. They actually made a few dishes especially for me and my veg ways! I mean, they really went above and beyond to cater to my dietary needs as their menu normally isn't very vegan friendly. Vegetarian yes, vegan, no, but don't let that stop you. Simple ask! I indulged in the sprouts, Bardot salad as well as the beets, and some frites which were all made dairy free, just for me!! All were tasty, but I remember the golden beets being exceptionally good. 

All of the ladies in our party enjoyed every dish they had. I'm pretty sure our table ordered and split one of each item on the menu....Charcuterie, lamb burger, wild mushroom risotto, sea bass and coulette steak were a few I remembered. Lost of "oohing & ahhhing" from our party. I do notice some changes to the menu. Perhaps they change out a few items seasonally? 

Cocktails were very creative, strong and extremely reasonably priced! I first tasted the 'Lola' which was vodka, cherry, lime, ginger beer and rhubarb bitters. Very good! I then had a 'Little Solider' which was napoleon armagnac, apricot shrub, prosecco, citrus. I would recommend either for a lover of sweeter cocktails, but 'Lola' was a favorite. Man, do I love a cocktail with shrubs and bitters! 

 It's really a sweet little spot on a quaint side street in Northern Liberties. Parking was as you would expect it to be in the area so leave a little time beforehand if you have reservation or just Uber it. 

I kept thinking how much I wanted to bring my husband back as this spot is pretty darn romantic. Perhaps we will try the happy hour one of these days. It's Sun-Fri 5-7pm with $5 bar snacks, $1 off house wine, $1 off well drinks and 1/2 off all beer! 

Highly recommend especially for couples! 

Fab Philly Mom says: you're not going to want the kiddos here with you. Maybe for brunch, definitely not at night.

This place deserves one star for being clean and having friendly customer service.  Those two things, however, are probably not that hard to accomplish when there are no customers in the store during dinner time.  I've decided to try this place after driving by several times - what a mistake!  The hamburger is probably the worst hamburger I have ever eaten.  The meat tasted like it was cooked several years ago, frozen, and then reheated in a microwave.  It was dry, hard, lacked a hint of flavor - disgusting.  The bun and veggies seemed ok, but I ordered a burger not farm raised onions.  Why would a new place trying to get new customers have the audacity to serve such travesty is beyond me. My son got a hot dog, which was eatable, but nothing special.  Turkey sandwich wasn't horrible. The bottom line: I wouldn't go back to this place if they paid me.  I am not sure where the few positive reviews are coming from, but I am guessing they are from customers who had a meal  during a time when they actually cooked the meat on a grill and it was served fresh.  If that's the case, this place is inconsistent, which is hallmark of a bad restaurant.

This place needs a new manager and as far as the server Kate she was terrible. She didn't speak she never said thank u or your welcome... She never asked if we needed anything else or how we were doing... She acted bothered. Food was cold service was terrible I'll never be back.. Wait for this... I'm updating cause it's a couple days later and they took a five dollar tip unauthorized out of my credit card when I put a line through the tip area!!!

First, let me say, I don't drink alcohol and I'm probably the most sports-challenged male you will find these days. So, I know, I must have been crazy to bring my kids to a college sports bar/grill but they said kids were welcome so I figured I would test the theory. Plus, I was armed with a brand new, shiny Groupon that was squarely aimed at satisfying my big burger craving. 

First, the ambience. Let's see, LOUD music reminiscent of a club, check. Multiple flat screens showing most current sports updates, check. How's your lip reading? You'd better be good at it because you can't hear anything from any of them. See previous statement about music.

Next, the service. We were seated immediately (self seating) and the friendly waitress  must have followed us to our table because she popped up instantly to get menus and drink orders. Since I was an Archies virgin, I asked for her recommendation. Teriyaki mushroom burger and onion rings for me and two "Not so giant" burgers with fries for the kiddies. Sounded interesting so we went with it. Food was delivered in a decent time, about 10-15 minutes, and was steaming hot! Good start!

The Teriyaki burger was cooked to order and had a nice slice of pineapple on it. Very interesting flavors and it worked okay. I think the sauce masked the flavor of the burger (or lack thereof) but it was excessive. The onion rings were large, somewhat crunchy and not overly greasy but were lacking in flavor. The kids' Not So Giant burgers were just okay. One cool thing about this place is the perpetual 2 for 1 burger prices for UNR students. Great incentive for college students and if I were one, I would probably frequent this place more often. For the regular, working, non-Groupon toting guy that I am, the value was a little less than desired. And next time, I will choose the outside patio seating to save my aging ears.

I wish I could say curiosity drove me to stop into this little market but that's not the case. My wife saw a recipe for vegan BBQ Jackfruit that is supposed to taste so much like meat you wouldn't miss it. She remembered seeing canned jackfruit at this store so.... the request goes straight to the top of the Honey-Do list and off I go! I like to try new things and experience different cultures so this was my cultural adventure for the week.  

When I got to the store I was pleasantly surprised to see the store was clean and well organized. The staff not only spoke very good English, they were friendly and engaging. I didn't feel like a total stranger just because I didn't speak their language. More importantly, the prices are very good compared to other Asian markets that I've been to. 

I love to see the different products that are popular in other cultures and this little market did not disappoint. 
I was completely enthralled by the variety of different drinks that they had in their refrigerated section. I will definitely be back to explore some of those. 

One thing to note, the store was very cold and everyone was wearing a coat so bring one if you come.

Came here because I wanted to try something different than Steves and figured since their whole business model is authentic cheesesteaks it would be a win win but it was a fail. 

Restaurant is super clean. Nice eat in area. Tvs playing sports - so from first impression I thought I was in for a good treat. Ehh looks can be deceiving. 

Ordered myself a chopped original it wit wiz. Hubby ordered original sliced wit wiz. Then we ordered cheese fries and buffalo wings. Got home and me and my hubby swapped halves so we could try chopped and sliced versions. Consensus was chopped was better which is odd because we are always usually sliced fans. Anyway the bread was just okay, wiz kind of bland and we could barely taste the fried onions. Fries were soggy but they were crinkle cut which I love. Fries were the best of all items ordered. Wings sucked so bad. First the blue cheese was horrible. Wings were dry and they weren't the right type to absorb the sauce - hard to explain but not a fan. 

I'm critical because they advertise the philly experience but I could have gotten a better cheesesteak from a random pizza place joint for a cheaper price. So they fail to execute their claim to fame.

OK, so this one was tough to be a vegetarian with a teeny tiny sweet tooth at, but it was still probably my favorite restaurant we visited on our recent EATINGOURWAYTHROUGHTHECITY trip to NOLA. We went for Saturday Jazz Brunch & the experience was just amazing! I haven't seen service like that in eons (but I'm not that old, mind you!) Impeccable attention to detail. Total old school sophistication and elegance. We were almost overwhelmed from arrival to departure. The hostess informed us (cool factoid!) the wallpaper was hand designed by a famous artist for the restaurant. It was beautiful! The only disappointing thing were the gentlemen in the restaurant who did not adhere to the Jacket Required rule (a tee shirt & jeans.... Really?) The wandering jazz trio was terrific! Serenading each table with a special request or two, great music, amazing voices... a wonderful touch! This is a very meat-friendly (or should I say not-meat-friendly!) restaurant. We both enjoyed a couple of ice block Bloody's to start yum! My husband drooled over Chef Tory's Jazz Brunch (a speciall game/foul jumbalaya du jour, which he really drooled over!); eggs cuchon de lait (which I'd hoped to have eggs, until I heard about the ham in the hollandaise and shredded pork as the bed) and finished off with the creole bread pudding souffle with whiskey cream sauce on top!) He nearly exploded. Again, I was trying to go vegetarian, but it was nearly impossible. The waiter, while sincerely kind, once he finished RAVING about the cuchon de lait (& I told him while it sounded so rich, that I was a vegetarian) looked at me like "Well what the hell are you doing here then?" (with complete kindness of course!) and suggested the pancakes. My starter was the fresh fruit parfait with whipped yogurt (sooooo tasty - but man, sweet, sweet, sweet!), followed by the pancakes (not on the menu now, but rather sweet cakes topped with seared pineapple, mango, creme freche, pecans, white chocolate & LOADS of syrup) - they were delicious, truly, but for someone with a minor sweet tooth, it was a lot of sweet! Since I had a 3 course meal, I had to order a sweet dessert (poor me!) special apple coffee cake that was really quite yummy! Strong, delicous coffee topped it all off. All in all: AH-MAZING! Go. Worth the cost just for the experience alone (& if you ask my husband, for the game "soup"!) Go.

I went to dinner @ Grillsmith with my family. The facility is really pretty, and I really enjoyed the decor. The experience and food were a miss for me though. Upon asking if we'd been there before, the hostess said "I'll make sure you get a good server," which if our waitress was good, I'd be concerned to have a "bad" server. It took forever for the waitress to take our order, and it wasn't busy. We ordered two steak meals with fries and vegetables. Both of which came out cold...not even warm like it had been sitting under a warmer. But after waiting so long to get dinner, it wasn't worth it to have it reheated. (Having to reheat a $30 steak isn't really acceptable, anyway). The fries were cold. They're supposed to be "kicked up fries" with extra garlic and herbs, but were really nothing out of the ordinary. The flavor of the steak was good, just unfortunate that the food was cold. Finally, the ladies restroom was completely out of soap- the soap pump had been opened up like people had been trying to shake it upside down to get soap out. (And that it had likely been out of soap for a while) Here's hoping the waitstaff has a separate bathroom stocked with soap to ensure food safety :/

bad bad bad BAD BAD food and experience!  Does anyone realize they use the cheap a$$ bread that places like Abner's uses for cheap a$$ cheesesteaks?!  This place actually makes me kinda mad!  It's this dirty hole in the wall that has a bright yellow menu with red writing like one of those gross fried chicken or Tex Mex places you find in any major city.  You walk in and the smell of grease is so heavy in the air.  Thennnnn, you order with the owner's little son who messes up my order (I definitely said Vietnamese BBQ pork hoagie--and yup! they call them HOAGIES here) and they give me what is usually the house special one (Vietnamese ham, Vietnamese meat and pork).  They YELL at me when I point this out and after I give them some little girl Asian attitude (my boyfriend was with me and heard me say BBQ pork--he doesn't like fake ham/meat like SPAM so we definitely wouldn't order anything but tofu or pork bahn mi) they reluctantly make me a new one.

Reasons to never come here again:

1.  They use sriracha sauce instead of jalepeno peppers.  NOT OK.

2.  The bread, as mentioned above.

3.  The pork is SAUSAGE...cheap breakfast-meat sausage and they add some Asian sauce to it to try to make this.  Is this for real???

4.  There's one piece of cucumber and the skin is left on.

5.  Did I mention that you feel like you jumped into vat of oil when you walk in?

People come in here to get chips, soda and a greasy burger.  It's a shame that people get bahn mi here.  It's the most gross tasteless fake bahn mi I've ever eaten.  If there's a 0-star option, this place would get it.

Ok.  So this is my take on this place.  Seated promptly.  Arrived at 5:30 but quickly filled up by 6:00
The craft beer selection was very very good rating them a 4 out of a 5.  This is also said for the bottle list. Got to try some incredible beers.  
The food was good but, BUT portions were small, for the price.  I ordered the sirloin steak, with cauliflower mushrooms, sweet potato purée broccoli rabe and broccoli spears, in au jus sauce.  29.00. I'll bet with all due respect the portion was 6 ounces.  Maybe 8, but I don't think so.  Either way, for 29.00, THATS CRAZY!!!! By looking around, the burger was the way to go!  
Another reason for the 3 stars was the activity up and down the dining room.  I guess instead of walking through the bar area, they cut through the dining room.  Annoying for those quiet dinners.  Too much traffic!

I've been coming to Foxy's for years and have only had lunch/dinner menu items. 

I usually get one of their hoagies. Ingredients are fresh and everything is prepared well. I've also had seafood and pizza which is pretty good. I always have to get a side of curly fries... they beat out Arby's any day. 

Service is usually pretty fast and straight to the point. They offer both indoor and outdoor seating. Prices are good for the quality. 

A good spot to hit up for some comfort food or seafood before going out to the beach!

I was in the mood for Greek and didn't want to drive fat. I remembered this place had recently opened and was somewhat close to home. I placed an order for pick up: a falafel wrap with a side of Greek salad. 

I arrived about 15 minutes later. One of the staff members told me to wait at one part of the restaurant without acknowledging me, but the woman who took my order immediately realized that I had placed a pick up order and stated she was putting my order together. As she was ringing me up, she told me she included a side of hummus. How nice, I thought. 

I opened my to go container and saw the wrap and a huge portion of a Greek salad. 

When I got home and further inspected my order, there were a ton of onions on the salad. Yes, it was a huge portion for a side, but a lot of onions and not enough potato salad and tomatoes. The tomatoes also did not seem very ripe. It was an okay salad overall, but I've had better and tastier Greek salads. 

I tried the side of hummus because I planned on putting it on my wrap, but it was so bland. I didn't end up having a lot of it. 

The pita wrap was meh. It didn't taste very fresh, but it was grilled. The falafel was somewhat hard and also didn't taste as fresh. It did have good flavor to it, though. I enjoyed the tzatziki thought the flavor was good as well. The tomatoes on the wrap were the same as on the salad - not very fresh. 

I really wanted to like this place because it is close to home, but it was average at best. My advice for this place is to have fresher ingredients. If these improvements are made, I may consider returning.

Came here last night for dinner. My husband got the taco special (steak tacos with pineapples) and I got the vegetarian tostadas. We both started which horchata which was amazing! They gave us an order of chips and salsa to start while we waited for our entrees. The tortilla chips were freshly fried, however, some were crispier and some where soggier. The salsa was okay; it was thin and was mild to medium. My husband's tacos were very good, according to him. I loved the veggie tostadas. They had a perfect balance of freshness and crispness. It was the best part of the meal. The staff were very friendly and the place is clean and simple. We are glad to have another authentic spot in Pinellas Park and plan to come back soon.
50 minutes for dinner and a surly manager makes for a negative experience

We have been coming here for a few years now.. The sushi has never been omg amazing but it has always been a good go to. Today 8/12... Place is at about 1/4 capacity.. service is way too slow. I have been here when it has been packed and service was faster. It's like all the sushi chef's are in party mode. There are plenty of them but they are not really doing anything. There was one outside leaning on the window smoking with some people and came in and grabbed a bunch of drink cups. No washing hands or really protecting himself from the smoke. Our server seems to be somewhere in space. We have been checked on by some other server that is running her butt off. I have never seen this place like this. This is very disappointing. I think it's going to be awhile till we come back or recommend them.

I'm a huge fan of the Del Pez in Newark and have been a regular customer since it opened. I decided to take the trip to the new location for a change, but unfortunately everything I love about the other location they lack here. 
On a side note-  It definitely wins for the space and décor-- they did a great job. 
We sat at the bar, and I ordered my favorite Mexican Beer that I LOVE to say they have at the Newark Location, Victoria, but nope not here. 
Then we ask If we could have some of the famous corn nuts that they always make at the Newark Location, nope, we don't do them here. 
Next up, we order the Nachos, because we LOVE the plantains that they use at the Newark Location that makes them different, and like nothing else you can get at other Mexican Restaurants, nope not here. They give you the generic pre-made chips. 
So, we took another look at the menu, but they didn't have either of our favorites from the other location, so we decided to leave and go somewhere else. 
We were very disappointed that this place is so different than the other one. 
We will definitely go back to the first location, but this one doesn't have anything special about it. I can buy a $12 Margarita and pre-made chips just about anywhere.

I'll keep it simple. 25 minutes to receive soup appetizer. Our waiter is buddies with couple behind us ..who during our meal watches videos, and holds conversation on their speakerphone. Speak to maitre d and he offers to validate our parking....we didn't park there. A real shame. So many good memories of this place.

How can I many ways can I say awful? Let's start with the loud country music on the sound system. The music was annoying  at the level it was set at. I should not have to raise my voice to have a conversation with the person across the table. The decor is a reused wood interior. It reminded me of a wooden cave. Dark and monochromatic. Not attractive. 
My wife  ordered the brisket for lunch with mac and cheese and steamed veggies. I ordered the breakfast burger. My wife's entree came with more bbq sauce on the plate than meat. There were 4 skimpy pieces of brisket. It was hard to determine if the brisket was good because of the amount bbq sauce the.meat was swimming in. The bbq sauce tasted as if it was off the shelf KC's Masterpiece or Kraft.  It should have come on the side so the patron could decide how much or little was appropriate for their taste. The mac and cheese was bland and lacked the taste of cheese. Bad bad bad. 
The burger I ordered was supposed to be done medium. Instead I got a lump of meat charcoal on a roll. The Sous or chef should be  ashamed of themselves for presenting this in the window for service. This is cooking 101.

The service was painfully slow. I could understand if the place was jumping, but my wife and I were the only food patrons.

Avoid this place. The closing of this place cannot come soon enough.

Our visit to Cafe Beignet started with me ordering a mint julep for $5.  "You drink whiskey now?" my husband asked.  "There's whiskey in a mint julep?" I chirped back at him.  The bartender was friendly and warned me that they don't use fresh mint, they use their own mint syrup.  

$5 cocktails and a seat to watch a local jazz band play?  Sure, I'll take it!  The drinks were decent, but not worth ordering a second.  They're making their money off of the people who want to sit and listen to the band play.  You can get some great pictures and virtually free entertainment here.

Since I'd had a few cocktails prior to this, I needed water.  I went back up to the bar and asked for a cup of water.  A waitress, who didn't bother looking up from her phone, curtly told me they only serve bottled water.  I think the bartender would've given me the water, if the waitress wasn't there, just judging by the expression on her face.  I asked how much the water was, and again not looking up, the waitress mumbled, "two dollars."  

That was my last impression of Cafe Beignet, because we left promptly after that.  

Being on Bourbon Street, it's hard to miss.  And being in the center of everything, it's still worth a visit.  Order a cocktail or some coffee, listen to the band, and then GTFO.

We came for dinner. They had a special of the day, the Lobster Seafood Pot. It was on sale for $25. Normally $39. We both tried it. The seafood was too soft. It must have been in a big pot and simmering for a while. We also had the octopus appetizer. It was also to soft. The cooks need to do a better job on the seafood. 
The restaurant is located adjoining to a hotel. It was clean with a large bar with one tv. 
Don't think we would be going back.

We have been here at least 20 to 30 times over the course of our life. We go sometimes just for drinks. They have live bands had a huge sitting area. Great spot to hang out with your friends.
Location is great. Right in the middle of River Rd in the heart of the action. Big outside sit down and bar area to take in the sites and people watch.
Food is good, we usually get the burgers and apps.
Great selection of beers. Never disappoints.

I'm excited that there's something on Mass Ave that has a fast food "feel" without actually being fast food. The falafel wrap with a side Greek salad is about $10 and is a big portion. The food is super fresh and made to order. There is some indoor seating but it's a small space and gets super cramped during peak hours (lunchtime).

Pricey, but good. $15 for two tall lattes. Worth it for a treat every once in a while! Cute little place with some outdoor seating. I love the drink options. I do wish they had some hot food options to make it a breakfast option!

Ordered delivery on slice and it delivered very quickly which is always a plus. They are also open late which is good. However the food was rough. The mozz sticks were the frozen kind they just toss in a fryer to heat up. The sauce was cold and the mozz sticks were lukewarm at best. The pizza was greasy and the crust itself was horrendously bad. One of the worst crusts on a pizza I have ever had honestly. Wont try again.

Best Eggs Benedict in town? More like best on the PLANET! Innumerable thanks  to Robert S. for suggesting PJs  - not only do they have benedicts to die for, ALL their food is fantastic! And it comes paired with (hands down) the best waitstaff in all of Reno. You will have a great meal here, guaranteed. 

We were in town for the Balloon Races and thankfully PJs opened extra early just for the event. While the rest of Reno were sleeping off hangovers, PJs was packed with patrons enjoying an early morning breakfast. Even though the place was hopping, we were greeted warmly, seated quickly, and our order was taken immediately and cheerfully. The water and coffee refills never stopped, which was amazing considering how busy our waitress was. I saw a kid at one table knock a huge glass of orange juice onto her, but she took it in stride and with a laugh quickly cleaned it up off the table and herself and kept working hard without missing a beat. Her shirt and pants were completely soaked with sticky juice, but she just kept going with a grin on her face. Impressive! 

Having been up since 4am we were exhausted and starving, but due to packed conditions I thought for sure we'd have quite a wait for our food. To our great surprise (and happiness) our food arrived quickly and steaming hot. Not only were the portions more than generous for the price (you WILL have leftovers) but the food was also incredibly delicious. 

My PJ's Eggs Benedict ($11) were the best I've ever tasted in my life - three huge, perfectly cooked poached eggs atop thick slabs of Candian bacon and tomato, smothered in a bright and lemony out-of-this-world sauce. The waitress explained it isn't like other sauces, having sherry in it, and was I okay with that (I was). You'll really love this version, I promise you! Normally the amount of sauce served is so skimpy I have to ask for extra, but this time there was so much I couldn't even SEE the English muffin!  I am especially grateful to the waitress who suggested adding avocado, as it's not listed on the menu (it's an "insider's secret" apparently). It really amped up this already incredible dish; I strongly suggest adding it if you like avocado. To make things even better, the chef somehow managed to add a heaping portion of perfectly cooked red potatoes to the already groaning plate. Oh man were they yummy. 

The hubs had the hugantic breakfast burrito ($11) Stuffed with eggs, cheese and meat, it came mounded over with wonderful salsa, avocado, and was crowned with dollop of sour cream as big as a chihuahua's head. Had the burrito come on the plate alone, it would have been impressive enough, but believe it or not, it was nearly crowded off the plate by a huge pile of red potatoes and onions, which were themselves nestled up against a similarly large portion of refried beans smothered in two types of cheese. I felt like we'd died and gone to Mexico. It was brilliant.

Do yourself, your tastebuds and your wallet a favor. Come to PJs. If it tastes this good to a person half asleep after the 5am Balloon Races, I can only imagine how good it must be to enjoy this magnificent food and service when you're fully awake.

Not the cleanest buffet I have seen.  Also, this company has been charged with credit card fraud and human trafficking.  Is that somewhere that you want to spend your money?  Not me.  There are several other options in the area if you are looking for asian cuisine.

First off, I'm Italian, so it's tough to get a 4 from me. This place is funky!!!  Down stairs and kind of dark!  I had a salad and meatball sandwich. The salad was great, with mozzarella on it!!!  Too many Italian restaurants don't do this. The sandwich was nice!  Great taste and soft bread!  I would have liked more sauce and cheese; no such thing as too much sauce or cheese!!!  If I was back in this area and wanted Italian, I'd go back again!!!
The atmosphere is divine compared to the other local hibachi restaurants. The drink specials were an added touch! Hibachi was pretty good and sushi also. I will definitely bring friends here.

A very interesting twist in pizza, it's like ordering a burrito at moes.  Many different selections for pizza, If you like pizza try this place out.  They are personal pizza's for a great price.  They brought me the wrong pizza so my experience was not the greatest.

I decided to take my mother here for a Mother's Day lunch. What a disappointment!!! We were seated immediately. Our waitress quickly came by put two forks (no knives) on the table and offered drinks. We went (what I'm guessing was a special) w/ $2 Coors Light drafts. My mother loves seafood, so she ordered the shrimp salad. I ordered the chicken cutlet club and some crab fries. Within maybe 2-3 mins the waitress dumps off my mother's salad. A minute after that, here comes the fries, a minute after that, my sandwich. Would it be THAT hard to deliver the food all at once?! I am convinced that nothing here is made to order. The chicken cutlets were more like 3 small/thin chicken dried out chicken fingers on an over sized roll. My mother's salad was just a pile of romaine lettuce, maybe 4 grape tomatoes, another 4-5 croutons, and maybe FIVE little shrimp! All for the low price of $12.00! And the fries were overcooked to top things off. 

My mother looked at me and said this was the worst salad she's ever had. Then she said, we should have went to Longhorn down the street, which I wholeheartedly agreed. I brought her here because that's where she wanted to go since she's never been to the ones in Philly. I'm never spending another dime at this joint again. It seems like they're more about turning tables over than seeing people enjoy a meal.

I dont know how to sugar coat it.... my order was simply not executed well.

Its a little crazy that a restaurant can feature several different kinds of eggs benedict on the menu but now know how to prepare a poached egg.   I got the steak benedict  - and my eggs were completely hard boiled.     You just time them for 3 minutes in the water and they come out perfect.   They must do this a hundered times a day but they still come up with hard boiled eggs?       The steak was a little tough too but I could have lived with it if that was the only issue.   Also, I think there was a total of one teaspoon of hollandaise sauce drizzled over both eggs.    Come on - try a little !

So the falvors were there....it was simply not executed well.   Get the head chef in there for some quality control.   

Service was very friendly and prompt.   I give the servers an A+ but that doesnt make up for the subpar food that was served.

Where do i start...

Better half and I spent the entire weekend trying new places and so far so good until we ventured here. First thing is their website advertises a Live band starting at 7pm... Live music consist of an old dude playing hand drums to a recorded track...:( That is not live music! No offense to the guy on the hand drums but it made the scene feel like the movie "Cocoon" just an old dude pounding on drums..felt like a senior citizens home. 

Next our waiter must have had laryngitis because she kept wispering EVERYTHING! my wife and I kept saying HUH?!...HUH?!!! Can you speak up?! 
Finally our order came, my wings were ok but my wife order was wrong so she had to send it back,..once they brought her proper order the fish wasn't cooked all the way through :( by this time we were ready to get the Heck outta there!


I don't see myself venturing here again, there was nothing worth wild worth coming back to...

After all the great reviews I've read about this place it was time i checked it out myself  for my wife's bday.....

The Good:  Upon arrival we where greeted with very friendly valet workers. Took the escalator upstairs to the restaurant where we were greeted by a very professional, friendly hostess. Inside decor is dimly lit providing an romantic atmosphere. Our waiter Suki was AWESOME! being it was our first time here she offered suggestions and took her time explaining what dish is what.  I ordered the Shrimp Scampi and my wife ordered the surf & turf that came with steak and lobster tail. She LOVED her meal while i didn't care for mine at ALL!  TIP:  When you go to a restaurant for the 1ST time that specializes in STEAK order the STEAK!! I tried some of my wife dish and almost slapped myself for not trying the one thing I brought us here for!!!  Anyway,...Overall experience was great! I think the owner or Manager came by our table to wish my wife Happy  Birthday , then Suki brought my wife a box a some sort of chocolate cookie things along with a gift card...HOW FREAKING NICE IT THAT!!! 

The Bad:  OK well I expected the price to be expensive so it wasn't a shock our bill totaled $138.00 so Nothing really bad to say about Fleming's!

Overall: I will return over and over again! The price was well worth the experience and the superior customer service! great place to take your spouse or whoever here to celebrate any occasion.

We came here based on the hype but were a bit disappointed to find it really didn't live up. The bartenders were NOT knowledgeable about their products and had a hard time making any recommendations. In addition, the craft beer selection was pretty abysmal.
The only reason I'm giving a 3 instead of a 2 is the food. They really seem to have the right idea as far as menu items go however the two dishes we tasted unfortunately lacked balance. Ben F got the Gangster's Sweet Spot (Vanilla Cinnamon French Toast stuffed with strawberries and cream cheese with maple syrup and fruit on the side) which he found to be sweet on sweet on sweet. He usually loves this type of dish but found it was completely unbalanced. 
I had Bootleggers Toast (Poached eggs, tomato, basil, olive oil, balsamic reduction, queso fresco and avocado "smash"). It sounded promising and I can confirm the ingredients tasted fresh however the avocado was not smashed. It was cut into large, thick slices which were awkward to navigate with all the other delicate ingredients . The dish in it's entirety was just kinda bland. The only part that had flavor was the balsamic which was drizzled very sparingly over the top with a huge puddle residing beneath a large section of toast, rendering it inedible.
Overall, they've got good bones but lots of opportunity for improvement!

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time but unfortunately I was really disappointed when I actually got my food. Everything I'd heard led me to believe it was a "bowl based" menu similar to Korean bibimbap style, but I was sorely mistaken. The dishes contain only rice and meat, sides/veggies cost extra. I rarely, if ever, complain about prices because I firmly believe you get what you pay for when it comes to both food and service, however, I didn't enjoy paying $1.50 extra for a little tiny portion of kimchi since this is typically something included in Korean meals. Aside from that, the flavor just wasn't there. The sauce was not spicy at all and there wasn't enough of it. Not somewhere I would go again.

I, like some of the reviewers before me, was underwhelmed by Charley's. There were some very positive points, but also some definite opportunities for improvement.
The bar and dining areas are quite impressive, however, the restrooms are a bit shabbier than I expected, based on the price point. 
We had seafood samplers to start with, which were spot on. Everything tasted fresh and was well-prepared. Everyone enjoyed their salads and although the plating of the Caesar was a little old-fashioned, the flavors were nice.
Now the steaks. Most of us ordered the filet and were disappointed to find that we really couldn't taste the flavor of the steak itself as it was completely overwhelmed by what seemed to be liquid smoke flavor. As a steak lover, I was saddened to find that I could not eat more than a few bites...the flavor was just too strong. Others at the table had similar experiences with the steak. The shared sides were a bit on the small side for "family style" sharing and the grilled veggies tasted as if they'd had the same treatment as the steak. 
Overall, I'd return for the seafood, however, I would not return for the steak.
I just got bacon on my fries. I enjoyed it until I got to the bottom of the container and there was a dead bug in it. If not for the bug, I'd be raving about this place.

Meh...this really isn't my kind of place. 

Helen Fitzgerald's is owned by the same people who own Sybergs, which means a lot of their menu items are the same.

I came here on a Friday night for a friend's birthday party. There was a group of about 6 of us, which isn't a terribly big party. But our waiter seemed to have issues taking care of us. Not sure what was going on there, but he kept forgetting drink orders, not keeping our water glasses full, etc. Eventually we just asked him to keep the water pitcher at our table. 

The food was mediocre and overpriced, IMO. I ordered the shark bites appetizer, and it was just meh. I remember the shark bites being SO good at Syberg's when I went there years ago! Maybe my tastebuds have changed or the quality has gone down, because these weren't impressive at all. 

Coupled with the inattentive service, I doubt I'll come back to Helen Fitzgerald's anytime soon.

Wow. Yum! I was in the area after a run on Grant's Trail (LOVE!), and I was craving Chinese food like, hardcore. 

Enter Bo Fung Chinese Kitchen. I read all of the other five star reviews, saw the glowing reviews of the hot braised chicken, and I knew I had to go. I was on my way, YEAH!

I called in my order of hot braised chicken and crab rangoon while I was driving there. When I arrived, my food was ready for me, and still piping hot. YUM! Oh, and the girl working there was the nicest girl ever. She was so sweet that I actually tipped on a carryout order (and I rarely do that! Don't call me cheap...)! 

She gave me a bajillion fortune cookies, and I also had to buy a couple of almond cookies. Yum. Tempting. 

Anyway, the food. I got home and tore into it! SO yum. The hot braised chicken was DELICIOUS. Food orgasm! It was lightly breaded, and the sauce was amazing and not too heavy or overpowering. AMAAAAAZING. 

I love that I got such a large amount of food for so cheap! Wow. Oh, and they only accept credit cards for orders over 7 bucks, so keep that in mind. 

I can't wait to return and try something else. Until then...5 STARS!

5 stars for an awesome run, 5 stars for amazing Chinese food, and 5 STARS FOR THE WINE THAT I'M DRINKING NOW. Yum. Mmm. Tipsy Stephanie for the win, yall!

This Mediterranean restaurant has been voted the Best of Boise for many years in a row.  The food is great, but the service tonight was less than great.  They may have been busy with take out orders, I'm not sure, but our pre-order was quite botched.  Both lentil soup containers were only half full, one platter accompaniment to a gyro was totally missing, and the chicken shwarma was not in a pocket pita as ordered.

We did enjoy the gyros, hummus and vege platter, but since this is the second time the service has been sub- par, we are wondering what has happened to the quality service we have in earlier visits.

Definitely above average, and although I can't say for sure maybe one of the best in town, but I was unpleasantly disappointed with my meal, whig included the much loved dan dan noodles. Points for byob status, chill waitstaff, huge tables in the basement, and a surly Mr. Han who will visit your table.  I'm a bit spoiled after living next to a Grand Sichuan up north, so I may be back to amend this review as my search continues.

This place is so big...don't get lost.

Paisano's sucks - don't bother going. Stax was pretty good, and I liked the concept of building your own burger.

I didn't stay in the hotel so I can't say anything.

We absolutely love the Datz in Tampa. Our first (and last) experience at this location was awful. We were seated almost immediately. Our waitress was extremely rude and passive aggressive. It took her over 20 minutes to get a drink menu. She argued with us when asked if we could get a coffee drink re-made that had globs of cinnamon in it. No apology, rolled her eyes when she was walking away, and slammed the kitchen door open. At no point were we rude to her. We were trying to enjoy the weekend with our family and left after getting our drinks. I understand that people have a bad day, but this was uncalled for. We will not be recommending this location to any friends and family-- such a disappointment.

We were so excited after reading the reviews! Bummer,...maybe because it was 2nd Saturday night, maybe other reviewers had a lot of drinks prior to reviews. But what I know for sure, we didn't experience the awe inspiring food others did! We met there a party of 12 with reservations for my sisters birthday. We ordered rum drinks and apps. The drinks were all over the map..some so strong you couldn't drink them, some so horribly sweet you couldn't stand it. The beer on tap served warm, in a warm glass, and the restaurant was so hot, all 12 of us were using our napkins to dab sweat from our brow. It was like we were being pranked. The Calamari was oil soaked and over seasoned with an annoyingly large amount of cinnamon. The Maui and scallop cevechi gave me and another diner a large mouth full of dirt! For the price and the quality, we were completely underwhelmed! We had planned on ordering dinner, but after the apps only 2 of our 12 bothered to give an entree a try. They regret it. The street tacos, with steak, plain, no seasoning and lacked any uppmh on the presentation. The poquito shrimp tacos, well they lived up to their name, as you could barely find the shrimp. We are moving on this evening, if you see this place, you should move on too! There is way better food and service elsewhere!

I was a bit underwhelmed by the service and pizza at Pizzeria Vetri.  The sauce on the margherita was good but there wasn't a wow factor to the pizza at all.  Service the day I went was also very strange and scattered.  I would definitely pass on this place and save your $$$.   Get your pizza fix from somewhere else.

Decent bar with a good beer selection and not too far from the streetcar stop.

We sat on the balcony and enjoyed some some fresh air and a nice view of Magazine street.  Great option on a nice day!

What I got:
-American IPA
-Southern-Style IPA
-Red Ale
-Kolsch w/ Hemp
-Imperial Stout
-Beet Hummus
-Pretzel Bites

What I would get again:
-Imperial Stout
-Beet Hummus

I'm kind of on the fence with Dunedin Brewery.  At least I know if I were ever to return, there would be something on the menu worth my "beer buds."

I've been twice now and the service was okay the first time, and really bad the second time. We ordered nachos and they ran out?? Then, half our group ordered a mixed shot and the waitress came back 20 min later and said they didn't have one of the ingredients for that so what did we want instead? It was very awkward, they should have suggested something else in that circumstance and the waitress just didn't know how to handle herself or manage a table. Our food took SO long and I finally asked when it was coming because we had an event to get to. She went and checked and it was ready, which I think it had been waiting for some time because nothing was warm. All in all a pretty unpleasant dining experience.

First, let me say that the food and drinks here are always great.  I haven't had anything on the menu that I didn't enjoy. The atmosphere is neat too; you can sit outdoors (if you can get a table) and inside - both have funky, fun decor. But, the downside - the service is always SLOW! Everyone is friendly, but expect to wait 20 minutes before your drink order is even taken. Then, you might as well order two because you don't know when she'll be back.

Visited here for the first time on Friday night (6/24/2016) for wings.  Despite the parking lot being PACKED, we were seated right away.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive.  My boyfriend ordered mild and cajun wings, while I ordered the garlic parmesean ones.  We were happy with all three flavors.  The wings were large - lots of meat - and crispy.  The flavors were great too. We're picky about our wings, but we will definitely be back here!

We ddin't come during a specific game, but it is worth mentioning that there were a LOT of tvs around the bar.  We'll be back for a Phillies or Eagles game in the future.
Diner-grade food.  A local establishment where the food is as doldrum as the company.  My ceasar was a joke.  Go for the beer and karaoke, don't go for the food.

Love, love, love this place! Visited NOLA the first weekend of October and lucky us, it was within walking distance from our hotel. It was a Saturday morning around 10:30 and we waited about 45 minutes to be seated. BUT..drum roll please..they have the nicest servers that will bring you drinks while waiting. I highly recommend the Bacon Bloody Mary because it was amaze and who doesn't love bacon?! They have inside or outside seating and the inside is way bigger than it looks from the outside. To the important stuff - FOOD! I am an omelet addict and this place filled my expectations. Superb and tasted very fresh. The 3 others I joined with had no complaints either! See my pics for delish dishes at The Ruby Slipper (sorry I don't remember the names of what my crew ordered!). Point is, click those heels and wish to be at The Ruby Slipper. You'll be happy you did!

Tried this hidden gem on a Thursday night and it was one of the top best Mexican restaurants I've been to! Love the atmosphere, service was quick and food was tasty. Chips and salsa are served with every meal. I ordered the Jalisco Special - shrimp, chicken, chorizo, onions and peppers with cheese sauce w/rice and beans. Also came with tortillas, but very good eaten without too! I'll definitely be back. I didn't get a pic of my friend's Carnitas Tacos, but my oh my they looked good! Muy buena!
5 starts for their shakes but only 2 for the burgers. Beef patties were somewhat tasteless and the fries could be better. I was expecting something in lines of 5 guys. Nice decor

Pass this one by..really..first hints it might not be great..a kitty cheap curtain going into the kitchen, mashed potatoes, mc donalds like apple pie do NOT belong on a chinese buffet!!  Go to the chinese buffet in Countryside instead..its better, not great but better. This place was overpriced, food was mostly cold or old looking/tasting and i'm not an overly picky eater btw..really was "blah"..we won't go back..even the cream puffs tasted stale. Meh...

i think all steak & shakes are slow and overpriced. They seem to all have poor service. The do have some of the best hangover food around. I particularly love their chili and they have a salted pretzel shake that is the perfect salty-sweet for any ladies suffering with pms cravings. :)

So the last time I came here, I left with a very bad taste in my mouth. Why you ask? Is it because of the food? No.. It was the service pertaining to the food that I was VERY upset about. We order 2 bowls of pho and a rice plate. The order they got wrong was the rice plate. We ordered thit nuong/flame broiled pork, what was brought out was shrimp. When I told the waiter that we didn't order shrimp he didn't even attempt to try to fix the problem. He just told me "No, you ordered Shrimp". I told him we did not because the child that is eating the rice plate does not eat shrimp. He walked back to the kitchen and again, "No you ordered number XX". I told him maybe the waitress/lady wrote down the wrong number, but it was then obvious that this guy was not going to back down and did not want to take this plate back to the kitchen. My friend didn't want to make a scene at the restaurant and she was already enjoying her bowl of pho, so she basically felt pressured into taking the plate to which her daughter did not eat the shrimp. Water never got refilled and service was non existence after that.

Yes, Yes the pho is still good, but now I'm inclined to try other places before coming back here just solely based on principals (This is why I have issues with old school Asian people's customer service and ethics).

I still am a huge fan of this place, I still have not tried their cakes. I do come back often for the egg tarts and a few buns. I did wanted to write a review for the milk tea; which is really 2 stars in my opinion but I just can't justify lowering the initial star review (because I am still a fan of this place).

This is the only place that I know of that serves/offers durian boba, so of course I ordered that. I LOVE durian, but I did not like their durian boba. It did not taste good. It tasted watered down (it was blended) and the boba was actually kind of under cooked. It was overall really hard to drink or enjoy. I know for sure I will not be trying that again. Maybe if I feel inclined I'll try the other flavors, but every time I think about it I'm completely turned off by the flashback. If and when I do, I will definitely write an update. But for now I'm really here for the egg tarts and buns!

So i was here for the saturday brunch thing. and honestly if it wasn't for the 2 or 1 deal that I got from the 777 thing i probably wouldn't have eaten here. there wasn't much to eat, everything was alright. the champagne reminded me of sparkling cider. but overall it was ok. 13 something for 2 people.. so about $6/7 for each person, it's not awfully bad and plus you get to make sure you are full. 

plus they ran out of the eggs benedict =(

Close to where I live, has all the herbs I need for spring rolls, and they have a dining area. I believe they said they get their shipment on every Wednesday or Thursday (I could be wrong, I do have horrible memory). This place has all the basic things I need for pho and spring rolls. I do remember calling once when I first move here to see if they carried Thai chili, the person that answered the phone was very nice and helpful. The parking lot is a pain but it's never filled up. This is one of the other Asian markets that I'm a regular at.

so as time passes this place doesn't seem very appealing anymore, but again it could be because i'm comparing it to better places in reno? but regardless every time i step in the elevator floors it smells like putrid smoke. the rooms are small and cramped, the internet is uber slow. again maybe because i'm comparing this place to another but even the special rooms aren't even all that special. sorry SL you are no longer my fav place...
Our favorite local Indian food, too bad that COVID closed the buffet - well worth it!

Great place and they now sell alcohol . My wife and i have struggled with finding any good Mexican food in the area and this is the best by far. Staff was very attentive and they passed the most important test - great guacamole.

I was disappointed for the price 
The meal was ok not good or great just good 
***TIP*** walk in look at fish in aquarium and leave
The local aquarium would be better and then go to red lobster - same thing less cost 
I was really disappointed the shrimp wrapped in bacon stuffed with jalapeños- most have been ghost peppers- they really were not there 

For close to $30 a meal 
I really should have asked for our money back - or refused to pay 
As I write this I remember more about the meal, meh!
The aquarium was nice but like I said go to the local or local zoo - I think more enjoyable time for less money and you would get some exercise

My mom saw this place on tv and wanted to try the GARLIC BOMB so we came here today and was all disappointed.

The service was not all that and like one of the other reviewers said, they look unhappy. They also did not say hi or bye. When my brother & I walked up to the counter, 2 girls were right there but just talking to each other. They looked at us and continued their conversation; at least say hold on or something.

The CHILI was oily and not that good at all.
GARLIC BOMB was eh ...
MENSCH was just a normal sandwich.
FIRE STEAK was spicy-ish but I did not like that the bread was soggy on the bottom; however, that does mean the meat is suppose to be juicy, more like greasy in my opinion.

Only good thing is they offer seeded bread and the fries are good when they first come out hot.

The 3 of us already decided we are not going to be coming back here. Goodday.

My salad was nauseatingly gross for lunch today. I have no idea how they took a piece of fish and cooked it so wrong that it tasted and had the most un fish like texture ive ever had. My boyfriends burrito was also very blah. 80 percent of this mess got left on the table for the ridiculous price of $28 (lunch for 2, 2 NA drinks and a tip). I work in the restaurant biz and would never serve fish to a customer that looked that off. The only saving grace for this place? Yogurt beach is right across the parking lot so we had that for lunch instead :)

Pizza is good. The only thing is how long it takes to get food. I have been here a number of times, and I don't understand why it takes so long to get food except that their kitchen is not efficient. Tonight I came in to order 1 slice of cheese and 1 slice of pepperoni pizza. It took 35 MINUTES to get 2 basic slices of pizza. I lived in NYC, and to have a mural of the city and to take that long on a regular basis to deliver basic pizza is a disgrace. It's also nothing to write home about. It's good and gets the job done but takes FOREVER.

I visited this place for lunch during Restaurant Week (although I ordered off the normal menu), so weight my review accordingly.

This place was all-around solid, reasonably tasty, not outlandishly expensive Italian fare. 

The atmosphere is... odd. There's an open-air feeling about the place, with walls painted a variety of blue colors with and without vines and lemons. It toes the line of kitsch. Depending on your sensibilities (and dining partners), this may or may not be an issue for you. 

The food was pretty reasonable. I had the littleneck clam pasta, which was pretty tasty (and $10, from the normal menu). I was with a group so I also stole bites of a few other dishes too. The salmon and the tiramisu were both a little bit dry, and the flatbread foccacia reminded me weirdly of mayonnaise. The lemon drop martinis were pretty good, but only pretty good, and they're $10 (not $5) if you don't sit in the bar.

I would probably come back here if one of my I'll-only-eat-Italian-or-hamburgers friends was visiting. Otherwise, there are probably more interesting places.

I've had breakfast here several times now, and it's always been OK.  I haven't been wowed, but it hasn't been bad either.  The restaurant is clean, and bright, but the tables are close together, so when it's crowded it gets pretty noisy.  I feel like everyone around you can hear your conversation and you can hear theirs.  In the evening I'm more accepting of loud places,  in fact I really enjoy being in a booming environment when the sun goes down, but in the morning I just want a quieter setting.

The food is average, and I find the prices a little high for the quality.

I must, however, highlight the staff.  The folks that work here have always been very nice and my meal service has always been timely and super efficient.

This review is for bar service and drinks only as well as observing other patrons who were eating. The food looked pretty good (this is more of a 3.5, but I rounded it because the food appears to look really good). I might come back next time I'm randomly craving mac and cheese (on the lunch menu as three cheese macaroni).

It's a bar/restaurant. It seems more family-oriented than elsewhere because it's larger and more restaurant-y than other bars we hit on the 4th of July. There were a good amount of available tables around 7-8pm (while other bars were packed).

My brother ordered a Hell or High Watermelon (can). The bartender didn't know if they had it, so he left to check. When he returned, he started serving other patrons. He finally came back with the beer a solid 5-10 minutes later. I normally would've rounded down to 3 stars for this, but the food looks really good, and our friends were served immediately, so I rounded up.

Shoutout to them having creme brûlée for ONLY $6!! (again, I didn't have any food. I am just mentioning this because it sounds like a great deal compared to $9+ elsewhere).

"I should've just gone to Geno's for a cheesesteak." Oh my god, people, go back to the suburbs. 

I was here once right before the I guess dinner rush (although they're not open late enough for dinner, so it could've been the late lunch crowd?). Literally 10-12 people (3-4 separate parties) came in right after we ordered. 

I had the Arista (pork, long hots, broccoli rabe, sharp provolone), and the other two people I was with shared the Daddy Wad (Italian Hoagie, Sweet & Hot Peppers, Sharp provolone, Tomato, Onion, Hot Copa, Pickles & Arugula). This was $9.

This is the only place I know of in the city that includes both broccoli rabe AND long hots without making you pay an extra $2 for the long hots. It was good, but it's certainly not the best pork sandwich in the city. It's the best in the Italian Market (seriously, ignore the tourists and skip George's). I'd place them behind John's (#1) and DiNic's Italian Pulled Pork (#2) in best pork sandwiches, but if you don't have time to travel to them, here's your best best in pork sandwiches.

The "Daddy Wad" ($10) wasn't bad compared to the other Italian hoagies we've had.  The arugula and sweet AND hot peppers were a nice touch. I love that they include all these extras free of charge when other sandwich shops usually only include one (sweet peppers, usually) and charge extra for hot peppers, but it's included! 

They're not the best in the city, but they're up there, a great place to stop if you're in the Italian Market, though I wouldn't come to the Italian Market only for here. 

ja eat yet?

Unagi is a solid choice for sushi in the Old Metairie area. I stopped in here with my wife the other night and even though we were the only patrons in the place, we very much enjoyed the sushi. I grabbed a to-go menu and plan on ordering lots of takeout from here in the future! 

BOTTOM LINE: Good sushi.

Maybe we got the wrong thing? But five stars on this place seems absurd. 

I took the advice of other yelpers and ordered a cinnamon roll and we ordered two sandwiches and a chicken salad plate. Have you ever eaten a meal and thought, this could end badly? That's how I felt about my meal. In the end, I felt okay, but it didn't taste fresh or like high-quality ingredients.

The cinnamon roll was clearly microwaved and the bacon was an almost sickening addition. The Cuban meat tasted like low-quality lunch meat and the chicken salad tasted like it had been sitting out all day. The sandwiches didn't come with a side, but the chicken salad did. I tried the pasta salad, no, no, no. I like the concept and the service (plus one star), I also like the beer selection and $2 beer Tuesdays (plus one star), but I can't see myself going back. If eating in Lenox Village again, I would pick pretty much anything else.

Very similar to Amada. Portions and service were just right. Great for foodies and groups. Dishes are meant to be shared with your party. I think it is enjoyable that way instead of ordering separate dishes.

A coffee shop that's open late? 24 hrs in fact? Great... Except that I don't feel comfortable coming here at night as a solo woman. It's difficult to explain what I mean by this, but if you're a woman you'll know. The back room especially is more of a male-friendly and crazy-friendly environment. Not sure if it is any better during the day because I've only been at night. As for the people watching, well, it's great if you're learning the DSM-IV.

Wait times can be long. I don't like having to wait in line behind an entire group getting ice cream and froo-froo drinks when I just want coffee. It's enough to make me go mental!

I've been eating Penny's Pizza for the past 40 years, even went to high school with one of the original owners.   The Limerick location has gone through some rough patches over the last couple of years, but have been putting out pretty good pizza lately.  It's an acquired taste with the cornmeal crunch and the sweet sauce on top.  It was a long drive so we usually only get it about every 2 months.  We were thrilled with the closer location and tried it tonight.  We got our usual large with half pepperoni.  The crust was a little thicker than usual, seemed to need a little more time in a hotter oven and lacked the classic cornmeal crunch.  Service was polite, but seemed inexperienced and disorganized.  Hopefully with time they will improve.  The dining room is bland and uninviting.  The pizza for slices under the heat lamp looked pretty gross.  There are thousands of people that grew up with this pizza and crave it.  If they can make it the right way consistently, they will be sitting on a gold mine.  BTW, the strombolis were always funky and nasty.  Whatever cheese is used needs to be changed.

Went at quarter to noon on a Sunday. Wasn't busy when we arrived, but started to have a line for seating as we departed. Not impressed overall. Not a likely go-back.
