I was in the mood for steak so I ordered the Filet medium rare. It came out VERY rare and cold, so I sent it back. By the time it came back out the rest of my party were all almost finished and we had to get going to see the parade so I told the waitress to cancel my order. Well of course a half minute later she brings it to me. Well, the steak was HALF the size of the first one and she asked if I'd like to take it home. I said no. It was so pathetically small. I mean maybe 3 oz? Another friend of mine ordered a sirloin steak and hers was raw as well. She got her second order and it was just as raw as the first one, so we ended up leaving to go somewhere to eat after we learned that the parade was canceled, which is why we were on a time crunch anyway. I have no desire to go back. Learn how to cook a steak! It's a basic!

Came here to celebrate my friend's birthday and the service was great! I had the cheesesteak waffle and it was delicious. Only "negative" thing I can say is that it was a bit too cheesy for my liking but still very good. I also had the 80s milkshake which again was good but a bit too sweet for my taste. My friend got a salted caramel milkshake and that was good and wasn't sweet! I would definitely go back again!

Last night was our first trip, ordering is a little daunting for newbies. The menu is up on the wall, it is easy to read but there aren't many descriptions of what you are ordering. After we ordered we found a laminated menu, ask for one before ordering, it explains what everything is and I would have gotten something different after I read it. We had the tour of Italy with a side salad and piece of garlic bread. Side salad was straight from a bag and no cheese or crotons. Lasagna did not have a cheese layer but was good, spaghetti was good and the fettuccine Alfredo was my favorite of the three. We could have split the plate it was big. Pizza looked good. If we go back we will split a large pasta dish or each get the smaller portion, skip the salad and get an order of breadsticks or garlic bread.

So, I was super excited to try this place out as soon as it opened. Then I find out that it's owners are the owners from Zim Zari! I was very happy to hear that, cause I love love love Zim Zari! Anyways, we tried to go here one night and the wait was way to long. So, we tried again later that week and got a table right away. The chairs inside are horrible!!!! The worse chair I have ever sat in in my life! I noticed that someone else in the restaurant had taken a chair from outside, so I asked to waiter if he could get me one as well. He said " sure, no problem!" . 
Those chairs are much more comfy... 
Our table of 4 ordered 2 lobster Mac n cheeses, grilled cheese with tomato soup and I can't remember what the last plate was called. It was like a French dip sandwich or something. The lobster Mac n cheese was good, but not something I would like to have as my main and only dish. It had no sides, which it didn't need since it was a nice portion. I think it would be better as a side item. As far as the grilled cheese and tomato soup, the soup was more like a marinara than a soup. Not very tasty. The grilled cheese was ok. And the unknown sandwich was another OK.. Nothing was really spectacular here. Would much rather Zim Zari next store. I do realize the place is still new and plan on giving it another shot. Hopefully they replace the chairs inside lol
I think I will wait for it to get cooler out to go back just in case they don't so I can sit outside.

I ate lunch here today with a large Meetup group. Tacos are discounted on Tuesday, and that's what we came for. I had the Sayulita (cod), Puerto Rican Pollo (chicken) and Carne Asada (beef). The bill came to $10.91 including tax and tip.

The vibe is Baja beach shack, with both indoor and outdoor seating. We sat outside, where plenty of flies added to the authenticity. Service was a bit slow, but we were a large group. The food was good and portions fairly large. On the downside, the corn tortillas were soggy and fell apart. Also, why do all tacos come with aioli, avocado slices or avocado sauce? Not my favorite ingredients. Mix it up, please.
I ate lunch here recently. I had the market hash ($11.79) with scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, veggies, toast, jam, and a small fruit cup. It was tasty, reasonably healthy and not too expensive.

Mental Note....if you name a restaurant after a dish you prepare....prepare it *#&@ing delicious.  The prime rib was fatty and lacked flavor.  The other dishes we ordered were mediocre.  The only redeeming value was the interesting atmosphere.  Has a cool old style "supper club" feel.  Definitely dressy (guys bring your suit jacket) with a more conservative and older crowd.  If you have a Tommy gun, you'll feel right at home here.

Went to Lola last night for dinner (thanks Groupon!) and am still having mixed feelings about it. My food was great. My service was fine. But I've read so many terrible things about their service; had less than stellar experiences there in the past when we were just going for drinks; and witnessed a group come in that had made reservations via Open Table, called the day before to confirm, had someone from Lola call them to confirm that morning, yet their reserved table was no where in sight when they showed up. Fail.

I guess I'll just say go at your own risk (during off hours, with a small party, try to sit at the bar, and don't be in a rush to get in or out of there....). 

Here's what we had:

The Gravois Champagne Cocktail: it was okay... pretty much just tasted like plain ole champagne. 

A glass of red wine. I don't remember which one, but it was the cheapest option and he poured me a HUGE glass. No complaints :)

A bottle of Scrimshaw. Sort of like Budweiser. Don't be afraid of it just because it has a fancy name/bottle. 

 Lamb chops with carrot puree and mashed potatoes. I wasn't crazy about the sides, but man, those lamb chops. Delicious.

Lobster 'corn dog' with mac and cheese. It must have been good because he practically ate it all, but said it was really rich. Only get it if you really like cheese.
Very good. Expensive, but they have a great lunch special. They take real care with all the details in the food.

The wings here are SOOO good! Stop by just for those. I like this place because I've always received very friendly and quick service and everything on the menu has always been solid. Drinks are okay. Lovely chill atmosphere. I will be back to try out their brunch.

MAKE RESERVATIONS IF YOU DON't WANT TO WAIT 1 1/2 hours for two people on a Saturday night!

MAKE RESERVATIONS!!!!!

Really enjoyed my Valentines/Anniversary dinner here. Food was so delicious, we had the Supreme I think that is what it is called. It included Filet Mignon, Lobster, Shrimp, Chicken Teriyaki.

I ordered an AMF and my husband had a Long Island. Both were perfect, like probably one of the best AMF's I have had. The Long Island was good but I think Cheesecake Factory's Long Island is better. 

The show was very fun, our chef was really good and entertained the group well. 

The Shrimp Appetizer was really good as well as the Calamari rings. So flavorful. The meal came with a seafood dipping sauce, a meat dipping sauce, soy ginger sauce, and a hot mustard sauce.

We also added fried rice to ours, which was really good too. Full of flavor. 

Meat was cooked according to how we wanted it, so tender and juicy. Lobster was really good. Shrimp was SO good. Chicken teriyaki SOOO GOOD. 

Overall it was so worth it. We paid a total of $150 for two people with Supreme and two drinks with fried rice for both of us. It was delicious, so fun and so worth it. Its definitely something you should try out. We loved our teppanyaki dinner!

Just ate here, it was one of the most delicious pizzas I've ever had. They hand toss their pizzas fresh to order and use a brick oven to cook it. We ordered a Personal pepperoni, meatballs and mushroom pizza, (perfect size for two) and another personal pepperoni and sausage.  

Sauce was delicious, fresh mozzarella for the cheese, perfection on a pizza. We loved it. For appetizers we ordered a small HUGE Caesar salad (no raw eggs in the dressing btw) and a small plate of antipasto, really yummy! Salad had the crispness and the antipasto was delicious really enjoyed it a lot. 

For dessert we had the seductive mouth watering tiramisu and their "famous" canoli, both exceeded our expectations. Glad to know this place is two blocks from where I live.

The only downfall I would say is that they charge when you add toppings, (cheese and sauce is already included) but anything else you want on there is anywhere from $2-5 

To wrap up the bill, two sodas, two passion iced teas, one kids apple juice, small Caesar, small antipasto, two personal pizzas (adding 5 toppings-3 on one, 2 on the other), tiramisu, canoli, total: $68.95. Not bad at all. 4 adults, one 3 year old. 

Worth the money for the freshness and btw great service! 

Enjoyed the beautiful atmosphere and the fact we can see the kitchen cooking our food, a plus!

Very ehh Mexican food. The food wasn't bad just nothing that I would want to come back for. Also the margaritas kinda tasted like lemonade, this was a pitcher though so maybe an individual marg would be better. On the bright side, the service was great!

Generally a not bad place for beer and a number of the menu items. They have an interesting list of egg rolls, from Philly cheese steak to German and they aren't too bad. Several of the soups are very good, I had the white bean a while back and it was good. Wings are great, moist and meaty... 

On my most recent visit I had a burger... what better to go with a beer ? ?? and it was pretty OK.... In my search for a good burger... if not the perfect burger, this was not in the competition, Kind of dry, uninspired bun... order something else... you'll be happier.
Very interesting place. You have to know to go here. Only local know where it is. Interesting decor. Very good service. Fresh, homemade food. Mostly deep fried. Affordable prices. Worth a visit.
I really like this place. Staff very nice. Fair prices, good food and good live music

I was with a group of friends for dinner. The restaurant was very busy because it is new in the area. Very interesting decor. Very loud, it's hard to talk. The food is good but nothing extraordinary. The prices are affordable. The service was average. If someone likes southern cuisine then this is a good place to visit.

Papa johns has always been good but it's really pricey now with the competition being so force in the pizza world. They were running a special for $5.99 so I took the opportunity to have some good pizza with their excellent garlic sauce. I go in to get the carry out and the staff was very polite respectful and just eager to make me happy. 
After getting home shortly after getting the pizza I realized that this is not the cheesy meaty pizza that I remember from Papa Johns. Still good and well worth the special price it was offering. I guess my previous experiences over took what I got this time. Other than that I would definitely have the pizza again. Especially for that price.

I've been to this location a few times, and it's ok.  That's all it is though, just ok. I normally try to avoid this location because it's attached to the mall and it's always busy.  The food itself is just way to rich and over the top. Sometimes that's just what you're looking for and that's fine, but mostly that is what keeps me away. They do have a lighter fare menu, and I still find it to be too rich.  My biggest complaint about this location is that everything takes forever. If you want to eat here make sure you have time to spare because you will be here a while no matter what you decide to order. I've never had anything bad to eat here, but I have noticed that the food itself will be luke warm and the plate it's on is scalding hot. I don't understand that at all.
Anyway, it's never going to be my first choice to eat here. There are just so many better options, but once in a while I do stop in and waste some time and calories. It's worth it once in a while.

The positives are that this is a very cool space with great decor and a nice bar. I can't give it a higher rating because while the food is well prepared and tasty, the Tapas size servings and high drink prices are tough to take. I'm not a fan of having to grab a snack from the frig after eating out!

I don't know if romance is dead inside me or if I'm just a cheap-ass.  There are far better places to go hang out and grab a dessert than here and at much more reasonable prices.  

I can't say much for the ambiance either.  I think it's tacky.

We went on a weekday when it was relatively slower but the service was still pretty bad.  It's ok, though.  I'll just go down the street to grab a coffee.

As you all know, Inomly review when externally happy, or very dissatisfied

I am shocked at at the poor service I received from this place. I've been coming here for years and this trip was my last. Let's break it down

12:19 we get seated
12:26 we have to call someone over to acknowledge we are there. She takes our drink order. Two bloody Mary's, and an order for 12 raw oysters 

Shortly after, the drinks came. And timely compared to when we finally ordered them. And we ordered our food at this time.... 

Twenty minutes later, no oysters.... But she attempts to put my salad in front of me. It's now 1:05. Maryjane complains. She apologizes and walks away

1:05 we give up. We're not mad, we're JUST not happy with the quality of service we are NOT getting, so we get up and walk to the front desk. I tell them I want to pay for my bloody Mary's and just leave. (The food we asked for was raw. It shouldn't have taken over 35 minutes and it STILL wasn't coming out

Waitress charges me $13.27 for two bloody Mary's. Yes, you read that right. They actually CHARGED us after this fiasco

And the way she snapped her POS device out of my hands because I didn't tip her was just plain rude. I just have now words.... I HATE the excuse "we are short staffed".... unacceptable bullshit

Never again

My family and I had dinner here on Christmas Eve.
I made reservations and wasn't informed it was BYOB.

The waiting area is this tiny, crunchy area with nowhere to go. And your right next to the restroom. 

Our waiter was very nice.

Food was fine.  Typical Italian fare.
There was some wine available also.

3.5 stars

Less than a year ago, the Memphis Taproom opened up a few blocks from my house.  Between then and now, it's become quite popular and one of the best bars this side of the city.  So the owners decided to spread the wealth and  go to the other side.  The result: Local 44.

Local 44 is a pretty standard bar that focuses of serving up good beer and food.  It's clearly run by the folks from Memphis, as evident by the  similar menu and beer selection.  There are about eighteen beers on tap, including the beer engine, which gives beer drinkers of any persuasion a good choice.

Beer selection aside, the rest of the experience is average.  The service was acceptable; not great.  The prices are average.  The atmosphere is nice, but forgettable.  The only real reason to go to Local 44 is just that, if it's your local spot.  You won't be seeing me make the trip from Fishtown again.

Downsides: The bar charges tax on beer, which is lame, but not unheard of.  Beers that would be $4-$7 are suddenly $4.40 to $7.70.  Even with the tax, the prices are still acceptable.  I was having trouble deciding the beer I wanted, so I asked for a sample.  The barkeep shot back that they "don't do samples, because that's how [they] keep the prices so low."  I didn't think that was true, or a good reason for denying me an ounce of beer.  It's not breaking your bank.

Bottom Line: This place is fine. If you happen to be around, check it out. It's not going to crack the top ten or even top twenty list of Philadelphia bars, but it will do just fine and continue to serve up good food and beers.

Being from NYC and living in HI, we've had some of the best selections of Japanese food. We were so happy to find out that Yokos is owned by JAPANESE and you can tell the difference when you eat the food. The lot can get packed since they share a parking with another popular restaurant and several other stores. And if you go during prime dinner time, there will likely be a wait inside. But why 2 stars?

First off, for our first time here we had about 8 people and we spent close to $400 here. We ordered several rolls on the menu, sashimi and several appetizers. They were all excellent. 

Now, the service. When we got to Yokos, there was a thunderstorm outside and they just opened for the night. I wrote everything down on the order form they give you so that the waitress wouldn't get confused. But she did and several our orders came out wrong. We didn't want cream cheese on any of our rolls and a few of the rolls I requested no avocado and to have cucumber instead since someone is allergic. We still got all of them, even though I neatly wrote it down. Mind you this is also after we waited almost 60 minutes for our food (even though we were one of the first orders placed). The waitress had our orders remade, which then took an additional 30 minutes. So half the table was starving. And another person at the table didn't get their udon until AFTER we were almost done with our food so they had to watch us eat. Drinks were always empty, we had to constantly ask them to be refilled.

Eventually I asked to speak with the manager. In the waitresses defense, the owners told us that 1) the waitress was new, and 2) the power briefly went out for a short time and their order system got messed up. Ok so I get it. So to make up for the food taking so long and the horrible experience, one owner told us that she would take the orders that came out wrong off our check and we wouldn't get charged for them. BUT THEN GET THIS, another owner then came after and told us that we were only not going to be charged for wrong rolls and the bill stayed the same (well DUH, we shouldn't be charged for the food half the table can't eat), and then she asked us is we wanted ice cream. So they never took anything off the bill. We spent close to $400 there, had TERRIBLE service and the wrong food come out, and they couldn't take off the $30 worth of rolls for their own mistake.

Okay, since the food was good, we tried Yokos again and ordered about $200 worth of take out for a group of us. My husband and nephew went to pick up the food and brought it home. When they got home there was no soy sauce or spicy mayo in the bags (when I asked for it over the phone). So he went back and let my nephew run in to the restaurant to get the sauce (everyone knows that parking lot fills up). They gave him soy sauce but wanted to charge for the spicy mayo. He explained that we just had the big order but they still wanted to charge for the sauce. Since my nephew is just a kid, he didn't have money and just left. When you spend over $200 on food, shouldn't they give you the $1 or $2 spicy mayo for free? It's not like I just got a bento box.

It's such a shame because the food is good (3/4 stars). I'm sure they do well and have lots of regular customers. I'm happy for them. But for us, I guess we were unlucky with service (1 star). These instances left a sour taste in my mouth and we will likely not be going back.

This Vietnamese restaurant is probably my favorite in the suburbs. I highly recommend this place for their soup noodle dishes. I think they execute their soupy dishes better than their dry entrees. My favorite vietnamese noodle soups to get here are: "pho saté" and "bun bo hue". Both are on the spicy side but just so flavorful and satisfying, especially on a dreary, rainy day. The service is always on point and I've never been disappointed when eating here. I'm confident to say that their quality has been pretty consistent. Come here for your noodle soup needs!

Setting (+): It's nothing fancy, but has all the essentials like adequate seating, clean space and good lighting. 

Service (++): I've been here at least three times and all three times the service was absolutely wonderful. The waiter was super attentive and helpful. 

Food (+): I always get their tacos and my absolute favorites are chicken and shrimp. The side of Mexican rice is quite delicious as well. The chips taste fresh and you can always substitute beans for pico de gallo if you're not a fan of beans. 

Price/value (+): I love the you pick 3 tacos deal in which they charge you the same no matter which tacos you pick. Doesn't matter if it's shrimp or chicken, still the same price for the combo. Portions are decent and filling. 

Bottom line: One of my favorite spots for Mexican bites in the area. I highly recommend if you're hungry for some tacos.

Casual cowboy atmosphere with pretty expensive food, which would be okay if it was worth it.  My husband's $25 steak was maybe 1/2" thick, mine and my son's pork ribs were just okay but at these prices I feel like the meat shouldn't need sauce.  These needed it, and they came with runny BBQ sauce.  The bathrooms were the highlight of our visit- they look like outhouses but lead into modern day facilities.  Overall I'd say save a lot of money and grill at home for a better meal, which sucks because we were really looking forward to this place.

Dear managers of Peter Piper - PLEASE stop overbooking birthday parties.  I realize this seems like it will make more money for you but you cannot seem to handle the output of food or cleaning of tables when your tables are filled with parties.  Please!

Don't get me wrong, I love a good salad. This was my first Sweet Tomatoes experience, and from what I'd been hearing from this place, I expected to love it. As I walked in, the first thing to greet me was their signature salads. I got one, and went along down the line adding my favorite salad ingredients (perhaps I've been spoiled by Core on the UA campus because I found Sweet Tomatoes to be lacking several essentials). The signature salad had obviously been sitting out for a while, and the salad I made was as expected, nothing spectacular. I tried the chicken noodle soup (Meh), the pasta and mac and cheese. Alright. To me, this place's only saving grace was the yummy lemonade and soft-serve ice cream.

A bunch of us felt funny afterward.

In short: Expensive, slightly fancier version of your usual salad bar.

Omg.  Not much to say.  The chef is probably wasting the food.  If you don't know how to cook, don't cook.  Just donate them to the hungry people.  Almost forget to say, I should give credit to the chef who makes the dessert.  But unfortunately, I don't come to buffet just for dessert.

So I'm really curious how in the world this place got 4 1/2 stars? Usually Yelp is pretty accurate but this one stumped me. The meat on the Cuban sandwich was just plane ol' deli meat on some Cuban bread probably bought at the local grocery store. They even forgot the pickles! Nothing about this place was authentic. The rice and beans seemed like they were straight out of a can. Little to no flavor at all with anything and the service was just meh. The workers seemed bored and looked like they could care less about their jobs. If you are looking for truly great Cuban, try Bodega in St Pete. So far that place has set the bar for me for Cuban sandwiches in the Tampa Bay area. Don't even waste your time at this place even though my review will probably get lost in the shuffle of seemingly bizarre 4 and 5 star reviews. I guess I just have high standards for Cuban sandwiches?

Probably the best breakfast in Clearwater, although over-priced for the portion sizes, and the service is never that great.  Coffee is always cold and refills are not free.  Just goes to show that Clearwater breakfast joints are sparse when this place is the "best".  Even still, I do go here now and then... just order two plates if you're hungry.

I am a coffee snob (geek) and this place does it right.  It shares the same location as the wine bar, but they are seperately managed.  Great espresso drinks and brewed coffee is really good too.  The best that I've found is the bay area.  Worth trying for sure.

My boyfriend and I came here for winter 2016 restaurant week, and I can see how the place got three stars- it's not bad, but it's also not great. 

The Good:
- The Gnocchi. If you ever come here, this is a must. This pasta was surprisingly light and super delicious. 
- BYOB. Those 4 letters say it all. Oh, and if you forget your bottle, they'll offer you house wine. 
- Friendly Staff. Our waiter here was beyond friendly when we interacted with him. Since we were seated in the back, I felt like he forgot about us at times. 
-Dessert. Yum, Yum, Yum. The Tarfufo was delicious and so was the chocolate moose. 

The Bad:
- The venue is small, which resulted in us sitting up against a very cold window. 
- Over all the service was slow, they were nice, but the wait time between dishes was way too long and I often felt like they had forgotten about us. 
- Pollo Oscar- This dish is unique, but the crab meat promised on the menu is really lacking on the dish. 
- Overall I think the food was a little expensive for the quantity and quality. 
- 10% discount for cash paying customers. Although some might see this as an advantage, I prefer paying with my credit card. 

With all the options for Italian food in the city and restaurants for restaurant week, not sure I would come back.

Sunday March 13, 2016  (10pm)

So let me tell you guys about my horrible experience, I had at TGI Fridays, on this Sunday night. I just wanna say, I have never felt so unwanted as a customer, in my life, than i have felt tonight by the staff of the TGI Fridays at this location. So I've been craving the Sizzling Chicken an Cheese plate, been thinking about it all day, just knew i was going there, and having this for dinner. So we arrived at 10pm, it says their open till midnight. The hostess at the door, tells us that the dining area is closed, and we can sit at the bar. she wasn't very friendly or informative, nor did she guide us, or give us menus. So we sit at the bar for about 5 minutes and steal a menu from the other end of the bar.  The bartender, Chelsea,  approaches us, and she informs us that the kitchen had just closed, and we won't be able to place a food order. We were bummed and stated that we weren't here for the drinks, we specifically came here to eat, so we start to grab our keys and leave. She stops us, and says "Well wait, let me check with the kitchen, maybe we can still squeeze your order in" So she comes back, and gives us the green light. we place our order, she puts it in. After about five minutes after that. I see her again, and ask for a soda, and his drink. So we sit there for about 30 minutes, then she goes and checks on it, and comes back with a bag of To-Go food. Like my jaw dropped. just utter dissapointment, She states well i didn't know you wanted it for here. I clearly stated i was her to eat.  Like are you serious? did I ask for a to go order? How could you assume something like that? That could've easily been cleared up with a question, if you had any thought on it. Like I ordered a Sizzling dish, the point is to have it brought to me sizzling on a cast iron plate. The meal looked so un appealing in the to-go container, there was pretty much no cheese in the dish, and what they did have in there was burnt to a cheese crisp that was at the bottom of the container. The mashed potatoes was just blah, absolutely no flavor, and tasted like they were instant mashed potatoes. 
 Not only did the food lack, i ate my dish at the bar with plastic utensils, out of the plastic containers. The bartender had no interest in taking the food back and properly plating it and serving it to us, once she found out that she had  made a mistake. She simply drops off 2 small side plates and some silverware. Like we're supposed to  take the food out of the containers and re-plate it, if we wish to eat here. My boyfriend was entirely pissed off, he didn't even try to eat his food, he simply took the togo container and stuck it in the togo bag, and waited on me to finish my meal. Honestly whats the point of saying your open till midnight, if your going to start closing 2 hours before that, and be busy doing closing jobs, that distract you from providing full service to the remaining guest that are trying to enjoy the establishment. So that was how i spent my Sunday night, getting treated like shit at TGI Fridays. All i wanted was some good service and some good food. Its clear that neither of those can be found at this location of TGI Fridays. Im sad to say this experience was so bad that i don't think i will ever return to any Fridays location, ever.

Stopped for Muffuletta and Shrimp Po-Boy sandwiches the afternoon of 3/18/2007.  We always go here at least once during our bi-annual visits to New Orleans.  This place is a French Quarter institution that has been there for at least 30 years or more.  Food is expensive in The Quarter, so although the prices seem high, they are reasonable for the area.  Not much of a Mart, but the sandwich and plate dinner choices are many and delicious.  The reason for only 3 stars is the poor customer service.  You have to be fairly assertive in catching the order-taker's attention as he WILL NOT look for customers to take their orders.  He is much too busy helping to fill the many phone orders and prep them for delivery.  Also be warned that it is Cash Only.

Stopped in for dinner after shopping at ikea. When we walked in there was only a few people eating but as we waited for our food it got pretty busy quickly. For dinner I ordered the baby churrasco and my boyfriend ordered the Arroz chaufa. After about 30 mins of waiting for our first of we were getting kind of annoyed and had heard another table complain to their server about the wait. He replied "we do have a few tables ahead of you" instead of kindly going to check on the food. The workers attitudes are OK. While waiting we were brought bread which was warm but a little hard.  One thing I really didn't appreciate was flies flying on my face....... and on the table. Finally our food came out and by that time we were SOOOOO annoyed. It was good but for how long the wait was for the food and our terrible server. We will not be back

We came here after cycling at soul cycle. It is a short walk up the street from class and we needed to carb up. We went and put our names in for outside seating for three and was quoted 25 minutes. However, the hostess forgot about us and we had to go in and ask the status off our seating. She immediately grabbed the menus and sat us at a table that was open when we got there. Either the hostess staff isn't paying attention or they need a better system. 

I gave them three stars because it is a decent eating spot but there was nothing that really made it memorable for me. The sheer proximity to the cycling class is what brought me here and the price. I can not deny the price of the food vs the hugge portion is a big plus! This is a good 3 star spot! Middle of the road is not bad! 

For my breakfast, I got the banana pancake in a small size. Wow the small is huge!! I wonder what the large is like. The pancake was decent with the visible banana slices cooked inside the pancake vs piled on top. I usually can finish a pancake this huge but this time I couldn't. 

I would definately come back if I am in the area.
Healthy but very little flavor. Their popcorns were staled. Gave a try for the second time, but same result. Will not try again.

The first time I ever tried to get into Square One, it was a two hour wait.  Is the place worth a solid 120 minutes of standing?  Read on to find out!


Square One is a solid restaurant, bar, and distillery in the Lafayette Square area.  I came here a little while ago with some friends to enjoy dinner and a few beers, and I think the four of us mutually decided it was a pretty solid, 3-star, "A-OK" experience.

It's a nice atmosphere inside, even if it's a bit confusing at first figuring out where to go if you want a table (the hostess is at a stand at the back of the first room).  The huge glass windows reveal showcase brewing equipment stockpiled in the corners, and see-through floor panels reveal barrels and casks in the basement.  The noise isn't too bad at all, and the patio area does look pretty nice, as some of the other reviewers have mentioned.

Our friendly, down-to-business waitress started us off with a round of beers.  I tried the Pilsner, which was pretty decent; my friends gave the sampler and a few other types a shot.  I think we were all happy with the taste of the unique beer.

The food, though, was, again, A-OK.  I think I might have been the happiest with the "Wurst Plate"-- a selection of sausages with spicy mustard over mashed potatoes and sauerkraut.  A friend reported the fish and chips were "okay, but nothing special," and a buddy liked the ribs but not the side, sweet potatoes and pecans.  The seared tuna sandwich was a no-go, described as "dry and not too tasteful."

I definitely feel, though, that the food and beer were both solid, with neither detracting from the other.  The value was pretty good, too, with plenty of sandwiches under $10.00.  The sausage plate was about $16 and the beers ran around $4.25 each.

Would I come back to Square One?  Not living too close, it doesn't seem like it'd be in my regular rotation, but it's definitely a location to keep in mind for those that want a reliable and accessible microbrewery venue for catching up with friends.  Looking forward to coming back eventually to see if my opinion changes, but for now, Square One's on the St. Louis B-list.

I really love these guys and their atmosphere, the pizza falls in line with that. Very good crisp and a slightly doughy feel. Crust alone, this is an 8/10. The cheese isn't my favorite. I love Provel but there is a slight Parmesan feel. I'm not really a Parmesan on pizza kind of guy but the cheese is very good, even though it brings the pizza down for me.

Trattoria Carina is a neighborhood gem. They offer sidewalk dining for up to 6 guests/table. Tables spaced ~3 feet apart with heaters at each table. Don't miss the Spicy Sausage Rigatoni! Also the staff is incredibly kind. I love chatting with my servers there!

In an effort to call attention to COVID-safe outdoor dining done well and support local businesses, I have started an Instagram account @PhillyCovidDiningGuide showing the outdoor set ups! Check out my post on Trattoria Carina and others here https://www.instagram.com/phillycoviddiningguide/

I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich, took one bite, and spit it right back out because something tasted off......the bun had MOLD on it!! I drove all the way back and one of the managers refunded my money, but the kitchen manager had the nerve to argue and ask what was wrong with it. At least I got sprite, because my stomach is really uneasy after that experience

We had a sudden babysitter for dinner the other night, so I went to Open Table to see who had availability.  Grbic has been on my bookmark list as far back as I can remember, so we decided to finally try it.  I tried not to get my expectations too high, since some of the reviews mentioned the food being bland.

For us it was good, but not anything amazing.   We had chicken Jaeger Schnitzel and another special summer chicken dish that had chicken, various veggies and spaetzle baked in a dish.  We also had the cevapi appetizer.   The cevapi had the taste of a really good grilled hamburger, but in the shape of a breakfast sausage link.   They were good, but we didn't care for the sauce that came with it.  My wife called it perfectly, it tasted like thousand island dressing with a kick.   The spaetzle that came with both entrees was good - it reminded me of Germany.  These are little scrappy, pea-size chunks of pasta.   No doubt they are made in-house.  The flavor of the dishes was good, again, but neither of us was floored.   

To go with our dinner, we got a bottle of Romanian Pinot Noir, whic neither of us liked.  It interesting that all their wines by the glass are Californian, but by the bottle, they're all Romanian.  This gave me very little confidence that the wines by the glass were a good idea.  This whole wine experience would probably keep us from coming back. I will say the bottle was very reasonably priced at $24.  

We saw maybe 6 people come in to eat while we were there on a Saturday night, so Grbic is obviously no flourishing.   I believe they need to price their entrees $3-4 lower to bring more people in.   For great food from this part of the world, we'll stick with Arber, which has become one of our favorites.

I've known about Cuisine d'Art for a couple of years.  It's not far from work, reviews are good.  Still, I've never been.  Do you need to ask why?  Uh, I'm not a woman.  The snob appeal  and effeminate nature of this name are so over-the-top, they've just about ruled out a couple of men coming for lunch.  Can you imagine: Businessman1:  Let's go to Cuisine d'Art.  Businessman2:  Sounds Yummy...I mean, how about those Rams? And do they have quiche?  

My wife made a rare trip up for lunch with our daughter, so we came here.  Glad we did.  It's essentially an upscale Bread Company, but less of a bakery.  Everything comes on china, you get silverware and a real glass.   Prices are a little higher, but mot much. 

The lady at the counter said the chicken salad was popular, so I had the chicken salad on marble rye.  The wife had the pick two special - also chicken salad, but on croissant, with a salad.  The pick two is definitely the way to go here, my sandwich was huge.  Enough for two, really.  The chicken salad was good and fresh, but I needed to add Guldens to give it some kick.  I guess they don't want to offend the local old ladies by adding too much spice.  Maybe a spicy version would be in order?   

So man up, boys, and head to Cuisine d'Art to get a round of quiche for your very best buds!

I really wanted to like this place, but they had a minimal amount of local produce and products in general. Was not so much a grocery store, and more like a grab and go deli place for lunch. Parking is generally a huge pain too, so I would not recommend this place to buy groceries. If you are working downtown and you want a deli sandwich/meal this is the place to go

Wow  I love this place.... I normally frequent this food truck during Sundays @St. Phillips for breakfast... and I love getting the vietnamese bah minh crepe..... I have also tried the fig w/ duck variety.. and that is also delicious! My only gripe is that you have to order the crepe 30 mins before you intend to eat it.. because they are so busy!!! I often just park my car.. order the crepe.. do my grocery shopping for the week at the farmers market.. and then return for my breakfast. =)

I get the hype, this place is run by some friendly koreans which kinda threw me off, but oh well. Free miso soup before your food gets there and free icecream after your meal. Food prices are also super reasonable, and I can definitely recommend the salmon lovers sushi special. Be prepared to wait though or try to call in for a table, sometimes this place can get packed

Stopped by while running errands next door at Sew Perfectly as I was picking up some alterations, and was pleasantly surprised by Nomico's offerings. It reminded me a lot of traditional Hong Kong dessert places back in the bay area. I got the papaya coconut milk drink and it was great although a bit too sweet for my taste. The place was very nicely decorated and felt clean which is very important to me. If you love mango this place is for you as they had a variety of mango everything!

Will be back to try some of their Nomico specials..

Gonna give this place 4 stars as I have not actually eaten here... I just stopped in for a drink before a yelp event.. bartender was nice.. staffed seemed friendly.. will have to stop in to experience more someday

I have been to the Wayne and the Conshohocken locations a few times.  Solid place to meet up with friends after work to enjoy a beer, loud music, and watch sports on T.V.  I usually do not gravitate towards this type of restaurant but it is an easy walk from my current living situation, and my husband and I were basically in the mood for the bar scene that serves food.

As far as ambience it is what you expect from a place named The Great American Pub.  Lots of wood decor and large bar areas with televisions and plenty of bar taps.  Since we were more in the mood for eating than drinking, we were seated next to the bar area that has some booth tables.  Our server was very pleasant but not always available, but we were okay with that because we were in no rush.  My husband ordered a special fried chicken sandwich and I got the Smoked Beef Brisket Soft Tacos (Twin tacos with cheddar, pico de gallo and shredded lettuce.
Tortillas, guacamole, salsa and sour cream).  I was pleasantly surprised by the portion and the quality of the brisket.  The brisket was top notch; not dry at all and seasoned very well.  And there were plenty of fixings on the side to add to the taco.  I probably should have taken the second taco home, but my beer brain convinced me I was hungry enough to enjoy both.

Large space - cool upstairs. We didn't get too much service downstairs but we were checked on upstairs and it has a huge projection screen - which was perfect since we were in town for the SEC Tournament. It seemed a little empty when we came so I'm not sure why it took a while to close our tab. Either way, no big issues and we had a good time.

I literally drove 404 miles non-stop for this meal.  Literally!

We were heading home after an extended weekend in PA.  We stopped in Columbus, OH for lunch and somehow nobody felt the need for a pit-stop before we made it to the restaurant for dinner.  Not quite sure how that happened but it makes a good story.

Late dinner on a Tuesday night.  It took a little while for someone to be designated as our server and the guy who sat us felt bad about the delay so he comped us an order of their corn fritter things as an appetizer.  Those were some really hot (temperature) little bundles of fried goodness.  Slightly sweet, crunchy and gooey all at the same time.

I decided on their shrimp po boy for my dinner.  I was anxious to see how it stacked up to the version I had tried at Gulf Shores the previous week.  I would like to say different but both were good...but that would be an understatement.  The shrimp on this version smoked the ones on the version from Gulf Shores but the remolade at the other place was a lot better.  Maybe its a tie - maybe not.

Kid 1 claimed she wasn't hungry but then decided on an order of fries.  They were pretty tasty and both looked and tasted as though they had been cut freshly in house.  Normally I would not let her call that dinner but after being cooped up in the car with the kids for almost 12 hours I really didn't care.  There goes my nomination for father of the year.   

Kid 2 ordered a humungous burger.  I thought about trying a bite but just didn't have room.  The wife nicked a corner and reported that it was very good.

The wife went after their SBR - sausage, beans & rice.  I managed a bite as well and it was delicious.  The sausage pieces were pretty small but that just meant that every bite had a piece or two and the flavors were uniform throughout the dish.  The beans were in a slightly spicy sauce.  Not spicy like hot, spicy like flavorful.  Delicious!

The kids each had a piece of their snicker's cake for dessert.  There was an invocation of the daddy tax and I thought it was a pretty good dessert choice although it is doubtful that it was house made.

Great place!  Can't wait to get back to dive a bit deeper into their menu...

I expected to be "wow-ed" but really wasn't.  Very loud place, relatively weak cocktails and food that was only alright.

We came here for our anniversary and the wife let them know it was a special occasion in advance.  It was nice that they welcomed us with a couple of glasses of champagne.  Our waitress was very attentive and took great care of us during our visit...she's the reason for the 4th star.

The food?  Not that special.  Well executed but not exceptional.  The deviled eggs we started with were just alright.  I appreciate a twist on an item but it has to be discernible beyond the visible to add anything to the dish.  Several things listed as ingredients (trout roe, fried capers, cayenne) sounded like they would fit that bill but they were of such small portions that they got lost among the other flavors.  

No bread service :(

Next up for me was their chicken schnitzel.  Well-executed fried chicken but adding a couple of lemon slices on the side doesn't really make it a schnitzel.  Also, they have spaetzle elsewhere on the menu but offered a warm potato salad and a small salad with vinaigrette as the sides for this dish instead.  Those two intermingled on the plate and created a different flavor profile than perhaps the chef intended.  This dish needs some work as it really came across as fried chicken with potato salad and a salad - not what I think they were shooting for based on the menu description.  

I tried a bite or two of the wife's steak - great flavor but overcooked and very chewy.  We asked about the cut and it was something we had never heard of before.  Lingering impression of that dish is that it took a lot of work to masticate.  To paraphrase something I picked up along the way...the juice wasn't worth the squeeze.

Without a doubt, the high point of the meal was dessert.  I didn't know you could make bread pudding out of pretzels...wow!  Add in some chocolate and some ice cream and it was absolutely the right way to end the meal on a high note.  If the service wasn't already enough to bump this review to 4 stars the dessert would have carried the day.

Sad to say but these guys are not the Kimchi Guys you've been looking for.  

It pains me to go with 2-stars on this review given how excited I was for them to open and to get to try their food but I just cannot get to "A-OK" based on the experience or the food.

We visited with another couple and a 5th wheel who wasn't a 3rd wheel at all.  We ordered a variety of stuff.  Nobody was really impressed.  We left and went somewhere else to have dinner all over again.  It was much more enjoyable.

Here are my observations by menu item:

Mandu - I've had a lot of mandu all over the peninsula and look for it on this side of the pond.  I'm not sure what I was served but it wasn't mandu.  The ratio of wrapper to filling was way off.  Maybe calling this a fried dough knot is more appropriate?  Also, if we were the only ones in the restaurant at the time...how was it possible to serve us luke-warm deep-fried anything?

Korean Fried Chicken sandwich - a significant miss as well.  Not as spicy as expected.  Served with lettuce and tomato instead of something more inspired.  At least it was served at a proper temperature.

Overall notes:

Kimchi - how in the world do you name your restaurant after an ingredient and not push that ingredient forward?  How is it that every entree doesn't at least come with a small (1-2 oz) cup of the stuff?  Big miss.

Portion sizes - it's a pain in the ass to get to this place.  Good luck finding parking that doesn't cost a bunch and then they serve tiny portions at high prices?  I cannot see where this is a sustainable business model.

I love the notion of this place but the execution comes across as half-baked.

Decent OG all around.  Friendly, prompt and accurate service.  Decent food.  Great OG salad and bread sticks, etc.  Normally I wouldn't give OG a four star review but they managed to get everything right for this business lunch and I didn't get stuck going somewhere that allows smoking.

One thing that I really enjoyed about this lunch was the 1/2 chicken parmesan sandwich.  I often avoid OG because I just don't want to be THAT full.  Sure I could eat less - but seriously, not with those bread sticks!  The 1/2 sandwich, salad and two bread sticks worked out exactly right and I didn't feel compelled to take an afternoon nap at a customer's site.

Oh yeah - there should be a law that every restaurant needs to give you at least one Andes thin mint at the end of your meal...

I actually have had a few of their salads which are quite good and quite large and I think by and large better than their burgers which are not bad but not the best.You're looking for an alternative salad place like myself you're always looking for someplace new I would give this place a try for that reason.
Apparently they fix the problem with insisting single diner sit at the community table. The food is very good and so is the service and comfort levels hand side raised the rating.

I'm a woman of many hankerings, obviously. I begin almost every review with, "So I had a hankerin," after all. I'm also always talking about hoagies. Studies show that I'm roughly 78.3% hoagie at this point. I'm drawn to Italian delis. Because I love them. Chickie's is a really great Italian deli. Excellent.

I love all manner of their good sandwiches on Sarcone's bread. The Italian is one of my favorite hoagies, I assure you. And another thing, Chickie's veggie hoagie is completely one of my #1 hankerings. Eggplant and peppers, rabe and sharp provolone, I love...on bread that I love...I love it. It might be my favorite sandwich from this joint. This is important to note, as we already discussed my Italian hoagie loyalties generally lie with the amazing things that Italian people are able to do with pork.

What am I gonna do without your golden beets?

 I keep thinking about the grilled seitan too. I'm a fan of seitan, but I've never ever had it so good. I'm thinkin about it piled atop the yukon mashed potatoes, spinach, and horseradish cream. A little red pepper tapenade up on ya... I'm telling you, it was so good. Nicely charred, juicy, flavorful seitan.... I couldn't shut up about it to my husband when he came home later that night. It was wrong of me. It really could come off like bragging. 

 I told him that if that if seitan of that caliber was made from an animal, I would hunt, kill and eat that animal everyday. It was supposed to be a high compliment, but certainly is just yet another insane thing to say.

Every single taste was delicious. The eggplant and cauliflower braciole was delectable covered in herby salsa verde, the wood-roasted maitake mushroom dish was amazingly rich and creamy, without cream...how do you do it? Smoky mushroomy goodness! More cauliflower is more better so some crispy cauliflower and pickled ramps were in order as well. Delicious. Everything. Delicious. Cheesecake? Delicious!

I kept repeating over and over how Horizons provides the best vegan food that I've ever had. It's beyond that though. It's just some of the best food ever. Beautifully prepared, gorgeous, satisfying, flavorful... All vegetables, all foods should be celebrated this well.

It was a great meal. I was in great company too. That means you, Blake and Adrienne :). I love sharers! Thanks wise Blake F. for this brilliant dinner plan.  Had to hit up Horizons one more time...

I think I'm gonna have to get the Horizons cookbook. What am I gonna do without those beets, I asked you?!

I will follow (stalk, whatever) these chefs' cooking. I will.

Now I'm looking out the window, across the street at Horizons. While my gaze is still incredibly creepy, it's also tinged with sadness... I'M GONNA MISS YOU HORIZONS!

Steak and Shake happens to be one of my mom's  favorite restaurants,  thus I have been a patron for years.
I think they have a very good chili, cheese dog. There chili has always been good, now add a good hot dog, some cheese & diced raw onions and you have another winning combination. 
We all know about there burgers, sliders, fries, chili, baked beans, malts, hot fudge sundaes. ... all pretty top notch for the niche  they fill in the restaurant  world.
Breakfast, lunch or dinner, Steak and Shake will give you a good meal for a fair price.
They all look pretty identical, but each has a personality  of it's  own. A great place to meet to catch up with a friend or even to dine alone. I have found pretty consistent  food over the years. Now, service is a different story, that can vary from the time you enter to the time you leave. On my last visit service was very good. The entire experience was a winning combination. 
What's a girl to do? Keep winning  combinations  coming your way!

I have heard about this place, from everyone!  Unfortunately,  I seldom am downtown, so I miss out on many places, until my timing is right.
From the outside, it resembles a school bus, with it's  bright yellow color. It kind of lures you in. We ordered a steak taco, chicken taco, torta, Quesssadilla,  beans & rice.
Food was definately sub par, lacking flavor & seasoning. Things were way too greasy & appeared stale. No bueno. Not the type of food I enjoy at all. 
Service was terrible & rude. Food was not hot & tasty. This place may get all types, I just know I removed my bookmark & won't be returning.
Too high of prices for portions & quality of food.
What's a girl to do? Love, love Mexican food, but when you need to eat again in 30 minutes because you threw most of your meal away, keep looking!

Good service, good food & good value.  I think there burger, for what they are are good. Hey Goody - Goody serves same size. just not as good. The chili is passable & the fries & breakfast is good.
I was really glad they added the chili cheese dog, yummy!
The ice cram shakes & sundaes are always the good.
What's a girl to do? My mom is addicted, I grew up with it & it's much better than fast food.

It has been years since I have been to Mimi's Cafe, I do remember my last visit as being posative dinner ecperience. An  unofficial group of us met there Sunday for brunch. 
I gotta say the decor is somewhat dated and vintage, but it was packed with hungry dinners. 
Between all of us we had breakfast foods, sandwiches,  salads and full meals. It was great to see this array of offerings at 1 table and be able to discuss our individual meals with each other.
My first concern was when it took over a half hour to get a glass of water. My second concern came after all the orders were taken, which took 45 minutes and we still had not recieved our basket of breads. The bread finally showed up about 10 minutes before our meals started arriving.
Okay I understand it was about 12 people, but that should not be overwhelming for a restaurant that has been around at least 20 years, or any restaurant for that matter.
The next concern is when the food started arriving and the first 2 plates were sent back as the server or kitchen did not make the food as it was ordered. I am not exact on how many orders were wrong at the table, but that was 2 I heard the orders placed and the customer not even take the plate as the mistakes were so obvious.  Another in the group had a food allergy to onions, I heard her ask if her order could be made with no onions, no problem replied the server. When it arrived it was covered in diced green onions, come on really?  Did she really need to specify white, yellow, purple, green onions and shallots? Thankfully she noticed it right away and no paramedics were necessary.  This is all just gross negligence on the restraunts part. Either the server did not relay the orders correctly, the kitchen decided to cook without reading the tickets, the kitchen expadater was non existent or asleep and obviously the server did not check her orders when she pivked them up in the kitchen.
Okay LOL, my order and food was half delicious.  I ordered the chorizo, mushroom and red pepper omlet.  The omlet was a bit dry, but had great flavors. It was served with this thick red pepper or something like that piled way too high and heavy on the omlet, it was overwhelming, so I removed it all and the omlet was quite flavorful. The home fries were over seasoned with their Italian herbs, but they forgot the first ingredients,
 the salt and pepper. The home fries were cooked, but not properly. They should have had a harder outside than the inside. When I was almost at the end of my meal, I finally got the servers attention and asked if a roll was supposed to come with my meal, she said yes, but I didn't want it, I explained that was a mistake and she wanted to know what kind of roll I wanted. 
What is the problem with this picture? They have multiple roll choices and I am supposed to know what they are? She started naming some off and I took the honey one that sounded healthy. It arrived cold, my omlet was eaten and the home fries were going to remain on my plate. The roll looked promising, as I tried a nibble, if it had been warm, I think it would have been the winner of my meal.
I am just glad it was a fairly priced meal and it is sad to think the roll may have been the star of the show, if it had been given a chance to shine.
One last concern, it was regrettable that the server had several people show their driver's license to prove it was their debit/credit card she was returning to them, when she only had 3 checks in her hand.
What's a girl to do? Brunch with friends, yes next time it will be at a new location.

Red Lobster is to seafood, what Applebee's is to steak...ahhhh maybe that is a bit harsh. They are an institution. My grandfather died at 100 and his favorite restaurant was Red Lobster, for that reason alone and all the memories it gets the fourth star.
No really I like Red Lobster, when I am in the mood. It is not a high class seafood restaurant, it is a chain that probably pays cooks off the street $10.00 per hour. Personally I think some of their prices are outrageous, especially the "FRESH" seafood. I really like their bar and it would be a good drinking bar, but they have like nothing for happy hour. The bar is big and comfortable and just inviting. I find the restaurant usually to be loud and have an obnoxious atmosphere, so just eat in the bar.
I stopped by a few weeks ago after the gym, for a quick and healthy bite and ate at the bar. Damn those warm cheddar Bay Biscuits!! I told myself that just 1 would be okay, since I had just had a good work out, well that didn't happen, more on that latter. I ordered the grilled Tilapia with a house salad, broccoli and a plain baked potato (with sour cream on the side).
The Tilapia was well seasoned, very thin and a bit over cooked... hey it's very hard to not overcook fish that thin. I have always liked their baked potatoes, they have almost a creamy texture to them, really unusual for a baking potato, but good in a different sort of way. The house salad is iceberg blend with some shaved carrot pieces 1 tomato wedge and croutons. They said they had no light dressings so I did the oil and vinegar with some lemon wedges to zip up the flavor a bit. Salad was not particularly fresh, but it was really cold. And the broccoli was just plain,under  seasoned and lifeless, but it wasn't overcooked and mushy.
OK you are right it only deserves 3 stars, I have to leave sentiment out of this. Okay now that I changed that, back to the biscuits,  I swear, no I know they are addictive, There were 2 in the basket and after the 1 I allowed myself to eat, they were both gone and since I was sitting at the bar and the bartender was bored 2 more hot biscuits magically appeared and disappeared. I usually find service in the dining room disappointing and slow. 
If any of you know me, seldom do I eat out like I am on a diet, I eat for the experience and to try new things and really taste the food quality. Clearly this was a utilitarian quick dinner to just feed the stomach. Service at the bar was excellent and the place always looks clean.
For the price it was a healthy, decent meal. For dining, no I never would call Red Lobster a restaurant where one dines. Quick meals and keep the biscuits coming nights it is just fine.
What's a girl to do? Some nights you just have to grab a bite on the fly and I really try not to do fast food joints.

I have been coming to Ivarones for so many years & still love it. It is a lot of wood inside that blends for a cabin, romantic type of appeal. I love their big wood bar, totally awesome. Every time I enter there are organized friendly greeters. Trust me It pays to have reservations, no matter the day or time.
I was taking a friend for an early Birthday celebration. It was so hot out, when we were seated, we just wanted to chill & have some ice water. Craig was our server & totally related & gave us time to cool down, no hurry.
First Craig took our drink order & brought us nice hot bread for the olive oil & spices
 The bread was great & had wonderful texture &  flavor. The herbs in the olive oil were bland & had no pizzazz, this was disappointing. 
I started with the escargot, can't pass them up when I see them. They were server in an escargot serving dish with clarified butter, herbs & garlic that was not overpowering. The snails were succulent & well seasoned, swerved with hard toasted baguette around the plate. The escargot butter was a great dipping sauce.
Unfortainately we both wanted prime rib, so no sharing tonight! The salads were fresh & crisp & hit all the right notes. My partner got the large prime rib & I the regular
 A waiter brought the entrees to the table & looking at them, I was disappointed. Before he could serve them Creaig showed up & said this was not our order. He immediately went to the kitchen & returned with 2 beautiful prime rib dinners.
We both agreed the prime rib was the best we had eaten in years. Tender, well seasoned & cooked to perfection. The twice baked potato lacked anything to set it apart, it actually was one of the worst I ever had. It lacked the major components that usually make a twice baked potato: bacon, green onion or chive, sour cream & cheddar cheese. The only redeeming quality was the didn't over whip it & you still had some of the " meat" part of the potato.
This was a Birthday dinner & they did give us a piece of frozen German chocolate cake. You could easily tell it had come in frozen & lacked moisture & any great flavor, but it was a nice gesture. I made reservations & put down it was a Birthday celebration & requested no embarrassing singing. Unfortunately this did not get conveyed to our great waiter Chris & I had to ask about Birthdays, EMBARRASSING!
Overall a nice, quiet evening, once the couple took the screaming baby outside.
What's a girl to do? Waiter great, most food mediocre, cocktails good & quite expensive, has Ivarones changed that much? Maybe I should just stick to Berns.

Who knew, we had a little wine gem in the east grounds of Hillsborough county? Lol, they have a yearly wine festival, that is full of live music, loads of people, foods, fun & so much more.
During it's "regular operation" they have tours of the vineyards as well as the operation. 
They have a cutesy type of their version of a general store/KC everything store. They offer some great items for wine enthusiasts, tourists & has something for everyone.
Along with this they offer some great specialty items, such as cheese, crackers, charcuterie & various other items. The selection is limited, but quite good. This of course is also where you can purchase your wine, be it to enjoy there or take home, for private consumption.
Overall this is a unique & enjoyable experience, for all adults to enjoy. Hillsborough County does not have an abundance of wineries, so when I come across one, I relax & enjoy. 
They have added a brewery, which is exciting. Personally, I am not much of a beer drinker, but from what I have heard the concensus is quite good. A good addition to an independent vineyard.
This is a great place to come & people watch. Also good for letting your hair down & having a chill time with friends or a special someone. It really is an amazing venue to meet friends & enjoy some time together.
Hillsborough really does have many great things to do & places to go. Fortunately, for those of us that live here, this list continues to grow. Always a new experience just around the cornor.
What's a girl to do? We all love options & the more, the harder decisions become.

Every dish that I have tried at Wildflower has always been exceptional. It is one of my favorite restaurants in NW Tucson. Last time, I had the chicken tacos which were pretty good. Usually I will order the salmon when I go to Wildflower. The servers are very knowledgeable and friendly. They also have a good wine selection.

Beverly's is still a great option for a late breakfast or an early lunch. I'm usually a sweet for breakfast kinda guy, but this time I feel rather savory. I opted for the "crab and spinach" omelet, though it really should have been spelled "krab". It was good, but not as good as another omelet on the table. 

The real winner though was the "leftover omelet"! Yum. This omelet appeared to be baked and the herbs in the egg really came through. It had a combination of many things, hence the "leftover", and the combination was delicious. I would definitely have this omelet again.

We also had the opportunity to meet Beverly (who is very nice) and learned something new: Beverly did the black and white sketches that hang on the walls. She signs them "Beverlee", so it's kinda confusing. 

Oh, and on Sunday mornings expect a wait. But pair breakfast with a trip to the Corey Avenue Fresh Market (http://www.yelp.com/biz/corey-avenue-fresh-market-st-pete-beach) and make a morning of it. That's what we did and had a great time. 

PS. I would have described the omelet's contents better, but clicking the URL for Beverly's redirects you to a prescription drug site.

I go to this place fairly often as it is close to my house and my sons school.  My son loves the egg drop soup.  The other food is average.  I consider myself a regular customer.  I had to go to the bathroom really bad the other day after picking my son up from school and I knew they had a restroom and that it would be quick.  The lady behind the counter started waving her hands at me and said, "no! no!"  I asked, "I can't use the restroom?"   She said NO!   The place had people in it so it was pretty embarrassing. There was not even a sign on the door saying "Restroom for Customers Only."  I could not believe it.  It is not like I am a homeless drug addict and was using it to shoot up in.  I am a professional local business owner!   I almost peed my pants making it over the pizza place next door.   I will never go back to this place to eat again!

I decided to give Uncle Maddio's a try after Irma.  I ordered an XL pizza, which comes with choice of crust and sauce, and 3 included toppings.  I also added an order of breadsticks.  Bill was about $23.00, so pricy.  This is like a chipotle of pizza.  Toppings are in bins and they apply them and toss your pizza in the oven.  

There was too much sauce and way too few toppings on the pizza.  The bread sticks were not doughy enough for my taste, more like flat bread and lacked flavor.  The had more rosemary than garlic, and I favor garlic butter.  

The staff was super nice and very friendly.  Won't be back due to cost and skimpy toppings.

Mediocre at best, I will not be back.  I ordered the chicken parmesan and it was overly greasy and lacked flavor.  It was served with a very small side of pasta, the sauce also lacked flavor.  The interior is also in need of some updating, the booths are quite worn.  Service was also painfully slow.

I have NEVER been to a restaurant with such a dirty bathroom. I completely lost my appetite because I figured the kitchen was also dirty. The others couldn't believe  how little portions of rice and beans that came with their 
 fajitas. It was comical. Rice is so darn cheap..Any way with the bathroom, the portion size, the patrons that go there, I will never go back.

A good place to come with a group people to try different dishes. I personally do not like the dan dan noodles which is one of their signature dish. If I had to recommend any of the dishes it would be either dumplings/wontons in chilli oil or the salt and peppered shrimp. We wanted to order the peppered squid but that was sold out so try that out. 

Overall I don't think the food here is appetizing or anything special but the service and everything else was nice.

I like pitchers of alcohol. A LOT. I just like ones that are actually palatable. Wrap Shack has pitcher specials, including the blackout special also known as Long Island Iced Tea. My group and I ordered a Jack & coke pitcher was painfully strong. We concluded that it wasn't very good and it tasted like we were drinking Jack served neat. I would've been better off ordering shots, quite honestly. They have a variety of both healthy and not so healthy wraps you can choose from. I ordered the chicken fajita wrap, which was essentially a burrito. Unfortunately, I found it to be pretty bland. Fortunately, their buffalo bites are pretty good.

Service was super slow when it was time to close our check. We were seated at the table and were ready to pay. Unfortunately, we felt like were abandoned, so after 15 minutes of waiting, one of the people in my group walked up to the bar to close the check. I like their offerings, but this wouldn't be my first choice, sadly.

Ohhhh  girrrrl. This is a place I would have likely never, ever visited on my own (Oysters? Seafood? Nah.), but when my best friend made a trip from Texas to Philly to visit me, and she requested clam chowder, I researched the best place. Oyster House came up several times, so we decided to give this joint a try. I'm so happy we did! 

The website lists a lunch menu served from 11-2:30 and a dinner menu from 5pm onwards. As we were due to arrive in the window between 2:30 and 5, I called to ensure we'd be able to grab a bowl of the "made fresh daily" clam chowder. The hostess cleared up any confusion we had - they do serve food within that window, but the menu is more limited. The kitchen is closed from 4:30-5 pm but the bar is still open. 

This place is very trendy, clean, with a very downtown vibe. I felt slightly underdressed in my lacy shorts and tshirt. We were immediately greeted and sat at the bar by the lovely bartender. Very handsome and very attentive. We ordered two bowls of clam chowder ($8/piece), an order of fries to share, and my friend ordered the Mexican Firing Squad to drink. The food was ordered and delivered in less than ten minutes. The Mexican Firing Squad was made with jalapeno infused tequila - it was a strong drink, worth the $11. However, it was VERY spicy. Almost undrinkable. Definitely meant to be sipped with a big glass of water closeby. I love spicy foods, but if I had ordered that drink, I'm not sure I would have been able to finish it. Once some of the ice melted, it was a little more tolerable, but if you're someone with any aversion to spice, DO NOT order this!

The chowder was delicious! I'll be honest, I'm not generally huge fan of seafood. I'll try anything once, so I ordered the chowder (never had clam chowder before!) I was worried it would be fishy. It was anything but - it was creamy, hot, delicious, with chunks of bacon and fresh garnishes. I had no qualms about polishing the entire bowl, and did so in about 6 minutes. The fries were okay. They were served with a spicy mustardy dipping sauce. They were garnished with something green, parsely or something. Not a huge fan.

Happy Hour is M-F 5-7, and Saturday 9-11. I am definitely keen to come try some of their specials, and maybe I'll even gain the guts to try oysters. Their drink menu is very impressive, so I'll be back for that alone.

I can't speak to their food, and the only thing I've ever ordered here is a to-go hot tea.

However, I've been a patron at Soup Kitchen more than once, and I just have to give a special shout out to their staff. I've never had a negative interaction. Every employee I've encountered is kind, well mannered, and down to earth - the type of people who seem to genuinely respect and enjoy this establishment.

So bravo to the management, the staff, and this cute little cafe for their customer service. It will keep me coming back!

This was my first time at District Donuts and the hype from my friends made me really excited to try it.

First- I lucked out with parking in the lot attached. I think there are around 15 spots back there, and it's a little tight. 

Second-I really like the atmosphere of District Donuts - it was like this urban hipster (in the absolute best way) place. 

Third- umm...YUM!! The donuts are so creative and Ssoooo good. I had a jelly donut and my friend ordered the tiramisu. Both were awesome. My friend's tasted exactly like the dessert. It was awesome. 

We also ordered coffee drinks. I got a delicious vanilla latte. It took a little bit of time for the drink to be made, but it was actually nice to enjoy my donut in the restaurant. 

The line seemed was not that bad when I got there around 9:30 on a Saturday. It goes fast :)

Overall thoughts: yum. I'll go there again for sure.

I've been here a number of times now and I believe the food is great quality. I do find that the food is simple yet delicious. Everything is plated nicely and overall the service is beautiful. My issue with Wilko's is the consistency and the price. It's way too expensive for what it is and there have been a few times where I had some overtoasted buns or bread for either their sandwiches or burgers.

Sandwiches and burgers are worth it for lunch despite the $12-$16 because they come with fries. I would switch out the herb fries for truffle or cotija fries. They often change up the menu every few months to keep things interesting. I love the texture of the fries and the flavors work well together. The lemon aioli is sometimes a great dip depending on the day. Grilled cheese is one of my favorites, but if you aren't too hungry splitting a pizza with someone is great. The sauce is warm and flavorful and the dough is fluffy and not greasy.

The dinners can go from $15-$40 but are delicious. I had the house fish once and the curry seasoning was divine. Overall I find dinner to be a treat.

Brunch is my least favorite meal at Wilko's because they don't offer more than other places but charge just as much if not more. Eggs and potatoes shouldn't cost as much as they do. In addition it's not satisfying, with a restaurant that offers so much I think that they are pretty good but pricey.

I was so disappointed by my first visit to Rotisseur. Everything except the chicken was very underseasoned. The mac n cheese was absolutely awful...no flavor. The noodles were all separated and I barely tasted any cheese. The roasted potatoes were flavorless..they were cooked well, but could've used a bit more salt and seasoning. Keep in mind that I'm a person who NEVER adds salt to my food, so it's crazy for me to say it needed more salt. The kale chips were good, but very greasy. Plus, they stuff the chips into a little container and they all broke into the tiniest little pieces. The chicken itself was quite good, but the sides were awful. I did enjoy that they were making all the sides on the stove behind the counter - it was obvious that everything was homemade and super fresh. But I'm so bummed..I hope it was just an off night for them because this wasn't nearly as good as I thought it would be.

Came here for lunch one day and enjoyed the outdoor seating. The oysters were tasty, as were our other dishes. The ahi tuna was impressive. The drinks were really tasty as well. I think we got one more food item but I can't remember what it was. Definitely check this place out...reasonably lunch prices and tasty menu offerings.

Sidecar used to be our favorite...one of the best burgers we've ever had. But recently, our meals haven't been so good. I don't know what happened, but the burger just doesn't taste the same. It hasn't had much flavor the last two times. And another of our favorites, the wings, were taken off the menu. The last time I went I got the fried goat cheese salad, which was tasty, but way too much greens and not enough other ingredients to complement them. I'm sure we will go back at some point, but after a few bad meals, we might have to search for a new neighborhood go-to...

My review is pretty much the exact same as Michelle's. My latte was only so-so...not particularly hot, nothing special, a bit light on the espresso (maybe only 1 shot?). But I have heard great things about the food, so I will probably pop back in. They received their bread delivery while I was there and the bread looked yummy! The pastries also looked HEAVENLY.

We popped into Pisces Sushi on a Monday night and ordered the sunomono salad, jalapeño hamachi, Manhattan roll (Spicy Tuna, Avocado, Cucumber, topped with Tuna, Masago, Scallion), Mango Madness roll (Panko Fried Mango, Cream Cheese, Cucumber, Topped with Avocado, Mango Vinaigrette, Togarashi), and Dunedin's Dream roll (Panko Grouper, Cream Cheese, Avocado Topped with Spicy Tuna, Garlic Aioli, Sweet Chili, Wonton Crisps, Masago, and Scallions). Everything was good, but just not spectacular. I felt like I barely tasted the fish - or much flavor, period. For example, I didn't taste any mango flavor in the Mango Madness - there was a sweetness to the sauce, but that's it. Given all the various toppings and ingredients, I just expected more robust flavor - the most flavor was in the jalapeño hamachi. The tuna was shockingly pink...I've never seen tuna such a hot pink color. It weirded me out a bit, in all honesty. I'd consider going back and trying some of the more basic rolls just to see if the fish is tasty on its own, but we just weren't overly impressed by the specialty rolls we tried. On another note, our server was excellent. Quite attentive and knew the menu well. Our bill for 2 with the above items, no drinks or dessert, was just under $70 including tax and tip. Of note, we always order extra ginger when we go to sushi restaurants and this is the first time we have EVER been charged for it (only $.50, but still). I don't think the meal was bad by any means, but A-OK seemed like an appropriate rating.

We went back to Cask for dinner recently and were very impressed by the improvements to the menu and food. Our server, Sabrina (who was fantastic) said the restaurant got a new chef who had redone the menu. Between the four of us, we ordered a steak Cobb salad, a salmon Cobb salad, taco trio, and the chicken and waffles. The food was all very good. My husbad's steak was delicious and perfectly cooked, and my friend said her salmon was excellent as well. My taco trio was pretty good...taco shells were a bit greasy, but they were flavorful and tasty. I didn't try the chicken and waffles, but they looked very good (much different/better than they looked when I had them for brunch back in June). Dessert was a bit of a miss....the cake in the bananas foster was so rum-soaked it tasted like fire. We literally gagged when we took a bite. The Soho s'mores (which are no longer on the menu but are offered upon request) were ok...but according to my friend who has had them before, they are different and not nearly as good. The wine list is lacking a bit, but their cocktails are pretty good.
