All in all, I would definitely return. The food is so much better than it used to be, so for anyone who hasn't been recently, give it another shot.

The service at Boca was good, so I give it to the wait staff. The food was not memorable in the slightest. The menu is very limited. The flatbreads here are the highlight of the menu. While I love the farm to table local as much as possible concept, there needs to be flavor. My father in law ordered the smoked meatloaf and it was lacking flavor. My mother in law ordered the braised short ribs, not bad, but not great. The flatbread that boasted bacon, heirloom tomatoes, etc on it was really good. I ordered the bone marrow where there was absolutely no flavor. Yes it was gelatinous, but it was in dire need of salt. No salt nor pepper at the table. A very pompous move on the chef's part. I'm fine with it as long as you season your food correctly. 

I may return at lunch for a flatbread, but will head to one of many other restaurants that South Tampa has to offer over a dinner here again.

A friend & I dropped in for an afternoon beer while we were waiting for some work to be done at my house. He recommended the place for it's beer...the good food was a bonus.

The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable, pouring us a few samples before we decided on a pint...I had the Riverhorse Oatmeal Milk Stout (very good smoked flavor with decent medium body) and my friend had the Pliny the Elder Double IPA.

When we asked about food, the bartender mentioned that some of the latino guys working in the kitchen had been sharing their recipe for handmade tortillas and my friend, being a fan of authentic Mexican cuisine jumped on the Boar soft tacos, served with a pepper sauce.

I had the Seafood Springroll [picture above]...a crispy treat that was your standard GBD on the outside, but had a steamy soft inside owing to the the way the shrimp & I'm guessing crabmeat liquid had mingled into the roll as it fried.  Served with a sweet/spicy peanutty dip and a more tangy fruity chop or compote, the two oversized springrolls made for a great midday snack.

I'll have to come back to see what the nightlife is like, but SPTR made for a great mid-day beer-diversion. 

I'd have to come back and see if the same atmosphere & level of good service held up during peak times before I give it a fourth star.

Decided to try a new place close to home. I went in for a slice, and was told they only do plain cheese pizzas by the slice. That was a bit of a letdown. considering I wanted to try one of a few different slices, since I've never been there before. Two dollars/slice, very large slice. Uneventful. Too much cheese, I was practically gaging it down. Too much flour on the outside of the dough. Overall not much flavor going on. I would probably only go back if I had a group with me so we can get a full size pizza.
Very overpriced and pretentious. This place embodies everything people hate about hipsters.

What's not to like?

Funky bands, no cover, decent al pastor options (they call it pineapple pork here) for the fooding if you are having a bit of trouble standing and talking at the same time. 

Another excellent option in the Marigny, certainly worth a stop if you like what you hear.
As a tourist and oyster lover, we really enjoyed this place. Excellent food, service and atmosphere. I'd recommend it to anybody looking a good meal.

Pretty decent Vietnamese food. I like that they have a huge condiment tray to adjust your liking if it is more sweet, savory and spicy. Their soups are good and the broth for pho has good flavor. I was a little disappointed with the Banh Mi that it didn't have enough pickled vegetables on it. Very skimpy and they do not put enough meat in their spring rolls. Good taste but they could amp up their Banh mi and spring rolls by adding more meat and veggies.  The soups are always delicious and served with the proper herbs, lime and bean sprouts.

The interior of the deli has a lot of room and was super packed at lunch. I figured this was a really good sign. My son and I ordered at the counter and went to sit down.  We waited for a while for our sandwiches. They arrived 20 minutes later, which was ok, because I wasn't in a hurry.  My son and I were really disappointed with the amount of toppings provided. My sandwich had hardly any turkey and there was really nothing special about it. I could make this at home. I heard some great things about this deli and for the price, I was expecting a quality product, but it was not delivered.

I usually stick to my favorite spot for Chinese food, but tonight I didn't feel like driving far so I ordered food to go from here.   Very disappointing. The food looked great, except for the Orange Chicken, which was soggy.  The House Pan Fried Noodles were Super bland. I couldn't taste any flavor and the amount of protein they put on the noodles were really skimpy. I don't usually eat orange chicken, I ordered it for my kids and they didn't like it.  I tasted it and could tell why. The chicken flour coating was thick and soggy.  The dish should have a balanced amount of sweet and savory. The dish was prepared really salty.  Hate to say this, but I can make better Orange Chicken from a package bought at Trader Joe's.  The Won Ton Soup was decent.  I wouldn't rave about it. I definitely will not come back here, even if it is just steps from my door. Going to stick with my usual Chinese Restaurant where I can be guaranteed tasty, good quality Chinese Food.

Good burgers. I really enjoy the albacore tuna sandwich and the tempura green beans are delicious.  I have eaten at Habit Burgers in California and they have always been really good. This location is in circus circus food court. I mapped it on my phone and didn't realize it, just FYI. Really, I would just go to my neighborhood places for burgers. Didn't seem as good as the ones in Cali. My burger was cold and they did not accept my discount for being a Habit Burger Email member. If you have any discounts from Habit, they will not accept them at this location.

If you are looking for a place for a big crowd to hang out, Gentle Ben's is certainly a great place. They have good beer and the atmosphere is very enjoyable. Because it's a sports bar, no one cared too much if we were a bit loud. We had wonderful time there for my friend's birthday party.
 
However, if you are looking for a place to get good food, this is not the place to go. I ordered a Western BBQ Burger, and it was tasteless. There was not much flavor in the meat, and I think the patty had been frozen, not fresh. After a couple of bites, I stopped to add some salt to it. Then I realized the server forgot to bring BBQ sauce for the burger, so I had to wait another five minutes (by this time the burger was already cold) for my BBQ sauce. I also had a taste of the Spinach & Artichoke Dip that my friend ordered, and it was disappointing as well. 

Mixed drinks were also not quite right. My friend ordered a margarita, and after the first sip, she asked the server to ask the manager if she could exchange it for a beer because it was so bad. 

My advice: go to Gentle Ben's for the sports bar environment and beer, but skip the food.

Every new restaurant needs 3 things to get their name out there: great service, great employees, and great food. Coneheads EASILY knocked everything out of the park (or I guess chicken coop, in this case). 

When we arrived, the cashier let us know how the menu works. They have a small and a large sized waffle cone to choose from and you can add chicken, fried cauliflower, or both in the cone. There's also a variety of sauces to toss them in, and for an extra buck you can add coleslaw, mac and cheese, or grits on top. 

Of course i went with the large chicken waffle cone with the 24k sauce (which is like a sweet honey mustard BBQ-ish type of sauce. Really good and highly recommend it!) and some mac on top. I also added a side of grits, because I heard they're amazing. 

The waffle cone was so good y'all. They're handmade and not exactly like your typical waffle cone. I was expecting one of those solid rock tooth-breaking ice cream cones, but these were sorta softer and crunchy at the same time, and super easy to eat. 

It was quite literally an easy way to eat chicken and waffles AND still making it resemble chicken and waffles.

Maybe this was a case of too much hype, but this was not a win for me. First, the seating is confusing. I think it is seat yourself, but I'm still not clear on this. Second, the music is loud. Maybe I'm too old to be their target audience, but it was too much for me. Third, when we went to order beers, our server had never tried and had no info on the three beers we asked about, one of which was on special. I understand working at a bar does not necessarily make you a craft beer enthusiast, but this person gave the impression they just did not care at all. We did get the wings, and they were delicious. But the server offered to bring our check before we were finished eating - twice. The wings were good, and so were the beers - but they were not enough to make up for the service when there are so many great bars around town.

Some friends invited us to meet them here, a place they regularly take guests in Avon. The food was okay. The Greek salad was delicious, and the saganaki was alright. Some of my dining companions had the chicken shish kebob, which was fine. I had the spanakopita, which was okay. Our server was not especially friendly, and seemed annoyed with us most of the meal. For us, that was a deal-breaker, and we won't return.

Ooooo I'm so conflicted about this review. The Goat had only about half of the employees working that they should have today. It took us forever to get our food (well over an hour) and there were numerous tables left dirty (I counted 8 at one point) while patrons were waiting for a table. The poor employee that was working the front of the house seating patrons was also acting as bus boy and at one point I saw him run a delivery out--it was craziness! 
Now on to the food. We ordered the tots with beer cheese and were left underwhelmed. The tots needed more seasoning and the beer cheese didn't give them what they needed. I asked for salt (salt and pepper were not on the tables) and ketchup and it made a huge difference. Our next part is what earned The Goat a 3 star review instead of 1 or 2--the food was delicious! My husband got the ranch hand burger and I got the double pepperoni pizza. Both were excellent! The food is good enough that I would be more than willing to give The Goat a second chance even after our lackluster initial experience.

This is a busy restaurant! Wait staff are pleasant but you will surely need to be patient as everyone wants to be here. And it is FOR SURE worth every bite. I started with the winter soup and ate every morsel. My fiancée had the brisket fazzoletti and she usually doesn't eat the whole meal--- yup! Done and delicious (I had a bite!), friends got the Thai Salmon, cucumber feta salad and seafood cioppino and for dessert fiancée and I did the brownie skillet. Everything was delicious, we had no left overs.

Quick trick to help with the wait time, know at least what drinks you want. They are delicious. I suggest the mule's paradise for those mezcal and tequila lovers. Order the drink with the choice of water so when they return for dinner selection, you can order a second round!

I would def return and probably see what next season has to offer. Looks like they change menu with what's available at the farms and it makes sense. Excellent time. Packed, make reservations AND be ready to be close and possibly hot. Masks are on and up but diners sitting free nose and mouths. Love The Love!

Cute little donut shop with made to order donuts. You choose among the fancy ones at $2.50 per, or $2 each if you buy 6, or the regular ones at $1.50 each, or $1 each if you buy 6. Natch we opted for the 6 regular, and they were hardly regular...these are hefty donuts that are freshly made and then hand rolled in your chosen flavors in sugar infused bliss. We tried the strawberry lavender and the cinnamon brown sugar. Both were really good, warm and quite substantial. If I were to try a fancy one, the banana cream pie would be on my list, but honestly the fancier ones were more about heavier frostings which I'm not a fan of.

Opens real early!

Update:We traditionally eat here a few times a month. I've left some rave reviews about the food but I cam no longer overlook the service. IF YOU CALL AHEAD THEY WILL TELL HOU THERES NO WAIT AND WHEN YOU GET THERE IT IS CLEARLY A WAIT. This has happened to us multiple times. They take reservations on steak night. I tried to make one and they said I dont need it. By the time we got there, 45 minute wait. The turnover is high and the service has gotten so bad. We're trying to balance the quality of food with the bad service but we will think twice before going again and for sure not taking friends.

Old review: 
This is one of our favorite go-to restaurants and our favorite overall Italian. 
Let me tell you why.
The food. Ah-mazing!
The pizza. We love everything about their pizzas. The homemade crust, the sauce, the homemade sausage. It is thin crispy perfectly seasoned and cooked dough. Do yourself a favor and eat the pizza in. It's best right out of the oven. My husba says great cold too.
The apps. Love the calamari and fried eggplant. Crispy and again perfectly seasoned and cooked. 
The entrees. Husband loves the chicken Parmesan although I like my breading a tad more brown that they serve it but they're happy to accommodate you if you ask.
The salads. Fresh and the Caesar dressing is legit. Not premade. Legit Caesar. 
The desserts. Love the cannoli. I have to confess, I like my own Italian cream cake better because mine is a light fluffy cake and Gendusas is dense. The gelato is delish too. 
The portions. We once served 4 people with a chicken parm order which comes with a side salad and a pizza. We had leftovers. It's soooo much good food.
The vibe. The atmosphere feels homey. The tables are old distressed and repurposed  doors with glass tops. Frank Sinatra, The Godfather  and a lot of other Italians line the walls. The pizzas are named after mob bosses and you get a souvenir cup with a famous line from the movie, "Leave the gun. Take the cannoli." 
They have a wall unit ac which will sometimes freeze you to death and it's loud.
They don't serve alcohol but you can bring your own wine and they'll pop the cork and bring you wine glasses. No corking fee.
The service is good and friendly but not over attentive. They aim to please and they stay busy as this is a popular local joint in Kenner's Rivertown neighborhood. It's convenient for us.

Service is terrible!! I asked for another drink and they used the same glass that I gave them. I would like my beer cold. Not out of the same glass that I had for 30 minutes. Thank you comb over bar tender (aka Rachel)with your Seminole Heights grown ginger beard! Cheers to you and your piss poor service!

Good, but not great, bakery and casual restaurant. 

They do have a cute chocolate mousse desert that is shaped like a little mouse. 

The restaurant is somewhat difficult to access off of busy Ulmerton Rd. and parking can be limited at lunch time.

As an out-of-towner, this place is amazing, yet confusing as can be!  I stopped in for lunch 2 weeks ago.  I walked into the bar area, and instantly realized that this wasn't what i was looking for, so i went around the corner, and found a coffee-tea house and placed an order for a pear and brie sandwich, then went to sit outside.  The cashier brought me my sandwich, but wouldn't take a tip really... yet he came back to clear my plate.  Kind of a strange service set-up, but everyone else seemed to understand it, so maybe I need some work?

Anyway, the sandwich was AMAZING!  Genuius pairing.  I feel lucky to eat something so delicious for lunch.  One of the perks of being an 'adult'.  The pear was poached and carmelized and sweet, and the cheese was gooey.  It was atop a toasted crispy bread that had received a quick smear of butter to 'grilled cheese' the sandwich.  

I'm now dreaming about having another one of these.

For $3 I had a veggie dog that was SO SO delicious at the Pop Up Garden next to the Jamaican Jerk Hut yesterday.  It was cooked well, on a fresh toasted bun, with toppings that just blew my mind.  I see this cart everywhere, and I've always been skeptical as a vegetarian, but man... the future looks bright.

Same great quality every time I visit. The waitress Jenny is super nice and is great at her job. The prices are extremely reasonable, the chefs put a lot of ingredients in the rolls and work fast. Love this place, easily the best sushi on Veterans!

I always check Yelp before dining out but this one time I did not check, we come across Gallito and give it a shot. The menu was impressive at first glance and caught our eye. The lady taking our order was very friendly and helpful. The killer is that everything (but especially the tacos) were extremely over priced. The tacos are literally the size of an adult male hand palm. No more than 3 inches wide, making for a very disappointing and non filling meal. 

Street Corn: (2/5) It was not absolutely terrible so I can't leave it at 1/5 but it was close. You can clearly tell the corn was canned or frozen and mildly warmed in a microwave if at all. It had a little flavor from the toppings and hot sauce I added but not much. Certainly not worth the $4 

Pork Belly Taco: (2/5) Again, it was edible and not terrible so a 2/5 is pretty accurate. The pork belly was very dry, over cooked, and room temperature. It was clearly sitting out for a good while without any heating element. The sauce and pork fat made it slightly good but very overcooked pork at room temperature just made for a terrible time eating it. 

Duck Taco: (4/5) The duck meat was pulled, tender, and juicy. The sauce tasted great and the toppings were the perfect combination. The only killer was the size, very disappointing and not so filling!

They have the best roast beef poboys in town, hands down! Pair that with a glass bottle of Barq's rootbeer that they sell and you have the best poboy combo around! They also have excellent fish and shrimp poboys.

Been here twice now and just don't understand the big deal. Small portions, not cheap, and not particularly good. A bit bland, even (I had the jerk chicken plate last). Have tried it twice now to check if it was a fluke the first time around, but no. Also, the bathroom is gross (and without (paper or other) towels) and there are flies everywhere, if you care about those types of things.

The weird thing is, both times I went there were no specials (which other reviews mention). I wonder if I really did pick the two worst days to go.

Despite being a place reminiscent of the bars I would frequent when I was newly 21, I didn't mind this place. 

I was the number 1 on Joe B.'s review list, part of a bachelorette party and we had a great time! 

For some reason, there was a line outside (snort), but they let our party in ahead of the line. They also were freely passing out "buy one get one free" drink cards - very dangerous. 

The music was okay (I think I heard the new Usher song 4 times), and the bartenders were nice enough. The best part was that I was drinking Stoli and tonic all night for pennies (not really, just compared to similar places in Chicago). 

The crowd was - funny? But who really cares when you're drunk and dancing with a group of friends? 

Oh, and F you to the douche bag bouncer that threw out my drink because I set it down for a minute while I was dancing on the "stage". 

I'd be back for a party or something, but not really to just come and hang out.
Hahaha how is this place still in business. This isn't good sushi at all and for gods sake turn the AC on!

Great place for to go bagels and bagel dogs. Great selection of fresh bagels. I like to pick up a dozen or two for snacks at a.m. meetings. They also make a small desert pastry called rugulah which is heavenly.
This is a pretty nice family owned business. They have some nice daily specials every day. A nice stop for lunch. The portions are very generous.

Greek Lady is very mediocre. If you are craving Greek, go to Yiro Yiro. I have only gotten the gyros and I have been unimpressed with each one I get. I got the lamb gyro first and they topped it with red onions. The red onions are too over-powering on the palate. They also add too much tzatziki sauce to their gyros. I usually get the vegetable gyro since their meat doesn't taste that good. I have gotten chicken too and wasn't that impress.

New owners?

So I used to love Dick and Jenny's even though there was only 1 vegetarian main dish.  I came recently with my boyfriend and some out of town guesses and both my boyfriend and I were kinda shocked at how disappointed we were in the food.  We had a cold corn soup that we were really excited to try because its so hard to find vegetarian soup and neither of us liked it at all.  The caprese salads were super small and even though they looked like heirloom tomatoes they were pretty flavorless like they were refrigerated for long periods.  There wasn't a vegetarian main course so we ate some sides and left hungry.  Not sure whats changed but we left feeling like it wasn't the restaurant we had grown to love.

Fun new restaurant that opened on St Charles Avenue where the old Cheesecake Bistro used to be. Bonus points that they offer complimentary valet parking on a busy street. I like the concept of a New Orleans Creole/Cajun twist on Mexican cuisine. Fusion doesn't always work for restaurants, but I liked it in this case.

The restaurant is really cute and spacious with a lot of nice decor; there's murals both outside and inside that are Instagram worthy. It's a great date night spot for couples or groups. I went here on a double date and we ordered the chips and salsa with cracklins to start off with, duck confit empanadas, beer battered fish tacos, Al's southern bone-in fried chicken fajitas and enchiladas (I think).

Overall, our group enjoyed the ambiance, food and drinks. The fried chicken on the fajita entree was delicious but it was obvious that it was Popeyes (it is Al Copeland Jr's restaurant after all) that came served in a frying pan with an $18.95 price tag. Other than that, everything else was very reasonably priced considering the location.

Our server was awesome! I am sure that Nole will do well.

So this was the first time I had been to the new location since their move. The awkward Part was the seating. A table got seated at the right and left of us and one table is literally right next to you but at a higher level so strangers are faced at you and you can hear both tables conversations. The burger was  ok I remember the burgers tasting a lot better at old location. Service was good and another person  also asked if our burgers were tasting good. All and all a good time

We ordered the Mexican Hot Chocolate, which tasted authentic. The waitress was super kind, but she seemed new and did not know the specials, so another waiter took care of us. The eggs and beans were great, but the best part of our meal was the Portuguese Bread, highly recommend it!! We left craving the churros, which were on display, but we will have to try them again some other time soon. Thanks Cafe Y Chocolate!

I'm not sure if it's due to the pandemic, but for a $13-14 Tiki drink you'd expect a tiki container with flames or something, and not the smaller plastic container used for complimentary drinks at the hotel. Worth its price in alcohol maybe, but you can mix that gasoline at home yourself for cheaper...and in whatever container you want. 

Cool looking place. Nice inside with plenty of TVs and bar seating. Lots of outdoor patio seating with the view of the water, although this isn't a sea breeze, so the air can be a bit swampy. 

Food was creative. Large portions. Presented well. Pork rinds and fish dip tasted ok, but didn't really combine well for me. My pork belly in the pork belly and pineapple sandwich was a little tough to chew. Crab cake sandwich was ok and also the largely portioned fried cod sandwich. Fries were tasty. 

My meal costing tiki drink with more than few different alcohols tasted ok. Again, in a small cup. My mango tiki drink literally came out of one of those pre made swirly things you find at daiquiri places. Service was friendly and a little forgetful. For the price, maybe another try in the future. At least with some homework done.

Food: 2 stars 
Service: 2 stars
Price: 2 stars 
Atmosphere: 3.5 stars


I did the all you can eat sushi.  It was rolls only and appetizers.  

Appetizers were meh, the mussels were good, covered in too much sauce.  The pot stickers tasted old I couldn't even eat the things.  

The rolls were empty and skinny and just not great.  Every roll was basically the same, crystal shrimp and imitation crab with very tiny piece of salmon.  Boring menu.  
I tried the spider roll and what they gave me was hilarious.  

I wouldn't come back here, false yelp rating.  

Only good thing was the ice cream.  Can't mess that up.  Haha.

Anyplace that serves up a martini called "Wedding Cake" has my vote!
Seriously, though, we've been going to The Porterhouse for a four years, and I'm happy to report, the quality of the food is consistent. I can't tell you how many times I've written reviews citing fabulous food only to return to the place and discover it's not so great, usually this is do to revolving chefs! 
Anyway, The Porterhouse does not have this problem! 
I've never had a bad meal here, and have tried just about everything, except the seafood. My PIC (Partner in Crime), however, has eaten the seafood and loves it!
A few favorites: The Ham & Havarti, the black bean soup, the smoked chicken spring rolls.
OMG - The Kentucky Derby Pie (pecans and chocolate) is TO DIE FOR. Seriously awesome. 
And if you like bread pudding - there's is fab - homemade!
Also to note - the pasta dishes are always wonderful too. You know how often you order pasta and the noodles are limp and pasty? Not so here, it's always wonderful!
One thing that didn't please us - the Creme Brulee - it tastes like vanilla pudding with a sugary coating. 
But - that's the only criticism!
Love the bar area - there is a wall of windows which brightens the place up. (I love a lot of light). 
Upstairs, the whole back wall is all window, which overlooks fields and is scenic in all seasons!
Love it! 
***note, they are closed on Mondays!

An "authentic" Italian restaurant in a SHOPPING CENTER - hell yeah bitches! We've been here twice, once for lunch and for dinner (I chose this for my birthday celebration - that's how much I love it). 
Small, but inviting and cozy. 
Staff - excellent, attentive, but with heavy Italian accent - just nod and smile if you can't figure out what they are saying. 
Owner is also the Chef. 
Food is SO DAMN GOOD. 
I mean, seriously. 
LOML had lobster bisque both times. He was astounded by the actual LOBSTER in the bisque. He loved it and said he could eat it everyday for the rest of his life and not get sick of it. 
I had the Mozzarella all Caprese salad - who knew mozzarella, tomatoes and roasted peppers could taste so fresh and explode with flavor at the same time?
The second visit, I had a special of the night salad, which was beets with blue cheese - HELLO, this was FABULOUS. 
The first visit, I had Pollo all cacciatora which was just perfect. LOML had Scampi e Faggioli and gave it a hefty thumbs up. 
We both had dessert - he had Creme Brulee (of course) and loved it so much, he had it the second visit and proclaimed it the best he's ever had. And seriously, it's about all he ever orders for dessert, so he has many different Creme Brulee to compare it to. 
I had Italian Rum cake the first time (soooo good and moist) and the second time I had a special of the night dessert, which I can't remember what it was called, but it was fabulous (see the picture). 
The second visit, we split the gnocci al pomodoro - little pillows of potato goodness. I wished I'd ordered a whole dish to myself so I could take some home...
LOML had the Scampi al Aglio for his main dish (he loved) and I had the beef medallions sauteed in a peppercorn sauce (divine). 
No "quirky" food here (I love quirky food) - just authentic, fantastically flavorful food, brought to you by friendly attentive staff. 
OH! And my cappuccino came with a snowman rendering in the foam!
Hands down, my favorite Italian restaurant in Bucks/Montgomery county!!! And so far, even beats out the Philly places I've tried!!
Make it a New Years Resolution to try it!!!
The Fox chain of restaurants must be going through a change, along with North & Wildflower , food has started going south, they were always consistent in the past, now not so much.

I've been to Marche a few times, but it's been a while, so today's visit was almost like new. Marche had always been a cool spot and I can't think of East Nashville without it. With the recent boom in Nashville, lines, wait times and parking have definitely gotten worse, but I was with my girls, so we had some good convo while waiting. About an hour after arriving, we finally got seated. Our server got to us pretty quickly and took our drink orders. I decided to try Marche's Golden Milk; one of my friends tried the Maple Syrup Hot Toddy. For those who aren't as familiar with Marche, their menu does change every so often. I think the crossaint French Toast is a staple (at least, I remember having it last time I was there), so I went with it. Actually, 3 of the 4 of us went with the French toast, and supplemented with different sides. The half order of the French Toast is actually pretty sizable - that, with a huge Turkey sausage patty and scrambled eggs, made for a very nice brunch. I did succumb to peer pressure and ordered dessert - maybe it wasn't succumbing as much as encouraging everyone else, but semantics - in any case, with our servers recommendation, I had the Eggnog Cheesecake; another friend had the Pear Almond Caramel Bread Pudding, my other friend had the timeless Creme Brulee and my last friend opted for a Matcha Latte drink. Needless to say, we were all satisfied. Pricing is pretty good - if you don't go for any dessert, and you don't have any alcoholic drinks,  you can probably keep your bill under $20, which isn't bad at all for Saturday brunch. If you have room in your belly and pocket, visit the bakery/barista section of the restaurant, where you will surely find more items to tempt you. Marche is a definitely a staple and I always look forward to coming here!

This place is all about the mashed potatoes! I can't believe it took us so long to go. I'm almost mad I didn't go earlier. Last year I took the honey out for his birthday and I chose Geist over 5th & Taylor and it was the wrong decision. So very, very wrong. That meal did not go as planned (see the review) and after having this amazing meal, wow, I wish we went back then.

We had a gift card so we went pretty big. It was also a date night after many weeks/months, etc of not having one. We ordered the tartar, duck liver mousse, mussels, fried chicken, and chocolate cake. The beef tartar might be the best in the city. Our waiter offered to prepare (mix) it for us and I recommend that if you order it, you ask them to do it as well. The duck liver mousse was a favorite as well. I loved the jam that was paired with it. My mussels were nice and light after the heavy appetizers, but I have to say I really enjoyed my partner's fried chicken. If you like fried chicken this is a must order. The mashed potatoes are so creamy and pair perfectly with it. The dessert was a cherry on top of a wonderful meal. 

One thing to note, the seating is a little close so we definitely heard all of the conversations around us. We first had a grumpy couple to our left and then a grumpy girl's trip to our right. One doesn't like to day drink, the other two do. They roped the third into day drinking and now that it was 8pm she was very, very cranky, while they wanted to keep the party going. Fifth and Taylor is also good for large groups so there were quite a few there. Many of them out of towners, possibly bachelorette parties.

Quite a conundrum, I spend most my time complaining that the food in the South is too fattening. Exhibit A, the 17 pounds I gained moving here. Then I write a review that 5 Points Pizza is too healthy. I still stand by my review HOWEVER their healthy stromboli was a welcome option to what I'm battling down here. I schooled the waiter in the calzone versus stromboli debate, calzone covered, stromboli more like a croissant.  I still want more grease and it's still not NY but it's growing on me.

This review is actually a 3.5er with potential to change.

I'll start here, I've had Chicago style pizza a few times in SF one being at Little Star which is a city favorite. I have never been to Chicago so I can't say I've ever had the real thing. Part of the reason I've only had it a few times is because it's just not my thing. It's too heavy. Plus, I'm a die-hard NYC style pizza fan.

So earlier in the day I went to Bella Nashville and consumed their meat pizza with an egg. It's by far one of my favorite pizzas in Nashville. I did this not knowing that after my top dog's game we were going to 312 to watch the World Cup and eat more pizza. My friend said it best though, "it's not pizza, it's a pizza casserole." Amen!

We ordered two deep dish pizzas, wings, and numerous drinks. The place wasn't packed but there was a good crowd. Our waiter forgot three of the drinks and to put the wing order in. He apologized profusely and comped the wings. He did everything he was supposed to so I'm not totally faulting him but you know, it was a hiccup. The pizza was good, my manbot says great, and the wings were just fine as well. I had a vanilla donkey (I think that was the name) to drink and it was fantastic. We also tried the weird shot that Chicagoans adore? and I will say, "no, never, it just sat in my throat and I will never drink it again." I don't regret trying it though. I love regional drinks.

Overall all this is what Germantown has been missing for quite some time. It's a place where you can come drink, or you can come eat. It's family friendly and sports friendly. The TV's are huge and viewable from anywhere. The room is clean, open, and well-lit. This also causes it to be loud. So be prepared. Overall, kudos to the space. I liked it a lot!

I'll definitely be back, probably to try the arancini and mozzarella sticks. I hear they are HUGE! I'll also be back because I like the environment. If you are a Chicago pizza eater, then you must try it. If you're not, then there are other items you can choose from even numerous salads that don't seem too heavy.

Holland House West!  Yeah I said it!  Okay the only reason it's Holland House west is because I went there first.  I really liked Patterson House but for some reason I feel like they don't totally commit.  I am spoiled.  I lived in a city that had Bourbon and Branch at our disposal.  Now that's a place that commits to the ultimate speakeasy vibe.  Patterson gets 4 because the staff is nice but has an uppity vibe.  It's also very dark and the dark and stormy was great but not excellent.  Holland House's dark and stormy is better.  I definitely think people should check it out, be prepared to wait, the proximity to Vanderbilt makes it over-crowded on certain nights.

I should've listened to the reviews and not gone here to eat but I always like to give restaurants a chance because sometimes they do improved from the last time someone wrote a review, to my dismay this restaurant lived up to its reviews they are not great at all!!
He gave two stars simply because the calzone that my son ordered was actually pretty decent but I ordered baked ziti and baked Ziti is not what I got I got a tinfoil full of noodles and pasta sauce no cheese and I added Italian sausage and I had one piece of Italian sausage and another one that was kind of cut in half so I wasn't feeling to easy about eating them so once I got home I had to add my own cheese and throw in the oven and create my own baked ziti.
My son asked would I return my answer is absolutely not

I wish that I had seven stomachs because it was so hard to pick just one thing from their brunch menu. My husband and I ended up getting the pork steak breakfast to share. The pork steak was cooked just right, with a sear on the outside and so tender on the inside. It was topped with pickled red onions that were then fried... sooo amazing! They went really well with the pork. It came with breakfast potatoes and two eggs, which we got over medium; your average fillers to make the plate look better. I also ordered a side of greens. I loved the teensy kick of spice to it. 

Our server was knowledgeable, though somewhat slow because he was also the bartender. It looked like it was only him and one other server in the front of the house. 

I had a solid brunch here and would love to come back to try their other menu items.

I went to Toscana 52 with 13 others for a friend's birthday. We were seated at a really cool, long table underneath a pergola. The whole restaurant is lit with white Christmas lights and it's very pretty in general. I ordered a glass of Chianti which was only $6.25, not bad at all! We had to wait at the bar for a little while before we were seated, but it wasn't too long of a wait (20 mins maybe). I ordered the bruschetta to split with friends and the linguini with clams. The bruschetta came with three slices which was perfect for the three of us who shared it. A few different variations of bread were also brought to the table with butter. The linguini with clams that I ordered came in a red sauce (even though the menu said it was in a white wine sauce) with a few jumbo shrimp thrown into the mix. The clams, shrimp, and pasta were pretty good, but I wasn't too crazy about the "clam meatballs" they added. They just has a funny taste to me. My boyfriend ordered the seafood special which came with a lobster tail and many other forms of seafood over a bed of linguini in a white wine & garlic  sauce, which I liked a little better than mine. He thought some of the fish was a little undercooked as well. Luckily, the portion of his meal was huge so he was able to push the sketchy parts of it to the side.

Overall the food was ok, but not memorable. However, the prices are very reasonable and the restaurant itself is decorated very nicely. Also, it was a good pick for a large group of people.

Several good experiences, one awful one.

In general, this restaurant has been good to me.  The beer selection is reasonable, with options ranging from light to porters.  I tend to enjoy the Betty Burger, which is laden with bacon, fried egg, and avocado.  This location is absolutely packed on Fridays and Saturdays so I'd suggest reservations.  You can always attempt to get a seat at the bar with varying levels of success.  Upstairs is a second bar and additional seating and several flatscreen TVs playing the most popular sport channel at the time.  I've never found the service (hostesses) to be particularly welcoming or really make the attempt to help seat people but they aren't generally rude.

On to the awful experience.  Random Wednesday night, sitting in the downstairs bar area, I and a friend order the Betty Burger medium rare (as with every previous visit).  The burger comes out looking fabulous, yet when we bite into the burger, the center is virtually uncooked - think of what ground beef looks like before you even put it on the grill.  I understand medium rare to be warm, slightly cooked, and still pink.  This seemed to have been the same understanding from the kitchen until this last visit.  Needless, we asked that it be cooked a little more and met little resistance.  We were informed they'd have to completely remake the burger because of all of the toppings, etc.  We thanked them and waited for the burgers to come out - exactly the same.  At this point, I was disappointed but rather hungry and figured I'd risk it.  My friend was still perturbed with this 'medium rare' and reasonably requested that it be cooked longer.  At this point, our waiter began to debate 'medium rare' and informed us, 'this is how our chef does medium rare.'  Given all of our previous experiences, this seemed unreasonable but we simply said that the center was still entirely uncooked and thus not medium rare.  The waiter took the plate back and they remade it again.  We noticed several of the kitchen staff poking their heads out to stare at us, which just seemed unprofessional.  On the third attempt, the burger at least seemed somewhat cooked in the center and was consumed.  When the bill arrived, we were charged for both burgers with no apology and perhaps a little sass.  While I recognize it's a business of making money and it's not a requirement to comp food for mistakes, we spent an extra 45 minutes in this restaurant waiting for the kitchen to make a burger correctly.  Along with the disappointing service, this experience has soured my otherwise pleasant feelings.

Prices aren't cheap enough here to be this disappointed at any point.  Despite the convenience, I'm not sure I should  come back.  Cheers.

Hand-drawn noodles!  Make it happen.

If you're feeling a nice bowl of noodles and like handing over Alexander Hamilton and getting change back even after tipping, stroll over to Nan Zhou.  Plenty of combinations are available, from oxtail to tripe and other questionable meat innards.  The house special meatballs are fairly clutch (and I believe they are the first option so you won't miss them).  This is version 2.0 of Nan Zhou, and they've opened up the space and added a bunch of random giant IKEA photographs of Paris and New York to the decor.  Cause why not?

Cheap!  Fast!  All crews reporting.  Gogogogo!  Cheers.

(Excuse the random SC references throughout...)

We were craving Italian and didn't want to settle for the spots in philly we've been too a dozen times. We came to Little Nonna's and WOW! Was is it an amazing experience. 

When you walk in and they ask if you'd like to sit outside, say "YES!" Their cute outside backyard garden is cozy and intimate. Great spot for a date or even dinner with close friends. 

We started off by getting a bottle of wine and the meat//cheese plate. I am on a charcuterie kick so this really hit the spot. Our waitress was very helpful and enthusiastic about selecting wine and food pairings. She also let us know when something wouldn't be good together, which I really appreciated. Her knowledge of the menu made the experience a very enjoyable one. 

For dinner I had the sword fish, it was a great portion and seasoned fantastically! My boyfriend got the Sunday gravy, very nice touch for an authentic Italian restaurant. It felt like we were in our Nonna's backyard! 

We skipped desert because we were so full but will definitely come back with an even bigger appetite!
Dangerous place to have within walking distance of your house. Good wine list and a helpful staff. I haven't had the food yet but the menu looks tasty. Great patio experience! Will be coming back.

I managed to make it a full 6 months back in StL without visiting this now famous establishment. I had only heard good things and my dining experience lived up to the hype. 

As part of the Schlafly 21st anniversary takeover, Pi had 21  different Schlafly beers on tap. Our waiter was able to help my entire party pick different beers as well as their dinner and dessert choice. Quality ingredients and care taken in preparing everything on the menu. Great food and attentive service. Can't get much better and I'm looking forward to coming back.
Good food - good service! Delicious noodles. My son loves it here. Parking is a little tight but other than that cute date spot .

Holy sandwich shop! I really wanted to try everything on the menu at this place but even my expanded gut has it's limits. I placed my order, grabbed my drinks, and my Hulk table flag and set em down to explore. Went back to check on friends, and was informed they tried to clear my beer- a most serious offense. Headed off to explore the many jars of flavor along the walls, and the cookbook, and the restroom has a charming poster of cutting utensils that included razors, beer bottles, and scissors-too cute. Not-so-cute, my beer went missing again, dammit. I assume I'm an undesirable and they want me out. The Mexican Coke is missing too. I'm parched, so I stuff duck, pork belly, mortadella, chicken, bacon and who knows what number of animals and cheeses down my throat and head for the hills in search of water in this desert of delectable meats. Wait- Desert of delectable meats"?????? Yes. Five. Stars. (Minus one for each overpriced drink they took back after a couple sips)

I don't like it when a server blows off a print-a-deal so you can't use it, and a place doesn't resolve the problem quickly and efficiently until you name drop and ask for management. Besides embarrassing, our time was worth more by five times the hour for the amount of this dumb deal anyway, and then the food isn't even face-melting, it's just okay. Wish em the best, but now that my friend's going away party is over, I will never ever ever be back to this establishment. The history in the area is great, but there are too many awesome places right down the street! Bump you.

My old college haunt outgrew itself and moved to this location. A bit of it's charm lost, it now resembles a large Wal-Mart or Disney of "Irish" bars now. Still, the live music is a great time, and the same ole staff is somewhat reassuring. Still feels like home seeing familiar faces, but kinda miss the old shit hole it used to be. At least I have my memories!
Waited over a half hour, fell on the greasy floor with my crutches and all we got was a "sorry" . Damn. Nevar.

After being pretty dissatisfied by neighboring Hooters, I mosied on down to Pete and Shorty's a spirited spit away absolutely starving. They had great outdoor seating, friendly staff, and in the women's room a painting of David wearing a fig leaf you can't resist pulling up- which I did. The server handed me an "I Peeked" button, how cute! The sliders were enough to kill my craving for flame-licked beef, the chili was great on tots, and the mushroom slices were to die for. The beer was frosty on a hotter day, and I sat at a comfortable table just outside an adorable little courtyard. Next time I'll lay off the deep fried foods and try something on the lighter side, but really happy to have stumbled into this place!

I'm notorious for ordering the wrong thing on the first try. I'm sure I did that again, since my small and large mix of truffle parm wings, and sriracha chili wings were just okay (12.00 for eight). My Howard Frankland (12.00) drink however tasted like hot dumpster juice. All other burgers (14.00) and sammiches (Cuban, 13.00) ordered looked quite good. The yuca chips were served with a mojo aioli that I really liked, and I enjoyed a beer cheese soup that had been discarded after just a few bites. Moral of the story being: order like the sheeple do, and be sure to bring friends so can find whats right for you! It was alright overall. So difficult to head to an alright place with so many awesome ones nearby.

Potential is a dirty word, but the right word for this place. Let the constructive critisizm begin! The serv ice was great with a huge A for effort. She admitted she has never served before, so when a couple things fell on the floor and she put them right back on the table and recapped the water, I was ok with it. The fresh pasta station and the sauce, as well as the pre-meal bread and dessert puffs were all ok. I was starving, and the house salad was full of mixed fresh greens, plump tomatoes and huge, flavorful artichokes with fresh mozz cheese. So delicious, I could have had it as a meal! What wasn't  so good was the shrimp. It tasted so fishy I thought  I'd  be sick. They came with a parchment bag of tempura veggies that were alright, but the fried on fried food violence was way too much.   I wouldn't suggest they serve that to anyone ever again. That dish is a lost cause. Lasagna was cool.

Is it just me, or does this restaurant seem to be going downhill lately? The Cheesecake Factory used to be the place my family always wanted to stop in when visiting from out-of-town. The service was always excellent, the atmosphere is great, and it seemed like it didn't matter what you ordered from the menu: it was bound to be delicious and beautifully-plated. This hasn't exactly been the case lately, and it's not just this location. 

Maybe we came on an off day, but during Sunday brunch before rush, three plates of food managed to come out at completely separate times. While drinks were refilled on the regular, the bread and condiments we asked for were forgotten and required several reminders. My entree managed to arrive well before my side and looked like it had been thrown onto the plate without care. And, as it turned out, it had been made incorrectly and was completely unappetizing. I ended up having to order a totally different dish.

Cheesecake Factory, you're really lucky that your cheesecake is so damned good. I thank you for the gentle reminder of why I enjoy shopping in and eating at local businesses!

I came here last night with friends for Taco Tuesday.  Previously, I had only stopped in once for drinks

The bar's atmosphere is nothing special, but the enormous patio is glorious.  The staff are friendly and, though it was our server's first night, she was helpful and reasonably efficient.

We tried tacos and small appetizers, all of which were tasty, and I can't wait to come back to try the Asian pear salad.

First time I visited this morning and had turkey sausage, eggs, pancakes, homefries and grits. The food was pretty good. It was not fall out my chair delicious cause the grits were bland. 

Its was okayyyy...I wouldn't wait in line for the food though
Food is just ok.Service is slow and bring lots of money as the games add up if you bring several kids.

This is going to sound weird.  This is my favorite restaurant in town, than why the heck only 3 stars?  I have probably been here 20+ times with family and friends and I have been holding back on writing a review until I figure out how to review this place.

The concept:  Amazing!  I do love Brazilian steak houses.  I love their salad bar and all the wonderful choices of top quality items.  With such a wide variety of meats that are all you can eat along with a great salad bar and hot food area, Tucano's really sets themselves apart from the rest of the places in town.

Ambiance:  From the moment you hit the parking lot and walk in, a fun and colorful decor capture your attention.  You are immediately greeted by the hostess as you walk in as they take you to your table.  A great atmosphere awaits you.

Once you are seated, you are immediately greeted by a kind Waiter/Waitress for drink orders and after that, you are open to hit the salad bar or begin your meat feast.  This all sounds great, why the 3 stars?  I have been here several times and it lacks consistency.  I do have to admit, my wife and I like our meat well done and when you go on busy nights, most of the meat that comes out on the busy nights, the meat is luke warm and it is hard to get meat well done.  We have been strategically going during slow times just to ensure that our meat comes out hot and well done but you can't always do that.  Sometimes we come on a Friday or Saturday night to celebrate someone's birthday and we just recently did that.  After telling the meat servers that the food continued to come out cold, they said they would try to bring out hot meat and it continued to come out cold.  Please don't get me wrong, I have had some GREAT meals here but they seem to fall short and inconsistent on busy nights. I would love to give them more stars but when you are paying a good amount of money per person for their buffet, you have to be able to serve hot food with consistency.

I'll be back and hoping to find more consistency and I will change my rating.  Overall an excellent restaurant.  Try their lemonades they are delicious!

They specialized in small pizzas.

For the price point, the toppings really aren't all the special.  I just think that they could put a lot more effort in offering variety on the menu and including bolder flavors.  I've tried the tono and the margerhita pizzas and they are okay at best.  Each time I've gone their, I haven't had to use my own money to pay, so I never really minded.  But would I give them my OWN hard earned dollar?  Probably not.  I have definitely had better pizza.  This place is overpriced for what you get and are even pretty cheap with tap water.

A friend raved about this place, so I went to try.  I'm into authentic Mexican, and they do have authentic and Americanized Mexican here.  I didn't like the run down decor and the restroom, oh vey, the restroom, it's in this awful, dirty, rundown hallway.  You have to judge a restaurant by their restroom.  If they don't care about their restroom, they don't care about their kitchen.  Would you eat a meal in their restroom?  Ask yourself.  I would eat a meal in the restroom of Campo or Brasserie St James.  Now the food.  Yes authentic Mexican, but it was all burned and looked recooked or refried and was chewy and dry.  Sorry guys, have to call it likes I sees it.  Nice enough service though.  For authentic Mexican I go to el Adobe or Betos, although I wouldn't take a date to Betos, just pick up or eat with my buddies.

Bad review is because they don't listen and get orders wrong.  I specially told the woman at counter steak with sauce and onions. No cheese.   Got home and had cheesesteak with no sauce or onions.   She even forgot to put my soda in bag.  Its not like they were busy.    Pay attention!

I was kind of shocked of the amount of places that stopped serving food after 11pm.  We were in a desperate hunt for food on a Saturday night and decided to try out Royal House since it was convenient and open.  I asked the waitress if she could split my po-boy with half shrimp and half fish, and she said they wouldn't allow it.  Instead, the waitress talked me into ordering Crawfish Etouffee, which I was already apprehensive about because restaurants can never really get this dish down right.  Crawfish Etouffee is one of my favorite Creole meals and I am highly critical of it, but to be fair, Royal House's etouffee was horrible.  Most of the crawfish were charcoal colored and they were extremely salty.  One of the bites of food that I took was so salty that I had to dispose of it.  I wouldn't recommend ordering this dish from here to anyone.

My bf ordered the Alligator Bites, and they were lukewarm, hard, and had an old taste to them.  It was evident that this alligator was not fried at the time we were there.  I assume it was probably fried earlier that morning.

I would never come here again.  The food wasn't good and definitely wasn't worth the price.

To make matters worse, I had a hair wrapped into my silverware napkin that was waiting for me once I started opening the napkin.  Just shoot me!

My hubby's is OBSESSED with the location in truckee, so I decided to grab my mom and sister, and check this place out.   They are very busy(which is usually a wonderful sigh!) so we grabbed the last table.  I ordered the meatball(a recommendation from the husband), my mom ordered a philly cheese steak, my sis ordered a breakfast sandwich.  The service was friendly. They were not the fastest sandwich shop. But not the slowest.  The place was clean.  The sandwiches are large!! So bring your appetite.  They had some super interesting chips, and cookies, had I not been so full, I would have tried a cookie! They looked tasty!  All of us had the same complaint... The sandwiches were dry.... Even my meatball sandwich was dry... How is that possible??? Maybe it was an off day? I'll probably be back to try another sub, and specify to slather it in sauce!!! I probably would not recommend it to any out-of-towners... I'm hoping it was an off day!!!! I'll keep ya posted on my next journey. I feel the potential in this place!

Though it was surprisingly not busy on a Friday night, our service still sucked and the people after us got their food for four before us even though we were a party of two and only ordered a large order of wings. Sadly, this location is the closest one to us but we most likely won't return, it was not worth it.

I didn't hate the tacos. A few time the orders have been messed up. The carne Asada was a little tough but the carnitas and chicken were cool. I really like the guacamole and spicy salsa. I don't like the pricing system. If they cost $9 for 3 that should be that price not +.85¢ per taco for MEAT. Staff is nice. Place could be a little cleaner.

Lots of beers on tap and really friendly bartenders.  I don't know what this place is like on other days, but on Friday night it got pretty packed.  There is a dj in the back and there is plenty of room in the back for dancing.  A lot of tvs with different sports going on too so its a sports bar with a dj.  A few different atmospheres going on all at once.  I just don't think it was worth paying a 5$ cover!

Came for quizzo which was fun.  The beer isn't too expensive which is encouraging.  I tried the beer with the smallest alcohol content - big mistake.  I don't remember what it was called other than that it started with ih binen something or other.  I wouldn't recommend it.  Service is alright, but the food didn't look so good.  Our friend got a soup that had a weird crusty shell over the top that I think was meant to be cheese.

If I could rate it lower I would!!!

Shame on Omni for passing this off as one of their properties. This is pathetically below their standards. The staff is helpless as they abide by management's policies. Really?

Here's what we got for $270/night (or thereabouts).......
Flimsy mattress even after asking for another or at least a bed board. We were both sore from the experience.
Window shutters that were broken.
Dirty coffee mugs.
No microwave.
No mini refrigerator.
1 regular tea bag for a 3 night stay...... and it's against their policy to refresh the tea bags and water bottles.
Filthy shower with mold/mildew even after notifying the front desk.
Torn screen on the sliding door.
Our room was by the pool pump and it literally droned all night. You'd think they could add a little sound insulation as they freely admit to this being a problem.
The stairs from the parking lot are in disrepair and some of the lights are out, so walking is treacherous at night. And they charge for parking!!!

I just stayed at a Hampton Inn for a third the cost. I had a comfortable mattress, spotless bathroom/shower, microwave, refrigerator, free breakfast and free parking.  

I'm not complaining about the decor as other have. This place is filthy and sorely neglected. This place is an absolute rip off!!!! 

Don't be fooled by the Omni name.

I really love Snap pizza but don't like this location. I recently came in to order a salad and saw that they adapted a touch screen ordering system. This is awesome! No more confusion or incorrect orders and no more miscommunication between the customer and the staff. I decided to go for the salad bowl but honestly I wish i got the gluten free and vegan pizza but the touch screen option didn't have the vegan pie? Not sure if I just missed it myself or it actually isn't available, so is  it something you have to order with the staff? Kinda sad about that. Anyway I placed my salad bowl order and waited for it to come out. It turns out that another customer basically got a similar thing as me and there was a small dilemma. Now I don't mind confusion but the employee was down right rude and even said "I wasn't asking you this" I was a bit speechless and didn't know what to say but now looking back on it it was super rude. I was trying to say yes that condiment is not what I ordered so that's probably the other person's. Anyway I will probably avoid this location. However the food was great!

Lots of vietnamese restaurants in this area. the pho was not bad, but not great like some philadelphia pho spots. The meat they used was definitely high quality and they don't skimp out on it. Spring rolls were decent too.

IF I could give less stars I would, very trash customer service, out of EVERYTHING, then I'm told a list of replacements and guess what? They were out of that also. Had only my car pull behind a yellow pole. Nobody else's just mine, I found that to be an odd request, since I should have been pulling forward. So I sat on the side street to see why I had to do this not every sure. But not one of the six cars after me had to do this.

Update: got home to ice cold fries not even a little warm and I live 0.6 miles from the location. Absolutely trash  ‍

Came her at the recommendation of a few people who told us it was a must try when in NOLA.  It was about 30 minutes before they closed and the line was still pretty long.  It took quite a while for the food to arrive and the process of ordering and getting a table then waiting for a server to come pick up your receipt to get your food was a bit confusing.  The food was ok and nothing to write home about.  Overall, I think this place gets a lot of hype that's not all it's cracked up to be.

Tried this place out recently for brunch.  It's an all you can eat buffet with various food and drink stations at the mid $30 mark per person with booze included.  The alcoholic beverages included bloody marys, mimosas, white and red sangria.  

Food options were diverse from some token Mexican items, salsa/guac, chips, the normal breakfast foods (eggs/bacon/sausage/French toast/pancakes), and there were other options including meat carving stations and steamed crab legs and shrimp.  The dessert options weren't as plentiful as there was fruit and some breads to dip into the chocolate fountain that seemed to be sputtering all over the table.  Overall not a bad option if you're looking for an all you can eat type of meal with some booze included.  The quality of the food is decent and buffet grade.

It's taken me a while to get out to this place given its location, but I'm glad I finally had the opportunity to experience it.  It was a bit humid on a recent August evening, however, the staff was very friendly and accommodating to our large party.  We managed to get a table on the beach side and our waitress did a great job of making sure she came by periodically to ensure our drinks were full.  Only tried some calamari for appetizers as the kitchen closes around 9pm and service for the beach area ends shortly thereafter.  If you're looking for a chill spot to grab a drink in the area I'd recommend stopping by.  Boat traffic can be heavy depending on the time of day you go.

Finally checked this place out on a recent Friday night.  It was quite packed and crowded upon arriving around 8pm.  There's no hostess or anything, you just find a table or spot at the bar and plop yourself down.  The drink prices are moderate for being such a loud, barish type establishment.  They have plenty of liquor and beer choices along with premade cocktails.  

The food was standard bar fare.  I had the margherita pizza and it was average at best in terms of toppings and flavor.  Our waitress, Allison, was quite attentive and bubbly and made sure to keep checking with our group to ensure drinks were full and we had everything we needed.

A pretty meh experience for how much you have to pay for a meal at these types of hibachi places.  We were seated pretty quickly, but it was around 8pm on a weeknight.  The soup and salad came out quickly and was pretty average.  Our chef came out and verified orders and got to work.  A good show was put on but the taste and flavors of the meat, vegetables, and rice were pretty average and nothing special.  I usually end up at the name brand competitor to this place in Tampa or Brandon, so it was a nice change, but I think I'll stick with the usual place going forward.

I always think of it as a treat to learn that I'll be venturing to this spot for any meal day or night.  They have a very convenient text reservation system or you can always call ahead.  I would definitely recommend reservations as space is at a premium when it comes to this place.  Parking seems to be as well so pack your patience.  

If you're the indecisive type, stay away from the drink menu.  It is pages and pages of goodness and creative concoctions that will appeal to every side of your drinking persona.  They creatively publish all of their menus in a newspaper like flyer and all of their menu items appear to have a unique Datz spin on them.  You can't go wrong with any of their items.

If you have a sweet tooth, beware of their cakes, cupcakes, and unique dessert treats.  Check out Datz Dough (located next door) for more on that.  This is a great place to grab brunch, a casual lunch, or low key dinner.  You won't leave disappointed or hungry!

I agree with some of the previous reviews, which are less than satisfactory.  The drive-through was defectively designed and constructed -  it is too narrow and too winding. It shouldn't be too hard to re-construct it to make it easier to get through. More importantly, the customer service needs to be improved.  I went there recently and ordered coffee, and clearly stated that I wanted it with no sugar.  The girl at the window handed me the coffee, which was loaded with sugar.  I went through again, and asked for what I ordered.  Another employee gave me another coffee, made as I originally ordered, but she made no apology, and seemed annoyed. This is at least the second time that I received an incorrect order at this location. The other three McDonald's locations I go to, in less prestigious neighborhoods, have much better customer service.

I'd also like to boost this place and clear up a few misconceptions.  In my experience, gutterpunks do not work here, though they certainly congregate outside sometimes.  It's the winter migration, people; these things happen. 

The actual staff is pretty cool. Maybe late at night you get some stoners, but stoners working the late-night cafe shift are as wholesome and American as anything else.

Besides, you can get coffee with alcohol in it here. And it's not too expensive. This cannot be stressed enough.  Have the friendly guy at the counter whip you up a Mexican-style hot cocoa/chili pepper thing with some tequila.  Then get yourself a cannoli and quit yer whinin'.

Glad to see barbecue in shaw. They were really busy so although I called ahead and gave them 45 min, order was not ready and I was missing an item.  I was ordering for guests but they had turkey ribs and smoked wings and said the ribs were amazing but the chicken undercooked. I tasted the cornbread myself and it was delicious. I will be back because they are just getting started and it should get better.

Salt salt salt . I ordered a turkey burger and while I love salt it proved almost too salty for me. Everyone at my table said the same about their meals . Someone with a bland palate and hypertension was running the kitchen today .

The customer service hasn't been the same for quite some time. I have called to place a to go order and can hear someone pick up and then immediately hang up. This has happened on more than one occasion. I won't beg to give my business.

Glad to have found a new addition to the Main Street stroll of restaurant offerings.  I enjoy a good pub and this one was average.  The atmosphere and design of the place made you feel you were in the suburbs were everyone gathers for the Sunday Game.  There are about 3 Large Screen TV's for your viewing pleasure.  The staff were friendly and offered recommendations and favorites on the menu.  

There are happy hour specials, so definitely ask about them.  The draft selection was average, but they need to increase the variety on the available bottles that are offered (i.e. sours, stouts and imperials).

I will come back to check them - you should stop by too!

If you have never been to New Orleans, upon your return home - all those who have visited will ask you - did yo go to "Pat O'Brien's"...so do yourself a favor and check it out.  If you are a drinker (depending upon which type of drinker - myself - not a sweet drink person - more beer and whiskey).  If I am with others who haven't been here, I will warm up with a world famous Pat O'Brien's Hurricane to get me started.  If not a drinker, no worries - Pat has several different areas to be seated - There is a courtyard area, then there is a darker bar area you may just want to sulk in your drink - But, if you want entertainment - check out the dueling pianos.  The fun will depend on the audience - come with cool piano songs for them to play (tip:  write down choice(s) on napkin - with tip included) - Have fun with it and request songs like: "Baby Got Back" or Some Miley Cyrus song - that is bound to move you to the front of the line.

Pat's ends up being a place to meet any mood you are in - check them out!!

I have been here several times and I like the place  a lot - the reason for only 3 stars goes to small size of the location.  I enjoy the old recipes of prohibition alcohol and I like the food menu.  

Despite the small size, the place has a good vibe.  If you are out on a date - this is a good place to start to get the evening started.  You hope to get there early enough to grad a seat - if not - its a bit of a buzz kill - standing and trying to appreciate the good drinks !!

The prices are average for good drinks and food.  I recommend to others who want to try something different from the norm.  

TIP - Listen to the wait staff  - ask for recommendations...

I asked around before my weekend get-a-way to Nashville- where should I dine out while in the city-this establishment was mentioned a few times!  

As we wandered around all the 'honky Toni's' and different restaurants on Broadway--Thru my haze of alcohol and fun--I remembered- Merchants--I demanded--let's go in & get some drinks and food!  The group agreed--and for them and myself-Merchants handled their business and provided good service and the food was good!

I had the wedge salad and smoked wings-both were good-not great! 

I enjoyed the vibe and our wait staff! Food-3-stars & 1-star added for good service!

If you are in Nashville and hanging on Broadway-stop-in to Merchants!

Ok...Louie Louie!  Great first impression for sure!

I made reservations for a girls get together and I arrived early to make sure we got prime seating and check out the overall vibe of the place!  I ordered a drink @ the bar and it wasn't off the happy hour menu so that was a bit pricey ($15) for a vodka gimlet!  Stick to the Happy Hour Menu..it will be be kinder to your pockets...lol 

Great vibes all around...Staff were super friendly and helpful about the menu and assisted with recommendations!  When my party arrived, they were pleased with the decor and energy of the restaurant!  

We all places starter orders from: oysters (sorry..no pic..sucked those down real quick..lol) and ratatouille which were both flavorful!  Our main dishes: Calamari and Salmon were on-point!  

Overall, Louie Louie was a success and this may be my new Happy Hour Spot in University City!

Yum yum yum! The atmosphere and food was deeeeeelightful-- great date place ;) 

I gave it three stars instead of four simply because their options aren't as prevalent as I had hoped! They have an array of meat toppings, specifically salamis and sausages, but as for vegetables they don't have much of any. They do serve local produce (beet salad was perfecto) and until-it's-gone appetizers that are quite nice. 

Overall, their pizza was delicious and I'd go back in a heartbeat when I can pull myself to spend that kind of dough on my dough.

This is definitely a fun beach bar. I had stopped one weekday night around 6:30pm and it was rather lively with a mixed crowd. The menu seemed decent so I returned on a Sunday for lunch. I had the quinoa veggie burger (the description was rather elaborate) but it was basically a frozen patty with spinach and cheese on top. It was fine, nothing exciting, and I just was happy that there were vegetarian options. I noticed healthy rice bowls that I will be back to try. My guy had a cheeseburger and fries and said it was a decent lunch. The portions aren't huge, but it's enough to keep you going if you're there for drowning your sorrows in a beer. 

I'll definitely be back!

We decided to stop here at the last minute, lots of good yelp reviews here!  My experience wasn't the best.  We started with the pork belly tostadas and they were great, but dinner was a disappointment.  I ordered the short rib risotto(highly recommended by server and reviews).....it wasn't good.  Something was clearly off, the risotto had a bad flavor and the Short ribs were overlooked and dry.  The service was great and they apologized and took it off the bill.  I re-ordered a app(eggrolls) hoping it would be faster and my girl wouldn't have to wait for me too long after she finished her meal.  The eggrolls were a bit wet inside and disappointing.

I'm not giving up on this place, we will go back and I'll update this review after my next try.....I might even order the short rib risotto after the manager told me that he and the chef both agreed something was off with the stock.  I appreciate the honest evaluation.

OK, after reading the rave reviews I had to try Toto's.  Just moved into Mt Airy and could walk to the restaurant, but this particular evening we were feeling a bit lazy so we ordered delivery.  Lady on the phone who took the order was super nice, delivery fast, delivery guy friendly, steak hoagie tasty, and pizza.... AWFUL.  I don't know if they were just having an off night over at Toto's, but it had to be the worst pizza of recent memory.  It was a Frankenpizza. Hardly any cheese to be found on the pie, it was basically a dried-up square of bread with a teaspoon of sauce flattened over the entire surface. Seriously.  We just picked off the toppings and ate them as appetizers before sharing the hoagie.  Pizza was bad but the hoagie was awesome, so overall it was a yay-boo.  Will probably give them another chance, but will probably stick to the subs or pasta.

There were four of us. The drinks took forever to come out . They had a decent amount of alcohol but, were quite pricey. Everyone's food came out at vast different times. It was also difficult to eat in the dark. The service was ok just very very slow. The food tasted pretty good and the portion size was generous. They charged me 50 cent when I asked for hot sauce!!!  And $1 for extra jalapeños?!?  Ridiculous 
I don't see the appeal of this place unless you have little time and a lot of money to waste .

The hush puppies were perfect this time. Everything was fresh and delicious. The fish spread was great . The crab goat cheese dip was very good as well as the poboy. The macaroni and cheese tasted like it was made from scratch. Our server was very good as well. This place seemed even better than before. The craft beer selection was also nice.
They have great food and great service, not a  fan of the new check out ordering things on the tables, kind of takes away from the servers communucations etc.

I absolutely hate how they serve their sandwiches cold.  The steak and eggs (breakfast only) is pretty good.  That is served warm and I would bring it back to put sriacha on it.  The pasta pollo soup is also good and I am addicted to the strawberry yogurt parfait.  The flat bread plain pizza is good, not the bbq/gouda.

This is the perfect place to stop for food after wallowing in the slow motion hell that is the PennDOT driver's license center.  It's right across the street.  After being in there, you will definitely want to eat some delicious food and forget all that you witnessed inside.

The man at the counter was very friendly and warm.  I ordered the vegetarian bahn mi and decided to try the homemade Vietnamese yogurt.  I had no idea what Vietnamese yogurt was, or how it differed from other types of yogurts, but it definitely was tasty.   Not too sweet with a sour tang.  It tasted healty.   The bahn mi was on a chewy roll.  I'm not sure if that's my preference, I think I prefer a crispy baguette, but nonetheless, it was a good hoagie.  Perfectly spicy with fried chunks of tofu and vegetables. 

The prices are very reasonable.  Cash only.

I really like this place!  I don't know what took me so long to try it.  I like the way it looks inside.  The ambiance is casual, artsy, and cozy.  The seats are kind of small and made for asian asses.  Don't worry though, they are not too bad.  

The ramen is super good!  I ordered off the menu - I'm a vegetarian and the miso broth is made with a pork base, so I ordered a vegetarian ramen with no pork and they made it for me.  There was a bit of confusion up front but they changed it for me, once they realized I called in advance to make sure they could do it.  Make sure you order some extra eggs in your ramen.  Wow, these things are good!  They are soft boiled and marinated in some type of delicious sauce.  I also enjoyed my extra topping of corn.  I didn't get o try any of the sides or appetizers on this visit but I'll definitely be back to do so.  The prices are very reasonable.

The cheese and sauce were good. The rest -- crust and toppings -- were a bit sad and forlorn. There were enough toppings, but they were overbaked (veggies soggy). The crust was just "ok". Tasted like the stuff I make at home from a Pop-N'-Fresh can. And a bit hard to cut through with a knife. 

I thought our waitress was polite and seemed on the ball, though she forgot one small item.

Good stuff if you're out to drink beers with your pals, but a little too pricey considering it's "just ok".

Since there are 1,000 pizza joints in Clearwater, I recommend trying another.

The real deal. 

If you miss New York pizza - huge slices, foldable, just the right balance of crispy and soft, and grease that can "run down your arm" if you're not careful - BAM. Legit. Boom. Look no further.

We finally got around to trying this place. We were seated right away around 6 p.m.  Our waiter was very nice and he took excellent care of us.  We started out with something I've never tried before; waffle batter chicken tenders.  They were really good.  When we go back, I'll probably just get those for my meal.  We also got a basket of rolls and biscuits.  Hubby had the BBQ brisket, mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese.  He said it was all very good.  He did say the brisket was almost too tender.  He likes a little bite to it, but I can't imagine anything being "too" tender.  I had the fried chicken, salad and loaded baked potato.  The fried chicken was excellent, the potato could have been a little more done.  The salad was good, but I'm not a big fan of all those fancy greens.  Give me romaine or iceberg any day.  We had so much food, we are taking half of it home, which is nice...lunch tomorrow!  I had to try dessert, cause that's my thing!  I decided on the  Neapolitan cake!  It is huge and beautiful!
