Went in on a Monday morning, 7am.  I was the only patron.  Not a very large selection of bagels.  Got a salt bagel with butter (not toasted).  One person behind the counter and she was a bit slow for only having to wait on me.

Bagel was small and on the stale side and just like every other bagel place, they use the same knife to cut their bagels so a salt bagel will taste like garlic or onions.  Yuck.

I'm from New Jersey.  I know what good bagels are.  Even Einstein is better than Truckee Bagel.

Major meh - the birthplace of the Hurricane serves drinks that barely deserve the name, only staying true to the QUANTITY of alcohol in the drink. They also automatically charge you for the tourist glass: if you don't want it, you have to take it to the bar after your meal and get cash back for it, which is a major hassle. The food is decent Creole/typical NOLA fare, but upmarked just for the tourists! Additionally, one of my friends ended up throwing up repeatedly in the bathroom - whether that was the food or the alcohol will remain a mystery. If you HAVE to go here, be prepared for long lines, subpar and overpriced food, and all other obvious symptoms of a tourist trap.

Background:
- Came here on NYE, a Saturday night, winter time. 
- Party of 2.
- Restaurant has been around for 40 years.

Overall, I wouldn't be opposed to giving this place a second shot. Seems like they have their ways and are successful since they've been around for 40 years. In future visits I would be more specific about how I want my food prepared. I would also come here only under very casual circumstances...lunch, happy hour, Sunday afternoon food/beer date with friends, or if I just wanted specific seafood and was in the area. I would not celebrate any special occasions here as the atmosphere is plain. Read on for deets.

Atmosphere:
- Small restaurant. Pretty quiet. About 6-8 tables of varying size total. Orange/warm colored walls. Little to no decor.
- Very simple, ultra casual style. Good place to go if you want seafood, but don't feel like dealing with high-end prices or pretension.
- They played really romantic-ish music while we were there which was strange for the restaurant since it's very casual and it was NYE. Gave me the impression they tried to make up for the plain walls with the music.
- Quiet atmosphere. I could comfortably talk to my dinner date without yelling. 
- Because of the size of the restaurant, the 2-seater table we sat at was really awkwardly placed.
- Clean bathroom.

Food:
- I ordered 6 raw oysters as an appetizer ($9), and lobster and beef tenderloins for entree ($30). 
- The oysters were very good. In my mind, it's hard to screw up something raw! They came chilled over ice with lemon and a marinara sauce (standard). Shells about 3-3.5" size - good size.
- The entree came with asparagus and mashed potatoes. Lobster was a good size, but not tender enough. Beef was over cooked. Side vegetables were very good. Asparagus cooked right and bright green, and mashed potatoes, standard comfort food fare.

Service:
- The owner/head waitress/hostess (small place, so not sure) was very friendly. We had trouble spotting the restaurant from the street (it's very small and tucked in between a couple businesses) and called the restaurant for help. The owner saw us at the corner and navigated us to the restaurant over the phone.
- Our waiter was very nice, but seemed overwhelmed or distracted. Missed standard cues such as: introducing himself, clearing empty plates or glasses from table, didn't leave us with salt and pepper on the table (had to flag him down), served lobster without drawn butter (had to flag him down). 
- Spilled my martini on the table.
- Waiter also spilled water in front of our table and splashed us. Not too big of a deal, it was just water, but he already striked out a couple times.
- I mentioned that the beef was dry and all he did was quickly mumble, "Sorry."

Drinks:
- Ordered their specialty winter drink, an apple cinnamon martini ($8/9) and then a mango martini ($8/9). 
- Apple cinn drink was unique, but I wouldn't order it again.
- Mango martini tasted like it was made from actual juice. Flavor actually reminded me that of those huge cans of apricot juice. Would not order again.

Shake Shack has a fresh and mean burger, but for me, I don't think for the cost, it is enough value or taste, and the service isn't always stellar. If they pumped up the serving size of the single burger by a 1/3, I'd be satisfied.

I ordered a single smokeshack burger (bacon) $6.69, cheese fries $3.95, and a beer $4 (on sale from $5.50 by the way!), and this cost me $15 and change. The invisible reason for the cost of the burger is the meat is Angus beef with no hormones or antibiotics. 

If you come here in a family setting, this can very quickly add up. For a family of 4 if  each person ordered the same thing as I did, it would result in a $60 meal at a fast casual burger joint. I don't feel this is really value-added considering this is upscale fast food, there are no left-overs and this cost doesn't even include dessert. By the way, that assumes single burger. For a smokeshack double it's $9.49. I'm not sure why a slice of bacon warrants $1.50 extra from the $7.99 regular double cheeseburger.

The atmosphere here is nice and industrial/modern style. They have wood top tables that have been converted from old bowling alleys. There's a handful of TVs hanging around. There are tables (2-4 seaters), booths, and a faux-bar area which could seat 12 in a square-shaped table.

They offer a different ice cream custard flavor each week. it can be ordered straight or mixed in with some other sweets. Their chocolate sprinkles are unlike any I've ever had. They're super fragile and tiny, just a quarter the size of a regular chocolate sprinkle. I find their custards to be too sweet and amplified for my taste, but the flavors are unconventional like jelly donut and pineapple upside down cake. In each city that they operate, they offer a "local" something dessert. Like in this PA location, they have a Valley Forge Freeze, and a Liberty Shell. 

The service here is hit or miss. Sometimes the employees act like they want to be there, other times, I find they could care less and I feel like I am an inconvenience. Upon ordering, you get a buzzer, and it'll go off when your food is ready. The dining area is also hit or miss. When they are packed around the usual dining times, there are no tables and whatever table there is, you need to flag someone down to wipe it. Note that one nice, full-service-esque thing they do is come around and take away your trash and trays.

I'm glad there's one in the KoP scene, but I do believe they are pricey for what they offer - a glorified burger joint. They do give Elevation Burger, Five Guys, and Smashburger a run for their money, but for the cost, I'd rather pick up some high quality ground beef and pop 'em on my Weber!

They have these things scattered all over the Quarter...plain little spots that serve frozen daiquiris...straightforward and nothing much to tell...on my most recent foray into the Quarter this ended up being a good place to stop and just chill with a White Russian...It might not be my 1st, 2d, 3d or 4th choice for a stop in but on this night, dammit, JIm, I was happy to find this little oasis of calm and just chill awhile!!!
Great sub joint!  I love coming here for a good cheese steak and fries.  I also enjoy the aesthetic of the place.  It's fun and welcoming especially if you appreciate sports and movies!

Nice place to grab some wine when in downtown Santa Barbara. The wine flights are a good deal - $15 for 3 wines either from the pre-selected flight menus or the main wine list. Haven't really had the food here save for the cheese platter, but the wine is pretty solid.

On my last visit though, the server brought two glasses of water and both glasses had brown dirt on the sides. Not sure what it was (looked like Coke stains or something syrupy) so we had it sent back. They were nice about it, but I would have expected better service from such an "upscale" downtown restaurant.

No, no and no.  I am sorry but my prediction is that this place will be closed , 6 months from now. I have traveled to Mexico endlessly, and this place is not only poorly managed and the food is horrendous.  Taco Bell is right down the street. We have given them MORE than ample time share to show up, only to disappoint.

Service was weak but yelp check in special free drink gives them a boost.

It was a Sunday afternoon and the Rays were playing, you would think Gators would be a blast, NOPE! The place was pretty lame. Neither the staff nor the customers wanted to be there!!!

We had to be there because we were about to go parasailing. We wanted to get a little buzz first. But they were so slow with drinks, that was impossible. We only ordered pitchers. They had no specials, no nothing. 

Food service was slow too. We were a tad bit late for parasailing because of the time it took to get our check. We had to run out and warn the guys in charge of the boat. 

Ultimately, the food was decent. It was bar food and met expectations. Price was fair too, but poor service and too slow to get our drinks. Thankfully we could drink on the parasailing boat. We had a nice time absent the stress caused by poor service!
I live close to the Pho Quyen over by USF, But I like going to this one for the atmosphese. The food is similar with both of them, so you cant go wrong with good vietnamese food.

Well I'm back to update my previous review. Months ago I said the place was getting "weathered" over the years, to put it nicely. but yeah it was getting pretty rundown. Looks like they remodeled the inside which is nice. New flooring, coat of paint and some other things to freshen it up. The parking lot and exterior needs some work but hey it's a start. Food is good as usual. Never had a problem with any meals here, in fact it was very delicious. But there was some problems with things not being available. It was 11:30 am and they "ran out" of the pork broth, seems weird that early. And I heard the waitress tell other customers they didn't have egg rolls, they didn't have this, or that. Seems like A managerial ordering problem. Hope they get it fixed and it was just due to the recent remodeling or supply chain problem. So I moved it up one star.

Rude! I had just picked my mom up from surgery and brought her here to eat. It was cold outside, but they would not allow a 70 year old woman to stand inside. What incredibly insensitive behavior! They said it was a fire hazard, but no way. She was standing in a corner bothering no one for like 2 minutes. I guess they would call while you wait in the car but they never said that until we were leaving! And when I politely said how uncalled for it was to make the elderly stand outside in the cold, they said I was being rude! No, I was very calm. I will never recommend nor attend this place again. The 20 year olds running the place have A LOT to learn about tact, discernment and respect! The owner should be ashamed. In the age of Facebook, our experience will be well known very soon which is not good for business.

Agree with Vanessa R. Way better restaurant options in SB!
The bad: Disappointed with our dinners. I had the Halibut and husband had the swordfish. His was overcooked and mine was wayyy overcooked. Sauces on both dishes were bland and just too under seasoned .

The good: service staff incredibly friendly , cool place inside with ample seating and if lucky to get ocean view amazing scienic ocean view. Had Brussel Sprout starter and that was good . For dessert shared the Coffee Ice Cream Pie (Mud Pie) it was so good!
Would come again but only for drinks with a view and dessert

I live across the street from this location and I keep trying to go through the drive-thru for food. Today was my FOURTH time coming through the drive thru, being told to come to the walk up, and leaving because of the rudeness of the employee. I truly don't see the difference in serving someone standing vs. serving someone sitting in their car. Either way you still have to take an order, make it, and hand it to the person. I've worked drive-thru before, I know how things are supposed to be done. I'm sure they're just using this as an excuse to keep customers away. What kind of food business are you that you can't properly utilize your drive thru... They lose my business each time they tell me to come to the walk up because I am in a hurry and on my lunch break. It is INCONVENIENT to park, walk up, and order when I could have just done the exact same thing from the safety of my car. Now you want me to walk up and be surrounded by people standing in front of your restaurant just because you can't take an order through the intercom? RIDICULOUS!!!! THERE IS A PANDEMIC GOING ON WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU PEOPLE. Smh... I've never been to a Rally's as bad as this one. Negative stars...

This updated review is based on customer service, not food.  

We ordered pizza and their newer offering, a "pot of meatballs" which comes with focaccia.  We did ask specifically for the focaccia to go along with the meatballs.   When we got home, the focaccia was not there.  By the way, they usually all give you a scoop of ricotta cheese when you order the meatballs as side orders.  This also was not given with the pot if meatballs. 

The issue is the response when I called back to let them know.  I spoke with a Whitney who was the manager.   She was apathetic at best.   Certainly, the customer service aspect of things was less than acceptable to me.  The food here is really good and we will go back.   I will make sure Whitney knows how she could have handled things to make things right.  

Lesson- always double check your order before you leave!  Chances are, the people who messed up don't care and won't even try to fix it!

Back in college, I worked at a Applebee's. No, I'm not proud of this, but there's nothing wrong with making an honest wage. Occasionally I'll get a hankering for something from Applebee's - and no, I don't have to use my Yelp application to find one :)

Last Friday night I was really craving mashed potatoes. Applebee's does make a mean mashed potato. And nothing else would suffice. Called in a Carside To-Go order and was out the door in minutes. Pulled up to the reserved Carside parking and a bubbly young lady was ready to greet me within seconds. As I pulled out of the lot, I thought to myself, "Why the heck don't I eat here more? This is so great."

And that's where the good times stopped rolling...

Got home and unpacked my order, only to find that the bubbly young girl (hint: bubbly = not very smart!) put fries in my to-go box instead of mashed potatoes. Normally I'm not picky about my taters, but the only reason I ordered Applebee's was to get the mashed potatoes. 

Mistakes happen, right? No big deal! I called up to tell them about the error - she was very apologetic and asked that I come back for my potatoes and a dessert.

Get back in the car, drive back to the Applebee's and wait. When she comes back out to the car, I hand her the bag of food, untouched. She looks confused: "I thought you only wanted mashed potatoes. You want an entirely new meal?" 

Well, by the time I've driven back and forth, it's been a good 30 minutes and my food is now cold. 'Aint no way I'm taking home warm mashed potatoes and cold fried shrimp! She looks very irritated and confused... "But I brought you dessert," she says.

I don't give a crap about the Duncan Hines creation that she carefully wrapped in aluminum foil at this point. I want the warm meal that I ordered. 30 minutes ago! That I've now driven waaaaay too much to eat!

Eventually I got my meal the way I wanted it. And I certainly didn't meant to frustrate or confuse the Carside To-Go girl (whom I tipped very well, btw). But it just goes to show you that places like Applebee's don't take the time or energy to train their employees (myself included!) properly. Or hire people with common sense!

#Fail

3 1/2 stars. Not bad BBQ for New Orleans. I like mine a little smokier but I am heavy on the smoke when I do my own. I think most people will like the level of smoke flavor though. The sauce tastes like it's bottled or something, kind of non-descript. The slaw is plain and not very tasty. The garlic mash potatoes were really good. TONS of garlic! The pulled pork and the ribs were way too salty for my taste but I don't really care for salt. Even though, I think most would call this too salty. Maybe they were just a little heavy handed with the rub that day because no other reviews mentioned salt. The brisket was moist and tender. Way better than I have ever made it. I will go back but will probably stick to the brisket. Some of the best I have had, at least here in the NOLA area.
Been here several times. Service is getting worse over time. Food was still fast and good.

My server was lovely and made my meal pleasant with her nice service. 
My meal was a spinach salad with 2 thin avocado slices, red onions, grapefruit, a couple of red grapes sliced in half. No dressing was offered but with the addition of a side of delicious white meat chicken salad, the salad was not dry.
The lemonade was being made and not available my entire lunch so i opted for mint iced tea. 
The only thing i did not like about my meal was it was hot inside. It was slightly less hot in the DR. ** You have to bite the bullet and crank up the air for diners when it's already 89 at 12:30 ** Its only going to get hotter as the day goes on. They had a window open out front where all the internet users hang. Perhaps thats contributing to what felt like the 80's when i dined. I heard 2 other tables complain. 

I enjoyed my meal and will return in the fall.

Where else in Delaware County can you walk in at 3 o'clock starving and be able to order from the breakfast,lunch or dinner menu? Certainly not the flavors of the month in the area  that close for a couple of hours in the afternoon. 
That's why i am glad this staple in Delaware County,that's been here for over 20 years and is in It's second generation of family ownership  is still. thriving. 
Today its a veal parm sandwich on a soft kaiser with a pickle and chips. It was devine !!!!!!

Prices are great. 
Breakfast, lunch or dinner - you will not be disappointed.

I searched around for a place to hangout for an hour while my friend is undergoing Physical Therapy down the road. A place to get either a full, inexpensive good meal or just a cup of coffee while checking mail/social media. Wi-Fi here is fast and reliable.  This Chick-Fil-A location has fit the bill for me these last 3 weeks and will continue until April 2016 as his PT continues.
As you enter the complex in which it is located you are pleasantly surprised to find plenty of parking. Inside, the place is just too cute!    Clean, bright and uncluttered. There are 2 real carnations in vases on every table.  You won't find any trash cans here because as soon as someone exits a booth or table it is cleared by CFA staff.
 Parents/Grandparents will be happy to see a clean, nicely lit, enclosed play area with seating outside the glass enclosure so you can feel like you are part of their play. And the kids do because they are always opening the door and interacting with the adults who have brought them here. It's really a nice family space.
Food: For fast food it is great. And they have healthy options. I noticed the kid's meals can include a fruit cup and milk. Great news for parents.
For me, I just try something different every visit. I love the healthier options here; particularly their Yogurt parfait and their salads.   But for those times when you just want something other than the salad you must try the Frosted Lemonade- Summer in a cup ! 
The late, great Paul Prudhomme said "You don't need a silver fork to eat good food"    This Chick-fil-A  location proves it

This review is for October 2014 although it's the same the dozens or so other times I have been here since discovering it in 2009.
 The Sungate is an oasis among the steel and tunnels and pipes that dot the landscape in Marcus Hook- an oil refinery town. 

First: It is very reasonably priced comfort food. Breakfast is great and so is lunch. Dinner is full service soup to nuts so to speak.

Service: Always good. All servers are equally good. They seemed to be cut from the same cloth. The recognize you if you go back.  At one point in late 2013 when I hadn't done my usual  weekly stop in on the way home from work for 3 weeks running, when I came back everyone who wasn't wrapped up with a client came over to say "Hi". And they had no idea I did Yelp reviews. Its just that kind of place. A place you like to take friends and family to for consistently good comfort food and service. 

Ambiance: It's a diner.  Clean, cheerful. Well lit parking.

Three of us ( including fellow Yelp PHIL D)  popped in after seven on a Monday night. 
We noticed outdoor seating as we entered the building and asked to be seated there and what a nice experience that was. It started with the receptionist who put up with our silly jokes to each other as we arrived at her station and continued as we walked to our table out on the expansive Deck. She was marvelous. I'm sorry I forgot my servers name but she was marvelous also. Our drinks were quickly delivered and order was promptly taken. This was a happy experience for all of us because we were able to enjoy a drink On the very comfortable deck and our entrées arrived  at the perfect time.
I ordered the Marsalla meatloaf which was two huge pieces of delectable meatloaf in a marsala sauce with mushrooms Accompanied by creamy mashed potatoes and a Huge serving of freshly grilled asparagus. This entrée at $12 was a great value and so big that I left with leftovers.
The other diners equally enjoyed their meals.
With this beautifully expensive deck, great service and great food I can see us returning here many times this summer.
I wasn't blown away but the food wasn't bad either. If you're going bowling and there's a wait, it is a good place to grab a bite or a drink!

Dined here with out of town guest a few weeks ago. I noticed the pasta station was new since I was last there. My pasta was DELICIOUS!!!!!! I barely touched my breakfast food!!!! The server was nice. We ordered the new item, Hennessy sangria and it too was DELICIOUS!!! Their salads are pretty good. The pastries always go fast and aren't replenished quick enough. 

I wouldn't recommend making reservations after 1pm because they start shutting down for their 3pm close. I felt rushed. The selections weren't replenished and one server just threw some shrimp into the grits :-( I went back for pasta station and the cook was distracted with their co-worker that she forgot my chicken and of course by the time I noticed the station had been broken down. 

I wish the area to get food was bigger. You really don't have space to move; always bumping into people. 

Overall the staff is courteous. A good place to eat if you have patience. The wait to be seated is always a bit. Enjoy!

Ordered takeout from Saritas Grill since it was recommended by the bartender at the Publiq House as solid and satisfying.  Cool big yellow box of a building steps away from .... everything on Freret Street.  10 fast minutes later, I picked up the food from a very nice waitress and went back to the bar.  Would like to dine in next time as the indoors has a different vibe.  The food was, indeed, very solid and delicious.  Beans and rice and meats and cheese all good - two different hot sauces included in the bag!  Will be back again.

As part of my never ending quest to find the best burger in Nashville, I found myself here based on the reputation and reviews. I'm sorry to report that I cannot figure out what all the fuss is about. It was insanely crowded, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it didn't help.

Most importantly, the food is just not very good.  The burgers were dry and spongey, and the chicken tasted like it just came out of the microwave.  The service was incredibly slow and frustrating.  It's clearly quite popular, I just can't figure out why.  There are at least 50 better burgers in town, despite their claims of having the best.

After a night of bowling, our friends suggested going to The Taco Shop. We agreed since it  was probably the only place that was open in the middle of the night. 
Their was a few other people there having their late night fix. The hubby and I had trouble deciding what to get as it was our first time their, and the person behind the counter was not very helpful at reccomending something. So... we settled on splitting a carne asada burrito and a fish taco with an horchata. 
The burrito was pretty good with the help of the salsa bar. The meat was tender and had some flavor, but the hubby said it wasn't grilled it was pan fried. 
The fish taco was just ok, the fish was soggy. I would not order this again. 
We both agreed that the horchata was pretty good, and we have stopped by just for that a few times. 
Overall, I would definitely come back if I'm hungry after a night out!

Beach dive bar. Bartenders were nice and respectful today. We had an order of both the mild and spicy wings which were crispy and cooked ok. The blue cheese came in a plastic sealed container. Not really very good. 

We enjoyed watching the sunset.

It's been a few years since we've been to the Pour House. Our first visit we were blown away with the burgers. The food was great and the layout of the restaurant was festive and made you want to come back. Finally had a chance to stop back in and decided to go with the calamari and fried chicken and biscuits. A Big mistake...  It was probably one of the worst meals I've had in a very long time. The Calamari was so over cooked it was almost inedible.. The fried chicken was overcooked the biscuits were soggy and there was no flavor to the plate whatsoever. Not sure what happened to the Pour House.. Guess I should have stuck with the burgers... But I'm not sure I'll come back.

Ordered from sbmenus.com. Waited an hour and called the restaurant to see what the hold up was. I didn't speak to the guy over the phone with a harsh voice or anything and he was very rude just said "I don't know man" in an annoyed tone. Then I asked if my food was still warm since I have been waiting an hour and he gave me more attitude. Heh... No wonder why you're 40 and serve college students for a living... Prick! I really hate when employees give me attitude. If I acted like that at every job I ever had I'd be fired. I guess service isn't very important to them.
Everything I have ordered from here is fresh and amazing! Seriously everyone should come here. I eat here twice a week.

Pretty pricey menu but you'll have no troubles finding something you like. Very big drink menu generally around $6 each.  Depending on how hungry you are you could finish a small pizza otherwise safe to just split it. Pic is small cheese $10. Pretty good tasty, thin pizza not too crispy. Unfortunately they do not have sides of ranch for the pizza (I know right!?) and on this particular night unfortunately service was very slow for both food and drinks, even water. Will def check it out again and some pint in the future. I have my eye on the Thai chicken or sriracha chicken pizzas.

High Quality food, great flavors and fresh ingredients!  Must Eat here if you can only have one lunch in Boise!

Our party was notified there is no saving tables so no sitting until after you order.

This location is smaller, with an upstairs seating area and outdoor sidewalk seating area, perfect for when the weather is nice.
I ordered the Turkey Brie with potato salad and a mint lemonade after reading fellow yelper's reviews.   Everything was delicious!  The bread was amazing, the sandwich was large for me, if you're a light eater I would recommend to share.  The lemonade was super fresh flavorful and perfect.

Not great for large groups, not good if you're in a rush.  Service is friendly, the interior is very fashionable and clean.

I was here several years ago with my brother and we did the whole wine tasting thing and had a great afternoon in what was a off the beaten path, cute winery with a little shop. 

I recently took my Dad there, thinking I was going to be showing him the same experience as he is a at home wine maker, NOPE. I knew that they had started selling beer but I had no idea that the cute little shop is basically just a bar now with a wall and a half of their wine to sell and about 5 wine themed items to buy. I was so disappointed, I know businesses need to change with the times but in my opinion this was not for the better. I know that the beer sales probably bring in alot of money but at the same time, it has changed the feel of the place. I'll just buy the wine in the store and not waste my time.

Wish I could still say the food was as good as it was when Tony was here but that's in the past and they have had a few cooks since.  The service is S..L..O..W..but the atmosphere and letting the kids play in the pool makes up for that so we stick to apps & drinks.  Like all the spots in Harbour the mosquitos are BAD..Ruskin is just full of farms, ponds, marshy lands and mangroves all over.  Just can't seem to get them to spray enough, takes a army to call in requests!

Under new ownership these past 3years or so but still seems to be lacking good service and food.  Some items ate away good like the burgers or fries but if you try to get outside that and order fish or salad then you have edible not tasty dishes.  I like the location but to tell the truth I would rather drive a few miles north to the Big Bend location.  It just seems to have more atmosphere and friendly staff working there

Have been here several times and it's been consistent each time. 

This is a place you order at the counter and they bring the food to you.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.

My wife and I have ordered different items each time we come to get a feel of the menu.  Although we have never had a bad meal, there is nothing we have had that makes us go WOW, that as awesome.

Heads up, all food is precooked.  So if you get grilled chicken with grilled veggies, you will have your food in 2 minutes.  Which brings up my next point....

If you are in a hurry for lunch, this is a great place to go, because you can order your food quickly and you are served within minutes.

Came here with a group because Two Ten Jack is not open on Sundays and they wanted ramen. Otaku's ramen is even MORE expensive now. $16 minimum for any type, or $22 dollars--TWENTY TWO dollars--if you actually want pork belly in your small bowl of Tonkotsu which normally comes with it by default at most other ramen joints. The only reason this place is getting away with raping people's wallets for soup is the sheer lack of competition for ramen in Nashville. 

The LA spots in Little Tokyo (which also make their own bone broth..?) have much higher rent, yet somehow manage to not gouge their patrons' wallets to make up for it.

Despite my original and excited review about this bagel company, and after many visits, I am sad to say that there are many inconsistencies. Sometimes the bagels are over cooked, dry and hard, and other times the bagels are Excellent. That also goes for their muffins which can be outstanding. 
But I will not give up on them because they have such potential.

Upstanding pasta sauces! We look forward to returning over and over again.
Their Cannolis as are their expressos are exceptional.

Looking for a great pizza? Well this is the place. The perfect mix of tomato and cheese on a perfectly cooked pizza with the perfect crisp crust.
Chicken Marsala was very tasty as was the chicken parm. 
Their happy hour wine pour is very generous and very reasonable.
I highly recommend Luigi's.
This the original Yummy House in a classy new restaurant. Still the best authentic Chinese meals in Tampa Bay.
Wonderful bakery & sandwiches. Dinner menu has gotten quite pricey.

Friday night dinner...not very busy. Had a server (Austin) who was inattentive. Only thing he was quick with was to bring the bill. The food was mediocre. The Brettman burger was bland and the beef was stringy. I was not impressed tonight.

Went in on Friday morning and found it to be busy. The wait was only five minutes. The server was nice but had to wait 20 minutes for my food order. I ordered the Slinger, a St. Louis classic. I was not impressed. It came out warm, not hot. The hamburger had an old taste to it with a hint of sour. The chili wasn't seasoned. The whole thing was...bland and flavorless. No seasoning at all.  Maybe it was a bad day for a slinger. 

The biscuits and  gravy were really good. The gravy was seasoned very well. The bacon was excellent. Thick cut and natural tasting, no taste of any chemicals like store-bought bacon

I did not send the slinger back because I had already waited 20 minutes for it and didn't want to wait another 20 minutes. 

The place was funky in decor. I will be back but I will order something else.

Went for lunch with coworkers mid week. Not too crowded and plenty of staff. Eager to fill your water glass; a little too eager that they are regularly reaching across the tables. 

Never mind that, the food was very good. We split two orders of the vegetarian rolls (3 per order). Two of us ordered the Pad Thai; the other two ordered clay pot soups. One soup was Green Curry Seafood Soup in clay pot (very spicy) and served with rice. She loved it. 

I am blanking on the other soup.  It was in a clay pot and was more tomato based and not served with nice, nor was it as spicy. She also enjoyed her lunch immensely.

The Pad Thai was listed as spicy so we both requested the dish with less spice. The restaurant happily obliged. The dish did skimp on the shrimp (only 4, and tiny), but was generous with the tofu and sprouts. It had good flavor, but I picked up a strong syrupy sweetness at the end. Next time, I would request the sweet to be scaled down too. 

Lunch for the four of us ran $54 before tip. Not too bad but slightly more expensive than other Chinatown spots.

Will return. Place has a large menu to select from and is deceivingly cavernous.

Birthday brunch for a table of 6 on a Sunday at 12pm. Underwhelming and overall disappointing experience. Food was skimp and not delicious for the price point. Service was not very good. 

$16 Bottomless was the only positive positive about this experience. You can switch it up and choose from mimosas, peach bellinis, kir royals, poinsettias. Good deal considering one single peach Bellini is $11. 

Belgian waffles- $18 - 3 tiny and dry waffles with some fruits and maple syrup. Could've probably made the same waffles and I don't even know how to cook.
Cheesesteak omelette - $19 - probably the only thing we all were ok with. The beef short rib was skimp. I think the only thing good anyone said about the entrees was that the omelette was good, which speaks a lot about the experience. 
Turkey BLT Panini- $17- for $17 I can guarantee you getting 3 Wawa Sandwiches is more worth your money and it'll taste better. Sandwich was really dry, everything kept falling apart. I love paninis and this was an insult to the panini name.
Surf and Turf - $22 - 3 pieces of shrimp, giant chunk of iceberg lettuce and some thin pieces of "filet," so thin it couldn't be cooked medium rare and was mostly well done.
Steak and Eggs special - $27(?)- 7oz ribeye with scrambled eggs. 75% of the ribeye was all fat and 75% was alive, we asked for medium rare and got rare. 
Seasonal fruits- $5- for a teacup of like 2 strawberries, 2 pieces of pineapple, and 8 blueberries.
Chocolate cake-$12- this was good! Layers of fudge cake, vanilla cheesecake, and chocolate cream was delicious.
Creme brûlée- $10- really basic and nothing special. Whole Foods creme brûlée tastes better than this. 
Espresso- $4- I used to be a barista in college, this was like half an espresso. 
Cappuccino -$5- nothing special super tiny.

Service- 2/5 - server was unfriendly. She kept bringing out 5 sharing plates/utensils/etc even though it was a table of 6, and we had to keep grabbing things from the table next to us...It was my friends bday (it even said it on the reservation) and she had birthday balloons and there wasn't even 1 candle on the 2 desserts we ordered! Another server (might have been the manager) who made conversation with us a few times asked why we didn't sing hpbd, told him we didn't get a candle. Saw him talk to our server while pointing at our table, we thought some kind of accommodation was going to be made for my friends bday but the server brought out the check.

We used a yelp check in and got one of the desserts for free. We sat outdoor on the mid deck but it was windy so there were clear plastic covers over the deck. The inside dining and overall decor of the place is very old looking, a little dingy in some areas but bathrooms are nice. My friend who dined here last month saw a mouse run around in the dining room, too. For a $$$ restaurant, we weren't impressed and won't be back.

Pizza was pretty ok and big for the price, although it was pretty thin. However, for old city, I'm not complaining about the price. I was able to customize my lone pizza slice with my own choice of toppings so that was nice! Obviously family business, cashier was an elderly lady with a harsh demeanor but it's not a big deal. Would recommend!

Atmosphere - average. The restaurant has changed hands a few times in the past 7 years or so, yet the interior has not changed much. As you enter the restaurant there is a large bar on the left that dominates the room both visually as well as noise. There are 3 fours tops outside front entrance that are a little small. 

Service - good. Our server was pleasant and reasonably attentive. 

Food - very good. The only reason I gave the restaurant 4 stay and not 3 is the food. With a focus on southern Italian entrees, the menu is varied enough that everyone should be able to find something that appeals to them. I ordered the veal parm and it was very good. We were a party of 4 and everyone was very happy with their meal. 

Covid precautions - average. The staff all wore masks and many of the patrons entering the restaurant wore them as well. However, there were nearly a dozen people seated at the bar, many shoulder to shoulder with no masks. 

Overall  Value - very good. The food is very good and the prices are reasonable. We will definitely return

Had some tasty noodle soup here. Wasn't  fan of noodle soup as much prior and I had little expectations coming here but I enjoyed my roasted pork and duck soup. Also they have the tasty cucumber salad they serve..so tasty!
We had some dumpling as appetizers and they were good as well.

I really like the Sherry selection here. I had the sampler for $20..man I could have ordered another round.

The food was half good and half meh. The meh part were mostly because of the salt content.

We enjoyed the crispy pigtails, and the fava bean salad.

The calamari was too salty as was the rice dish.

The shrimp was good and hot/spicy.

Rabbit sausage needed some help. 

Oh the dessert, we got the sundae, was really good actually. 

If I am to return I would just come for drinks (and the sundae). 

Waitstaff was really nice and into the menu.

I can't believe I didn't rate my visit here.

I was really looking forward to my meal here but I was sorta let down. I can't even remember what I ordered-it was that uneventful...uhmmm let me think...yeah I can't recall what I ate but was NOT impressed. 

Oh I was served this salad that had strawberries in it (I think)..it would have been better if they added something with KA-runch (walnuts maybe?). 

Water was good. I had this dessert that I think was a tart...not a hit. I won't be back.

I had this place on my bookmark and never realized it. I walked here after dropping my car off at the mechanic and realizing I had a long wait before i got the car back. I was directed here by the mechanic.

I figure i couldn't sit here for hours without ordering something PLUS it was around 8am so i guess breakfast was in order.
The place is def large which I like..space!
I can't remember what I ordered but it was on the brunch menu and it was a generous serving. I had hot chocolate (with soy) and that was served in a nice big ol'cup.

I enjoyed by meal, def not the typical egg and toast meal. I had to take the rest home. I then sat there for like 3hours....
But the great thing was that I wasn't given the look of death, the "why are you still here?" lol. After 3hours (finally finished reading Tale of Desperaux), I relocated to the starbucks 4blocks away to continue my wait.

But yeah, glad i stopped by here by accident cause otherwise it would have just died on my bookmark list.

The beer list was really impressive, but they were out of a few items I wanted on Tap.  I tend not to blame places for selling out of interesting things.  Some friends of ours enjoyed the food, but we didn't try anything, so I really can't comment.  

The place seemed nice and clean, but my wife had to use the men's room in an emergency, because apparently someone vomited or had an accident in the women's room.

We went to Moe Joe's this morning and it was delightful!! The interior was open and casual. The service was amazing and I love the free cup of coffee while you wait for a table ( this place gets packed on the weekends). The food here is fresh and delicious. We got the garden hash and the smothered breakfast burrito. The garden hash had a ton of fresh veggies, garlic, potatoes, avocado, cheese topped with two fried eggs. This hash was awesome and everything tasted so fresh and clean. The breakfast burrito was amazing and it was smothered in a pork chili verde sauce and cheese. The burrito was stuffed with eggs, sausage ( you can choose your meat) potatoes and cheese. The burrito was HUGE and was insanely good. Overall, best breakfast spot in the Boise/Meridian area.

Ok i know the staff here has to be so cool and trendy that they can be terrible bartenders, I get that vibe
But this place is awful
The staff ignores everyone that they dont know and are soooo cool they can just pass you by time after time when there are more bartenders than customers, but it's just a bar
And it's terrible
It's one of those places that make money by accident...
Might have been the place to be ten years ago but it's become a parody of itself 
Trust me, there are a thousand bars in ybor.. just keep waking

I'm a loyal fan of Thai Pooket so, on a whim, decided to branch out. 

I wasn't disappointed and I wasn't excited either. I ordered the red curry and it was full of veggies. Off the bat I know that my portion at Pooket is larger. Simply's rice also had a drier texture and wasn't really sticky. 

They both give eggrolls and I liked both the same amount. However, I prefer the sauce at Simply. Pockets is sweeter and bright orange. It's flavorful, but there was something more savory in Simply's sauce. 

The unique thing at Pooket that I always love and crave is that clear broth soup. I don't know how they do it- but it's sooooooo good and no one else has it! 

My friend said her chicken fried rice was bland and my other friend liked his Pad Thai. 

Pooket will always be my favorite but it was good to branch out.

During a visit to this location, the bartender was too busy talking to her boyfriend at the bar to serve other customers. When I did manage to get her attention, the drunk boyfriend became irate because he felt that his time was interrupted. On a second visit, I waited for for 15 minutes before being served. The waiter on this occasion was particularly friendly once he started to serve.

If it wasn't for the tuna tartar, which was decent, this would be a one star restaurant.  The tuna tartar had potential, but needed some finishing salt and maybe a little heat and/or crunch to make it more interesting. 

Ordered three rolls and they were awful.  The spicy tuna and the unagi rolls contained this weird mixture, which I assume was pureed fish.  I've never experienced that before.  The salmon rolls had too much rice and the seaweed was too thick.  We slathered the rolls in soy sauce and wasabi to make them more palatable. 

Ordered three pieces of sushi.  They were some of the largest pieces of sushi I've ever had. The salmon was not fresh.  The hamachi was boring.  The striped bass, which was the cheapest of the sushis, was actually the most flavorful. 

A crisp Riesling is usually a good accompaniment to sushi.  Unfortunately, there is not one on the menu.  The one they had was cloyingly sweet, with no acid or fruit.  It wasn't even finished!  The pinot noir was too earthy.  The cava, while not great, was the best of the options. 

The main restaurant can be very loud.  The small side booths for two are a good option for a couple who want to be able to converse.

First, I wasn't impressed with the decor of the restaurant. We were so squeezed in because the tables were to close together and the men at the next table were tall and big. 
I had lunch here for restaurant week. It was okay, but I've had far better meals. The argula salad was not to my taste. I also picked the butcher burger. It was medium well, which made it juicy. I enjoyed it, but it could have been more flavorable.

I might have given this three stars except for the fact that the name of the bar is Irish Pub, yet there is no Guinness in sight.

In general, it's not a bad place to grab a late night not-as-pricey-as-everywhere-else-in-center-city beer, but the food and ambiance is lackluster.

If you want better food and better atmosphere, go across the road to Moriarty's.

Lunched with a girlfriend last week.

You really have to watch coming in from the blazing sun and getting situated on those immediate spiral steps down, 'cause it's dark. Thank goodness there's a railing.

We were seated right away, having arrived a bit before 11:30 a.m., in a cozy booth that was quite private. And it seemed like we were the only people there.

I checked in on Yelp and got a free beer or wine! What a glorious surprise!

Service was fine with Phillip. Although it did drag and drag and drag. Maybe they're used to leisurely lunches, but we didn't want it to take the entire afternoon.

We both got sandwiches. They come with a choice of house-made chips or fries.

My girlfriend got the Vegetable Burger with eggplant condiment, cheddar and arugula on a wheat bun. She opted for the house-made chips.

I got the fluke sandwich ($12) -- With bibb lettuce, olives, capers, tomato and aioli on a wheat bun. I opted for the fries.

It was nice that we were given a vessel of water, but we drank it all up, and it wasn't replenished. So I was going dry.

She said her burger was OK. I tried a couple of the house-made chips, and they were OK.

The fluke was good. I ditched the bun and found wonderful flavors. The bibb got a little wilty, but that happens.

The olives were huge green olives. The capers were reasonably abundant. The tomatoes were cherry or grape or heirloom, and held up well. The aioli was a nice condiment.

The fries were well-seasoned. Something on them. I'm guessing it was Parmesan.

We left asking for elevator service up, and were beautifully escorted to the upper regions by a lovely employee who accommodated us and was incredibly gracious. And we saw the backside of the kitchen doing this.

I had a hefty recyclable to-go vessel of half the fluke and some of the fries.

I'm giving:
-1 for the stairs, which could be incredibly treacherous for many people
-1 for the dreary pace of the meal
-1 that our water vessel wasn't replenished
+1 for the Yelp check-in free beverage
+1 for the escort to the elevators
-1 for needing the elevator to get out of the joint

I'm not usually a +1, -1 person, but I had to do this to figure out where the rating should be.

And doesn't that just tell you something in and of itself?

Retirement celebration for lunch today. Retiree selects the restaurant. Six of us. So thankful they put us at a table for 10. And the six of us had ENOUGH ROOM!!! I mean good elbow room for ourselves and plenty of table room for all the utensils, beverages, salads, plates and pizzas.

If 10 people had been sitting at this table, it would have been just as cramped and uncomfortable as our previous visits.

Contrary to our previous visits to this location, the hostess and servers were quite friendly and highly attentive. Beverages and water were quickly refilled.

Everybody got an enjoyable salad: two Caesars, bada bing, winter caprese, house, and I got the blt. Everybody finished their salad but me. Mine was hardly dressed, so I saved it to doctor up at home.

I don't recall this option from our previous visit, but there are two sizes of salad. Everybody got a small for $6. The large is $9.

Each pair split a large thin-crust pizza. All pizzas were $20.

Two full Lincoln Park - mozzarella, garlic olive oil, zucchini, fresh tomatoes, feta and fresh basil.

My splitting partner got the Berkeley -- mozzarella, portobella, onions, kalamata olives, red bell peppers, garlic and zucchini. I got the North Beach Classico -- mozzarella, Berkshire sausage, mushrooms, onions and green bell pepper.

I always forget that any deep-dish ingredients can be made into a thin-crust pizza, and any thin-crust ingredients can be made into a deep-dish pizza. Great versatility, but more options if you have trouble choosing!

All pizzas were thoroughly enjoyed. All ingredients looked truly fresh. And the crust was crunchy and tasty. The Berkshire sausage on my pizza was so flavorful. Everybody ate their pizza with a knife and fork.

Everybody but my splitting partner had leftovers . . . to take away in recyclable to-go vessels. And I had two -- one for my salad, too!

The office went for a celebration lunch. The place is all black and red with Sinatra pictures everywhere. There's a glitzy bar in the back with mirrors, rather gawdy. And the bar in front is the longest bar I've ever seen with stools on both sides. It could seat an army.

The menu offers apps, soup, salads, pizza, sandwiches, pasta, salmon, fish tacos, chicken parmagiana. A rather eclectic menu.

Two of us ordered Diet Coke, and our server didn't tell us they carry Pepsi products. Well, it was OK with me, but the other person detests Diet Pepsi, so her beverage had to be changed out.

We got a basket of rolls (We had to ask for the rolls, after we saw other tables getting rolls.), and they were absolutely fantastic. There were yeasty, hot pretzel rolls topped with pretzel salt; and hot, herb rolls -- served with REAL butter.

Two of our group got the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich ($9) -- battered chicken breast, hot sauce, ranch, lettuce and tomato on brioche. They both chose fries as the side. This was A LOT of food! The chicken breast was huge, and the breading was also buffaloed, but not too heavily.

I got the French Dip ($9) -- roast beef covered with four-cheese gratin on French bread with au jus.

I've never had a French Dip before, and this was tasty. Still, I don't quite get why you would want to put bread in juice and sog it all up. But I did it, and the juice was good! The four-cheese gratin didn't add any flavor.

I got cottage cheese as my side, but couldn't help myself and ordered fries, too. Our server described them so beautifully.

The fries were homemade, skin-on and crispy. They were so dark, they almost looked overcooked, but they were perfect! Yum!

Nobody needs that much starch in one meal, but those rolls were so amazing, we just sat there and ate them all!

Then we ate our sandwiches and fries, and rolled back to work.

Two of us had hefty to-go vessels.

The Bar Louie girls -- the high school group of six -- decided to celebrate our second anniversary of getting together by going back to Bar Louie -- where it all started!

Three of us got there 30 minutes "early," so we speared a lovely rounded booth facing all the TVs. Got water, reviewed the imbibement list and took a little minute to decide.

Our server (We kept calling her Susie, but then explained to her why we called her Susie, and she got a hoot out of it.) was just spot-on with the leisure and flavor of our table! I wish I could remember her name, but she was absolutely delightful and extremely attentive.

Tuesday is $1 burger night. Well, you gotta know the $1 burger is lettuce and a bun -- it says so explicitly on the menu. No arguments from us readers!! You want cheese, bacon, mayo, grilled onions, raw onions, tomatoes --  anything else -- it costs extra!! For the most part, additions are 50 cents extra. Mayo is 25 cents extra.

The dollar burger menu encourages you to order a basket of fries or tots. Ask how much that costs -- 'cause it ain't $1. We asked. And we asked how many that basket would serve.

OK, here's the rundown: one basket of fries or tots costs $4, and it serves 2-3. BINGO! You got the picture.

We started out with a cone basket of calamari with its lucious ketchup-horseradish sauce. It was wonderful. I wish we'd ordered two.

Then we were on to the burgers. Everybody got exactly what they ordered, brought out by the "kitchen"? Not sure, but he was fabulous. And we got a basket of tots.

By this time our sixth attendee had arrived, and she was giving her burger order to the kitchen guy. He was taking it all in, but then Susie was there, so she took over. Great service!!

And we ordered another basket of tots. There's just something about tots that reminds me of childhood. And, yes, tater tots were already invented when I was a child. (So was fire.)

The burgers just hit the spot! Great buns, a good-sized patty with nice beef flavor and a reasonable amount of lettuce. Add a little ketchup and a lot of mustard (both free), dig into the tots, and you gotta a great meal! I added Cheddar to my burger, so it was a $1.50 burger. There were four cheese options: Cheddar, Pepper Jack, American and Provel (I think).

That second basket of tots was HOT-HOT -- fresh out of the tot-maker!! Yum!! The six of us did not finish that second basket.

A fabulous evening with good friends, good food, good service!

Yeah, I went back. We'll call this BAB (Brio After Bug). Ironically, we got the same table. I guess it's ours now!

I had my card for the free appetizer, so we selected beef carpaccio ($12.95, but FREE for us!) It was luciously tasting so thinly sliced meat with capers and a mustard aioli -- field greens in the middle (a beautiful presentation) on a HUGE platter!!

With that kind of an app, we both forewent salad and went directly to the entree . . . both selecting the chicken under the brick ($19.25), beautifully cooked chicken in a Marsala wine sauce with mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables. I opted to sub out of the mashed potatoes and got two portions of roasted vegetables. They were really roasted and that brought out such sweet vegetable flavor of the carrots, broccoli, red pepper -- and I can't remember the other vegetables.

Our server Derek was fabulous, and quickly got the flow of our dinner . . . slow, slow, slow, and it lasted 4 hours. I've never had a four-hour meal in a restaurant.

We had lovely to-go vessels.

OK, Brio, you've won me back, but no 5 stars . . . I still remember the bug!

Fantastic service.  The waiter was extremely friendly and gave us chips  and delicious salsa as soon as we sat down.  

We had a Groupon which was an amazing deal- for $28 bucks we got an appetizer, 2 entrees and dessert.  The calamari appetizer was crunchy and nicely seasoned and the portion was ENORMOUS.   The rest of the food, however, wasn't that great.  The crab cakes were really flat like pancakes and had no crab in it.  The key lime pie wasn't bad but it was more like a cheesecake with lime sauce on it and the crust tasted kind of old.  The drinks were really cheap- a pint of margarita was only $6 bucks.  

I noticed they also had karaoke in the back.  I'm not a good singer, but if I ever want to practice I'm definitely coming here.  There were only 5 people in the room and everyone singing was pretty terribly.  

I'd probably come back again for drinks and I'd like to try to tacos to see if they're any good.  This place definitely got an extra star because of the amazingly nice waiter.

If I could rate this experience less than one star, I would. Never in any of my restaurant experiences have I been made to feel this uncomfortable. We were at this location on December 2nd around 9pm. We were at the location for a birthday party with a party of six. The hostess I spoke with, Ellie , at first refused to seat us because our party was too large. I asked if our party could be split into half or a smaller group because we went to this location specifically for a special occasion. The hostess again refused to serve us and said we could order Cake to go. I asked her if there was any possible way to seat us because we drove at length to get her. She finally said that she would see what she could do. She then proceeded to pull over three other people working and begin to literately gossip about our party. The servers were all staring at our party and laughing while rolling their eyes. The rest of the evening was extremely uncomfortable because we were the last in the shop to be served. When we walked up to see the cake selections another sever (not sure of her name but she had blonde hair and black glasses on) was talking to another male about our party and how "annoying" our party was. To add insult to injury, the hostess Ellie, continued to talk about the clients in the shop and our party the rest of the evening with the other staff. It felt more like a gossip session than a relaxing evening out. I find this kind of service extremely upsetting especially after we have heard such great things about this shop. Needless to say I don't think we will be returning to this location due to the way we were treated on our first visit. I've always highly recommended this place to people visiting Indianapolis based of off reviews but sadly can no longer do that.

Update: after voicing a concern via twitter the account proceeded to block my twitter account. Nothing I said was rude or out of line from a normal customer concern.

I'll start by saying this place would get 4-5 stars if the service were better. It's in a cute building that looks like a former house. The layout is narrow but welcoming. The food? Fabulous brunch! I got an omelette. My bf got a great waffle with pork belly and sriracha. This dish was spectacularly flavored! 

About the service: SLOW. Meaning: we waited 20 minutes to order food...as did the other 2 tables in our room. One table asked each other, "What are we doing here? Eating? Let's leave the waitress seems to have forgotten." The waitress, who was very nice, apologized as they left and promptly took the orders of the 1 remaining table and us. The food came out after about 20 minutes. 

The entire visit was 1 hour 20 minutes...and the place wasn't busy. Good food. But tooooo slow!

For you are looking for a sports bar with TVs everywhere, I think you will get exactly what you bargained for.  The restaurant was clean and the staff friendly.  I order the black and blue shrimp salad which was pretty good although I thought the shrimp was a little bit overly salty, however the reason why this place gets a 2 and not a 3 is because the greens were a little bit wilted meaning they were not as fresh as they should be and the service was pretty slow.  We all got soup and/or salad at the table so should not have taken very long to serve.  The restaurant is also very loud since all the TVs were going and there was a descent crowd for lunch.  I think on game day this place would be perfect but on any other day or night give this place a pass.

**Problem with social distancing at this restaurant during Covid-19- they are placing people very close together and the bathrooms look as though they are not being cleaned. The upstairs bathroom I went to had no hand soap left. 

We went for a dinner date and got the following:
Butter rolls
Small oyster plate 
Some kind of filet mignon/beef dish 
Lobster mac and cheese 
3 cocktails  

The bill was fairly high at almost $200, and while the food was good for the most part, it wasn't overwhelming. The lobster mac and cheese didn't have much lobster in it, but my partner really enjoyed his steak. 

A huge issue I had was we were placed in a room where the wait staff kept opening the door to serve people sitting outside- on a night where it was around 40 degrees Fahrenheit. A couple of people complained yet they kept leaving the door open and that did not make for a pleasant indoor experience to have to sit through a very frigid breeze while eating.

Another issue was our waitress who informed my partner on his way to the bathroom that I was ordering a cocktail, as if I was ordering behind his back, although I was the one paying the bill. This was extremely unprofessional of her, and neither he or I appreciated this.

Overall, it was pleasant enough despite the tacky and multivariate decor, but I'm not sure it was good enough to match the prices and that we would go back.

Please don't judge PHL cheesesteaks by this place. I have lived in this area for 55 years and they make the most pathetic puny cheesesteaks I have ever eaten. I ordered it, opened it, saw 1/5 of the meat that should be in an $8 and politely asked for my money back. This place is the pits.

More like 3.5 stars (still waiting on those half stars, Yelp).  Been to the one of the Maggiano's in Chicago a few times and this one is exactly the same. It's the higher end of the Italian chains. Good food but nothing spectacular. Lasagna is good but not nearly as good as mine!  Also had the ravioli which was decent and flavorful. I think my favorite are the mozzarella cheese appetizer plank thingys. Made with whole milk so they're extra tasty!  

A little better than Carraba's, a lot better than Olive Garden but not nearly as good as homemade Italian.

Not to be confused with my four star review I gave to Cristano's in Tampa, where I had the pizza just a day earlier. At Cristano's in Clearwater, I decided to give the three cheese ravioli a shot. It was also very good, but for $14, they should definitely give you a bigger portion. Noodles cooked perfectly - cheese was very tasty; I just wanted more than ~8 ravilois. 

Ironically, the pizza that I saw on the next table at this Cristano's looked like a five star pie, better than the pizza I had at the Tampa location.  Oh, and the flourless chocolate cake was horrible, absolutely bland and dreadful (my favorite Gordon Ramsey-ism).  DO NOT order the chocolate cake! But at least our server wasn't a weirdo.

I was excited to try the restaurant I'd heard so much about. I was disappointed. 
I have to say the service is superb. Very attentive. 
We had a crab stuffed clams with chorizo appetizer that was awesome. 'Lick the plate' worthy. 
However, totally underwhelmed with main courses. One had fried chicken that was average at best. Bland. 
I had shrimp with grits. For $33 I would expect more than 4 shrimp. It comes with a tomato artichoke stew...I'm not an artichoke fan and asked waiter how many artichokes or if the 'chokes were minimal. He said minimal. Not true. 
The larger VERY loud group a few tables away ruined any "atmosphere" that was there. The couple next to us was so upset with how long it took to get main courses they angrily got up and left. 

So, due to the mediocre main courses I give 3 stars.

First time here...service was fantastic! Drinks were great...meticulously prepared (note the almost finished old fashioned in the pic). Food is a little underwhelming. While everything we had tasted great (crab cakes, a must have...charcuterie, you can pass on...most def get the bruschetta) the sizes are small, even less than tapas style. This the reason for 4 stars. Really like the view...although, it was cloudy the night we we're there. 
We'll definitely be back!

Its a NO for me. 

Came here with my husband for the first time for dinner and will never return. Ordered a martini...or should I say ICE TINI since it was filled with little ice cubes and it tasted like water down liquor. 

The only time we saw our server was when she took our order. I just really wanted some hot sauce with my wings but she never came back and was talking to her coworkers by the soda station. When we finished our drink, that's when she shows up and asks if we wanted another round of drinks. She literally checked on ALL of her table (that were about to leave) except ours.  

Horrible service. Mediocre food. Will never return.

The food was not that good.  I had the lasagna. It tasted like a microwave dinner. The garlic bread loaf was just the regular bread with cheese on top and a side of marinara. I can order better garlic cheese bread from dominos.  

On a positive note, my drink was ok. The mussels were just average too.  The servers were friendly but seemed inexperienced.  They had to be prompted to ask if we wanted fresh pepper or cheese with our meal.  They didn't know if we could transfer drinks from the bar to the table.
Dissapointing considering how great the old Malio's is. This isnt a horrible place to eat but its overpriced and has forgotten its roots in good old fashioned italian foods and steaks

Never actually shopped here, but, had their products over the Holidays. Their soupersod (soppressata) ispretty alright, but, I noticed is mad expensive after looking at the price on the container. The mild/sweet I also expected to have a little more flavor, but, was still good. I would personally stick to South Philly stuff, though.

I got the double cheese burger for $4 on the menu. Taken one star off due to very bad & dirty restrooms. They have their own seasoning, could not taste it all that much. They need Bigger plates, the cookie was touching my burger on the plate Cookie & burger very good, the bun was nice & the cookie was great. I did find 2,lint hairs on my plate, may of came from a towel I think. I like how they had the cookie on the plate touching the burger but what do yu expect for $4. the place does need a thorough cleaning probably would not come back, good service from the waitress in red hair though. Their coupons are not that great, yu can save .50 on a burger/fries that is $3.99 yet yu can get a burger, fries, cookie & another side for $4. I also had the coke slaw, not very good, a little discolored & slimy. This is a place that yu may question yurself to eat at, not sure how sanitary it is in the back.

The steak n egg. Nuff said. Oh and be sure to ask for extra sauce ;)

I order from here quite often, REALLY nice owners (i guess they are) stupid me does not know either of their names, and after all this time (and as i'm typing this) i feel bad.

It's either a toss up between the steak and egg (with extra sauce) or the sunshine special. Can't  go wrong. Plus add a bag of chips and an Arizona energy drink with it all for about eleven bucks?! can't do better! 

Trust me, try that steak and egg, but i hope your mom isn't around because you'll definitely be wanting to slap her right in the face it's so damn good.

You will get a solid breakfast here, no doubt. I've been a few times now and each visit has been a good experience. The place is always busy, definitely a good sign. Plus my being a breakfast enthusiast, pancakes and waffles always holds a special place in my existence.

Nothing modern about the design, it's very original on the inside. It certainly feels like a place fitting of its name if you follow me. Nothing bad about that, I'm just saying the place feels right. It was pretty much just what I expected the first time I went.

I usually order the chicken fried steak tho as I think it's one of the best dishes on Earth and Betsy's is hella good. The wait staff has been pleasant on my visits, i also heard they hire inmates to help work the kitchen? If so, that's cool. I really like when businesses are open to hiring convicts. Makes it seem like they're real, down-to-earth  people, in my eyes.

Great food at good prices, you should certainly stop in if you're in the area and in need of a good breakfast or lunch.

I've eaten here so many times, I'm surprised I've yet to write a review. This was the place that kept me alive when I first moved to Mid City. I'm usually between the general tso and sesame chicken combination. If I'm feeling extra piggish, I'll help myself to an order of the crab ragoon, they're not all that bad. In fact, I don't think anything I've had from here is all that bad.

I've also been here for their lunch buffet and I can tell you it's definitely worth the money. They keep the place clean, you can see into the kitchen line which is always a plus. The combinations are at least two servings and under ten bucks, incredible!

The delivery ($15 min) is also a plus, because how can I pig out and be lazy if I have to actually go and pick up my own $#! T?! Those sugar buns are pretty good as well, just don't try them the next day, finish em fresh.
I love that Hoshun is open late, as i am a nighttime New Orlenian. I usually get the Playboy roll, it's lit on fire at the table and is in my opinion the best roll on the menu.

I got the Hu Tieu Do Bien (seafood rice noodle soup), it was pretty bad, i would give it a 3or4/10. The broth was just too fishy....and not good.  I just had nam phuongs Hu Tieu Do Bien a few days before and that was way better, prob a 8/10. I know most people get pho here, but if another dish tasted this bad, I can't imagine their pho being that good... 

But everyone should try the Hu Tieu Do Bien at Nam Phuong, its a good change from the usual Pho, especially since Nam Phuong is right next to to viet huong.
Was excited to try this place. Friendly staff, good food. Just thought it was a little pricey for what you get. Also forgot my ID so didnt get to try their mimosas so will be coming back for those.
Slow service and only so so good. Our meals came ten minutes apart and my burger was raw not medium rare

This Jimmy John's makes the commercials on the radio appear like straight up lies. These slowpokes are NOT FREAKY FAST. Sandwich was normal, meat was salty and I have noticed this in the past as well which will turn me off from jimmy in the future. You see the delivery guy walk to the door like the song in his head goes La La La...Hello Sky! Doo de doo...Hi there Bird! So yea no more ordering, if the fix ever hits again better off saving time going into the stupid parking lot and waiting in line.

I was so excited to find a restaurant dedicated to Kati Rolls, and this place did not disappoint! I opted for a vegetarian option and got the paneer masala, which was super flavorful. The worker at the counter was extremely friendly, and guided me through the different spice levels so that I didn't completely burn my mouth off.

The menu has a large variety of options but isn't too overwhelming. I would recommend one roll if you're looking for a snack and two if you're looking for a meal.

If my days of staying out late weren't behind me, this would be my go to spot for late night eats given its late hours and proximity to bars/night life.

Kooma has a very nice selection of menu options. From sushi to stir-fry, there's something for everyone. I got the Wilmington sushi roll, which was a tuna roll with avocado and jalapeño. A+! I also had a martini, which I've heard they're known for, and it didn't disappoint.

This restaurant is a bit on the pricier side but it has a swanky ambience and good service.

Spaghetti and meat balls.  One of the simplest dishes that exists.  the meatballs were meat.  No real spices to them.  Bland.  the meat sauce was sour and very acidic, meaning they don't know meat sauce or at least how to balance it.  The spaghetti?  You have to be an awful chef to screw this up, and this was okay.  Kudos to the "chef" for at least getting the pasta right.

I usually go to an all you can eat place on the East side but I decided to check out this place in Broadripple and was very disappointed. The floor was sticky and the bathrooms were nasty. The food wasn't very good either. I got the chicken teriyaki roll and the chicken was so dry I couldn't finish my first piece. I told my waiter that I didn't want them and I needed to try something else because of the issue and he stated that I couldn't leave more than 7 rolls on the table or I would be charged. I ended up having to eat more food I didn't like or I would be charged...so I paid more so that I wouldn't have to eat those rolls...very gross. Kasai on the East side is still the best as far as food, customer service, and consistency.

We've now enjoyed two breakfasts there. This is a great cafe for those craving a home style breakfast. They've got a great bakery and we love their muffins and chocolate croissants. If you get their breakfast sandwich I recommend adding a side of potatoes. Their home cooked Turkey meat came right out of a daily roasted Turkey. Yum. The staff is sweet and the story behind the biz is heart warming. We love that we could sit outside under the heat lamps and bring our pup too. This restaurant attracts really delightful customers too.

I demand the ability for half stars....this isnt fair to me or the restaurants. 
Okay. This wasn't the best dinner I have ever had. I adore this place....I really do....I feel as if I am scolding my favorite nephew. Set the scene: Beautiful chilly night, Veteren's Day, roughly seven pm. Along with my good friend V, and her fav Pokemon Trainer E, we walk in. Clearly we were the only adults to have brought a halfling that evening. The hostess asked "how many"?, we replied "three". She looked at the main seating area, which had a ton of open tables. And decided to sit us near the bar on the great table under the beutifully drawn Dr. Suessian tree(it really is pretty). We felt kinda ostracized to be honest. She could have thought about it, then asked where we would like to sit. Sitting at this great table away from the rest of the restaurant left our service to be slower than usual, but still adaquate. We ordered same as last time: Lemon Crostini and the roasted eggplant pizza, and since Pokemon trainers do not eat such things....we ordered the Salami pizza for him and told him it was pepperoni. Both Pizzas were way over-done. The crust was black on the bottom of the Salami one, and highly spotted on our eggplant one. Neither myself or V could cut the pizza with a knife, and felt like neanderthals with a leg of (insert beast of choice here) using our incisors to rip it apart. The Crostini was FLAWLESS, and the Angry Orchard Beer was AWESOME. My disappointment comes from the seating choice (perhaps if you want kids to sit there, leave that wall blank, and give them the colored chalk to draw?) and the burnt pizza. I will go back, and I really think this is a 2.5 star review, for that Reilly's pizza, I ask forgiveness. We will be back soon, but with less excitement I am sure. Still the coolest building downtown.

The evening was planned.

Leave work early, lunch, then wander the city for a bit before checking into our hotel, (we stayed at Sofitel).  Shower, relax a bit, then dinner at Del Fresco Grille before walking over to the Kimmel to see Alvin Ailey. Afterwards, maybe a drink, then back to the hotel.  Next day, brunch, then an art gallery with friends....etc.

A wonderful evening that even the light rain couldn't ruin.  We both live in Philadelphia but never actually stayed in the city.  So, it was something fun and special to do with your SO.

Right?!

The evening was awesome, fun, everything I could possibly want.

The weakest part of the evening?  

Del Fresco Grille.

The restaurant looks great, I love the feel of it, sophisticated but relaxed. 
Service from our waitress from spot-on, she was efficient, chatty but not overbearing, knowledgable and free with her answers. 

The menu was interesting without a lot of filler or randomness to it.  I could appreciate the more simplistic dishes and even the items that were a bit more complicated made sense. 

We had the Guacamole - Hand-Mashed Avocado, Crisp Corn Tortilla Chips. Kale & Brussels sprout Salad w/chicken - Roasted Almonds, Dried Cranberries, Orange Segments, Shaved Manchego, Creole Mustard Vinaigrette along with Grille Prime Cheeseburger - Doubled-Stacked USDA Prime Beef Patties, American Cheese, Lettuce, Red Onion, Sloppy Sauce, Tomato, Pickle.

The presentation was awesome, the salad was honestly gorgeous. I was almost excited to eat it!

The guacamole was ice cold with large chunks of avocado. Which I was pleased with, I don't like my guac to be totally smashed. It would be nice if the chips were a bit more hardy, they kept breaking. Sadly, the guac was bland, very bland and it tasted of nothing.

I brushed it off and called it a one-off, we continued with our meal 

As I said when I saw the salad I was excited but sadly the salad offered more of the same bland taste of the guacamole. Which was incredibly surprising given the ingredients.  I was expecting SO much more in flavor.

However, the food was incredibly bland. I have high blood so I'm aware of my salt intake and I normally do not cook with salt if I do, I use very little.  

SO was equally unimpressed with his food selection as well.  I'm not sure if it was just a bad evening for them or.....but I was not impressed.

I've always been a fan of Ish's cheesesteak - it's flavorful, delicious, juicy and everything you want for a good cheesesteak.
Today, I visited Ish again, but this time, somehow, I tried their infamous chicken cheesesteak and Ish cheeseburger, which I had high hope on. Oh man! What a bad choice! The chicken cheesesteak came out with big chopped grilled chicken with provolone cheese on it. It was bland, no flavor and very dry. The burger - let me put it this way- is not better than a gas station or food truck burger, and the bun was cold. Just a nightmare! 
The only thing I recommend of getting from Ish is their cheesesteak, believe me, it's really really good!!!! Avoid anything else!!!

Ok I am a Tria DEVOTEE. I love the wine (try the Riesling Kabinett), I love the cheese, I love the happy hour and the Sunday School specials. I'm pretty sure I have eaten the entire menu over the course of the last year. The service is also amazing. Recently, we've been buying the $8 for $15 Groupons, which is a great deal. I have also found them to be very responsive in the rare instance that I have had a complaint or issue.

I had a lot of fun here and would return but it was just okay for the hot pot compared to what I've had before. Everyone that worked there seemed to be so miserable. The bottle of wine we bought was actually terrible (I can't believe I just called wine terrible. I love wine and have pretty low standards for it honestly.) They didn't have a very robust sauce selection. All in all it was fun I filled my tummy but am going to hit the other hot pot spots first.

Went back last weekend and they sat us by the door (it was maybe 35 out) - which the hostess *assured* us wouldn't be cold. 

Like hell it wasn't. 

I froze my ass off every time someone came in, but because they were packed, we were committed to the table. Plus, we were all hungry and trying to make it to a show in Jersey right after ... Still trying to regain feeling in my limbs.
