I get that extra table is making you money and I'm sure it's fine when the weather is nice out, but don't LIE to people to get them to settle for that miserable ass table in the winter.

3.5 stars....

The food is good and artfully prepared.  The chicken Satay was great, 2 thumbs up from my son.

We had crispy duck with curry and Pad Thai.  Both were good, aside from a bit too much sauce on the crispy duck, and that seemed to "uncrisp" the duck - my son liked it anyway .  

Service was excellent, and there were quite a few tables for a rainy  Wednesday night.

Found this place on Yelp, and we will go back for a second meal to confirm this review.  It has great potential, and I would recommend  giving it a try

This place is fairly new to The Reading Terminal. I stopped by to try, always game for something new. The food was pretty good. I'm not a yam person but it was probably the best thing I ate there. The jerk salmon resembled baked or stewed salmon, it wasn't grilled nor did it taste like jerk but again it was tasty. I would return, trying something different next time.

It's a Chili's.  Great burgers, great fajitas, great sammiches, and surprisingly good "Mexican" selections.  They actually have been changing up the burger selection.  I think last time I got Alex's Southwest Burger?  It was delish.

This particular location has improved by leaps and bounds over the past few years in terms of service.  Maybe they stopped hiring the Picture Rocks crowd?  The servers used to be kind of ... trashy, and I remember going in one time, standing at the front for 5 minutes, leaving and going to Baggins.  I quit going here after that for a couple years, but have been back a few times recently, and the service at this point is top-knotch!  Way to turn the place around!

I try to go easy on service establishments.. for I have worked as either a server, bartender or manager the last 4 years to pay my way through undergrad and grad school.. but, sometimes enough is enough. I have (unfortunately) been to this chili's 4 times. And EVERY SINGLE TIME, there has been a blonde haired manager with a MOUTH on her, either screaming at her staff (so much so that its distracting to the customers) or to bar patrons! I just got off of a 10 hr shift at work and was craving some of the delicious tilapia they have here(the only reason they got 2 stars is because they have good, affordable food), so, I got take out.. not only did I wait an additional 15 minutes to the 20 I was informed it'd be (on the phone) but I heard this manager-employee SCREAM "I'm not fu**ing playing!".. and I'm sure most of the restaurant also heard her. Enough is enough, corporate. You're losing a customer today. And I hope that others take this review into consideration before spending money on a place that not only employs but does not reprimand this behavior.

Disappointed in service and the the food was okay, meh.

I guess I showed up at an odd time because the place was empty and not an employee was in sight. I could hear people speaking in the kitchen but no one came out. I loudly said hello a few times, nothing. I should've taken that as a sign to leave but I didn't. 

Finally a gentleman came out and asked me what I wanted. I had a few questions about the chicken kabob, thighs/breast? He didn't know so I went with something I've never had, fish kabobs. My order was to go and it was a 15 minute wait.

When I think kabobs I think meat on a stick. That wasn't the case for the fish, no biggie. The fish had amazing flavor, packed the punch I adore from Indian cuisine but it was dry. I should've ordered a condiment/sauce to help that situation. I was also thrown off off by the skin still being on. Lastly, the rice was my favorite part of the meal!! I'm not sure what they put in it but it was devine. I saved some to eat with breakfast the following day.

Overall it was okay. If I'm in the area and want tandoori chicken I may try them out again.

Super cute place! I want to bring my mother and girlfriends here for lunch and of course tea.

I didn't stay long, picked up an online order. In the short time I was there I was happy. I loved the multiple tables with differing setups. I felt like I walked into someone's home, very inviting. I also noticed the baked goods, some of my favorite things.

I ordered cranberry scone mix, clotted cream, fig and ginger jam, and Lady Grace Afternoon tea. I had the pleasure of baking my scones with Tina through a Zoom event. Tina is awesome!! She is definitely one of those people you can't help but to like, immediately.

Now the scones, DELICIOUS!! Served warm with clotted cream and jam will change your life. I'm looking forward to trying more items from Tina's Tea Room!!

Outstanding restaurant.  Great atmosphere, perfect for a date or special occasion  The waiter knew the menu and food well and recommended a new beer which I loved.  The steak was amazing, melts in your mouth.  The sides were great too.  You just want to lay back and enjoy your full stomach after eating this terrific food.

Superrrr not impressed at all. I've been to a ton of Hawaiian restaurants, as well as having home cooked meals from actual Hawaiian mamas, and this place doesn't shine a light to any of them. I'm also Samoan, which I know isn't Hawaiian,  but we still know good Polynesian food when we have it, and this place just doesn't. I've been here and the location on speedway on 4 different occasions because I convince myself that the longer they've been open, the better it will get. That plus, I love island food! The mac salad tasted like it had been sitting in the fridge for a week. It looked really bland and tasted about the same, plus everything in it was cut rather large which wasn't very appealing either. The teriyaki chicken was also pretty dry. The beef was good, but nothing to rave about, and the pork was also decent. The best part about the meal was the rice, and teriyaki sauce.... All in all, please don't let this be your only reference to what Hawaiian food is supposed to be like:/

The service here was terrible at best.  I stood at the hostess station with two other parties for almost 10 minutes before one of the other parites got impatient and went to find someone.  Once seated it took almost 20 minutes to place my order (lemon garlic wings and a corned beef sandwich).  The wings came out about 15 minutes after that and has no seasoning what so ever.  I would have sent them back but I didn't see my server for another 15 minutes.  Then my sandwich took and additional 15 minutes to come out.  The wings were good but I am sure they would have been amazing with some flavor.  The corned beef was really good but the portion was small and it came with a really small side of chips.  I had to go to the kitchen to find my server and get my bill.  He apologized for everything taking so long and offered a couple of beers on the house but I just wanted to get out of there at that point.  I would skip this place all together.

We picked up dinner for Our Aunt and Uncle for their Wedding Anniversary. On 08/18/2014 when we pulled out his trying to find a parking spot it was a lady standing outside smoking a cigarette she came in and squeeze some hand sanitize on her hand then she came in it was another man behind the counter short one at all which I don't know who neither of them was the shift manager and I'm not for sure then the lady proceeded to take our order so I asked her about the Groupon that we have purchased she didn't know what I was talking about so I had to explain it to her and the prices have went up so we paid the actual group plan was was you buy a Groupon for $15 and get $30 worth and she proceeded to tell me that you get a slab of ribs a whole chicken or 21 4 pieces of cornbread and to side but when we looked at the price is it went up we wander paying $10 and some adsense my husband came in said the chicken wings looked dried out but before I can look at him the guy had already wrapped them up so we proceeded to give her the coupons and went home to try to have a good meal and we are all our platters and the chicken wings was dried out leg day was a day or two hole the collard greens was good but they was not chopped up the whole chicken was okay but they chopped it in for pieces and it was a little dry too and the ribs was the best thing but they could have stayed in the smoke up a little longer cuz some of them was a little pink and the corn bread was cold and hard like the had it in the freezer it tastes a little like if it was a marble cake but cornbread and they did not put no seasoning on the ribs no BBQ sauce on the ribs they gave us for little cups of barbecue sauce and the other players had nothing so we was eating dry ribs. This is bothering me about the chicken wings because I had told my aunt about this place at because my uncle loves ribs but I'm fortunately it wasn't a great place to celebrate we shoulda went to a sit down restaurant but everybody had just got off of work we just wanted to grab something and go home and celebrate but I will think the next time and hopefully I won't be back there to get no chicken wings if I go back it would just be for the ribs only ribs they cook them the day early and then wrap them in for you and no telling how long the food really was sitting there it could have been sitting from yesterday if they didn't sell out. And on 8 21 2014 I called the restaurant and spoke to the same lady did not wash her hands and to let her know about the Wingdings was very dry and all she said was is nothing she can do about it she will head the tub chill pass it on to the manager but again is nothing she can do about it and then put the wings in a rotisserie and also informed her that yes I know but those wings should have not been dry out and she did not take my name no number to the manager and call me back  they need good customer service or the business would crumble. And I did eat there before but better.

Good burger. Didnt care for shoestring fries. Nothing to rave about.

Street parking by meter.

Meh.

Just not impressed in the least bit.  I have dined at this restaurant twice in hopes for a better experience.  It just didn't happen.  The two for one margaritas  (which are brought out at the same time) taste like lime flavored tang.  Yuck!  They do offer a lunch buffet which seems to have decent offerings for $9.99. My daughter had a soft taco off of the kids menu which was $5.99.  Upon receiving the check, I noticed she was charged $2.49 for her drink which is ok, I'm just use to most restaurants offering free kids drinks.  But what really got me was the additional .50 that was added because she had a soft taco..are you serious?  Additional charge for a flour tortilla.  The salsa tastes like tomato sauce, the taco meat isn't flavored well, the hard shell taco was over done just overall not good. 

It's just a highly priced version on Mexican food that just isn't that good.

I am a local college student who has lived off the halal food trucks for the past couple years. I also visited NYC to try out the original Halal Guys. So coming here, I didn't know what to expect. However, the high reviews and long lines at the grand opening surely heightened my expectations.

Pros:
1. The location is in Chinatown. Accessible and around a lot of surrounding places/dessert areas.

2. Tremendous customer service. Quick, friendly, and attentive to give you extra sauce throughout your meal if you're eating there. Everyone is always smiling.

3. Healthier than food truck. You can tell that the meat is better quality, the veggies are fresh cut, and the sauce portions are not as extreme. (But I must say, the sauce is what defines the taste. I always get extra sauce...and then extra extra sauce!)

Cons:
1. The quality is actually just pretty hyped up. The meat tastes a bit dry and they give way too much rice for my liking. The rice doesn't have much taste which ends up making me want to drown it in more sauce. In the end, I'm just eating straight up white sauce and rice. 

2. The seating here is sparse. There's 3 small tables outside which is really underprepared in my opinion. If you know that this is going to be a busy chain in such a populated area, why only have 3 tables? There's a high chance you'll stand eating or stay on-guard for a free table for the entity of your meal. I understand that China Square is still not open entirely and the space is tiny (there may be a chance they want to imitate the grab-n-go mentality of the original food truck), but still. 

3. The price. For a small bowl ($7.99) or a large bowl ($8.99), you get healthy halal, but it just goes back to my con #1. Tiny meat and veggie portions, and just heaps of rice and sauce. It doesn't even come with a drink! So you end up paying $2 more for a fountain soda. 

All in all, I personally prefer food truck halal. It's cheaper (considering the portion size and the drink included). It tastes better because the sauce-meat-veggie-rice portion is balanced out. I find myself drizzling more and more sauce every time I come to his Halal Guys location! The calories! The overkill on rice just ruins it all. Although it's unhealthier because of the grease, it fills me up and I stay under a budget. 

Lastly, I don't know if this is still an issue, but I couldn't order a drink when I tried to order from this location on UberEATS. They said they didn't have bottled drinks, but they could've just given me a fountain in a to-go cup like most places would do.

This was my first time experiencing this place and I'm surprised I waited so long since Forest Gump is one of my favorite movies of all time.

I went with my sister on a Sunday afternoon after we spent some time shopping on John's. 
 
We were seated right away, but as we walked to our booth I noticed all the fun stuff on the walls. 

We shared the artichoke shrimp dip and it was amazing. I'm usually skeptical about mixing shrimp with a cream based dish, but it was a pleasant surprise. Next I had the "Trash" bucket, which included fried fish, shrimp, fries, and crab legs. That was no disappointment. The batter used was light and seasoned with great flavors.

One of my favorite parts of the experience was the trivia questions that our server went over with us. I also like the signs we used if we needed assistance, it was a great alternative to trying to flag someone down. 

I recommend this place!

Lunch rush visit on a Friday afternoon...

They cook the food fresh and depending on the time of day you'll have to wait so plan accordingly because I did not.

I went to the mall with several co-workers and they all got their food from a different vendor. They had their food quick whereas I stood waiting in line. I only ordered vegetable soba and I didn't get why it took so long and I really still don't. By the time I sat with my friends it was time to head back to work. I didn't order chicken, but still waited in line waiting for it to be cooked because they had two men doing chicken and one man doing rice. 

My food was hot and fresh, but not really worth the wait.

I didn't plan on going to First Watch at first, in fact at first sight I thought it was some sort of medical facility/business, but my sister corrected me and insisted we go there for breakfast.

It was a Saturday morning so naturally it was busy, however the wait was only approximately 10 minutes. We opted to sit at the community table because there was only three of us, which means we sat down right away.

The atmosphere was pleasant and the décor was bright and clean.

I ordered a coffee and the Casa Frittata (eggs, feta, spinach, tomato, and sausage). It came with an English muffin and home fries. The coffee was hot and good. The creamer options were nice because you could choose from plain or various flavored singles. The food didn't take long and when it came out everything was still hot, not just warm. The Casa Frittata was yummy and the home fries were just right, not too greasy. The English muffin was average and came with just enough butter. 

Our server was very attentive and nice.

Overall, I was happy with my experience and will return.

A family member often ate at this Cody's, so when I went out with a friend and we were in the area we decided... hey, why not?  Now, it was pretty busy on a Wednesday night with a 10-15 minute wait.  Not a big deal.  There was a special on fajitas being two for the price of one.  It sounded good, so my pal and myself were curious to see how everything was.  Our server was very nice but clearly a bit harried, and was kind enough when we mentioned being interested in beer to tell us that if we ordered RIGHT THEN, we could take advantage of the happy hour.  We appreciated that, placed our order of steak and shrimp fajitas along with an order of cheesy shrimp appetizer and waited.

She came by first to let us know that they were busy, but that the cheesy shrimp should be up soon.  Then, after over 20 minutes she swung by and told us that unfortunately our appetizer order had been placed, but picked up by a different server for another table and offered us a salad while we were waiting for the next order to be ready.  Not really what either of us wanted, but we wanted to be understanding.  Our server, still trying very hard to be nice (and it was appreciated) but still clearly busy came by already stirring up our salad with the dressing included.  Doled out a portion for both of us and was off like a shot.  I take a sniff and ask my pal, "... it's ranch dressing, isn't it?"  He confirmed, and I dumped my salad back into the bowl.  We weren't even asked what dressing to have, but ranch and blue cheese are pretty much the two I can't stand personally.

The cheesy shrimp finally comes out, and it's hot but tasty.  It used real butter, which was appreciated.  However, the serving plate is deceptive as it only really houses six medium sized shrimp in tiny indentions.  When we finished, our fajita plates came out.  My friend didn't have a SINGLE green pepper in his and only one slim sliver of red pepper.  I didn't have any red pepper at all, and I counted a whole of four small-ish sized shrimps in total.  Between us, we were only offered five taco sized tortillas.  Yes, I know we could've asked for more... but really, with how hectic everything was, our food might've gotten cold before they were brought out.  Everything was good enough, and the deal was a solid deal, but the steak of our fajitas were definitely on the chewy side.

At the end of it all, our server could tell that our experience wasn't the best, and had the manager comp our appetizer.  Which was appreciated... but there was enough going wrong through the experience that I can't give a good rating.  I'll probably give them another chance some time and hope this was simply a fluke on a busy night, but you have to wonder... this was a Wednesday night.  Did the business short staff itself to create this experience?  I'll have to come by at some other date and hope matters are better.

First it's a diner. Plain and simple - no gimmicks, no tricks, nothing fancy. Don't go in expecting it to be something other than a diner. 

There are 2 "U" shaped counters with bar stools around each counter and one "chef" aka short order cook with a flat top for each counter. The the staff moves down the center of the U taking orders.

The food is very good, but not exceptional. The staff is probably the strong point of this place. They are very good, comical, attentive, and make you feel like regulars. The prices are reasonable for the French Quarter.  The omelets are large, really one side of plate to other large, and nicely filled or topped with add ons. The sandwiches are good, about what you expect, but not spectacular. Burgers are a good size and fries are crispy.

There is a wait, but the line moves quick. I recommend it over other options for breakfast in the French Quarter. It is worth a try. the food is good, the portions are large, and if you don't like it, you haven't spent a fortune there.

A little bar inside of the hotel where I ended up meeting with people a few times.  Despite the number of times I ended up in the bar I never once had food or beverages.  It ended up serving as a rendezvous point for people in the conference and we would then go elsewhere.  Oh well... perhaps next time!

Not the best place for wings but when you don't wanna go to wing house, mugs n jugs is the next best place. Their naked wings are all right and the boneless buffalo wings are also pretty good. I've never had their other dishes so I can't speak for those.

Service is decent but can sometimes be pretty poor. 

The karaoke bar can be a curse and rarely a blessing. If you can handle constant loud noises and horrible and/or drunken singing then it shouldn't affect your visit here too bad.

Two locations. I have only visited the one in the Little Nugget. The little burger diner sits towards the back of the slot machine casino. Entrance is either through the alley or through the casino. Advice is avoid the alley for your safety. Bring cash as cash is easy to conduct transactions here. Food is well valued. Always open. 

Line can get busy but moves fairly quickly. Food orders are moved to patrons quickly. Staff here are typically friendly and helpful. The place looks like a hole in the wall and kept but food value and substance to sober is what patrons dine for here. 

We come here to order the awful awful for its name sake. Over sized burger with your typical fixings and more French fries then most single person can consume. All burgers are seasoned and cooked appropriately. 

The food offered here is not fancy but hits the spot before or after heavy drinking. Food is also good for those on a tight budget. Usually can't finish a good portion of the meal.

Overall one of the best burger values in town. Small location but definitely good at pushing out the food. Four stars. I keep coming back for more.
Enjoyed lunch here. Tomato basil soup, mandarin crunch salad and garlic pasta were tasty. The service was quick. Good place for grabbing quick lunch. Parking can be challenging, though.

Came here with a large group for a birthday brunch and it was a pretty good experience! First, I wanna comment on the atmosphere. This restaurant is clearly trying to set itself apart from others because this is the first time I've seen a DJ spinning at a brunch spot in nola. And I loved it! The place is fun and has a lot of seating for big groups so if that's what you're looking for I'd definitely check it out.
Next, the service. It... could be better. Our waitress was very attentive and helped us pick out food in the beginning but as other tables started to fill up I could feel our service getting slower and slower. But given that there were 11 people in my party and it was clearly a busy day for them, I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt. Overall it wasn't too bad!
Finally, the food. I wish I had pictures but our table ate everything too quickly. The meatballs and garlic bread were AMAZING. The pasta bolognese and the signore bianco were also super tasty. I didn't feel too strongly about the ricotta gnocchi or the bluecrab risotto, but I believe the risotto is one of their most popular dishes.
Overall, they get 4 stars for the slightly slow service and the fact that our dishes seemed to get less tasty as the courses progressed. But I will definitely be back!

I have gotten from spread 3 times. the first i picked it up and it was the best sandwich ever.  i then got it delivered and it was cold, bacon wasn't as perfectly made, the eggs were not super fluffy like before.  i then tried one more time and picked it up and it was good, not great like the first time, but good. i probably wont get it delivered again, but 2/3 times pretty good!

You get what you pay for and at their $11.99 dinner buffet you'll get indigestion (and worse). It's popular with students because it's cheap and all-you-can-eat. Plus they have great cocktails. But with excellent Indian restaurants just around the corner, you'd be wise to pass on this fast trip to the toilet.

Just no...

Stopped by while waiting for the wife to get off work. No cabernet, no merlot, and $9 for a glass of cheap pinot noir (I saw what they had on their shelves) when the bar literally 300 ft away according to Yelp has a happy hour going on.

Go across the street. At least they'll probably have what you want.

On a mid Saturday morning I had an urge for pancakes.  I hadn't been to IHOP for around a year so I thought I would give it a try.  The small parking lot that is shared with other stores, but I felt fortunate to find a space.  Something is going on with Brandon, as the traffic was horrendous getting there, so I was hoping there wasn't a line.  I lucked out as the restaurant was pretty full and a waiting list did form after I was seated.
 
My prior experiences at IHOP were fairly mediocre, but today I had not complaint.  Duane my server came over to take my drink order as soon as I sat, coffee, orange juice, and water.  I always ask for a glass of water as a back up plan, since I have had too many experiences at various restaurants sitting for ages waiting for my coffee,soft drink, or water to be refilled.  The drinks were delivered to the table in less than 3 minutes.
 
This morning I ordered off of the 55+ menu the 2x2x2, which in my case consisted of scrambled eggs, sausage links, and pancakes.  The order arrived very hot in about 5 minutes.  The scrambled eggs were done as I liked them, not over or under cooked.  The pancakes were done perfectly, light and fluffy.  You wouldn't think it would be hard to make pancakes, but I can't count the times at other restaurants where my pancake were burnt on one side (always the side facing down like they are hoping you won't notice).
 
In summary, the place was clean, crowded but not too noisy.  The service and food were above average for a restaurant chain.  In my mind 3 stars is very good for this type of establishment (I might give 5 stars for Sunday Brunch at Oystercatchers, but then again that's 6x the price).

Another one star review. What a surprise.

I don't know how many times we've been here, maybe about 6 or 7 times. 

Each and every time we've had shitty service and bad food. I don't think I've ever had fresh french fries there. Each and every time they've been soggy. If I had to hesitate a guess it would be that they scoop the fries that are getting older out of the bin into the containers and putting them aside before they dump the new batch in that then sits there until the old, packed containers go out, repeat. 

Same thing with the burgers. I'm not making it up, half the time I've been there I've had dry, stale burgers buns, twice to the point where they were inedible. I mean hard and stale. I don't know what's so difficult about pulling buns out of package, processing them, making burgers, and sending them across the chute. 

Then! To top it off, you can't order anything special order. It just gets messed up. "McDouble, no ketchup, no mustard, add lettuce." That's it. Never have they gotten that correct. 

Lastly, I go there normally around peak time. So it's not 1/2 before they close, it's not dead of the afternoon when they hardly have any drive-thrus going through. 

There's a reason for the lack of cars at the drive thru. There's a reason this location pretty much only gets one star from everybody.

Just pick another location.

Holy hell! What a place. I must have gotten Punked or Gagged or something. I don't even know where to start.

When you walk into the place you get full-on 80s vibe. From the (lack of)  decor to the carpet to the buckled and stained ceiling tiles. I was totally expecting to see CRT TV/VHS combos on the walls and was pleasantly surprised to see that they had upgraded to horrible picture quality flat screens. Bonus.

It was extremely apparent that the owners put $0 back into their business. Not to make it look better, not to upgrade it, not to clean the place up.

We came in on a whim because we'd passed this place many times and figured we'd give it a go. 

We found a booth and sat while we looked over the menu.

Y'all....everything was sticky. And by "everything" I mean *everything*. Menus, table, parmesan/chili flakes/salt shakers, everything. That place needs to shut down for a long weekend so they can power wash everything. They should just rent three power washers and go from ceiling down to the floor with everything piled in a big mound in the middle with a clorox bleach and water combination. 

When I went up to order the employee said nothing. I mean nothing. Just stood there with a pen and pad. So I ordered pan crust, bacon and mushroom, two drinks. I got an answer back of "is that all". I said it was, the order got rung up, and the nice young man just outstretched his hand for my card, not a peep out of him, and the transaction was completed. 

I took our two cups and got drinks from the fountain. Then sat down.

And waited.

The place was as loud as you'd imagine a small room to be with ten 8 year olds running around unattended. Another reviewer said it best, though she meant it as a compliment: "There is just enough background noise to drown out any racket your own child might be making." I shit you not, that is actually in a five star review.

While we waited we (honestly) sprayed down the entire table and all the shakers with hand sanitizing spray.

When the pan crust pizza came to the table we didn't know what to say. We just sat in awe at this sorry excuse of a pizza. It got worse.

Please, I beg you, look at the pictures. 

What they call "pan crust" is regular thin crust stretched up about 1/2 - 1" up the sides of the pan. The crust was thin, flabby, and barely browned. Again, look at the pictures, I'm not making this shit up. It gets worse.

The bacon was bacon bits. The mushrooms were jarred/canned mushrooms. 

I don't even know how to properly describe this thing.

The only redeeming factor with the entire pizza is that it was cut into about 26 slices. I know they do that because this "restaurant" is meant for patrons that are 8 years old and younger. So that's awesome.

THEN.....oh!...THEN as we were walking out leaving 3/4 of a pizza sitting on the table we got a glance of the "salad bar". Bahahahahahaha!! Again, see the pictures. It was so abysmal we both laughed as we walked out the door. 

If you are looking for a place to have a birthday "party" for your 6 year old and don't want to spend the money on chuck e cheese and want to give your guests of how it felt going out to a somewhat shitty family restaurant in the 80s then this is definitely the place for you.  

If you are looking to be ignore by employees and feel unappreciated this is the place for you.

If you are looking for extremely sub-par food at regular prices then this, also, is the place for you.

I don't....I just don't.

Don't go. Just don't go. It's not worth it. Do yourself a favour and opt to upgrade to McD drive thru and eat in the parking lot with folding tables and balloons.

Fall from grace! A royal flush for Queen Donuts.

Are they under new ownership? Didn't recognize the lady working there. What happened to the Asian couple?

I came here at 9:00 a.m. and they hardly had any in their case to sell. Donut holes, lots of glazed, two chocolate frosted, a smattering of a few things. All could fit on three trays. This is 9:00 a.m. and hardly any inventory? Shame. I was going to get a dozen to take home to the family. Change plans.

I got a glazed and a chocolate donut. I took a bite of the glazed. One bite. "What's going on here?" No fluffy texture like it used to be. Slightly doughy. Took a bite out of the chocolate frosted. Same thing. Took one more bite just to be sure. Ugh. Done. Drove to Donut King to save my palate. [That turned out to be a disappointment, too. The royalty falls.]

5* = A top favorite. Mind-blowing good. I will definitely return and I will go out of my way to go here. Worth every dime of my money.
4* = Outstanding. Tucson-top-tier. Some elements not quite as good as it gets, but it still is worthy of my regular business.
3* = Good experience. I might do repeat business if it is convenient, the only option, the only one in its category, or on a whim, but would not be among the first thing to come to mind. Would definitely recommend you trying it to get your own take on it.
2* = Not so good. Would not recommend at all. Waste of money.
1* = How are they still in business? Stay away at all costs!
Yum!  Tried this place for the first time today and sooo good. Very fresh and flavorable. Will definitely go back.

I've heard great things and I wasn't disappointed. The pizza here is tasty, convenient and all at a great price. You can walk in and grab a slice and a breadstick straight from the counter or you can order your own personal pie. 

My sister and I each grabbed a slice and split a breadstick. The breadsticks are HUGE and come with your choice of one sauce. I tried the bacon and chicken pizza and it was very good. 

I only have two complaints:

1. I wish they offered gluten free. 
2. I wish they had at least two different pizzas with a white sauce, pesto sauce or something other than the regular tomato.

Regardless, I'll be back.

This is a welcome addition to the neighborhood! Beautiful space with lots of gluten free options. With it being a farm to table restaurant I see so many possibilities. 

My friend and I tried the loaded smashed potatoes, guac and chips and chicken bites.

The chicken bites were my favorite! I LOVED the sriracha aioli but I didn't care for the ranch at all. It tasted too herby for my liking.

The potatoes were very well cooked and good but I was wishing for either melted creamy cheese or more cheese on them.

The guac and chips I could have done without. We wanted the chorizo dates but they were all out, so we settled for the guac. I thought it was very bland but the chips were good. 

I'm ready to go back for a burger or another sandwich soon. Everything looked very tasty!

Maybe I'm cranky because I dumped what was not their finest cup of coffee (when I poured it down the drain, my office kitchen was filled with the smell of cat pee. Wtf?), or because today was the first day I went in since they increased prices, but back when their coffee was $1.00, I'd have given them 4 stars.  Half the time it was kind of burnt, but you could tell it came from quality stock and was the cheapest decent cup around.  I went in today and they raised their price to $1.50.  Think about that.  A 50% increase in price with an increase in neither quality nor quantity.  So now, for approximately 30 cents more, I can go just about anywhere and get a much better cup of coffee.  I highly doubt I'll be going here again.

What a difference a half dollar makes...
This place was just ok. Nothing spectacular like expected. The prices are very high for what you get. Service is slow.

This place is satisfactory a little on the pricey side. I have ordered both sit down and take out a few times and have yet to be wowed. Why did I keep come back ...I really wanted to love this place.  I have ordered the steamed dumplings and spring rolls for appetizers.
The spring rolls fall apart are served very cold and we're pretty tasteless. The steamed dumplings were also pretty bland. Any sauce is extra$$. And the serving of sauce is equal to 1/2 a shot glass. I've had several of the specialty rolls. The Rolls are OK. I have never gotten a roll that other reviewers say are amazing again just satisfactory. The service is ok and the place seems clean and tightly managed.

Major disappointment.  Our first getaway since the pandemic.  Didn't want to travel too far so took the drive from the Bay Area for 5 night stay in one of the luxury suites.  Got in yesterday and was really looking forward to dinner here.  First off it took about 10 minutes after we were seated for someone to come take our drink order.  Hubby has a shellfish allergy so couldn't really order any appetizers.  But we did order the bone marrow.  It was basically tasteless.  Only finished half of one bone.  Our Waiter wasn't aware that there were two different 22 oz bone-in ribeyes on the menu.  I had to get the menu back and show him.  I asked for mine to be cooked between medium & medium well (Ruth Chris calls it medium plus).  The waiter had a hard time with it...  It ended up coming out more like medium rare.  No pink at all it was pure red.  They took it back to cook it more and what a disaster.  It was overlooked.  All brown.  More like well done.  Very dry and no seasoning whatsoever.  I only ate a few bites.  My scalloped potatoes were dry and not good.  After we were done our waiter came by and said he would bring our check.  Did not even ask us if we wanted dessert.  That is a first.  Never ever would I visit this place again.  We are here a few more nights and have reservations for the Italian restaurant but I will be cancelling.

Fun place to eat but we definitely won't expecting it to be so pricey. We love about 30 minutes away and saw this place being built. We planned to check it out but didn't do our homework beforehand. We pulled up to the parking lot full of very expensive cars. All we could afford was a drink each and sandwiches. Luckily they offer sandwiches on the menu. They had some really fun drinks we enjoyed. I guess next time we need to save up some money. It was really nice inside.

I really want to love this place, but there is a huge lack of service. I've been to the restaurant 3 times. The first time was their soft opening. I got the usual service of a new restaurant. Slow moving kitchen, overwhelmed  servers, and a bartender getting to know their bar. The food was well prepared and tasted great. The second time we stopped by for dinner on a Sunday evening. We did not have a reservation and walked in. There were a few tables open with dirty dishes on them, but the rest of the place was full. We were finally acknowledged and seated by the windows after 10 minutes. Unfortunately we were ignored for 15 minutes after that. The table next to us was talking about how long they had been there. We chatted for a bit and found out that they were going up to the bar to order drinks for the lack of service. At this point we opted to leave and get dinner elsewhere. The third visit was for happy hour. It is not the best deal in town, but they do have a couple of good things included on the happy hour specials. The bartender was chatty and a good time, but you could see the frustration with the lack of ingredients he had on hand. Fortunately we stuck to wine by the glass. The hot food at this visit was really tasty, but the same could not be said for the raw bar. We were served 12 oysters without the brine, 3 shells were completely broken, and 3 were served on the top shells. Sitting at the bar, I got a view of the guy preparing the oysters for other tables, carelessly pouring the brine out of the shell while struggling to open them. 

Like I said earlier, I really want to love this place, but they make it really hard to do so. They really need to get their act together and hire the right person to make this place what it can be. Their menu is well put together and they offer some good combinations.

Had a drink and sat about 6 feet from a great jazz band.  This is what New Orleans is all about!  Small place and limited beers, but a very enjoyable bar to hang out with some music. 

Fritzel's was our highlight on a mostly dingy Bourbon Street.

We stopped in here for brunch before the Philly Auto Show. They have some interesting offering on their menu, such as short rib eggs Benedict or cookie dough French Toast if you have a sweet tooth. A couple of poached eggs and a side of meat later, the portions were big and filling for brunch. Atmosphere was open and busy, service was good. 

Brunch was very good, however one of my poached eggs was a bit overdone, so I have to ding them for that.

Bobacup is getting a bit slagging today. A few week ago I find out after 9 pm they don't cook the Hong Kong waffle and we turn away. Last night they completely remove from the menu. Don't understand it. Their reply is not popular item. 

Now they serve crepes with fruit and whip cream. I have order the one with strawberry and banana. Not my liking. When they roll the crepe and try to pack in the fruit in cone shape. It doesn't work. I would rather they lay it flat fold three folds with the fruit inside. It turn out they give out their best product and go to somethings they are not good at. 

Although the boba menu is still there, but the service with no smile, and the quality is not there. A drop of star from my previous review. I wonder some time what define their identity.

A lot people visited this place after church. This restaurant seem like a popular place for after church gatherings. One thing notice these restaurants mainly white people. So you know their food is American taco.  However they have the way to attract these type of customers. 

I like some of the Taco but my wife love the cracked corn. I got the chimichuri steak taco and my wife got the blacken fish taco. The steak taco may need to be improved but the fish taco is very good. The cracked corn is top with spice and cheese that make this corn very desirable. 

I would said this is Baja type taco place. It has it specialty. I like the interior design to show the beach look. You may choose one of the flint stone car booth to eat you taco. It is almost like movie.

I like this restaurant because they are most affordable in the area. The price is reasonable with amount of food they have provided on each dish. Basically the amount is good mother and a child or two older person. For young adult is plenty. You will not go hungry after visit. 

The downside of the restaurant is every thing take too long. It take more 10 minutes after they drop the menu and come to take your order. Often they forget to bring what you need for additional things. The service did take a back seat in this restaurant. It is not they don't have enough help, it just the mentally slow in this restaurant. 

I got the sautéed palomilla with Mofongo. The first taste is great when dig the outside of mofongo. After you get to the outer layer, it lost the best taste. The palomilla I prefer it to be grilled instead of sautéed. However, they don't have this option.

If need home cooking, this is your place. The restaurant chef prepare the meal from beginning. A lot of work. The dish that I have need a lot of time to prepare. I have the OX tail that was cook for long time to make it soft. It cook in the Caribbean spice and has a lot of Indian influence. The tail must be slow cook to make it separate from the bone. This dish accompanied with cabbage and the bean rice. You can have the choice of white rice. 

I also have the flower drink - Sorrel. They prepared it and put in the cup and store in their refrigerators. Sweet treat. They have some other food please check it out. They also have fried fish. You can call ahead to have your fish prepare before you arrive. It will take some time to fried. The owner of the restaurant is very friendly. I like about this mom and pop shop.

The Domina's pizza is actually located inside the gas station. I am not much a pizza lover, but if I have to chose the pizza chain domina is my choice. I like old thick crust pizza, I am not a fan of tin crust. If you have to pig out, please go all out with no reservation. At that point you have blown the calories count any how. 

Tonight they have the $5 two topping deal large pizza. It is enough for me and my wife. We have order the pepperoni and bacon. I call in 10 minutes before my pickup and they are ready on time. The two topping deal only on the carry out. Please make a trip to nearby pizza place. The total come to $6. Great value. 

They lay the pepperoni then the bacon on top. The pepperoni is great and crispy. With bacon on top the juice of bacon further cook the pepperoni to give extra crispy. The bacon is great in this sense. Everything go well with bacon. 

Please catch the deal while they last.

I has been want to try this chain for some time. This is Greek and seafood place. I was in hurry and saw them on the street. I have checked them out on the Yelp and feel it is good for a try. 

The food order is delivered at average wait time since I ask my fish to be grilled. I have order seafood platter special. It come with choice fried or grilled on shrimp and fish. I have selected the fish grilled and fried shrimp. It come with French fries. The fish is not open flame grilled, it is cook over the hot plate. It does have good flavor. The fried shrimps have spice in the coating. It is pleasant to eat. Although they are not as seafood market fresh, but they are good enough. 

The platter come with drink for $10.99. Average deal. It is quick and easy to dine in the restaurant.

I have been eating their food very often. However, I have never review them. Our company lunch meeting often order from this place. Some time is good and some time is off. This is about 3.5 star restaurant in my book. 

Today I have the calamari and Tazza Istanbul Shrimp. I have order the appetizer of the calamari is for me to chew while keep me awake during the lunch seminar. It is working. Although it is not the best fried calamari, but it didn't cost that much either. The Tazza Istanbul Shrimp have a good Turkish sauce to go with it. It accompanied well within the rice. The shrimp size is about 36 count per pound. It is not the big size. Food is ok. 

They offer very complete menu and many choices. Start with appetizer, salad, soup, sandwich, wrap, seafood, platter, burger, and their specialty.

My revisit was satisfied. They were running the $8.99 deal during the weekday 3 to 5 pm. I got the chicken piccata. The chicken is grilled. The sauce has piccata and lemon base. It is delicious. It come with slide zucchini top with bread crumbs. 

Even thought the price is reduced, the service is top notch. The food also is great quality. They did not reduce the quality since the price of the dish was cut more than 40%. I have to tip my hat to the restaurant for such good quality.

Please have someone on the phones whose knows the menu and is capable of making orders over the phone fast and efficient. Everytime my office orders from here I give the place a chance but I get violently sick a couple hours after consuming their foods. The cakes are full of butter, the fruit salads are nasty with molded pieces of fruit, the seafood is suspect because it smells old and their soups are gross. Nothing but the bagged breadsticks are consumable and sure to not make you sick. I'd NEVER recommend this place!
Worst Chinese food I have ever had. Service was horrible and the food was not eatable at all. We had to leave it all and we all felt sick.

Spoke to owner Ben. He came to the phone and we talked. I applaud that. We agreed to disagree. Might even return. 

Challenging review to write.  have driven by for years, wanted so much to really like this place.  Good food, mediocre service and a very strange and defensive response from message to owner.

Went their with much anticipation for a business dinner.  Started with the 1/2 pound crab cake.  Good to very good.  $5 or $6 splitting charge, server did not know.  Are they kidding on a $14 appetizer?  Mentally both of us checked out after the whole big deal about the sharing charge.  And getting a second plate to do it ourselves took some asking.

Caesar salads, small but good.  Main courses well prepared and generous.  If I were to return found all kinds of interesting options to explore.

Got very weird again at the end, the server spent all kinds of time trying to get us to sign up for their email list and to download their app.  Told us all about the coupons and free stuff we would get.  We declined and then asked for seconds on the espresso.  They took our check back and revised it.  Again, their choice.  We did buy $70 bottle of wine, didn't seem to matter.

I sent a note to the owner, he defended everything to the end.  No worries, he has a successful restaurant and the right to do things his way.

Simple suggestion, make first-time visitors feel welcome and they will come back.  Neither of us will.

We had Sonny's on our dinner out rotation but after tonight we won't be back.  No more 2 for 1 drafts.  Fewer ribs on the special plates as well as the food being cold.  They were not busy so there was no reason for cold food and slow service.  Manager blamed corporate and we hope corporate sees this review.

How can this location differ so much from the location in South Reno?  We stopped in for a late breakfast on a Friday.  I didn't think they would be too busy, but I was wrong on that account.  This place was slammed!  We were seated in the back by the bathrooms (see Paul S.'s review from 2012 to see how awesome that was).  This area is really too small to have that many tables in it.  I understand they are busy and trying to cram as many people as possible, but I was stacking items on our table to have enough room for my plate.  

Jason ordered the chicken fried steak and I had their California Benedict.  Jason was fairly happy with his meal, although the coffee was really watered down. I've had the California Benedict at the South Reno location, but here it just wasn't good at all.  The toast was burnt to a crisp which made it impossible to cut without a steak knife.  The eggs were cooked perfectly but the avocado was really old and brown and the benedict sauce itself tasted old.  

In the future, I'll stick to the location in South Reno.

I love Yats but was really disappointed in the last time I was there. Ordered two to go dishes and literally all rice glazed with drunken chicken (by glazed I mean barely enough for dipping). Next time will order rice on the side to make sure I get the moneys worth. 

Will say - bread was amazing per usual.

3 stars for a solid omelet and pancakes. The Wheel Cafe is very cute and I was looking forward to trying a new breakfast spot. The interior was comfortable and the open kitchen with the bar was nice. Their menu is standard breakfast fare with a couple of specialty items like the Elvis waffle and Dutch baby offerings. I will be coming back for one of those Dutch babies! Their coffee is sourced from Ethos and was great. 

We ordered a stack of pancakes and a vegetarian omelet with hash browns. To be honest, it was just an a-ok breakfast. The portions were decent and food was delivered in a timely manner, but it was just ok. To be fair, I like things flavorful so I would have loved some additional spice on the hash browns, but I know that's not everybody's thing. I ordered some of their homemade hot sauce to spice things up, and it was ok. 

Service was very friendly and nice and I love to support local businesses, so we'll be back for breakfast one of these days. Maybe their rotating specials board can bring in some exciting new offerings, but I'd love to see them use some more supplies from local businesses and maybe upgrade their bread offerings. 20 Shekels bread with my a Wheel Cafe omelet would be a match made in heaven!

Service was friendly-ordered the fried pickles which were mediocre-the asparagus and oyster soup and a burger...the soup had an odd flavor-very unique-the burger that I ordered medium came out well done...but the part that was bad was within 20 minutes of eating I was overcome with a belly ache and so were the other two people with me:( so something was definitely bad! The location is great the people are nice but the food fell flat.

Times change, and Raw has lost that fantastic glitz it had when it first opened. Yes, the samurai in the lavatory is still the coolest thing we've seen in a public bathroom, and the flat granite slab that serves as a co-ed sink is someday going to grace our home, but ambience isn't what we come for, we come for food.

The hot kitchen has suffered recently and that's been reflected in a menu that has dropped to a quarter the size it once was. The short lived tempura menu is no longer offered, a shame as the tempura was some of the best we'd tasted. 

The Sake menu has also started to suffer due to supplier issues, with some of our favorite sake's no longer available. There are still some great offerings (try the black bottle) but it's always a disappointment when your old 'standards' go by the wayside.

Luckily, there's Chef Sam.

Chef Sam will be the only reason this place pulls through from the gutting of the hot menu. His skill with sushi is amazing and on this visit we tried his interpretation of Beef Negemaki, which was delicious. The bartender that evening, Chris (one of our favorites so tip him well) suggested it be served with a small portion of rice and I agree, it would be perfect with the delicious sauce.

Sam's sushi is always delicious. Check with him to see what he's brought in fresh the day you go. White Tiger is delicious though a tad spicy for me, but Sam is always happy to cut back on the spice when requested to.

If Sam's not there on the night you go, we suggest you come back another day.

We'll be trying this place every so often to see what happens as Sam takes the reigns of the hot kitchen and the place gets it's feet back.

The bell hasn't tolled for Raw yet, but the hunchback and his hammer have started climbing the steps.

Dutch Eating Place is a Reading Terminal tradition, almost as much so as DiNic's or Beiler's. With delicious breakfasts at some of the best prices, it's definitely worth a visit! While the line may be intimidating, it moves quickly. My go to is the apple dumpling: like a hot mini apple pie/fritter hybrid topped with whipped cream. Their blueberry pancake special (2 gigantic pancakes with two slices of turkey bacon and a cup of coffee) is also a great deal! The staff is so friendly and even held two seats for my friends during peak brunch hour on a Saturday! The service is so quick too! Check it out the next time you're in the area!

Cheu Noodle Bar is like a dive bar crossed with a ramen joint. It's dimly lit, and they serve unique cocktails, plus they have plenty of finger food. Their menu changes throughout the year, so come often to experience it all. I went with my boyfriend on a Monday night, and it was still completely packed. We were able to be seated right away, but our seats were at the bar. 

My boyfriend and I both have allergies (me to peanuts, him to both peanuts and shrimp), so we're pretty careful when we go out to eat and read the menu thoroughly. After we both ordered the brisket ramen, our server was chatting with us about a customer who had an allergic reaction after eating the brisket ramen because of the shrimp it contains. We were obviously alarmed because nowhere on the menu was it listed that there was shrimp in the brisket ramen. Luckily, we were able to change my boyfriend's order before he ate it. I just thought it was strange because shrimp is such a common allergen, and this has obviously happened numerous times, so you would think that they would attempt to make a change. 

The rest of our meal was pretty good. I liked the fusion aspect of my brisket ramen, and my boyfriend enjoyed his miso ramen. Not sure if Cheu really lives up to the hype, but it was a decent meal nonetheless.

Bluestone Lane is beautiful coffeeshop in the Rittenhouse Square neighborhood. The decor is bright and airy, with plenty of sunlight. The set up is a little awkward; there's some counter seating, but there's a queue to be seated by the staff when you enter the shop. It's not usually too crowded, and there's always seating available, even if it takes a while... But given the set-up, which is somewhere between casual cafe and sit-down eatery, it's not somewhere I would feel comfortable setting up shop to do work for the afternoon. Their drinks and pastries are on the more expensive side in comparison to the other cafes in the area. I recommend the pressed juices; not too sweet but still flavorful!

Had been wanting to try this place and after a conversation at a NYE party with someone who raved about it, we decided to give it a go.  Sadly, it didn't live up to the hype.

First impression was good.  The place was welcoming and had good ambiance.  We were seated quickly and the hostess was friendly.  Few minutes later hostess comes back as our waitress.  I noticed some cocktails were $9 and some were $24.  To me that either means some are sharable fishbowls or some are top shelf.  I asked the waitress what sizes the cocktails come in and she just stared at me.  So I clarified, asking in terms of ounces.  More awkward staring and she finally said she didn't know.  Ok.  No offer to walk 10 feet over to the bar and find out.  Cool.  I guess I'll be surprised when I order this Margarita... Got the perfect margarita and boyfriend got some pineapple thing.  Mine was strong but not great.  I wasn't a fan of his, but whatever.  Not my drink.  

We got the build your own guac and the red snapper ceviche as starters.  The guac was perfect.  Seriously great.  That's about it.  The ceviche was plated well and visually appealing, but that's it.  I took one bite and said "nope".  Boyfriend finished it because he was starving but didn't love it.  It was a bit overpriced, and tasted more like a seafood salad than a ceviche.  It really missed the light fresh flavors that are meant to come with citrus and onion and just felt heavy and overly fishy.  Not how I prefer ceviche, which is something we eat once every few weeks.  (I will point out that we didn't complain and it was gone when she collected the plates, so she likely had no idea we weren't satisfied and if you don't speak up, they can't fix it, so that's on us) 

I was going to order the fish tacos but learned they were out.  Was thinking about the lamb but they were out of that too.  After that I felt pressured to order so I just got a salad thinking it would be pretty hard to screw up.  Wrong again.  It looked like it would have been great if it had a different dressing and base.  The toppings (tomato, radish) were fresh and looked good but the spinach/lettuce was a bowl of wilted soggy slop.  I really wasn't a fan of the dressing; probably should have gotten it on the side.  Tried my boyfriends' spicy tacos.  Got no spice (and I'm a weenie when it comes to spices usually).  Ordered a different cocktail, something with jalepeno.  It was just ok.  Not bad but not great.  

I felt like there was a lot of time where we were just sitting & waiting for her to come back.  They weren't terribly busy but I think she was the only server; didn't see anyone else. At nearly $100 for 2 of us I don't think we'll be back.

We came in for dinner for the first time and were very disappointed. Our meal started off on the wrong foot when I was poured a flat beer (Sapporo) from the tap. The server did fix things by bringing me a can which was fine.

Then things got worse with our Deluxe sashimi order. The octopus we were served looked unappetizing with a brown colour which I have never seen before. The server again fixed things by switching out the octopus for another fish (salmon). However it's disappointing that the sushi chef served the octopus in the first place. The rest of the fish was quite disappointing in quality (freshness) and generally poorly cut. The next day I did not feel great in the morning as a result of this meal and I do not see myself coming back again. One would expect higher standards especially for the prices being charged. 

There are far better Japanese restaurants in Edmonton who are charging similar prices with far better standards and quality.

Not sure what the hype is about this place. I've tried it numerous times just to be sure and each time I leave feeling disappointed and ripped off.  I am not a fan of over priced food just because the atmosphere tells you it should be over priced.   We've tried just about everything on the menu between my eating partners.  The seafood bouillabaise is the most disappointing as I love that dish and you can't normally go wrong. Either you know how to make it or you don't.  They don't! The steaks have always been cooked wrong and nothing is superb, not even the service. They are very slow. Messed up a few people's order 1 of the times.  If I am going to pay what they charge...I expect to either have fabulous service, fabulous food, or preferably BOTH.  I get neither here :(    I can see if you are going to dinner and corporate pays but I would not pay with my own money to come there and eat.

Food was tasty but the service wasn't good. 
We ordered edamame, chicken dumplings & pork dumplings. We wanted to try the pork buns but they were out. 
As an entree, I had the spicy katsu ramen bowl with extra noodles (tip from a friend who's been there a few times). 
Everything was really tasty, the katsu stayed crisp while in the ramen. The appetizers were all good as well, nothing out of the ordinary- what you would expect from edamame & dumplings. 
The service was really slow & we were 1 of 3 tables. The waitress also gave us the wrong check at the end of the night. 
The decor is random & feels like you're eating inside an IKEA display.

Really enjoyed lunch here this afternoon. Went over there on a whim and we were pleasantly surprised. 
Service: Our waitress was very nice and helpful. She gave us suggestions based upon her favorites and helped pick out wines that would pair well with our choices. 
Food: We decided on the gnocchi, brussel sprouts &"the Joey" pizza. Everything was delicious. 
We finished our meal by splitting the tiramisu, so decadent but a nice treat. I don't think I could have finished it on my own.

This is a Downtown Nashville area staple. It's snazzy as hell and whenever my business partner and I would close a deal, we'd come down to this place and get a steak and some wine to celebrate. They've got Southern food but I'd say it's overall America reimagined. Their duck fat tater tots are not to be missed. The space is quite large, but there is usually a wait there for dinner, so don't expect to be seated straight away.

I heard what the car ahead of me ordered and it damn sure wasn't the 4 bags of food that came out the window. Wonder how much the employees are giving free to their friends? My food was cold and my order was only about half there...or maybe you only get 8 fries with a medium order and the red beans and rice only comes half full with the medium order. Will never go back to this location again. It's worth the extra drive to go to the next location for sure. That or get a friend working in there so I can get 3-4 times as much as I actually pay for.

I was carded ( I'm 29, I just have killer genes and a baby face) for easily the worst margarita ever. Okay maybe the one at marathon on the square was worse.

I started adding ice water, splenda, limes from the table, and salt to try to make it drinkable. I should have sent it back, but our waiter did not come back to the table until our entrees arrived.

I've never been to the actual restaurant, but I have had delicious delivery.

yes they deliver all the way to my hood ( rittenhouse area) which is amazing.

it's pricey but fresh!

the roasted vegetables are awesome

If you are in Apollo Beach, Latitudes is a must attend location if you want to meet your neighbors ...as it is a "locals hangout". Conveniently located along StRd 41 in the Winn Dixie shopping plaza. 

From a drink perspective, the bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly. The same hold true for the wait staff although there is never enough staff and getting prompt service is a challenge! From a menu, while there is a small variety, and the food is average but not spectacular. Weekends have live music, but small in delivery meaning there isn't much room for the performers and inside can get quite cramped...and super loud. Overall, I'd consider it ok, but not my first choice.

Some coworkers and I went here for a lunch meet up on a Friday afternoon. We made reservations. The atmosphere is very attractive-as are the two dining areas. I ordered a club sandwich with sweet potato fries. It was tasty. Our server was prompt and attentive to our rather large party of 10. Everyone was satisfied with their meal and we all appreciated that the server noted that gratuity had already been added to our bills. It's a nice touch because sometimes that happens and you don't notice and end up double tipping. Only slight negative was the wait we had. Will def be back though!

My mom, sister and I came here for brunch and all had omelettes with cinnamon toast. I would recommend the food, but I definitely felt it wasn't worth the price.  My sister asked for a Diet Coke, and it ended up being one can for $1.95. I ordered a coffee and only had one cup, but it was $2.95! We paid more than $50 for brunch for the 3 of us - I'd probably skip it next time.
What a nice breakfast! Ring Bologna as a meat option! Are you kidding me?!? I wish I thought of that! I'll be back often.

Had dinner here with my brother and mother for her birthday.  Shocking that it can be so inconsistent, although my first 2 reviews were based on happy hour only.  The cream of mushroom soup had tiny chopped bits of mushrooms, I expected larger pieces.  The flatbread tasted like cardboard.  I ordered the Mediterranean Shrimp.  The orzo and the vegetables were fantastic, but the shrimp itself was overcooked, chewy, and dry.  This should really be a 1 but the sevice was good so I'm bumping to a 2.  I was supposed to come here with a date, but I'll no longer be making that suggestion when there are so many other good places to go.  Bringing my mother here was my suggestion also.  Wow, I had 3 disappointing restaurant reviews in one weekend!!

I was impressed with the decor and ambience. The waiter was very friendly and highly knowledgeable of the menu. Then the food came. We ordered an appetizer made of a stew-like concoction of white beans, duck, pork, and sausage. The white bean cassoulet. It was very meaty. It also was not very flavorful and the meat was too chewy for me. 

We ordered two pizzas. One was the BLT made with jowl bacon and leeks. It was pretty good. The other was called be-bops made with pork belly and fennel. It was nearly tasteless and the pork belly was more like tough pulled pork. For dessert, we had gelato that tasted about like supermarket ice cream. For me the best part of the meal were the mixed olives they put out in place of bread. I can't recommend this restaurant though my son was more forgiving than I. But even he couldn't really brag about the food, only the service.

Tough review. This Kung Pao was the closest to the Kung Pao I'm used to in Boston (thus the best kung pao Ive had in NOLA) but it was SOOOOOO greasy. I'm talking a puddle of grease at the bottom of the plate.  The grease just separated from the sauce it was so much. (See pic). 

The grease made the food sit heavy.   I threw the leftovers away. 

I might try something else next time.

I love this place. It's one of my go to brunch spots - especially if I have a picky eater with me because you can create your own omelette. This time around I got the broken yolk sandwich. It's two fried eggs, avocados and cheese. I took off a slice of bread and ate it as an open faced sandwich. It was very delicious. The arugula salad is always a nice and fresh side as well. I've tried several items on the menu and it's all been very tasty. I love that the Patachou group as whole uses fresh and local ingredients. You can really taste it in the food. 

My only complaint with Patachou was their cappuccino (taste and price) and the price of a croissant. Maybe I'm just acting spoiled since I just got back from a month in Europe where the croissants were 1 euro and the cappuccino's were 2 euro... but $5 each is a bit pricey to me. Additionally, the cappuccino looked like it was made extremely quickly as it was half milk foam and it just didn't have a great flavor to it. Maybe that was just a one off incident though. 

Overall, I'll be back again and again! I love Cafe Patachou and all the other Patachou restaurants. Indy is lucky to have them!

My roommate and I both had coupons for free cherry limeades and came to this Sonic. There's no drive through so we ordered in a spot by pushing the red button. My roommate ordered two cherry limeades and the man on the other side told us the price and that they would be right out. My roommate quickly mentioned the coupons and we didn't get a reply so we waited. A girl came out with our drinks and we handed over the coupons and she said I don't mean to be rude but in the future try to mention these when you order and we said that we did mention them but we couldn't tell if he was still listening since we didn't get a response. Well she didn't even wait to here all of that, she started walking away after we told her we did mention them. Only after activating the BIGGEST eye roll I've ever seen and then proceeding to truly stomp off. Totally unacceptable customer service.

Just okay.  Not somewhere I'd be dying to go back to but would have no problem meeting a group there.  The attached hotel entrance is very nice.  Didn't eat just had a beer at the bar and it was a tad pricy.

Despite this being my first and only visit here, and a brief one at that, I had a great first impression.  The building itself is visually appealing on the outside.  It has a great mix of neighborhood bar and hip place to be feel about it.  The chicken quesadillas had a lot of meat in them and weren't drowning in cheese.  Great experience over all although I didn't stay long.  Enjoy.

My friend moved to the area (Wayne) and we wanted t try this Tapas/Mexican restaurant in her neighborhood. We came for dinner and decided to enjoy the beautiful day by eating outside. The staff was very nice, food tasty, but, for the price, the portions were very small. We thought salad would be too large for one of us and decided to share: We had the Verde: Salad Greens, Goat Cheese,Apple Crisp with Seville Orange Vinaigrette. When our server brought the salad, we thought it was half. We both ordered Tapas and know it's smaller plates...I ordered the Quesadilla with Chicken.It was very good, a little small. My friend ordered Chorizo Fundido.It has the sausage but too much cheese, she couldn't taste the chorizo.  We both left feeling like we could have more food.

We will come back and try the lunch menu.

My husband and I have been here several times both as a couple and with our teenage kids.  When the service and food are good, we have a great time.  When they are off, it's not a great experience. The ambiance is very relaxing and the decor is a dark wood with white linen tablecloths and nice heavy, large dishes, utensils and glasses.  I have a favorite dish: Pasta Fra Diavolo, spicy tomato cream sauce, campanile pasta with chicken.  The chopped starter salad is excellent with lots of veggies and a light italian vinaigrette dressing.  My husband enjoyed the filet mignon and mashed potatoes about a year ago, but when we returned recently, the filet was comparable to a hockey puck.  He asked for medium-well, but there was no pink.  The mashed potatoes were dry and clearly had been sitting around for some time.  He returned the dish to the kitchen and did not ask for a replacement.  The dish was removed from the check.  The manager gave us coupons for free appetizers next visit.  One more thing to know is that the cocktails are really good; however, my husband and I sat at the bar last night and saw that the way they "wash" glassware is less than hygienic.  Not sure if this is normal, but they dipped glasses into to different sinks containing solutions and then put them back into the inventory for use.  We stopped ordering drinks after than.  Looked like a cold sore waiting to happen.  Overall, if you're there on a good night, expect delicious pasta.

I was reading the other reviews trying to figure out how to put into words the squicky feeling I get about this place and Sarah L. put it perfectly:

"I think it's more like just a Chinese food version of Applebee's."  Exactly! 

'Nuff said.

January 17, 2015 Saturday - 8:30 am breakfast
2 adults 

Atmosphere - 5 stars
Food - 5 stars
Service - 5 stars

Background - Been here before during the UYE Breakfast Club.  Now it is time to try it again without a big group.

Atmosphere - Modern retro with a twist of industrialism.  Sounds like I just described a painting.

Food
  Drinks - Just water today.

  My Meal  
    Main Course - I had the apple cinnamon French toast combo plate.  Apples inside the bread made into French toast coated in cinnamon.  Perfect!  Two eggs over easy cooked perfectly and oozed its yummy goldenness all over my plate.  I had to steal a slice of toast from my wife to help mop it up.  Then I had one patty of Mark Estee's Reno Provision sausage, simply yummy.  I only wish it was bigger, but I knew it was before ordering.  I love how their plates are egg shaped.

Service - My wife's order was particular and out waitress was able to figure out what she want and make it happen.  So big kudos for handling my wife's special order and getting the kitchen to deliver the way my wife wanted it.  The only drawback was the service almost came to a stop as they were flooded with new customers. 

Future - Yeah!

June 8, 2011 Wednesday - purchased at dessert 1:15 PM, ate the cupcakes at 6:30 PM.
Just myself

Atmosphere - 3 stars
Food - 3 stars
Service - 4 stars

Background - I bought a deal via LivingSocial.  I looked up Mixed Cupcakes website since I had never been there before.  They looked good and the reviews on Yelp seemed fair.

Atmosphere - A small strip mall restaurant.  Place shares a store front with a sandwich shop.  I went after lunch to pick up dessert.  It was empty except the two workers.  Lights were off or extremely low with the lights.

Food
Appetizer - Wasn't here for that.

Main Course - Wasn't here for that, and did not see the menu board for the other place.  

Dessert - The Raspberry Beret was had a fresh raspberry on top.  There was very little raspberry jam filling, I could have used a lot more of it.  But the amount there did keep the cupcake moist.  The Gimme S'More cupcake itself was dry, nothing that special.  I loved the frosting which was a marshmallow butter cream, the texture was very much like a freshly melted marshmallow.  The graham cracker crumbs were lack too.  For $2.50 a cupcake I thought that was little much.  If I had the bottom of the Raspberry Berets and the top of the Gimme S'More I think that would have been perfect.  I did love the box that held them.

Service - I felt weird walking in.  It felt as if I was in the wrong place and did not belong there.  After I found the counter the lady was helpful.  I explained that I had a LivingSocial certificate and she recommend that I get four cupcakes as they are $2.50 a piece.  So I got two Raspberry Berets and two Gimme S'More.

August 25, 2012 Saturday - lunch 1:30 PM
2 adults 

Atmosphere - 5 stars
Food - 5 stars
Service - 5 stars

Background - Heading to down Virginia and needed lunch.

Atmosphere - An old house with lots of character.  I love all the art work on the walls that is for sale.  We sat next to a painting of a sad elephant balancing on ball that had a Shriners hat on. 

Food
  Appetizer - none.  

  Main Course - Order the steak baguette and we decided to split it as we saw other huge sandwich!  Oh my, this was good.  The steak was cook med rare and sliced to bite since pieces.  The bread had a nice crunch to it.  The salad was a great mix of different greens, some craisins and with what I think is Gorgonzola cheese.  The cheese did not have a bite like Blue cheese.

  Dessert - stuffed, and I split the sandwich with my wife.

Service - Friendly and funny

Future - If I am in the area again I will be back.

This place is quite in a central area and the parking area is quite tight. I absolutely love the crunchy roll over here as well as the truffle salmon sashimi as my most favorite dish here!!! If you love truffle, you must get this dish. I also had the pineapple chicken fried rice, which was quite okay since there wasn't much meat in it. I also had the gyoza which was pretty standard like other sushi places.

I'm leaving this review after my third attempt here at Philly Bagels. I've come on weekdays and weekends and it seems that the day of the week does not impact the fact that they are very slow. If you want to get a bagel here, your best bet is to order ahead over the phone. 

On this current visit, I ordered three breakfast sandwiches. After waiting 20 minutes (which I feel is a bit long) I went to the window to make sure they were working on my order. I had seen many people order after me and leave before me, so I was a bit frustrated. They told me they were still working on it. The reason I felt so inclined to ask is because the last time we were here, we waited 20 minutes for two breakfast sandwiches, and we were what seemed to be the only customers. When we approached the window to ask where our order was they told us they forgot it. Things happen, so we were understanding and came back.

While we stood outside waiting, we saw many customers confused about the ordering process. There is limited signage and it's very small.

After a full half hour, we finally got our order from a woman wearing a mask that didn't cover her nose. 

Bagels are good but not worth the aggravation. I'd rather make my own at home.

Ordered take out from here on Monday afternoon... I heard the calzones were good so I was excited. I ordered the Meat me in St. Louis which was tasty, but very, very cheesy - they do put quite generous portions of meat and cheese into these calzones and the calzones are giant, definitely enough food for 2 meals or to split with someone. I tried my friend's Duke calzone and really liked that one! I would like to try some of the veggie ones there next time. 

We tried to get delivery but there was a 1.5 hour wait for it... so try to avoid delivery at lunch time! We ended up picking up the food 30 minutes later.

Best Thai in Nashville, hands down. This place is awesome, don't get scared when you pull into the parking lot. Yes the restaurant is small and doesn't have a glamorous outside, but let me tell you, the food here is amazing! I can't count the number of times I've ordered or come in here to eat. 

My staple dishes: drunken noodles with shrimp, drunken fried rice with shrimp, egg rolls, pad Thai, and green curry. You just simply can't go wrong with any of these things! 

Ordering pick up - they are so quick to have your food ready, and everything is prepped inside ready for you to eat on the way home!

So Borgne is really hit or miss depending on what you order. Tonight we had the tempura soft-shell shrimp, charbroiled oysters, brussel sprouts, and peanut butter semifreddo. 

Food overall: Meh
The charbroiled oysters were forgettable. They tasted more like they were barely warmed, rather than broiled. They still had a raw oyster flavor. 

We had planned on getting the shrimp toast, but decided to try out the soft-shell tempura shrimp since they were on the happy hour menu and because we don't often see soft-shell shrimp on a menu. The dish reminded me of something Benihana used to make. Everything was edible including the head, tail and eyes. While the texture was pleasant enough, the dish was lacking in flavor. The sauce accompaniment was lackluster and too spicy.
