The only thing I would complain about is the fact that the fish came by itself, not with cole slaw or fries which was lame. I felt like it was missing something. 

For dessert we ended up getting the Oreo cheesecake- but not too sure it was Oreo cheesecake- tasted more like just a plain Oreo cake. I think the next time I go- I'll try one of their seafood boils because that's what everyone was ordering around us and maybe that's what they are known for- more so than the other items on their menu.

Came in today for lunch with my friend who took me to get my physical therapy done for today. Went in about 1 pm and were seated right away. The server was very nice and quick with our food. She checked on us multiple times and made sure that we were okay. 

I ordered the Avocado Grilled chicken salad, but they were out of avocados, which was a bummer. The salad came out and was huge though, although I was a bit disappointed they didn't have the main ingredient that made the salad. My friend ordered a cheeseburger and substituted the bun since he can't eat anything with seeds. The order came out correctly and was fresh and hot. 

I really enjoyed my lunch and felt like it was a great portion size. The customer service was also very good. I would definetly come back to try another salad.

Every time I come here the food is more delicious then the last time. Service is okay, but not when it's packed with people, you seem to get overlooked. When you finally do get a seat the drinks and food are worth it.

3 stars only for the food- the menu was huge with a lot of healthy items. The decor inside this place is pretty interesting also like nothing I've ever seen before, with sand and camels painted on the walls and cute beads hanging over the bathroom hallway arch way. 
The service here was so slow that's why I didn't give it a 5 star rating! The waiter was good in the beginning getting out drinks but we waited a while for the food and when it came time to getting our check- we waited even longer! 
I ordered a bacon cheeseburger with French fries and the burger was huge- the burger was so yummy too. Others at my table ordered breakfast items and all their meals looked huge and looked tasty also. For it being my first time here the food was great but waiting so long was terrible. To add to the fact we had to wait so long- they also messed up our check and the guy tries to pocket a $21 tip- that wasn't his.

We placed a to go order for 1 ceviche mixto and 2 orders of the platanos maduros. The woman that took my order over the phone was very nice. My issue is the food. The platanos were good but not the best I have ever had. They were also sitting in grease in the to go container. The ceviche was not flavorful. It was very bland and I have just had better in Tampa.

Five stars for 'quality', 1 star for portion size. Seriously, rolls are the width of a nickel and the fish portions are as big as a postage stamp. Its really quite insulting. Was still hungry after 3 rolls!  Can't even finish one Omega 3 roll at Sushi Teri, its packed with so much fresh salmon and yellowtail.
I recommend for happy hour. gets a little crowded but beers are half-off and they have an interesting draft list!

Went here a few years ago and they had fresh salami and sausage on display and you could get a sample to try. They got rid of the fresh meat display and now the sausages are only available is in a small freezer case and the salami is in a small refrigerator. No pancetta or bacon available. The selection of sausage and salami was decent. They had about 6 kinds of each, but not the same fresh, custom feeling as in the past. The menu for lunch items looks good and we have had great meals there in the past. Like someone else said, they went from being part deli and part kitchen to just being all kitchen. And the staff are ok. It's sad that it lost the small Italian meat shop feel.
I want to like this place but I always feel back an hour after I leave here. Other than the nachos and salsa I've learned to limits my trips here no matter who invites me.

This place is nothing special and the food is not good. Pancakes were burnt and tasted like dry pieces of paper. Bacon was half cooked and the service was not helpful and or nice at all. I don't recommend it.

I normally wouldn't go to a bar like this but an old friend was in town for the Army Navy game so I had to meet up with him.  I got there around 12:30 and this place was beyond packed. I'm fairly certain the fire marshall wouldn't have been too thrilled.  

It took me 10 minutes to find my friend as I circled the bar.  It was mostly due to the 3 Thousand 20 somethings falling all over each other and on top of me as I wiggled my way through the pack, but more so, it was the sticky floor trying to hold on to my shoes for dear life!  I actually had to use force to lift my feet off the ground!  

I guess if you're drinking "domestic" beer at the Irish Pub your wallets going to be a little happier than drinking an import or local beer.  Yeah - I didn't get that either.  I ordered a Troegs [from Harrisburg, PA] and it came in a small glass and cost me $6.  :-O

So sticky floors, expensive beer and too many drunk douche bags equates a single star in my book.  I will NOT be going back here.

I have now tried to come by and call for take out FOUR (4) times during their normal business hours and they are closed or don't answer the phone!!!!  Their mailbox is full. And yet they have a sandwich board outside saying that they are open and to call to place a take out order. Their Facebook says they are open till 9:00 pm. It is 7:45 and I called at 7:00, went by at 7:20 and called again just now. Closed or no answer every time. Their Facebook says they are open and place carry out. It says these are their current hours. So WTF? 

I mean I like the food but we have had our dinner plans messed up by them and been disappointed too many times now. Just do what you say you are going to do. That's all I'm asking.

As stated in other reviews, my job has me visiting the Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport (MSY) quite frequently.  And almost always, I am there between 12 PM and 5 PM, which of course coincides with lunch or a late lunch.  Everyone knows that prices inside of an airport are higher that everywhere else in the city, so be prepared to pay airport prices.

In the nearly 7 years that I have been a frequent visitor to MSY, I have never been able to walk up to the Subway counter and be the 1st person in line, as there is always a line here; and it's usually a damn long line.  The restaurant is located in concourse B, which is probably the busiest of the three concourses, and it seems that everyone loves to go to Subway.

The food at this Subway is no better or no "worse" than any other Subway I've visited.  There seems to be adequate personnel staffing this location; however, they seem to need a little more organizational skills, especially when dealing with constantly long lines.

I've read some of the other Yelp reviews regarding rude employees, but I have eaten here dozens of times and have never experienced this.  Now I agree that the workers could move a little quicker to suit my tastes, but we're talking fast food here, not fine dining.

It is what it is, and I'll be back.

I was extremely pleased when El Gato Negro opened a "Lakeview" location, as I had already eaten at the French Market location and had enjoyed it. The service was relatively quick and the food was awesome.

We had a sliced avocado appetizer, one chicken taco, spanish rice and an Acapulco salad.  The salad, which contained iceberg lettuce, vidalia onions, tomatoes, poblano peppers, queso fresco, corn, and a filet of grilled tilapia in a Mexican vinaigrette dressing was awesome; and I would definitely recommend it to anyone.
 
The only downside is that seating is limited and the close proximity of the tables makes for a loud atmosphere.  However, this place gets two thumbs up!

I ordered a bubble tea and potstickers. The tea was warm and the potstickers were ok. One of the workers had food delivered while I was there. I just found that slightly tacky. The workers weren't friendly. There was no one there at all besides me. I was there for what felt like forever for a small order. I went on my 45 min lunch and didn't have time to stop anywhere else. Btw the tea is still warm... this was my first time going and I won't be back.

The food is excellent the three stars is for service. There's always something with this place. I tried to call in my order only to be told they don't take phone hours after a certain time. Ok fine so I ordered online. My food was supposed to be ready at 8:45pm. Walked in and was told because the register was down the employees are all outside... I ordered and paid online. So what does a register being down have to do with my paid for food? There are no employees fixing food only one young lady at the register. Told to wait another 10 min. I'm sitting in the car and still it doesn't look like any one is fixing the food. I might have to just give up on this location and just go to the one in fishers. 
Just to be clear! Five guys burgers and hot dogs and fries are top notch! Just the service at this location is trash
Food is pretty good. Tum yum soup hit a spot. Price is reasonable.  My kids and I liked the pad see yew. My husband had pad Thai. My friend got veggie delight. It didn't look too appetizing.

First all, I had ordered a mango lassi before I started the buffet. it tasted sweeter than usual and I couldn't find the yogurt taste at all..it's like a mango smoothie that you can find anywhere else...disappointed.
Second all, I don't understand how people find the chicken "good", I tried both and they were dried like my grandmother's feet.
There are only 20ish items, so I got to tried all of them...none of them were actually spicy, not even a little bit, the only thing that I would call spicy is the fresh chili pepper in the salad bar.
I liked the lamb with the curry one but there's 80% of bone so I didn't actually get to eat the lamb itself, just had the lamb flavored juice over the rice tasted .
The dessert is also limited I can name them all: rice pudding, canned fruit, chocolate saucing and a strange tasting donut ball( like a used soggy sponge soaked into caramel oil)
Nothing exciting about this buffet, I just want to give it a "meh".
If you don't eat spicy at all though you might actually love it, but I need my Indian cuisine spicy. That's the whole point of eating it.

I've passed Joe's hundreds, maybe thousands, of times and always wondered how the pizza tasted. This time, I stopped in to finally find out. 

Firstly, the pizza is really good...not amazing, but solid. I ordered a slice of the pizza pie (top crust) with pepperoni, sausage, sauce and cheese inside. It was hot, the cheese was gooey, and 1 slice filled me up for hours. 

HOWEVER, the service here was lacking. The man behind the counter scowled at me for not knowing what I wanted to order (there was NO ONE behind me in line). That was off-putting, but I was hungry so I let it slide. Once I ordered, people came from outta nowhere and made the once comfortable standing space quite cramped and awkward. They have a nice sized dining area, but the area where you order needs a complete overhaul. (Side note: the average American woman is a size 8-10, not a 2-4...especially not if they're eating pizza on a regular. Make room!!)

Lastly, I paid with a card. I was told it was a $5 min, so I "needed" to add a drink, to which I obliged. Then he just stares at me, as if (by telepathy, I suppose) I know what fountain drinks they have (fountain was not labeled!)...He makes the drink then hands my card to the guy next to him and he says to me "move over"...smh...I paid and got the heck out of there before I changed my entire mind or gave them a piece of said mind. 

2nd star only for the pizza, because the service is beyond terrible!

Amazing selection, I haven't seen such a huge menu before that covers almost every mood you might be in. I attended a birthday party here one weekend and managed to sample a wide variety of the menu because everyone wanted to share a small portion. Some of the things that I recall were how great the hummus, mac and cheese and the baked BBQ spaghetti was. I ordered the beef brisket and didn't want to share it was that good.

The Sunday Brunch is amazing, Pecan French Toast, Beignets, grits, andouille sausage, bacon, egss. This is quite possibly the best southern cajun inspired brunch buffets in town, I highly recommend stopping by.

Highway 61 Roadhouse was also showcased recently on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives with Guy Fieri's on the Food Network.

I stopped at Taco Bus after arriving in Tampa on a Saturday afternoon the day before a cruise, much to my surprise there really isn't much open downtown on the weekends, however I came across Taco Bus and gave it a try. 

Taco Bus offers cheap fast mexican style food, overall the food was pretty good. The quality of ingredients seemed high however this is not a casual sit down style, its get your food and go, yes they offer limited seating however if its nice outside its much more enjoyable sitting outside than inside in the small booths.

Not bad if you are looking for a quick lunch, not sure about dinner I am sure their options are just as good.

Taco Circus is a solid choice for reasonably priced quality tacos in South City. The tacos are small, however they are less than $2 so you won't break the bank buying several to fill your appetite. The inside itself is small with limited seating, so there is a focus on carry out here over dining in. 

As far as the food goes the tacos are delicious, you first pick your shell (corn, flour, or hard) and then beef, pork, steak, chicken, they even have a veggie option for those non meat eaters. I tend to think that three tacos are the perfect size for a meal, however I wouldn't fault you for getting more and trying one of each! Taco Circus reminds me of Mission Taco only much cheaper! Overall this is a welcome addition to the neighborhood and I look forward to returning, hopefully soon to try their breakfast tacos!

This is your basic AYCE sushi place. Much more quantity over quality, but compared to the other AYCE sushi in town (i.e. Sushi Train), this location may have just slightly better quality sushi. But don't expect much and especially don't expect too much from the freshness. Most of their rolls are cooked anyway, so if you're not huge on raw fish, then this may be a good choice for you. 

My friend and I tried a good amount of stuff on their AYCE menu, but there wasn't anything that stood out to me - nothing was impressionable enough for me to remember it. I did think it was interesting that they had options for dim sum (just ha kao and siu mai - both weren't good, so I'm going to just save you the trouble from trying it especially since it takes like 30 minutes for them to bring it out). Their "sushi pizza" is really weird. It's super fried and oily. Wouldn't recommend getting that one. Their hand rolls are good! And so were the tempura. 

The waitresses aren't the most well trained... sometimes they forgot orders or brought out the wrong ones. It got confusing and tiring having to wait 20 minutes for two pieces of sushi. I wouldn't have minded if it was super busy but my friend and I were the only ones in the restaurant for lunch. 

PROTIP: bring your student ID, cos they do student discounts (I think its 15%, but don't quote me on that - as you can tell, my experience wasn't totally remarkable enough to remember details)

If you're looking for authentic street tacos, Taco Mamacita is NOT your place. This is much more geared towards Tex-Mex and tacos you'd find at places like Fuzzy's or Torchy's, not small family-owned gas station taco joints. My friend and I split chips with white queso - which I 100% recommend. It comes out warm, it's super creamy, it's got a little kick, and the perfect complement to tortilla chips. 

I ordered 2 tacos: the Korean BBQ and the Taco Royale with a side of sweet potato fries. Loooove the sweet potato fries, absolutely hated the jalapeno ranch that came with it. It was honestly really gross and I was just not a fan. It had a strange aftertaste and was really bitter on the tongue. I ended up just dipping my fries with ketchup instead. The Korean BBQ taco did not taste like Korean BBQ at all - but it was still good. It just wasn't authentic in either the taco or the bbq sense. The Taco Royale reminded me of a fancy & fresher Crunchwrap Supreme. The sweet potato fries were really good but I also was wondering why a Mexican restaurant was serving sweet potato fries...

Try the margs!!! My friend and I split the El Camino margarita and it was soooo good. You can barely taste the tequila and it was a really good complement for our dinner.

I had high hopes...  darn it. Seems like half the reviews like the place, and the other half say they are overpriced for what they offer. I had to side with the "Overpriced" group.

I love seafood, and am a little picky, especially when the price starts moving up the scale. Being  a damn good cook myself, I am probably harder to please than a lot of people.

We walked in the door... and there was no hostess, maitre d', headwaiter, etc... or anyone to greet us or seat us. After a minute or so, a waitress showed up and explained they don't have a hostess on the weekdays. She seemed a little grumpy, but maybe that was just my perception. 

She seated us... and gave us the full alcohol spiel. I explained that my girlfriend is allergic to alcohol, and I don't drink when I am driving. We ordered water... as that really is my preference. She delivered the water... and we ordered some Conch Fritters. We also  ordered the main courses... I chose blackened shrimp with a Caesar salad... GF got the Fish and Chips.

Conch Fritters were meh.. crispy outside, but mush inside, and the conch was tough.

Blackened shrimp were the 60 to a pound size, and I got two skewers.. maybe 20 to 24 shrimp. SMALL shrimp! Blackening was mostly cayenne, and it did not have the complexity I expect from good blackening spices. Cajuns blacken with a ton of butter... that did not happen either (maybe trying to be healthy?), and it does add a lot of flavor. Salad was ok... but the dressing was out of a bottle.

Girlfriend said her Fish and Chips was good, but she only ate the fish, only had three of the fries (and she loves fries)... and barely touched the Slaw (and yes, she loves good slaw). So what does that say?

And the waitress never did seem very happy to be there either! 

I usually tip well... and I think I only did about 18% here.. instead of my usual 20-25%... because if it is that hard to be there, someone needs to look for a different job. 

We did not do dessert...  

Maybe my expectations are too high? If I want Red Lobster, I will go there... and that is what I feel I got (and no, I don't consider Red Lobster to be good seafood!)  lol!

Definitely overpriced for what they offer.  I guess all the TV's scattered all over the place, and the emphasis on Alcohol should have clued me in... but like I said above.. I had high hopes.

This place is really cool. I can really appreciate the decor and vibe of this restaurant. Now onto the food. We got the dirty queso which was just okay. I'm not sure I'd order it again. There chips are really thick which I'm not really a fan of. I tried the el traditional and it was the worst taco I've ever had. Those flavors just didn't go well together. The el santo was a little bit better but not something I'd get again. I love the margaritas. That will be their saving grace. We tried 4 different flavors peach, banana, blood orange and pomegranate. All delicious they don't skimp on the tequila. We had great service. I'll be back for the drinks. 5 dollars Mon-Friday.

Had the mini Cuban sandwich and plantains combo. When they said mini I was expecting half the size that I received. It was plenty enough for me. Both sandwich and plantains were good. 

Looks like expansion was taking place. Wasn't too busy when I stopped there but looks like a great meeting space for friends. 

I'll go back and try more menu items.

Tried Lovash for the second time tonight. I'm sad to say both times the food was unacceptable. 

The bread was like a cracker and for Indian bread this was not fit to be served. I think it was made yesterday and completely dried out and hard. 

We pay good money and expect fresh food. Both times we ordered we just felt they gave us old food. 

Sorry we won't try Lovash a third time.

Walking into Clementine's, the tasteful decor looks like it was pulled off of a Pinterest page! The price point is a little steep (especially on my post-grad school budget), but coming here is definitely an "ice cream experience" and you can definitely tell that the quality and care put into their products is on a different level than many other ice cream shops in town.

When I stopped in on a muggy May night last week, I sampled their moscow mule, front porch mint, and the (vegan) coconut chocolate fudge.  When it came to decision making time, I decided on the salted crack caramel and madagascar vanilla.  With chunks of salted chocolate cracker candy and vanilla bean specks had my taste buds in heaven for a few minutes! Fellow Yelpers have mentioned, they encourage you to sample as many flavors as you'd like to which I really appreciated!  (Be prepared to show your ID, even for samples of the boozy flavors!)

The portion sizes were on the smaller side, which was good for my waist line, but left my stomach asking for more!  This little spot is a great addition to the Lafayette Park area.  While this may not be a place I'll frequent weekly, I will definitely stop by Clementine's again on special occasions! 

For anyone that hasn't made their way to Clementine's yet, check out their website to see the available flavors.  The pictures of the different scoops (both naughty and nice) were artistically taken and will have you drooling before you walk in the front door!

Carp's food selection is tough. Oaxaca takes so-so, but the service is infamous for being laughably awful. Because the service is so bad, I can't give it more than a star. I rather just go to Rudy's (cheaper, tastes better) or Siam Elephant, which is amazing Thai food (and has oustanding service).

I came to El Vez on Cinco de Mayo for brunch with two friends and we had an okay experience. We decided to come relatively early in the day to beat the crowd, and luckily we were seated right away. The space is large and vibrant which makes for a fun ambiance.

The drinks were definitely the highlight of the meal. I started off with a mimosa which was great - an excellent ratio of orange juice to champagne. I also had the Pineapple Canela Margarita (mi campo reposado, orange nectar, fresh lime juice, pineapple purée, cinnamon & spices) which was soooooo delicious. The flavors made it the perfect margarita for brunch. My only complaint is that it took over 20 minutes for me to receive the marg after ordering it.

The food was not quite as exciting. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros without chorizo (two fried eggs, black beans, avocado, salsa mexicana, cilantro, and ranchero sauce). It was okay, but relatively bland and definitely overpriced for the portion size. I left still pretty hungry.

Overall, there are better options for Mexican in the area, and immensely better dining options on 13th Street.

I can't believe it took me this long to get to Bing Bing - what a great fusion spot! I came here with two friends on a Saturday night around 5:30pm. We didn't have a reservation, but they were able to seat us outside right away.

I had the rotating Tired Hands draft to drink (a honey saison), which was amazing (as I expected it to be). We decided to share a few dishes. My favorite by far was the Brussels Sprouts (with fried tofu, maple sweet and sour, and pickled red onion). Holy moly - they were so caramelized and delicious. We also had the Dan Dan Noodles and subbed shiitake mushrooms for the ground pork (the noodles also came with cucumber, radish, and peanut). We had some of these noodles leftover and took them home, and weirdly enough, they were better the second day! Finally, we got the Eggplant Mapo Tofu (sichuan chili sauce, yu choy, jasmine rice). While this was probably my least favorite dish (just because the tofu preparation didn't blow me away as much as I was expecting based on the two previous dishes), it was still yummy.

A group of friends and I came here for a little friend's Christmas dinner. I ordered the arroz con pollo as my entree and it was good. I liked the crispy rice even though it caught me off guard at first. It was seasoned well but the chicken was few and far between. The few pieces of chicken that I did have were kind of dry and lacked flavor. I would have liked it to have a little heat and kick to it. I ordered the Johnny Sanchez Margarita, which was meh. I felt like I could've mixed a better one in my kitchen. All in all it wasn't bad but wasn't spectacular either. I'd be willing to give another go though.

Cleo's, oh Cleo's. How do I love thee...let me count the ways. This is my go-to place for middle eastern cuisine in Nola. The meats are seasoned to perfection and are tender and tasty. The hummus is to die for and is topped with a chili sauce that I can't get enough of. I always order extra so I can put it on my meat too. Generous portion sizes. I love getting the combination shawarma. I get chicken and lamb. The storefront is always tidy and clean. You can find a lot in the store. It has a lot of grocery items and snacks. The service is pretty quick. There is another very popular middle eastern restaurant, which shall remain nameless, that is within walking distance of my job but will still pay the extra money to have Cleo's delivered for lunch. It is well worth it. It's open 24 hours so it's great if you need some food to sober up after a rousing night downtown.
Not quite sure I get what the hype is. Average burger. Average fries. Maybe its the chili and milkshakes. It can't be the burgers that earned this rating.
The food is not that bad I would come back soon they better than steak 'n Shake hands down

Overrated and Disappointing! Carne asada was DRY. seemed like it had been sitting around too long. Meat didn't have all that much flavor. Tacos I get in LA cost less and are so much better than the ones around here.

Wanting to try something off the beaten path, we took a stroll over to the Ace Hotel and after finding out that Seaworthy was a new restaurant, we decided to give it a try. My friend was craving oysters and so this seemed like a cool place to stop by. Seaworthy is a very cozy, comfortable, and chic restaurant and the ambiance was great. My friend dove into his oysters and loved them. We decided on a couple of small plates: soft shell crab, crab claws and blue crab. Obviously, we love crab. The soft shell crab was good. I was disappointed with the crab claws, because I frequent Joe's Seafood, not to be confused with Joe's Crab Shack, and I am accustomed to their stone crab claws, so I was a little shocked when I received Seaworthy's crab claws. The blue crab was a little too fishy.
For our main courses I chose the Sheepshead and my friend went with the burger. It took a very long time to receive our food and in the interim, my friend got sick and we had to leave, so our food was packed up for us. The Sheepshead was ok, not melt in your mouth buttery as our waitress had described it and my friend said the burger looked a lot better than it actually tasted.

I found out about Vui's kitchen randomly. I was I the mood for something different and I can say that it is a hidden gem in Nashville. The atmosphere is warm and inviting and the staff is friendly and helpful. The restaurant is always pretty packed (I tend to go at lunch) but that lets you know that the food is good. I love it

Food was good overall but my caesar salad wasn't very good.  I really wanted to like this place, but I think it was overpriced. I've been to Butcher and Singer and thought that the price matched the quality and portions.  Here,  not so much.  The dishes were very small and not filling.  Again, if it was cheaper, the portions wouldn't be an issue.
Being here a couple of times just love the bread and house dressing and me like sex in the city love my cosmo..And now they have good specials on weekdays. See what it all about.

I really wanted to like this place...after reading all of the super reviews I was totally excited to enjoy lunch here!

Let's start with the Margarita...it tasted liked lemon/lime-ade! No alcohol whatsoever!  I was pretty ticked off to pay more than $5 and not even get a slight buzz!  I don't drink that much and am considered somewhat of a light weight, so I should have definately at least been able to taste a little alcohol.  Nada, Zip, Ziltch!!!

Moving on to the three street tacos (steak, chicken & pork)...the only one worth mentioning was the steak.  The others were dry and bland tasting.  The tortillas were also breaking up all over the plate.

In conclusion, it just wasn't that good...I plan to try this place again, just to be sure...maybe it was an off day.

Bishop's is a solidly good Meat & Three.  It's quite beloved by some of the families I know here in the area, especially because you can carry out a good meal to take home to your family.  (Family meal is an entree, two sides, and bread.  Great deal.)  It's brought to you by the Bishop family that owns Hattie B's (one of my favorite hot chicken restaurants, with multiple locations now).  So obviously, get the fried or hot chicken.  That's my fav.  I feel like their food is all a-okay, solidly good comfort food.  Prices are reasonable.  You'll definitely hit a line at meal time, so be prepared to wait, and then since it's cafeteria style, get a table.  You also don't have to get three sides, one or two is an option.  You can get a meal for under $10 easily with plenty to eat.

Check the website if you're wanting a specific entree, as they do change and rotate daily.  Sides stay mostly the same, but check if you're picky.

My dislikes?  The parking situation.  It's a madhouse during lunch hour because the Chick-Fil-A next to it does insane business, and it also shares a parking lot with Jason's Deli during the lunch crush.  Not their fault, but their location is just kind of tight when it comes to parking.  It's also very no-frills (I keep using this term on Yelp, but it just fits) so expect a very casual, cafeteria-like setting.  Set your expectations accordingly.

Not particularly impressed with our experience at Party Fowl. We came in for Sunday dinner, and while the place wasn't busy the service was rather slow and inattentive. We felt like we always had to flag down our server, and we almost always had empty water glasses on the tables in need of refills.

We started with the Onion Loaf, which was probably one of my favorite things for the meal. The onions were thin and crispy and good.   If I came back, I'd order it again!

We ordered different meals, with skillet mac 'n' cheese and mashed potatoes as sides. I ordered the Hot Chicken B+B which was a hot chicken breast with maple bourbon beignets. The beignets were somewhat lackluster, very flat and greasy. The chicken was pretty good, but again very greasy.  I prefer other hot chicken joints in town to be honest... This stuff was just okay, hence the 3-star review.

The sides were disappointing. The mashed potatoes had formed a crust and seemed like they'd been on a warmer for a long time. The macaroni (one of my usual favorite things to eat) was lackluster in flavor. We had lots left over and didn't care to bring it home with us because we didn't love it.

Really nothing here tastes very good, at best the dishes are average. Theres a nice little feel to this place though, like stepping into the movie Grease..so if you're in the mood for chili cheese fries and some watery milkshakes at 2 am then this is the spot. Open 24/7

Bayona has never really been to my taste and a recent visit confirmed what I have long thought but kept to myself.  The restaurant is pretty in an old fashioned way and the courtyard is lovely (like so many in the quarter).  However the decor is dated as is the clientele - the average age I saw in the fairly empty dining room was well over sixty. While old-fashioned decor and aging patrons are not necessarily an issue I find that the food and service matches.  Over multiple visits the menu has seemed relatively unchanged and there were a surprising lack of options during my last one.  While dishes like garlic soup and caesar salad are well executed - that I am ordering them indicates that there is not much else to excite me.  Tried the tripletail as a main which was fine but not particularly exciting - just traditional and a little bland.  Service was excruciatingly slow for a small business lunch (party of 2) and even though we tried to move it along it still took well over an hour for two courses in a nearly empty restaurant.  We kept ordering from the busboy to speed things along and as a result the first time we saw our waitress was when she dropped off the check.  While Bayona is better than many options in the quarter it is not for me and certainly avoid if you are looking for a quick meal.

Extremely disappointed. Probably won't be back and can't recommend to anyone else. Food was cold and I mean cold, not warm but cold. Service was a free for all. Sat us upstairs and James was trying his best but taking care of a party of 12 and a party of 10 that came in after us. The muffuletta sandwich was very thin and the bun was hard as a rock like it had been toasted and got cold. Had the "blackened" shrimp and creole jambalaya. The shrimp was not blackened and had been cooked on a flat griddle with no spice. Also the shrimp was cold like it had been taken out of the refrigerator. Had the boudin appetizer and it was soggy and falling apart so I did t eat it out of a safety concern. Very disappointing!

We originally went there because we thought we would get the bottomless drinks but we decided not to because I was too expensive... it wasn't not reasonable at all... in the end we stayed and ate.

The food was good. I don't think there was anything particularly special about the food. It was certainly not a culinary work of art, just simple good comfort food. 

The prices were reasonable and the food portion was great! Depending on what you order you will leave there feeling full and satisfied or stuffed. The Chicken n Waffles was definitely a hit. I think it was the star of the show compared to the other meals. 

The service was normal... good. The inside of the restaurant was very nice! It seemed slightly modern... so it was kind of a bust when the food came out and I wasn't in awe. 

I probably won't go back not because the food was horrible but it was average... plus and expensive bottomless drink special... not worth it.

Tucked among all the other bars in the area, I must've passed by "Bar" more times than I could count. Maybe I mistook the sign for part of another bar's sign? Maybe I never even looked that high. Probably the latter. 

But Philly Beer Week brings out all sorts of bars from the woodwork, and my first visit to Bar was a great one! Their happy hour is just what the doctor ordered. It's a small space, but cozy, and not pretentious at all. The best part is, despite the kind of divey look of it all (outside and a little in), their beer list is top notch. TRULY a ton of great options. 

If that's not your style, just get discounted pickle backs and shots of Fireball.  Or $2 PBR pounders.

Truly, something for anyone. Ideal jumpoff spot for a night out, meet up with your buddies, grab some brewskis, and hit the town!

(to the tune of Niall Horan's "Slow Hands")

She said "Dinner by the parkway."
So I took the bus all the way.
Cause I'm craving guac
and I just can't stop.
I've been thinking 'bout it all day
Tacos sitting in my bell-ay.
Batter fry those fish
Put them on my dish, baby

My hands
Got sauce dripping down, but I'm not stopping.
No chance
That I won't pick back up that bite I'm dropping
I know
Yeah, I already know I want another
I got big plans for tacos
in my hands, baby.

Good tacos (fish is totally worth the extra 50 cents), great guac (steep price made more clear by the HUGE portion size), and their fountain soda is fancy AF. Garces does a bang-up job, typically.

Friend got a salad topped with "shrimp" (extra $5) and got 5 individual shrimp. A dollar per shrimp feels a little silly, they were very petite. We ordered some sides, too, which weirdly came about 7 minutes before our taco entrees with our guac - would prefer them to come simultaneously, as they were hot and cooled down a bit by taco time.

Josephine, it just sounds like a country song. Perfectly named for an exceptional dining experience in Music City.  Beautiful decor, friendly and very knowledgable staff. The service was top notch. Attentive but not bothersome. They have created an unpretentious but elegant dining experience. The clientele was as eclectic as the area.

I hate cauliflower but if my momma had served it grilled and tossed in buffalo sauce I would have had it twice a day! Add to that some exquisitely seasoned Brussel sprouts and you have two appetizers you can feel good about eating. The beef cheeks were awesome, the sauce/gravy was rich but not salty. The steak was perfectly cooked but would have preferred it to be served whole as opposed to sliced. That being said, the steak was delightful.

The meal was topped off with a hot pecan pie served with coffee ice cream. It was so well balanced and exceptionally prepared that it should be a crime to serve it any other way!

In just one visit I am a fan! I liked it so much that if we were going to have more children and we had a girl I would name her Josephine!

Met a friend here for dinner. She had been staying nearby to visit family & highly recommended this place for every meal. The waiter was very personable and the dining room comfortable. Had the schnitzel which was okay and I passed on dessert, which my friends said was exceptional. Would go again if I was in the area, don't think I'd make a special trip.
We did go on a Monday night & there aren't a lot of places open on Monday.

Kelly's get high ratings on a regular basis from me for being unique, in a great location, having a creative menu (pimento cheese and crackers!? Veggie Mac & cheese....YUM) and breakfast served at lunch if you want. Also an honorable mention for having an indoor atmosphere that is quaint yet funky and spacious outside patio - Key West feel complete with fans to keep the air circulating add TV's and a bar- a place where you can get a good loud laugh in with your friends if you choose. 
The "side salad" that comes with the lunch combo special was impressive. (See pic). They even added raw onion. Home made bleu cheese was excellent. Portions generous for price. 

Downside: limited parking, service is so-so and usually is, servers know the locals and hang with their table often not even checking on you after food is delivered. Good news is food always 5 stars so no worries  PS- since smoking is allowed outside it drifted our way the entire meal. BUT.... That's a preference and not a reason not to eat here - go inside. Again-4 stars every day of the week!!!

Utterly disappointed. For a place in a perfect location, with beautiful decor, the food was underwhelming. "Roasted best salad" tasted nothing like sweet house roasted beets, but rather something from a can. Options were extremely limited for someone avoiding gluten, and certainly overpriced for the quality of the food. 

As I said, the place is gorgeous and centrally located if you're going to a show or event downtown, so to have drinks with friends this could be a perfect spot. Just be prepared to spend $$.

I had jury duty this week and I was like aww shucks. Then I thought oh wait! I can go to Good Dog for lunch! Then I got selected and now I have to report next week too. SO NOW I CAN GO TO GOOD DOG EVERYDAY FOR LUNCH. 

I love this place. Great burgers, great salads. 

Today I got the harvest salad with shrimp and my FREIND got it with chicken. We shared the meats. The chicken was cooked to perfection. Grilled yet juicy. 

Of course being animal minded I absolutely love the decor and tag line. 
This is one spot I can say you won't just try once and forget it. Try it. Prove me wrong.

The Mc Donald's of cheese steaks. They aren't good warm and don't ever try it cold. 
You can make steak ums at home that will be infinitely better.

This is a cool spot to hang out. I wish I liked their coffee. It taste like wood chips. I think it's a matter of preference though not anything the place is at fault for. So between the cool decor and the great service I'll give it 3. 

Oh yeah I had their fruit parfait and I wasn't into that either.

Meh.  I don't really like to do a bad review mainly because if I didn't have a good experience I don't want to go back and relive it through a review.  We were going to go somewhere else after a concert at my daughters school but it closed at nine and we weren't sure we would really have time so we ended up here.  

I'll start off with the good which was our server was very good.  Offered suggestions when I wasn't sure what I wanted and kept a good watch of our table.

The bad of the night was the food and that is where the low rating comes from.  For a app we got some Beef Bulgolgi tacos.  The hoisin sauce was so sweet that it made them very hard to eat.  For outer entrees my wife had yamada roll and I had the seafood ceviche.  These like the app were both only one note with the sushi trading only like the sauce(to me, my wife liked it) and the ceviche tasting only of cilantro.  I could only eat a couple of bites of the ceviche because it was so strong.  They did end up taking that off of our bill since I didn't eat it with was very generous.

I am thrilled to have this place in the neighborhood. I have been to the location on the east side and was not disappointed and this location did not let me down. The place is neat and bright; nothing fancy but I feel good eating raw fish here. The price cannot be beat. For $15 at lunch and a bit over $20 for dinner you can eat all that you can stuff into your face. My favorite is the sushi pizza but everything is pretty good. Is this the best sushi place in Indy? Probably not but the food is above average and you definitely get your money's worth and then some.

After writing my first review I was given the opportunity to come back and give it another try. Although I was hesitant some friends of mine had made reservations for NYE so I decided to give it a try. Once again I was sorely disappointed. 
Once we arrived it took forever for us to place our order. I think as a waitress it it very important to feel out your customers. This was not are only stop for the night and we didn't have the time to sit at the restaurant for over 3 hours. 
I gave them another star this time because once we did get the food it was very good I ordered the spinach ravioli and enjoyed it very much. 
Once again I felt the food was very much overpriced. For 1 entree and one alcoholic beverage it cost me over $30. 
After giving this place 2 tries I think I am done.

For years I have been hearing about this place but I was never able to go. I wanted to go for lunch because the price is a bit cheaper and you get pretty much the same selection. And finally the day came! And let me tell you I was not disappointed! It was just like I had dreamed, men approaching your table in gaucho pants with meat on a stick! It was delicious and a bit overwhelming! So many options, not only do you have a dozen different meats to choose from you also have a huge salad bar! I really appreciated how attentive the staff was and constantly filling up the sides that come along with the meat. My only complaint would be that I wish I would have been hungrier when I arrived.

Our first time in this location.  Ordered Bang shrimps( not the best we had in this chain), fish/corn chowder (was so-so) and Josefine mussels (quality of the mussels and preparation was awful). The service was not accommodating to our needs. Ambience was dark and gloomy. Needless to say it was our first and last visit.

First visit for lunch. Ambiance (except of cleanliness of the restrooms) was modern and fine ( though acoustics are not great for a quiet conversation), service was nice and efficient. Food: Spicy wontons (A), Stuffed eggplant (A+) Pork soup dumplings (A), Chive dumplings (B) edamame dumplings (B-), Chicken feet (C). Price tag is higher then it should be for the quality of the experience. Worth coming back to try other dishes from the main menu and then make a conclusion but as Dim Sum goes not much variety of our favorites and not the best taste we've ever experienced before.

I liked many aspects our SoBou experience: sazeracs were wonderful, pork cracklins, boudin balls and sliders were all yummy, and the room is both hip and casually inviting. Cerviche with crawfish was a standout.

Other things fell short: my chicken on the bone was tender and nicely spiced but a little cloyingly sweet and came with no sides, which I thought was odd. Just four sticky sweet chicken legs all in a row. My husband's steak was almost flavorless and a little overcooked - just not a good piece of meat. 

Other aspects of the evening were just plain bad. The waiter was, well, stoned. A nice guy and cute as a button, but he couldn't keep track of what was going one...like whether we had ordered yet, or whether we had just arrived or were waiting for the check. 

A major drawback of SoBou is that it feels like a hotel restaurant so the crowd is what you get at a hotel sometimes. We had both bachelor and bachelorette parties with all of the accompanying yelling, cursing, and craziness. Posh New Orleanians were seated next to suburban moms from outside Cleveland next to twenty-two year-olds enjoying a pit stop from Bourbon Street. It all added up to a weird atmosphere.

I need to give a shoutout to the sommelier Patrick who did his best - offered comped, lovely  appetizer and wine pairing plus lots of personal attention - to make up for our server's inadequacy. That gentleman is going somewhere, and I hope it's somewhere that shows more consistent class than SoBou.

I really did have high hopes for this place...after all, I do respect those who are non-traditional, organic and anti-GMO (and/or the like). The dishes and drinks were pricey (maybe it's just me?). I mean, they don't even have fountain sodas, or at least I didn't see any on the menu. No, I will not pay another 3-something for a Mexican Coke, which tastes just like American Coke. The burrito was so-so, with plenty of dried, hardened bits inside (possibly the rice or beans). The spicy pepper sauces were also gross, as gloopy stuff came out (can't think of any other way of putting it!)! I did tell the server, who was unattentive at the end (hey, I'll cut him slack the place did get busier). He suggested I talk to the person in charge, but I turned it down. I hope they did listen to my complaint.

Ate here for the first time last night and it was all right. I really went just to taste their doner kabob (which I believe is hard to come by around here!) and fries. Food was good and their drink. Wish they'd have, like, combo meals. But I gotta remember, it's a small business place. I enjoyed watching Guns 'n Roses music videos on their TV while dining. Oh, and they don't take plastic. But they have an ATM, which didn't really make me happy. I usually don't carry cash on me, for which I know is my own fault. But, my advice to any business owner who only takes cash: Get with the times!

Used to be my go to Mexican place for over 20 years, but as new places popped up we stopped making the drive.  Last night was what I remembered, the food was great chicken enchiladas, chicken tacos, and a chicken  burrito.  The chips were thin and crispy and the hot sauce was excellent, but the mild sauce was straight salt!  Our waiter was nice and the food came out quickly.  Sadly the margaritas were weak and the pitcher on the rocks barely filled the two margarita glasses.  It was quite pricey and there were not happy hour drink specials at 5 o'clock on a Friday.  Love the food, but can get great food, strong margaritas, and happy hour specials for cheaper in Sparks.

I thought it was just OK. My husband had a much better experience than I did, so hence the 3 stars. The peach tea was great, so things started off great. I decided to to try something different and did the breakfast sandwich. It includes over easy eggs, which hung off the brioche bun, making for a messy eating ordeal. The sandwich itself was OK, but I lost a sausage while eating because it felt a little overloaded. The sausage by itself was also a bit tough.

I had potatoes with it, and to be honest, I think mine I make at home are better. They seemed to lack moisture and I didn't realize at the time when the waitress asked me that I was charged 50 cents for onions being added to them.

Tasted hubby's food and the pancakes were good but warm/borderline cold. I was surprised he was still happy with that, as I would have sent them back. Our wait was a bit long for breakfast food, but the couple who came in after us who sat next to us got their food right away. I can't tell you why that was, but it was more waiting than I would have expected for a breakfast sandwich and pancakes. 

The whole thing was pretty expensive in the end as they charged for the eggs and meat to go along with my husband's meal. I would possibly return but not for the dry breakfast meat.

I enjoyed my shrimp chimichanga and their wings. I will definitely go back and sample the drinks next time. The food was tasty and filling though. I can't complain at all. I hope to go back here soon.

Don't waste your time. Take your hard earned money to Popeyes. But If your looking for an overpriced mediocre meal this is the place for you. I think the AC is broke its so hot in here. 11$ for 3 pieces of chicken. Plus if you want white meat it's a $3 extra charge. Oh and despite the ridiculous price you are paying you can't request certain pieces of chicken. I requested 2 breast and just 1 wing verses what they want to give you (1 breast and 2 wings). Even when I said I would pay even more money for the chicken I wanted I was told I couldn't have what I wanted. Apparently the customers are not Always right here. The woman who work here are not very nice. There is no service or anyone who waits on you. The whole place feels very dirty and sticky. They are out of half the drinks they are supposed to have. They have random duck tape all over the walls. Not sure why. The amount of time it took to get our food when we were 2 out of 10 people in the place was wayyy too long. Once we finally got our food it wasn't hot. It was bland and dry. Very disappointing. I got mashed potatoes as my side item. Born and raised in New Orleans never have I seen a gravy like the one they had it was just horrible. Seriously misrepresenting true New Orleans food. And they had green beans on my plate. I didn't order green beans nor was I aware these were coming with my food. The bathroom was like a sweat box. The door didn't close all the way so anyone could have walked in at anytime. And the restroom was very dirty just a mess everywhere and smelled like urine. As I said to start with don't waste your time.
Just tried Poke Falls on a couple of recommendations, and found it to be ok. Not the best, but ok and at reasonable price. Probably won't be back...

I like the Columbia restaurant, I like the food, I like the architecture, I like the history. What I don't like is the service. I think the Columbia is such an institution many of the long time servers just don't care. They know they'll be packed tomorrow night. And the night after that, and the night after......you get the point.

After reading so many good things about this place, I finally tried it out Sunday morning.  Everything people had said was true - it's wonderful!  It's a very cute, quaint corner spot, and we sat outside which was lovely.  The black and white paper menus and mismatched tupperware cups added to the mom-and-pop feel of the place.

The food is French cafe style, with a variety of pastries, bagels, coffee and quiche for breakfast, and sandwiches, salads and soups for lunch.  We were fortunate to come at a time when they were serving both.  I had the Tolosa sandwich (goat cheese, roasted red peppers, garlic and herbs on a baguette) and my boyfriend had the Gaulois sandwich (salami, brie, pecans, and lettuce) and they both were delicious... everything fresh and melty, mmm.  Our waitress was very friendly too; she "felt bad" that the OJ was so small so she brought out water with it (best she could do).

Cozy, unassuming place with good food, and reminded me of my time in Lyon, France with the food selection.  Can't wait to go back, c'est magnifique!

This place is nasty! We ordered margarita drinks and bartender use her hands to put ice in our drinks! Right in front of me . I wi never come back here. I don't want to know what's going on in the back . Dirty !!

Waffle House is Waffle House is Waffle House.  

I don't expect much when I go to one, so I'm never disappointed when I leave. 

And this one did just fine at 3a on a Friday night.

This is an affordable breakfast stop downtown. There is plenty of seating in the restaurant with some outdoor seating. When you first walk in, you order at the counter then find a seat. 

The Dome fries are AMAZING! I tried to eat to eat them like a human, but inhaled them like an animal. While the rest of the food was okay, the service was mediocre.

Food is good, the won ton soup is probably the best in St Louis. service is  very good. Love that they bring you tea when you sit down! The menu is your basic Chinese -American Their "spicy" food is really rather bland  Not gourmet  but nice for lunch on a cold day

OH i was so excited to find an "Authentic Mexican Restaurant" Near my house  OOPS  Not good  Tongue tacos were OK but just   Tripe tacos were little burnt things in a tortilla.  Sauce and chips  Chips were ok  Sauce seemed to to be squeeze bottles of Tabasco Sauce  One daughters Nacho plate was just left half eaten on the Table  Other Daughter  ate a  little of her Carne Asado  and took the rest home, where we pitched it 
Also on both visits we were overcharged Not goung back

Some years ago I had gone to Patricks and had a very bad dining experience  and did not go back for a long time  But I did not want to write a really horrible review  When I went last  year I was pleasantly surprised and wrote a good review  Now I went back and I'm afraid the meal was not  good at all The green beans had stems still attached  the potatoes tasted as if they had not been scrubbed clean I called the waitress to  tell her and she said    " I'll tell the chef " no apology no offer to bring a different  order of green beans and potatoes  My "Medium rare" rib eye was barely warm  Just raw  I left the Veg, took the meat home to cook it and won't be going back.  The only reason for the 2 star instead of 1 was the salad  it was  OK

Cash only pizza place that was literally just grease and cheese... What a Shame. The pizza was low on sauce and the crust was really blame and burnt.

In addition to the food, the parking is absolutely terrible.

Soho Sushi is a subpar tasting, trendy for no reason,  overpriced, parking nightmare right off Kennedy Blvd. I have yet to hit the jackpot of actually getting a parking spot on arrival,  which truly defies all odds. I assume they allow the employees to park in the lot, which likely takes up half of the 15 total spots. I've tried about a dozen rolls from this place, and not a single one has wowed me. The price is a little on the high end for what you get,  but nothing outrageous given that it is a sushi place. The atmosphere is disappointing, with literally zero intimacy. All in all,  this place is flat out overhyped,  which seems to be a recurring theme in South Tampa.

Food was overcooked, and certainly not al dente. The sauce on my vodka pasta tasted like spaghettios from a can. Our server was very abrupt and did not give us a lot of attention. Parmesan was not offered to us, and after I requested it, I was promptly covered in it myself due to the haphazard grating by the waitress. For the same price, you can have a much better prepared meal at Taverna in Newark, and much better service.

What a great Wednesday wine tasting! For $25 we tasted 8 wines, snacks, and a surprise piece of pumpkin pie at the end (thanksgiving eve). The soms were so knowledgeable but let us tasters give our opinions and asked us questions as we went. It was great to be involved. They have such a selection and the atmosphere was great. Only thing I didn't like was having to use the public restroom across the walkway.

Love the amount of TVs for a football Sunday! I'm a Panthers fan and the fact that they were able to have every one o clock game on was great! I got a few mimosas and shared the loaded waffle fries. Everything was very good. I wish they had more Sunday specials. $8 for a mimosa is not what I would have expected on a Sunday afternoon. I also got their drip coffee and it was great! Hopefully in the future they will build on their Sunday specials because I'd love to come back!

I came with a group of girlfriends for brunch here on a Sunday. We made a reservation ahead of time (amazing because most places don't let you do that) and they were so willing to push it back 30 minutes when we were running late. We were sat as soon as we walked through the door. It took a bit for our server to get to us, but once he did, he made our visit great. Sam kept the mimosas flowing and dealt with all our dietary needs. Half our table ordered the chefs choice skillet and it was so good I couldn't even grab a picture of it. That day it was eggs, cheddar, pulled chicken (forget what kind), avocado, and some veggies. It was so good I scraped the skillet clean. Others also ordered the Thai salad, and breakfast biscuit. As far as I recall there were no complaints!

Found this gem while out shopping on Small business Saturday. Right about the time I mentioned that I was getting hungry to my husband, we walked by this hole in the wall, and the smells dragged me in. Large sandwich menu that wraps around 3 walls (hot dogs, and sandwiches -hot and cold). I settled on the Golden state, and my husband had a turkey and pastrami (can't remember the name). We had the choice of white/wheat or rye bread. There was only one girl working to make orders and they were pretty busy, but we didn't wait too long. Simple, but well done. Reminds me of a NYC deli, boars head meats and all! Even the set up and seating is very similar to what you'd find in the city with little bar style tables in what could be an ally. We will be back!

Decided to try this place after work one day as we pass it on the way home but had never been. Felt like we were transported back to London and I'm sad we hadn't been here sooner! Scotch eggs were awesome, liked the honey mustard sauce, not the spicy one. Husband got meatloaf, said he would order it again. I got fish and chips- loved it, but will get the smaller size next time because the fish is huge! Perfect vinegar tartar sauce. I wanted to try dessert but I was stuffed, so will have to make sure I save room next time! Look forward to taking family here when they visit
Mediocre food with terrible service, we won't be going back again any time soon!

Came in for Father's Day had burgers nachos and a chicken Caesar wrap. We got free appetizer which was amazing!! This place is around the corner and didn't feel like driving too far, server was good. 

If your up for some drinks and average food this is your place!!

This place is really terrible. Went to Mothers Day brunch and was really disappointed. We were early for our 10 am reservation and checked in before a massive line started blocking the entrance. 45 minutes later most of the crowd was sat and we were still standing around waiting. They had forgotten to seat us I guess. We asked a few times (after no one was waiting anymore) to be sat and it was like a major inconvenience to them. 

The place felt like a cafeteria. The food was ok. It's hard to go wrong with breakfast food really. The dessert table looked nice, but I was not even interested after being treated like we didn't matter. We had made a reservation with a high chair, didn't get one. I asked for a high chair and they didn't bring one. Asked again, they brought a broken one. So I asked for a different one, then my husband asked a different person 10 minutes later, and finally I went and got my own because they were just incredibly aloof. Every time they poured water in our glasses they managed to spill a bunch all over the table. It was just an all around awful Mother's Day experience. I felt bad feeling so annoyed because my mom had picked it. Never doing that again.

The last two times I was there, once for lunch, and once for dinner(tonight), the service has been horrible. Management was visible but not doing anything but talking to his staff. They definitely have a training issue or issues, but it starts with the management and leadership which they clearly do not have. I complained last time. This time I did not. And next time, there will not be one!!

Me and my little one stopped in after a day of shopping. The place was pretty empty so we were seating fairly quickly and the staff were very nice. 

My 2 year old loved the bread and herb dipping sauce and his kids pasta dish was the best thing we ate. I wasn't a fan of my salad as it was drenched with dressing and the mussels okay. They were lukewarm at best and the broth lacked real depth or flavor. 

I'd venture to try again. Maybe my picks on the menu weren't their best dishes.

This is more of a 3.5 stars but I'm rounding up to be nice. 

Two of my best friends came into town to visit me. One of them is fairly allergic to a lot of things. I figured a place like the Libertine would be accommodating. In fact, we called  before we headed over to see if it would be ok.

It was a Sunday night. Not a lot of people were around when we got there. My friends and I sat down and chatted for a bit. Maybe we should've figured out what we wanted... but when the waiter showed up, we weren't ready to even order drinks and he was visibly upset. We ordered a few beers (I didn't know their Urban Chestnut wasn't on tap!) and then ordered food. Due to my friend's allergies, we had a lot of questions and the waiter got visibly upset again. My friend was uncomfortable enough to stop asking questions. 

When the food came out, we were impressed by the generous portion sizes for the sides and appetizers. The corn was good. The mussels were good. My food was amazing. My boyfriend's pasta and pork belly was fantastic. One person's burger was over cooked but when we flagged down a server and sent it back, the server was accommodating and friendly. I guess we just got unlucky with our waiter.

We had a meh experience here due to a server having a bad day. The food is good and other people we interacted with were nice. I do recommend this place but I'm not certain I'll be back.

YUCK!

Unfortunately my  husband took a mystery shop at this place, so I went with him.

A Baja Frat House of sorts- neon bright yellow and blue everything with "eat me" on the tops of the tables and on the walls. I wish someone would have yelled "food fight"...

I ordered the Fajita Plate. It came with 2 sides. I chose the Borracho Beans (pinto beans with beer and bacon) and the Cilantro-Lime Rice. The sides were big but bland. All I could smell was warm beer (from the beans), so I had to put them in a relocation program. The rice was devoid of Cilantro or lime. The Fajita mix portion was very small. The tortilla's were dry. 

Even the Diet Coke was lacking carbonation. 

Missing the customary chips and salsa provided at most Mexican restaurants,  I went back and ordered some. Mistake! They season the chips with something, but all I could think of was Lawry's Season salt. The salsa was flavorless. I was asked if I wanted the salsa hot or cold. Who eats hot salsa? 

On the way out, I had the urge to belch and chest bump the guy coming in.

Now didn't reading this make you feel all warm and FUZZY!

I recently went to Acacia with my husband and mother. Mom gave us an anniversary present and it was also her birthday (we argued over who was paying the bill). Yummy experience, complete with fantastic scenery!

My husband thoroughly enjoyed his 3-onion soup appetizer, complete with crusty bread and white, leek and red onions. Tasty. He called it one of the best onion soups he's ever had. Tall compliment! Acacia provided unlimited fresh organic bread-unusual and tasty. I believe the bread choices change from day to day.

Mom & I split Thai chicken dumplings for our appetizer. They were mild, but the medium spicy sauce was off limits for my mother's tolerance levels. Wasabi was served on the side, but it sat ignored by our low-spice tolerance mouths. Excellent dumplings.

I ordered halibut, which was really tasty; I loved the carmelized or darkened effect. My husband enjoyed cioppino--a unique spicy, smoky flavor. I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of scallops, crab claws, shrimp, salmon and mussels (& more) that it contained! It was a hearty serving--and nothing was left! That was clear testimony from a happy diner.

We were treated to a dessert for the special occasion, to our delight. Unique and delicious strawberry-lime crumble with vanilla ice cream. It sounded questionable to me--however, I was game for some adventure and it was really good. Raspberry sauce was dribbled on it, and it also contained fresh berries on the side and cooked ones in the crumble.

Lovely ambiance and view from our table. It was a bit noisy for an upscale restaurant-I think that part of the ambiance was intended when it was designed. The main courses generally ranged from $22-29 or so. I'd go back in a flash. Everything was top quality and the service was excellent.

UPDATE - Stopped in today to give their new breakfast a try. 9 AM on a Sunday and it was empty. Menu is large with some unique items and of course the bakery is also on display. Service was slow , mostly the food from the kitchen. I mean really slow. I ordered two eggs with the ham steak. The ham was a thin piece of over cooked dried out ham. Sure it was a whole 'steak' but was too thin and could hardly cut with a knife. Egg whites were good as well as potatoes. We also ordered once of the Cuban type sandwiches with egg pork salami and ham. Was a bit too soggy.   We won't be going back as there are so many better breakfast options around the area. Bathrooms were unavailable at 9 am as they picked that time to clean them. Great planning. 

I also find it odd that half of  LCD screens around the dining area show advertisements for Pasco County lawyers and other services. Find it such a cheap thing for the owners to do, but I guess they have to make up some revenue for how long this place took to open. 

We won't be back for more than just a beer and app. 

I left a review a after our first visit on their Facebook page when they opened and they deleted my review and blocked me from their page. Makes me wonder how they have a 4.6 rating there and only 3 here.

This review reflects the experience that I had, but I have heard better. I went with my friend, on a friday night before New Year's eve, and we were really hoping for some dancing.  She had had a great time there before. Sadly, no one was dancing so we left. I would go back though on a Saturday night and see what the deal is.

Once again need 1/2 stars. 
Because they really are 4.5 out of 5 stars. Seriously the best biscuits I ever had. 
Fillet butterflied Oscar style is probably the best steak dish I ever eat!
The side dishes are only thing I don't love here compared to Ruth Chris or Del Friscos. It also is one of the more expensive steakhouses.

One of my favorite places to eat.
Some how the food is cooked slightly better here then Ruth's Chris else where.
But the service is not as great, still very good just not over the top like at King of Prussia.
Shrimp cocktail with remoulade sauce is an absolute must every time.
Besides that everything else is on point too.
Parking is hard but it is CC Philly what do u expect?
Just pay a couple bucks extra and valet.

Soho Backyard is the New Taco Thursday Soho hot spot! We came here Thurs for $2 Chicken tacos and $3 Mahi Mahi tacos and they were awesome! They also have gator and lobster tacos but I haven't tried those. Maybe next time. Soho Backyard is a laid back hidden bar off the beaten path behind the CVS and a bank off Howard in between Howard and Armenia and is not visible at all from Swann so while I passed by this area a lot, I literally had to use Google Maps to find this hidden treasure. This bar has $4 yeunglings and bud lights on draft and $5 wells which is pretty average. There is plenty of parking available in a private lot without valet which is nice because most places in Soho charge money for parking. Bathrooms were not the cleanest. The bartender tells us that this is a popular brunch spot where you can add a bunch of toppings to your bloody Mary's on Saturdays and Sundays. Decor has cool blue and pink led lighting and the bars have tons of hanging paintings with 4 tvs and a really big projector TV which is great for watching football games! When you're looking for a more chill bar that's less busy in Soho, this is a good spot. Bartenders tend to talk to their friends a lot so it can take some time to get a drink but I like their laid back vibe. Will be back again! :)

Best pizza in Downtown St Pete conveniently located next to all the bars and clubs and open late til 2AM. Late night they only give you 2 options- cheese or pepperoni but during the day ya can make your own pizza with whatever toppings youd like. This is a very small establishment with a counter facing the outside window and chairs and tables outside on the street. You place your order at the register and pick it up when they call your name. There is no table service or alcohol. I got the pepperoni and double spinach veggie pizza slices for $6. They got a deal for 2 pepperoni and a drink for $5 but it doesn't apply to specialty pizzas. Both pizza slices were really tasty, hot, and crisp. They have great extra seasonings to put on like Italian, garlic, Parmesan, hot peppers. Service was fast and friendly. I dont think they were running air conditioning inside because it was hot!  Will be coming back again!  Thanks!

Gallito Taqueria is a new Mexican Restaurant in a shipping container at Sparkman Wharf in the Channelside District of Downtown Tampa. "Gallito" is Spanish for "little rooster". 

Gallito Taqueria serves Duck Carnitas, Carne Asada, Pork Belly Pastor, Chicken Tinga, and Barbacoa Butternut Tacos for $4 per piece, street corn, mango with chili. 

To drink, Gallito Taqueria serves Modelo Especial Lager, Victoria Lager, Pacifico Pilsner, and Corona Familiar Amber for $6, Sangria, Pavo Real Red Blend Wine, Pavo Real White Blend Wine for $8, and Jarritos flavored sodas for $3. 

You have to stand in a long line for 45 min to place your order and then stand in another line waiting for another 10 minutes to get your order.  We ended up ordering 3 tacos which included the Duck Carnitas, Pork Belly Pastor, and Chicken Tinga. The tacos were so small, they're about half the size of regular tacos and about half the size of my phone. The Duck carnitas was my favorite followed by the Pork Belly. The tacos sadly didn't come well marinated and to my shock there was absolutely no salsa or hot sauce available, which really left these tacos quite dry and lacking flavor. Sadly, we left still hungry. If the tacos were better we might have ordered more, but with how long it took to get tacos, we didn't bother. When we placed our order, the server should have warned us that the tacos are tiny and we should order more. 

I judge all Mexican restaurants based on their house made chips and salsa and house made hot sauce but sadly Gallito Taqueria didn't even have store bought chips and salsa or store bought hot sauce so for that reason, they're gonna get a low score in my book. Add the wait time to get food, poor flavor of the tacos, no table service, no hot sauce, visiting this Mexican Restaurant was just not an enjoyable experience at all. We didn't even have a table to sit at. We had to sit on the steps which wasn't the most comfortable.

It's a shame that a real full service sit down Mexican Restaurant with an extensive menu and mariachi band, Hablo Taco, had to be bull-dozed to make way for this concept but it did bring back new life to the area. If you want a real sit down full service Mexican Restaurant in Downtown Tampa with decent sized tacos, house made hot sauces, house made delicious salsa and chips, I highly recommend going to Urban Cantina or Taco Bus instead of this place.  

Management, please stock some hot sauces, chips and salsa, offer table side service, offer larger tacos, and add better marination and more toppings to your tacos! If I do come back and see some improvements I am open to raising their score.

Jasmine Thai and Sushi restaurant is located off South Westshore in South South Tampa just before Gandy in a small Plaza with a small sigh that is easy to miss if you don't have the place programmed into your GPS. Jasmine Thai is next to Cafe European, Shanghai Chinese Restaurant, Zoe Milan Studios, and Westshore Men's Hair shoppe. There is no need to make reservations here as there is plenty of seating available, even for large parties. The decor is elegant with lots of gold, thai statues, Thai art on the walls, tile marble floor, and a large sushi bar on both sides of the restaurant. We were seated upon arrival with no wait on both of my visits. We got a half booth which was pretty comfy with padding and pillows. The music playing at the restaurant was a surprisingly random mix of genres from jazz, to Sinatra, and a jolly rock song. None of the songs were terrible or anything but I thought it was a Bit odd. Our food came out in less than 10 minutes after ordering. 

For our entree, we got the steak pad Thai and the Jungle chicken curry on our first visit and steak pad Thai and Green curry tofu on our second visit. It was absolutely adorable how the rice came out shaped liked a heart and our food was served in a round plate with the inside shaped like a Star topped with a purple orchid flower! The pad Thai and the green curry had a great flavor to it. I wasn't a huge fan of the Jungle curry. 

Our sever was pretty friendly although we did have to ask for drink refills and to close out our bill. Luckily it didn't take us long to get the waiters attention and we were in and out of there in a timely manner. Everything we've had at Jasmine Thai has been great and I really like their simply stated authentic Thai style elegant atmosphere. Our server told us that next month, Jasmine Thai will be taking over the former Beef O Bradys spot off 4516 S Dale Mabry, south of Lowe's, Britton Plaza, Eats American Grill, Crunch Fitness, Five Guys, & Jimmy Johns. I look forward to visiting them soon at their new location and trying more tasty dishes off their menu!

Was completely surprised by our experience on Christmas Eve. We frequent D. Brennan restaurants quite often, but this one will not be one of them. From the Captain who didn't want to be there to the back waiter that was a new hire as of that night trying to keep up to no avail and no help. 

We went through our appetizers before our table  received our first round of drinks and had to ask repeatedly for another round.  Not the experience we wanted to share with out of town family. 

The apathy of the staff can clearly be traced to its lack of leadership. When I asked for the General Manager's contact information, imagine my surprise when he was standing right next to the hostess and did not even inquire about the situation. Yes he did hear the conversation, he smirked when I told the hostess I would contact him after Christmas to let the holidays go by. Mr. Munoz I decided not to waste my time speaking with you since you obviously, by your lack of interest, didn't want to waste yours. 

This restaurant appears to cater to the one time visitor (tourist) and aren't concerned about the local dinner that frequent the area businesses on a regular basis.

Very enjoyable! Good tasting food for a good price. Only 1 young server who did well with about 5 tables. Large portions too. 
    Getting down to details: Odd rock music on sound system. And NO interior decor. No art, no plants. Nothing. It looks like they took over some other restaurant and just moved in. 
     We will be back.

Honestly, a little overrated, the food is average. Service was friendly. I didn't care much for the pancakes, they were dry, toppings were nothing special. With the popularity of the place- I expected a lot more. Thank god the day I went I didn't have to wait long, or I would be upset.
Must be under new management.  First visit was awful but I was pleasantly surprised this time.

There are not any true digs against Barrister's Bagel Co. Their bagels are honestly just Meh. There isn't anything to write home about, honestly. I ordered a bacon, egg and cheese poppy seed bagel toasted... there literally was no taste. I finished 2/3 of it and it was filling but again it would have been nice if there had been some flavor between the 4 main ingredients. My husband had a sesame bagel toasted with veggie cream cheese. He told me that he was disappointed because he had expected better given the reviews (we did research Barrister's before patronizing). My daughter had a toasted cinnamon raisin bagel with butter. No complaints. The bagel tasted good and it had just enough butter on it. We would give it another try but order other things. It's worth a try for yourself but we won't be going out of our way to recommend it. Also, a tip to the staff: don't talk negatively about other customers in front of current customers. It does not set a good tone.
I eat here atleast once a month. The food is pretty good, the service could use some work  though they are very unattentive.
I had a salad here the was almost $20 by the time I tipped. Let's just say I left and was still hungry. They must have washed my cup of salad in holy water touched by the Pope in Rome for that price.

I'm kinda torn between 3 and 4 stars, so I'll go with my default 3.5 stars. I made a brief stop here for lunch on my way back to western PA. FWOT is split into two main areas, the bar area and the dining area. The latter reminded me of a fast food restaurant area with menu displays and counter ordering for either eating in or take out.

I sat at the bar and ordered the 35 cent medium buffalo wings and Mac 'n' Cheese Wedges. The wings were decent and the wedges were definitely cheesy (a good thing).  I was more impressed with their variety of craft beers on tap and enjoyed a Summit Dunkle Weizen. All in all, a decent spot to grab some grub.
