I genuinely enjoy my visits to Brat Haus.  My knowledge is limited to the fries and beer, so take that for what you will. 

Though eating fries is almost always a positive experience, the fries here are particularly good.  They are seasoned the right amount, are a perfect thickness without losing crispness on the exterior, and the dipping sauces available are great.  I recommend getting the garlic and Parmesan added to your fries, though beware that it's raw garlic if you expected something else.  My favorite dipping sauces are the curry ketchup and the chipotle aioli.  As to beer, there are not many selections on tap but there are a ton of bottles available.  I would give this place four stars if it increased the draft beer selection.

As to ambience, I recommend you get a seat on the second floor's outside deck area.  It's the best location in Santa Barbara to just look out onto State Street and enjoy the relatively calm bustle of downtown Santa Barbara.  

Service is also what makes this a three star establishment rather than four.  Though the servers are always nice once they come to the table, it takes far too long for that to occur especially in the second story outside seating area.

Via Maestra gets four stars for food, five stars for ambience, and five stars for service.  I value food the most, so in the end I give it four stars, but it's certainly not far off from a five star experience.

I ordered the arugula salad with burrata and tomatoes.  The salad was a bit heavy on the arugula, but the burrata and tomatoes mixed well with it. I recommend putting arugula, burrata, and tomatoes on the free toasted bread they give you to maximize the deliciousness. The gnocchi with ricotta was great, though it came as three or four large gnocchi rather than many smaller individual gnocchi.  Out of all the items we ordered, I'd say that we could have skipped the lamb chops based on the price to taste combo.  That dish was fine, but it didn't have the same pop as the pasta dishes.

Overall, Via Maestra provides a romantic Italian experience tucked away on upper State Street. There are few restaurants that provide a cozier vibe than this, and the servers are kind and helpful.  I'd highly recommend going, and pro tip that they don't take reservations for parties under six people but they allow you to put your name on the waiting list by phone.

After walking by Audrey Claire and jealously staring at the dishes it's diners were eatting, I finally decided to come here for dinner. The wait  can really be hit or miss as they do not take reservations. 

Being a byob, I naturally gravitate towards loving the atmosphere and fresh ingredients that they use. I wish they offered the use f traditional wine glasses as the smaller ones they used were not particularly good to swirl the wine and open it up I did not pack an Aerator with me

We started with the smoked salmon flatbread which was a disappointment. We had about 1 salmon piece on the whole flat bread and it was basically a salad. The dressing they used was nice and light but I cannot recommend this dish.

Moving on to the entree round is where the restaurant received it's stars. My husband got the Australian Sea bass special. This was amazing the Sea bass was crisp yet still light and flaky. The risotto was perfectly creamy and cooked to perfection.

I ordered the black truffle potato encrusted tuna which was served with the freshest and crispest free beans I have ever had!

Though I did not prefer the glass choice and the flatbread the entrees were superb an fresh!
Great fresh local organic produce store. I like the small cozy and clean store that provides a great alternative to booths corner or a grocery store which can get crowded at times.

I love this place for lunch. The $9.99 deal with chips & salsa, app and entree is hard to beat for the quality of the food. I like that they've started adding daily specials to the lunch menu as well to shake things up a bit. I always go in and sit at the bar, it's very comfortable for solo dining and most of the bar staff is really great - they get to know you pretty quickly and have that Starr efficiency down pat. 

The soups are almost always excellent here, although sometimes a little lukewarm to my taste. And sometimes I want to tell them to slow down a bit with the food service - I know it's called the "fast lunch", but I want at least a few minutes to savor my first course before the main course comes. But overall these are minor complaints as I just find myself addicted to having lunch here every week or two, without fail. Oh, and get whatever the frozen margarita of the day is...slushy boozy goodness!

Perfectly pleasant little diner. Has a surprisingly comprehensive menu and fast service.

They did have a drive up window so this looks ideal for something quick or picking up a big order for the office.

I wouldn't call myself a biscuit snob - I will eat any carbohydrate that accepts butter - but I can judge them. If you're picky about your biscuits or are looking for something amazing, this is not your spot.

Maggie Mae's Sunrise Cafe is located in the Shoppes on Sand Key. There are other shops and restaurants in the plaza. When you go to the beach, it can be a challenge to find parking that you don't have to pay for and parking here is free while you're eating and shopping. My friend and I were looking for a good breakfast spot in the area and I've been wanting to try Maggie Mae's so there we found ourselves in a narrow, lil diner. When you first walk in, you don't expect much but when you get to the back of the restaurant, you see the beautiful intercoastal water way. It was so pretty! We decided to sit outside on that beautiful day and take in the water views.  Before my food comes, I go to wash my hands. The women's bathroom fits one person. It's small and dated but very clean and there was some interesting artwork on the wall.

We had a lot of delicious food options to choose from at Maggie Mae's but I decided on the signature Corned Beef Hash because it's house-made hash with slow roasted corned beef. It is topped with two eggs of your choice. I ordered my eggs over easy and an English muffin. I really hate the canned stuff so whenever I go to a diner, I look for corned beef hash with REAL cooked corned beef. This was the real deal. It was perfectly made and really delicious!  My friend had the Almost Famous Chicken Salad Sandwich served with wheat bread. It comes with lettuce and tomato and chips on the side. You can also make it a wrap if you want to. I broke a piece off so that I could taste the sandwich and it was good but nothing spectacular.  We loved  sitting outside on the intercoastal waterway taking in the views and eating a good meal. The service was prompt, the food came out fast, and it was reasonably priced. What more can you ask for? ;-)
I got a cheesesteak hoagie. It was extremely lame. One of the works steaks I had in a while. Should have gone with the pizza - it looked better.

Went here again recently. Same as the first time - food was exceptional as we've come to expect from "the girls". The reason for 4 stars is our server disappeared after leaving the check. Turns out we see her gabbing away with the host at entrance. After a while I got up to get her attention, and she had the nerve to signal me from across she'll be over in a minute. We all thought she was rude and unprofessional to respond that way.

Mariscos El BarCo was one of the restaurants at the recent Mercado Mexicano Yelp event.  They served an amazing Michelada red beer drink at the event and also showcased a shrimp dish.  I was happy to discover that El BarCo is owned by a former co-worker of mine who also owns the taqueria next to the restaurant.  I couldn't wait to go give it a try. 

Other than the restaurant being freezing, it was a pleasant experience.  The food is fresh and tasty.  The service is good.  I was one of only 2 people in the restaurant on a Saturday afternoon.  

The fish tacos were delicious.  It has been awhile since my one and only visit;  I'll give it another try.

The atmosphere was unique, water feature with fish and a fire pit.. mounted moose, bear.. but the service was horrible! The waitress was extremely slow..and the food was just average. The catfish had a fishy taste and was over cooked. The okra and white beans were undercooked. Hush puppies were just bland with no taste. The gator bites were ok, kinda tase like chicken. Nothing to make you want to come back. It needs work.

I really liked Puckett's.  Great live music and friendly service.  Food was southern of course.  I got the chicken and waffles and it was very simple.  The fried chicken wasn't all that special, but it was still good.  I ate it all!  

I would go back for a night of live music.  I would probably try something else though.

Food was ok. Ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp and wasn't impressed at all. The rice was dry, and the dish barely had any sauce. It was covered with coconut and peanuts, so the little sauce it had was covered with dry toppings which made it worse. The buffalo blast appetizer was very good. And I got the red velvet cheesecake. The red velvet cake was good, didn't like the cheesecake or the cream cheese frosting on it. The waitress was nice and very friendly. I'll give it another try. But maybe go for the salmon or a burger.

There is always a wait if you're trying to get in late night. It's a primarily young crowd with standard drinks and loud music. Nothing blows me away here except for the view. The view is everything and the reason why I like to frequent this place. Of all rooftop bars, this one has the best location.

The proximity of Coaches to Bankers Life will surely make it one of our pre-concert watering holes going forward. We met up with some dear friends for exactly this purpose before the Janet Jackson concert. They had several local and regional beers on tap and some decent music playing overhead. I kept looking for a TouchTunes machine, but never found one. Now as I read some other Yelper's reviews, I see that they host hip hop nights, I realize that we're going to have to go back and check that out!
Food was good but how am I supposed to enjoy a meal seated next to two screaming brats?  Ruined a nice birthday dinner.

I was really excited to come here, the menu and beer list on-line looked really exciting. I would say that the beer and some specialty mixxed drinks were a success however the food was not executed well.
We tried about 8 dishes and the only one that stood out for me was the pig tails, but even that had a terrible dish presentation.
The baked oysters, however smothered in cheese were completley tasteless of the parmigiano.
The fried mortadella was way over-fried and same for the pig sticks. The sauce that came with the pig sticks was inedible

Been here on several occasions and I found the food an acceptable alternative to the usual Pizza Huts or any take-out joints.  

Pros: decent food and variety on the menu (not just pizza), good beers and drinks selection, outside seating area, centrally located, lots of TVs tuned to sports
Cons: almost always crowded (poor service if it is crowded), very loud dining room
This place was closed sat night. I made a Rez on open table but when we showed up it was dark. So bummed as I have been dying to try this place after all the great reviews !

Months ago, my SO and I visited BSBH for burgers. They were pretty good, even if they relied too much on quirky toppings and weren't all that special otherwise. Service was slow, but we weren't in any kind of rush so it really wasn't that big of a deal. The beer list is interesting if you're a beer drinker.

Fast forward to today when we showed up for brunch around 1pm with a party of 4. It was busy and looked like a lot of tables were finishing up around the same time, so we sat down and started looking over the menus. The rush died down to the point that the restaurant was nearly empty, and we continued to wait some more. A few feet away from us, three servers stood around chatting. We joked about this and even waved our menus around. At this point, we were the only party sitting in the row of booths, and those menus are big enough to direct air traffic, so it would be pretty hard to not see us.

I'm a pretty patient person and understand that I'm not the only patron in a restaurant and not the most important person in the world. But at the 30 minute mark, in a 95% empty restaurant, now I'm annoyed, and I'm not about to beg someone to do their job.

We stood up, put our coats, and I said to the servers, "Hey we just sat here for a half hour with no service, so thanks." They looked a little confused and one mumbled "sorry." 

The brunch menu looks really good, but sadly we will not be back to try again. We'll stick to restaurants where the staff actually works.

For the 3rd time in a row, I paid for extra dipping sauces and Papa John's failed to give me the extra dipping sauces in my delivery.  I won't be ordering Papa John's ever again.  In addition to ripping me off by charging me for things I don't receive, the quality of food and service has gone downhill in recent years.
I ordered a large cheesesteak Stromboli and the chicken sampler.  I wasn't pleased at all. I wasted my $25 bucks! Live and learn

Ok I hate to be the party pooper here but I thought this place was terrible. A friend of mine raves about Soul Food Sunday and against my better judgement I went to see what all the fuss was about.  I will say I loved the eclectic decor. I could see this being a popular hang out spot with friends. I ordered the fried fish and the #1 rule to frying fish is the batter must stay on the fish. My fish arrived soggy with the batter sliding right off the fish. My husband tried the chicken and waffles and he was disappointed. I guess since I was raised on REAL soul food my standards were wayyyy to high. The only thing this place did for me was make me want to go home to my moms for a real dinner.

I take a group of teens here on an occasion. They have plenty of seating for parents and they allow you to bring your own water. that is nice. The teens have a blast and that is all I need. Plus they get great exersie. 

The food/snack area isn't bad.  I'm nto a pizza fan but it's ediable the salads are good for this type of place. They have a game area the boys like to hit while they are there. 

It's a perfect teen night/outing because parents can find a corner to plug in a computer or take ou a book and the group feels like they are on thier own but you are there just in case. 

We really like it. The only improvement I see that needs is the staff could afford to smile and be a bit more cheerful. It's like zoombie city with them.

We gave this a try this week for the first time. We made reservations for 4:30 not realizing they open at 4 so reservations were not neccessary but I would use the reservations for anything after 5pm.

Their homemade potatoe chips with blue cheese were delicious. I've had something similiar in Buckhead, GA but these were better.  My sweetheart got steak and was happy with it. I ordered salmon with a jalepno glaze. I did not care for the taste of it at all. I didn't want to say something but my sweet heart did and they were very kind in getting me another dish. On top of it my second choice was deliciouse but more expensive and they charged me for the cheaper of the two. My son had a hamburger which he orders everywhere he goes.

The food was very good. The atomphseper was very comfortable and welcomeing .  Very relaxed. The service was perfect. Very calm, nothing rushed but timely. We never went without anything. 

We will be back. Thank you.

Ok was a bit surprised at how great the pizza was. Not a very fancy place, but the atmosphere is a good place for kids and large/small groups. The drink list was not impressive.  They did have beers on tap, but I was expecting a bit more. I wanted a good mixed drink/or anything than the 6 beers they had to choose from. Come up with a better drink option for those parents who wants a drink while dining with the kiddies.

Best roof top patio in town.
 The restaurant has downsized since last year, losing it's bottom floor, but it's still roomy on the 2nd.
Good beers on tap.  Food is excellent.  Much improved since early days.  Park underground for convenience.

What a nice surprise. 
 Thanks to my friend Laini for the invitation.
The space is quiet and elegant.  The staff is so warm, friendly and professional. (Thanks to our server, Austin??)
They give you space to enjoy reading the menu.  They make recommendations.   
I watched our naan being prepared through the kitchen window.  
The food description doesn't do it justice.  It's so much tastier and beautiful than described.  I started with a mixed salad of cabbage, peppers, corn and all sorts of yummies.  My main was kafta curry.   Out of this world.  Spinach rolls basically.      The naan was off our diet plan, but we just couldn't resist half a piece each.  
Very pleasant atmosphere and excellent food.   Lunch for 2 with only sparkling water came to $48.  There is a nice wine list and full bar. I'll take my husband back for a dinner date.

I had the opportunity to eat at Anthony's Chophouse.  We started by getting the Cauliflower appetizer.  It was okay at best but tolerable. It had a unique taste that did not set well with my stomach so I gave it a D.  We next had the Anthony's Salad salad Wedge that was really a treat.  It is a must have!  I gave it an A.  Next we went straight to the main course that included the NY Strip Sirloin.  This was delightful but be sure to get medium well done.  I gave the streak a B because the steak was Luke warm but excellent flavor.  We ordered Mac n cheese as a side.  I gave it a C because it did not taste fresh.  The customer service was great I gave a grade of A.  Overall I gave the meal a B-.

High end Asian fusion in the suburbs. There's complimentary valet parking, which is always nice. A lot of reviews say it's good for happy hour or lunch spot, the dinner was a bit pricey.

Ordered: started with dumpling sampler for two and the special asparagus wild mushrooms cauliflower app.The dumplings were delicious with three type of dipping sauces. The special is a no go, small portion for $11 and it was nothing special, just a salad. For the entrées we got the Malaysian pork fried rice, Mongolian lamb and the crispy duck. The crispy duck was amazing! The duck was cooked perfectly and the sauce was a great complement to the duck. I will def order this again. The lamb was sliced, wasn't what we expected. The dish a bit fatty, more oily. The lamb itself was very tender though. The fried rice was tasty but nothing really special about it. They should add a crab fried rice that would be a good addition to the menu.

Service: the service was very attentive. The waiter had good suggestions for entrées. He checked in with us a few times and made sure that everything was okay.

Overall: I would come here again, the price point is a little high. Probably come here a couple times a year when I am craving the crispy duck!

I was in town for a convention and was staying at the Renaissance which is just a short walk from Pucketts.  I was in search of some good "country" food and I found what I was looking for.  I sat at the bar and was pleased to see a nice selection of local brews available.  I started with the fried pickles and jalapenos app - yum.  For dinner I had the chicken fried chicken which was done perfectly.  I didn't have room for dessert - which a local next to me said you have to have.  I'll try to save some room next time.

Awesome!  We had been to this location before when it was Mexican - but you wouldn't recognize the inside now.  We were able to sit outside which is a covered patio.  Perfect on a nice evening.  

For starters we shared the lobster and then the mushroom and Gruyere bruschetta.  Lobster was good - 2 sauces accompany.  The bruschetta might have been my favorite dish of the night.  Fresh mushrooms, Gruyere cheese and topped with an egg.  

Wife had halibut and I went with the filet.  Portion size was just right.  My filet was spot on temp and perfectly seasoned.  My wife loved her halibut as well as the sides on the plate.

Desert - we went with a peanut butter something (can't remember name).  It was actually a trifecta of desert - 3 different deserts on one plate.  Delish.

I can see Jansen easily on the Philly top 50 list next year.

This place is awesome! Their strawberry nutella crepe is really, really good. The crepe has a strawberry, nutella, and whipped cream filling, topped with chocolate covered strawberries. If you're craving a sweet crepe, then this is the one to get. I also previously tried an omelet from here with a side of seasoned potatoes, and that was good as well. I look forward to trying other goodies from this place (esp the pastries!).

I had high hopes.   Ordered reuben.  Bread great.  Sauerkraut interesting.  Tempeh bland.  Whatever the sauce is?  Not enuf.  I had high expectations.   I don't doubt that there isn't a ton of love in your food.  But love  and flavor are wholly different things.  Almost wanted to salt sandwich.   I never salt things.   Glad to see veggie option in the hood.   But spice it up.   Its not "Nola"   its New Orleans...

I was starting to like this place but then the third time I went- well that was the last time. They advertise 20% discount with student ID and locals but only gave me a 13% discount. I'm not arguing about the money but it just goes to show how dishonest the business is. The food is good and cheap but don't expect any customer service. The old lady at the register has quite the RBF. Also what made me decide that I won't be back-is seeing a cockroach crawl on the floor while waiting for my take-out!

We went in here on Halloween because there was no cover charge, and I always hear about it on the radio. I think we stayed for about four minutes before leaving, and we would have left sooner had my friend not already ordered a drink.

The Budlight bottle cost 6 (or 7?) dollars. 

It was really crowded, but seemed like no one was having fun.

There was a DJ, but rather than dancing, everyone was kind of facing the front watching him mix. Weird.

The upstairs was closed for VIP so I can't comment on that other than to say that I'm SO glad I'm not a VIP at this place.

It was clean. So if you are looking for a clean, expensive club, with a crowd that just stands and stares, this is the place for you.

I pass by this place all the time but somehow it took me 3 months to finally make plans to go at 5:30 pm on a Tuesday night. We were in and out of the restaurant so fast with no wait -- that's how I like it! I love a nice, clean broth that doesn't induce food coma. I got a small shoyu ramen with roast pork for $7. The meat was crispy with slightly burnt edges (I really like that actually), the egg was PERFECT with a gelatinous yolk since it wasn't cooked through all the way...yum. Definitely worth getting again. We had also ordered the 2 pcs pork buns to start our meal...I had no idea what a crispy bun was, it was quite delicious! Pretty oily, but I liked the crunch and the meat (more roasted pork) was on point.  Definitely coming back, love that it's close and a really quick meal with quality food. :]

It's a burger and fries place along with ice cream/ custard for dessert.  You can't really go wrong with this combination...

The inside was pretty clean although not completely clean, but it wasn't disgustingly dirty so that was good.

The customer service was excellent!  The people working were so nice-- what a great change!  And what a great concept that people would actually be nice to customers!

Good place to go and just hang out over some food.

This place was delicious!  Everything tasted so good and there are so many options.  My brother was with us so he helped with figuring out how things work otherwise we may have been lost.  The one big downfall I saw was that the buffet style and close seating made it a little uncomfortable.

I love this place. They're macho nachos are a must have if you go here!  They are made on a pizza pan so they are pretty big to share as an app or even have as your meal.  The tacos are really good too.  Years ago they had these Mexican pizza that was amazing! I wish they would bring it back!!!

I've popped in here a few times for drinks and once for dinner. It's a ok. Perfect for cocktails and a bite. Nothing memorable. We had the jambalaya which was lacking in flavor and the beet salad with salmon. The salad was more beets than anything including salmon. I would order it again only to split as a starter .  Atmosphere is casual and a bit dark. it's just one of those neighborhood spots you slip into for a drink and/or bite because of the convenience. I wish them all the best.

My friend and I ordered takeout from Sumo Sushi on a Saturday night in late June. The portion sizes were generous, the food was exceedingly delicious, delivery was fast, and it was a great value for the money spent.

Tuna Pumpkin (Lobster Salad wrapped in Tuna, with Mosago): 4 out of 5
This appetizer, served chilled, consisted of large chunk lobster salad rolled inside a raw tuna sashimi "pumpkin," topped with mosago. There were two "pumpkins" per order, each slightly larger than a large egg. The lobster salad was cold, fresh, succulent, and moist. The Bluefin tuna on the outside was equally fresh and delicious.

Seaweed Salad: 5 out of 5
The seaweed salad had a nice balance of crisp, fresh-tasting seaweed, light dressing, a sparing amount of white sesame seeds; and sat atop a bed of skinless cucumber spears. It arrived very cold (even in 80 degree weather) and was refreshing to eat. In terms of portion-size, it filled the better part of your standard small square plastic salad container. Fresh, cold, sweet, tangy...It doesn't get any better than this!

Volcano Roll (Spicy Tuna, Cucumber, Avocado and Tempura Crunch, served with "chef's special sauce" [spicy mayo, unagi sauce, and some other unidentifiable, yet tasty, sauce], wrapped in Soy Bean Wrapper): 5 out of 5
The sweetness from the soy bean wrapper, white rice, and unagi sauce imparted a subtle contrast to the salty soy sauce-dipped spicy tuna and creamy avocado, with a satisfying crunch of the tempura flakes and the kick of pepper from the spicy mayo. I should add that this is an "over-sized" roll, so it is twice the size of your average spicy tuna roll.

We couldn't have asked for a better takeout experience. I look forward to ordering from Sumo again soon!

Don't go here. Just don't. Well, unless you like bland food. You know when you go to a restaurant and the food is just so bad that it ruins your night? Well, this place is disappointment central.

We ordered the French Onion Soup, the Margherita Pizza, and the Pork Pot Stickers. When they arrived, we were starving. After the first couple of bites, we were shocked that food that seemed to be reasonably presented and delicious-looking from the online pictures was c-o-m-p-l-e-t-e-l-y devoid of flavor.

We decided to keep the alcoholic bebidas flowing to 1) maintain our buzz 2) get drunker so the food would taste better, and 3) be less agitated at our impending $70+ bill.

I won't go into critiquing the service at this point, but it was less than stellar as well. Just know that if Tom Hanks had had his welcome back dinner at Glenmorgan after escaping the island in Cast Away, he probably would have preferred starvation.

Service last night was disappointing...

Our waters were empty for the majority of the meal, we brought a bottle of wine which was unacknowledged by our waitress (it would have been nice if she asked to open it and/or put it in a chiller), we didn't have silverware or napkins when our appetizer arrived, and we got charged for a side of sauce that we didn't get. It seemed like we spent most of our dinner trying to flag down the waitress, when we should have been enjoying our night off and our food. 

With that said, the food was delicious, but it would have been more enjoyable if the service wasn't lacking.

First off the table was off so there was 4 of us and everytime someone put an elbow down or arm it bumped us all. Which isnt horrible unless you have food to your mouth. 
Second the waitress couldnt keep up with refills, forgot to mention that raspberry lemonade is not only $2.50 but half as small as the size of a coke and $1.00 refill. If I would have known this I would not have gotten and yes I looked at the menu all I saw was lemonade. I asked if they had raspberry she said yes. 
Third brisket was dry to me, pulled pork good. Smoked turkey if you ate it asap decent but if you stalled it got dry quick. My fiance loved the macaroni and cheese, I did not. I didn't care for the sweet potato either. Onion strings were good! And the raspberry lemonade was good for $4.50!
Lastly it took forever to get our check as well and a drink to go. We got the Bill's of course the guys just paid it. Us gals looked at it afterwards and it was allllllll wrong. Waitress and mixed up our checks, so I asked to talk to the manager because she never came back. Took him like 7mins (hes also the cook, no biggie understood). We asked if she was new, ya know newby mistake. He said no. Ok than well here's the problems... we explained the above. He said she should know better. We told her in the beginning how things were. She asked again if two checks. Just check you receipts before paying.

Fantastic view of the sailboat yacht basin from the deck!

This restaurant is a little deceiving because it looks like a little tourist diner from the street side but do not be fooled!  Walk around the side and take a look at the view.  You definitely want to ask for outside seating on the covered deck.  You will sit overlooking the sailboats and yachts and truly feel like you are having a Florida lunch!

If you are not hungry, the full bar provides a multitude of refreshments for an evening gathering.  This was a fun and unexpected surprise!

They used to prepare the most scrumptious grilled chicken banh mi with fresh, flaky baguettes and deeply marinated roasted meats, but less than a year later, the loaves are smaller and the chicken drier with plainer dressings. I still visit the bakery from time to time in hopes that the prodigal grilled chicken banh mi will return.

The restaurant was very crowded and loud as it was a Saturday night.  I ordered the NY Strip.  I was surprised at the look of it on the plate.  Ordered medium, it was shriveled and looked lost on the plate.  The meat was overlooked, dry and mealy.  After the meal the waiter asked how it was and I told him, I always order NY strip when I go to a steakhouse and this was my most disappointing in quite a while.  The waiter sent the manager over, and it was taken off the bill which was the right thing o do.  My dining partners enjoyed their meals.  However,  my husband said his filet was also overcooked.  My son got the fixe-price Ny strip.  He said his was delicious.  I should have ordered what he ordered.  Even with the entree removed the bill was quite steep for the quality and ambiance.  Lots of young servers, as a different server mistakenly put food down at our table that was not ours.  Seems like lots of help but not enough training.

Those who seek to get away, one assumes, necessarily have something to get away from, be it the crushing tedium and grinding resentment of your daily employment, the grim specter of your domestic life, outstanding charges for shooting a man in Reno (just to watch him die, presumably), etc. But, in getting away from these things, we oftentimes find that we've taken on a whole new set of problems that may potentially be worse than the ones we're fleeing. And there is little worse than The Getaway.

The tiki bar ideal rests somewhere between the exotic and the antiquated--yes, you want something with a South Seas-ish flavor, but you also appreciate it with a sense of ironic distance--you're acutely aware that you're not in Fiji or Honolulu or wherever, and take a sort of pleasure in that fact. So you expect it to be a bit campy, to serve antiquated drinks, to have a selection of red-faced, lovable drunks in beflowered shirts. You expect some sort of dusty, lacquered swordfish over the bar, sufficient thatch to equip a village of kraals, bamboo siding, a few carved grotesques. If your standards are ludicrously high, you expect the bar to be carved of koa wood, though this fact has long been forgotten and the bar itself defaced by countless rum-fueled scratchings and scrawlings.

Yet The Getaway is relentlessly modern; everything is landscaped into oblivion, to the point that the palms are visibly propped up with pylons and the furniture seems like it's off the rack at IKEA, and the spotless bar is managed by people wearing matching t-shirts and populated by a mixture of people who clearly dressed for a night out. The menus are printed immaculately on meticulously laminated cards.

No, I can't fault the place for being clean, though I can evince some existential angst at the fact that this is what passes for a tiki bar in this day and age: a shiny plastic recreation of something better somewhere else. So I'll fault The Getaway for a lot of other things instead. The parking situation is abominable (right off the Gandy Bridge, and if you don't get P.I.T.-maneuvered by one of the cars barreling down the road as you try to turn in, you're likely to be squashed by a jacked-up beach buggy whilst trying to get from your car to the bar area), the lighting has a vile sort of clinical affectation that makes you feel like you're drinking in a hospital cafeteria, the crowd is cloying and treacly, the chairs (which are clearly not meant to be beach chairs) inexorably draw you downward to a sandy grave.

Two additional offenses bear mentioning though: the drinks and the music. The drinks are fine (if spendy) so long as you stick to simple things. The rickey I had was fine, (and it had damn well better be, since it's just liquor, lime juice, and soda), but my companions, hell-bent on having the Authentic Tiki Bar Experience (tm) if it killed them, ordered some of the fruitier and blended drinks. The fruity rum drink tasted like banana-flavored antifreeze, which was perhaps not all that far from other rum drinks I've had, but my other companion, against our better judgment and the very laws of decency themselves, ordered something called a "Cabbage Key Creeper" (the very name itself conjuring poor decisions--do you really want to be the sort of person who strides manfully up to the bar and orders, in a brash tone, a "Creeper?"), which proved to be composed primarily of Kahlua and stagnant drippings from the water bowl of Cerberus, Guardian of Hades. It was one of those drinks that you sip and then immediately experience an involuntary bodily tremor, as if the lower functions of your brain were desperately attempting to forcibly expunge whatever you've been foolish enough to ingest. The Creeper sat untouched upon the (slowly sinking) table as our doomed companion went back to order a beer.

Also, the music, if "music" is indeed the right term for the cacophonous assault of seemingly randomly-distributed thuds and screeches that had been selected as the entertainment for the night in question. Yeah, you might have expected ukelele music or slack-key guitar or calypso or steel-drum music or some sort of Brazilian tango thing in a pinch, but no. This was basically what sounded like bad karaoke music for people with a preternaturally high tolerance for electronica, though not to a sufficient extent to break out the glow sticks and body glitter. it was too loud to carry on a conversation (even at an optimal distance from the stage), so our merry band simply gazed out over the water and wished (in vain) that we were listening to the tortured wailings of the damned or something instead.

The Getaway receives one extra star for its waterfront location and the patronage of local food trucks. Besides that, I very much felt, by the end, that it was a place that I had to get away from.

Irene's Cuisine made for a fun evening in both the back bar (with live music) and the dining room. The wait staff is saucy and likes to dish it out with the guests, which works for me. Others may not enjoy this so much, but knowing that now, just avoid the place.
The dining experience was somewhat of a mixed bag as the salad and appetizer were just okay, but the entrees were quite good. We experienced the crusted lamb chops and the fish special that day (Drum). Both were cooked very well, and were tasty. The service is very attentive and lively, with the traditional white coats and table mannerisms. The cocktails were well poured and presented.....I think they have done this before! All in all a very good choice, and I will definitely return.

This place is pretty good, but honestly, I'm not dying to go back. I don't love hamburgers though so perhaps this is an unfair critique. It was fun to try their ketchup varieties, but other than that... I'm not sure what all the hype is about.

I have no experience with "hot chicken" so I may be missing the point when I describe Joella's as greasy and messy. I liked the spice but disliked the pool of oil that collected under the white bread that held the quarter-white portion. Could just be me.

I do have experience with counter-order fast casual restaurants and I find that on this night the system didn't work. Hard to explain. The place basically serves chicken. There are only a few options. Yet we stood in line for a long time while customers figured out how to deal with the menu and how to pay for their meal. Something needs to be adjusted.

I also have experience with restaurants in general and for a place that's been open for a little more than a year, Joella's seems tired and worn. For the hour we were there, I didn't see anyone clean a table. No sparkle to the place.

We ordered chicken, just like everyone else. After 15 minutes or so, the cashier came to us apologetically and said the kitchen hadn't made up enough of the quarter-whites and it was going to take another 15 minutes or so to get our order out. This with maybe 10 other customers in the house (not counting take-outs). We waited. He did graciously offer us complimentary desserts.

In the end, we used lots of napkins to wipe our hands, picked up our pie-in-a-jars (an uncalled-for innovation) and left without much enjoyment. Everything above can easily be fixed and I hope they do.

If I could give this restaurant 0 stars, I would. First off, I am not sure how many smoke breaks our server needed to take within a 45 minute visit, but it was enough to smell like a Van Halen concert. The chicken Parmesan sandwich I ordered took a half hour to make with about 3 other customers in the dining room. Afterwards the little gossip group behind my table kept asking when their paychecks were coming, and after requesting to speak with a manager I was told, "there is no manager he hasn't showed up yet". Needless to say this place is a complete dive and there is a reason it's empty. It's awful!

I finally made it here for the first time, after much anticipation. The food was authentic, fresh, and flavorful. The experience was not relaxing in any sense. The employee taking orders was kind of rude and rushed us along. The place is tiny and extremely crowded. There is nowhere to walk, move, or even be comfortable. It kind of causes an anxiety. It seems very disorganized. There is a long wait for food, so much so that we thought we were forgotten about, so we asked the cooks. They also became rude and said "no questions, I will get to it when I get to it". When the food arrived, it was delicious. It's worth a 5 star rating on flavor alone. I got the combo, which is enough for two meals at least, and is only $5.00! The food is awesome, but they need a bigger place and better customer service.

Ordered the hummus plate with feta, which was supposed to come with pita.  When delivered, did not include the feta (but I was charged for it) and there was no pita for the hummus.  Called the restaurant and they said they would deliver the items but they never came.

I stopped by Bacco for a quick lunch and I was pretty disappointed. At first I was pleasantly surprised by the large menu and reasonable lunch prices. Bacco served free bread rolls that are really greasy and really salty. I admit they taste decent, but they could do without all the grease. 

I had the veal Carciofi, which consisted of veal medallions, served with pasta in a white wine sauce for $12. The veal was alright, but the portion was laughably small - literally two medallions! The sauce was served with ham and capers so it was really salty and really garlicky. The sauce tasted as if the chef had doused the meat in lemon sauce, it was absurdly sour. 

My mother had a chicken salad, it was fine but the vinaigrette was shockingly sour. It was lemon juice and vinegar with nothing to cut the acidity!

My mother likes to drag me here when I pop by the house. The menu is a little overwhelming consider the array of choices that mix flavors from different parts of the globe. They also have some of the unhealthiest options I've seen in quite a while. Is that a whole cow between those buns? The portions are hearty to say the least, but the food still isn't anything to write home about. I find the flavors to be muddled or hidden beneath too much spice. It's a good place for mom and dad to take the kiddies on a Saturday night. It's also popular with meat-head men and their dates looking to get trashed while they watch the latest game. The bar still allowed smoking as of my last trip and that was a major turn-off as the smoke tends to waft into the dining room. Plus: the Abington Pharmacy next door where you can grab some chocolates to replace the unoriginal dessert you just ate next door.

Wow that was some flavorful Mexican! The vegetables quesadillas were AMAZING. chicken fajitas were also really good. Table side guacamole was alright. Very friendly staff. I would definitely recommend this place

I don't know why this place is always packed, the pizza is NOT good. It's decent, but with better options around (Angelinos, Pizza Vetri) I recommend treating yourself to something a little better. The fries have no flavor and needed to be in the fryer a little longer.

Well I enjoy Bdubs every once in while. They have a nice array of sauces and no matter where I go, I haven't found a better onion ring sauce. 

This particular Buffalo Wild Wings is conveniently located in a strip mall at 86th and Township Line.  
The food is what you expect. Good but not special. 

Where I wish they'd step their game up is in the service area. I had a server a few months ago whom I assumed was new so I chalked it up to that, but had her again last night and I guess she thinks acting like she doesn't know anything and can't remember the drink specials and bringing the wrong drinks is fine.  But it just isn't.  

That said, I'm sure I'll be back. I just can't resist those onion rings.

How? How does this place get such amazing reviews? How have I heard about it for so long? I must have come on a really off night because it wasn't good in any sense of the word. For starters, the host took about 2 minutes looking at the seating chart to figure out where to seat us, mind you, the restaurant was pretty empty, I think there were maybe 5 tables of people and that was it. She finally looked up and said "I'm just trying to figure out which server is going to be the fastest." Hmmmmm....that doesn't instill confidence that we are about to get good service. We sit down and it takes about 10 minutes for our server to come to our table. Not a great start but I've worked restaurants before, I'm pretty forgiving so we ordered our waters and food while he was still around, I didn't want to wait another 10 minutes before he came back to order food. Our friends that we were with mentioned that the menu had changed and that the prices were higher than they remember. About 10 minutes later some biscuits were brought to the table, but only 3...and there were 4 of us...so another server brought another one around about 5 minutes later. The biscuit was good, I will give them credit that it was a really tasty biscuit. The food came out and I had ordered a chicken sandwich ($16) and it was so overly fried and tough it was really hard to eat. Also, it was just chicken, lettuce, tomato and I think aioli, no cheese, nothing to stick it all together, to give it any flavor. It definitely wasn't worth $16 and it was one of the least expensive menu items. The mac and cheese side was okay, I don't get why people think so highly of it, it was just soupy cheese and some noodles. It took about 20 more minutes before we got the checks and then another 10 to get our cards back. The night took about 2 hours, which was fine because we were hanging out with friends and it gave us plenty of time to talk. Even though the service was slow, the server and the hostess were very friendly.
Excellent jambalaya! Will definitely come back to try out the jumbo. Service could have been a tad friendlier but it was a busy weekend with a ton of people coming in for the flower show.

New ramen place was amazing. We were going to head to Terakawa originally but they were getting ready to close. This place still had an hour left of time. We hit it up and ordered the ramen. Not much of a selection but OH MY GOD that broth was GOOD. Can't believe there are so many ramen places opening up. This one was slammiiiing. Oh and space was plentiful. Can't say that about the other ramen place where it fills tight. This one was nice and airy. Maybe it's because we were there late? Who knows. I liked that it was low traffic. The bubble tea was okay. Nothing to write home about. The ramen is where its at.

And how cute is it that they serve your receipt on a Naruto book? HA! I loved it.

Hit it up before it gets so popular that you can't move.Maybe I should say this place sucks it won't get overcrowded like the other place. 

This place sucks. Nobody visit. Go to the other ramen place.

Parking is awful.
Takes too long. 
Dirty.
Service is bad. 
Expensive.
Not good. 

Did I sum it up for you?  If not:  GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

It's a ladies, really "experienced" ladies, lunch place. Food is so-so. I had quiche. You would think the pastry would be extra special at a French bakery but if was rather thick. The egg mixture was fine. I liked getting fresh vegetables as a side. The bakery looks great but I didn't sample anything. The macaroons in multiple colors was beautiful. Lbb has been in this location for over 30 years. They are doing something right.
I liked this place and really want to return. But the prices are so outrageous for what you get it just isn't worth it. Example 4 medium shrimp wrapped in bacon for $14! Really?

Had a great casual meal here the other night. Dropped by during the evening rush hour so the place was a madhouse: placed our orders at the kiosks. Picked up a salad and a stir-fry for my wife to eat-in the restaurant. Both were very good; would go again!
Came for the popular Seamus Benedict. Salmon was seasoned perfectly, but the dish was flooded in hollandaise sauce. So much that it was hard to taste the flavor of the poached egg.

While I still love the Mini Doughnut Factory, Little Donut House is definitely a close 2nd. They made the doughnuts fresh for me so they were nice and warm when I got them. They have a ton of options for doughnuts and serve Buddy Brew coffee. I got the smores (my favorite), boston creme, nutella, strawberry shortcake, cookies and creme, and the peanut butter. I will definitely be back to try more flavors!

omg.. yuuuuummmmmm
sandwiches are awesome.  great seating outside.  great service, clean and friendly.

There is really only one reason to go to union jacks: the deep dish pizza. Outside if Chicago, this is the best place to get a deep dish pie. If you ask, they might even make you the lasagna deep dish, even though it's not on the menu. Fair warning, it does take about an hour to get one of these pies. 

The rest of the food here is not memorable, and the service leaves a lot to be desired.

On my last visit, we were seated quickly and ordered some sandwiches and drinks, during a slow dinner time. We got the drinks quickly, but the food took a while. They were out of some of my favorite local beers, so I decided to try a local gingerbread beer. I hated it. I don't find myself hating beer much, and I can't remember the last time I couldn't drink a beer that was placed in front of me. But I took one drink and that was the end. 

After the waitress cleared our plates, she asked why I didn't drink my beer. I told her I didn't like it. She told me I should have said something, but in reality she hadn't been back to our table since bringing our food. She did however bring me a different beer, which was delicious. But she forgot to bring the second round for one of my companions, which she didn't notice until she returned 20 minutes later to see if I liked my beer. 

Overall, we were looking for a quick dinner and spent over an hour in the place. Come hungry for a deep dish pizza or don't come at all.

Walked in after taking the last parking spot in their lot. Parking stinks in this area so good luck! We sat at the bar and ordered and IPA and a stout. Both were HOB brews and good. As we enjoyed those we read all of the signs. A small sign way up to the right of the many said Thursdays after 7 pm 2 for 1 on a few choices and we happened to order the blueberry beer so we received 2 for 1. 

Now, as we were enjoying our 2nd one the new shift came in for the evening. We also looked around and we noticed the crowd. This place was full of 20 and 30 something HIPSTER people who were growing louder and louder as time went on. Staff turned into 2 20 something female bartenders who had no idea how to actually 'wait' on customers. People sat with empty beer glasses needing refills for long amounts of time and neither 'bartender' asked what they wanted next. They would rather gossip at each other at the end of the bar. When your sole purpose at work is to wait on people... do it. These two customers will not be back. The 'bartenders' sealed the deal. 

They offer t-shirts which were pretty neat. We liked several of their designs. 

They have dart board and a life size Jenga game which is positioned in the middle of the bar. When it topples over watch out because the bricks go flying and it is LOUD!!! Another disappointment. Put rubber pads down so it doesn't sound like the place is getting bombed. Or better yet, move it outside. 

The layout of this place is interesting. I am not sure if they bought this place this way or they added walls but it has zero flow and is not aesthetically pleasing at all. 

There is a nice patio out front which is covered so you can enjoy it on those super sunny hot days or those rainy days. There is also a patio out back which is you more low key typical garden patio. 

Bathroom was clean but had a weird chalk message on the wall. The garbage can was located in the other corner of the bathroom which made it impossible to open the door with a napkin and then get it into the garbage can. Hopefully they put an open garbage can by the door so people aren't throwing paper towels on the floor. 

All in all we enjoyed the beer which is what we set out to do today. But the staff and ambience were a huge let down. Prices were fair. They do offer 5 and 12 oz pours along with 16 oz. 

We won't be back. What is with HOB? This is our second one (Palm Harbor was the first) and they are both not enjoyable. Many people would probably disagree as lots of people were having fun. Could be a really neat place if they made the right changes.

This hyped up donut shop in Philly is very efficient even with it's long lines. The donuts were honestly just okay and nothing really that special. The actual donut base itself wasn't very moist and the flavors that they offered weren't really unique. Pretty generic! I wouldn't come back here if I wanted donuts in Philly.. I feel like I would've appreciated this more if it wasn't overhyped.

Came here for a family meal after seeing a 4.5 star review on yelp. The place was clean and the staff was very nice. The food was hot and fresh. The biscuits came right out the oven. After reading the reviews, I made sure to ask for MILD chicken but it definitely was not mild. Wish I would've payed better attention to the reviews that said the chicken was very spicy because it definitely was too spicy. It tastes a lot like Popeyes and that was what we were trying to avoid, we were hoping for more of a country fried chicken. Even the red beans were super spicy.

We ordered a steak, salad, and baked potato meal to-go and they brought the order out on time and everything was prepared as ordered. With the steak, salad, baked potato, and side of bread the meal is definitely fit to share or definitely depend on having leftovers. There is plenty of parking and our server/waitress to-go was very friendly.

Meh. Ordered two orders of wings. One traditional in Jamaican jerk sauce and one Buffalo (they are their non breaded with skin on wings) in garlic Parmesan sauce. I asked for them to be "extra extra crispy". They were not crispy what so ever. There was no garlic Parmesan taste at all- barely covered in any. Very bland. One star for the Jamaican Jerk sauce and an extra star for the good customer service the girls provided during pick up. That's about it.

ZERO STARS IF I COULD!!!!! I was craving their sushi for a while so I went today.. HUGE MISTAKE!!!
The cashier with the red highlights in the front of her hair (didn't get her name) decided to pet a dog (because God Forbid anyone in Santa Barbara goes to eat without their dog), and she had gloves on, she decided not to change her gloves after touching the dog goes in the restaurant and starts packing food. She did that before she packaged my food and the rest of the customers for the rest of the day. So  disgusting. Sushi Ai please teach your workers how to be sanitary! Or hire people who don't have attitudes because she had one as well along her lack of cleanliness. I threw out the food I drove 20 mins for to get that I was looking forward to away. I WILL NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN. I will order from the much cleaner and nicer sushi restaurants in my area.
Hmm. Food was good. Atmosphere was good. Service was good. Wasn't anything I will remember forever. That's about all I have to say on that.
I very much enjoyed my meal here. Place isn't fancy nor is the food but it was good. Buffet style and there was plenty of it. I would go black in a heartbeat.

The staff were fantastic, quick, friendly and attentive throughout the meal.  The chicken quesadillas are good, but the beef enchilada is not that great.  The ground beef poor quality, tortilla is too thin, way too much cheese.  I could only eat half of it.  Margarita was OK, not much tequila and served in a plastic wine glass?

We love this place.  We have been multiple times, tried most of the menu, and everything is delicious.  My favorite is the breakfast burrito.  Also a wonderful kids' menu.

I met the owners and their family on my last visit, they couldn't be nicer.  A great addition to Havertown eating.

I had a similar experience to Elise S. -- I called in an order, they told me 20 minutes.  I came 20 minutes later and then waited 30 more minutes for my order.  Sat awkwardly. 

To boot, I had only ordered 2 sandwiches.  One was soggy, the other real just bland tasting.  Not worth a 50 minute wait.  Also no one apologized or even talked to me as I waited.  Just talked on their phones.

Not going back.

Great for one or two drinks, but the prices are ridiculous.  Unsurprisingly, the entire staff has that "don't you know how special our drinks are?" attitude.

Go for happy hour to enjoy the ambiance, then move on.

Wife and I went here to check it out, skeptical of the three star rating going on there so far.

This chain had received so much hype that I thought the food had to be at least pretty good and the loud flagrantly gay atmosphere would be enough fun to make up for it.

It wasn't.

Don't get me wrong - the atmosphere was great, everyone was SUPER friendly and all, the food was just that bad.

I LOVE to eat, and I love to eat burgers most of all, but I couldn't even finish the poor excuse for a Wendy's burger they served me.  How hard is a freakin burger?  Especially an 11 dollar burger, c'mon...

Just such a bad food experience I can't justify eating here again.

Great pizza and a solid beer selection. We also like the shrimp appetizer. Kind of like a bang bang or firecrwcker shrimp from other restaurants. Definitley recommend for a good carryout option on your way home from work.

I can't believe that it took my vegetarian ass 6 years of living in Philadelphia before I took a trip to Horizons. My friend Josh suggested it for a group dinner to start my birthday weekend off right - and that it did. 

We arrived with a pretty large group (8) and while we had to wait a bit for our reservation, they gave us a great table in the center of the upstairs back room. I'm not used to making decisions when every menu item is a possibility, and it was a real treat. Between the group we ordered almost every item on the menu, and they were ALL delicious. I got a big kick out of all of my carnivore friends ooohing and ahhing over their dishes - no meat was missed! 
I also had some great mixed drinks. 

While it's a little pricey, and the art upstairs could use a major makeover, and the wait staff was SLOW (perhaps because they had a guaranteed  tip) the space was great, and the food was fabulous!

Went to this location yesterday around noon. Where do I begin. They were not busy, AT ALL, so my terrible experience cannot be "excused" by saying they were just overwhelmed from being so busy. The place was practically empty. It was me and a friend, so it's not like we were a big group. It was just two people. They took his order, and walked away from the counter. Didn't come back to take my order for another 12-15 minutes...and he had to ask for his cup to get his drink. When they were taking my order, cashier about charges me for FOUR orders. I ordered one thing and they told me it was $28.00. Nope....check again. I ordered a 3 piece chicken ($6 lunch) and upgraded to a small blizzard. Got it with gravy, they gave me honey mustard. I had to go up there and wait another 7-10 minutes to get that fixed. Then, when I was finished eating...I had to go BACK up there and get my blizzard made. And let me add this....there was a lady int here and they messed her order up too. There was also a family of three and they messed their orders up too. Every person in that place (total of 6 people)....they messed up EVERY. SINGLE. ORDER. My goodness. Terrible experience.

My review is based on donuts, because it's a donut place, right? My first experience here was one Saturday morning when I was craving a donut because I hadn't had carbs all week. I got the blackberry black pepper donut because it was absolutely beautiful and I love berries. It was served to me in a fancy little personalized donut box, for $3. Hmm, I wondered, three dollars for one donut seems really expensive, it must be this fancy little box, I should probably keep it. Well, it was the box because the donut was not good. There was no flavor, I was expecting some berry flavor mixed with spiciness, but it just tasted like a glazed donut. The only time I got berry flavor was the bite with the whole blackberry garnish. The bottom was greasy. The consistency of the dough was thick and heavy. I was not going back, but my husband brought home a donut for me recently so gave it another shot. A bourbon something or other, right up my alley. Same problems as the first donut. Greasy bottom, tough, thick dough, no flavor beyond sugar sweetness. But this one did have one good bite that contained the bourbon flavor. But it was just one bite, not enough to justify the cost or eating the rest of the donut to find it. If you are looking for a good donut and not a hipster experience, I highly recommend Southshore Donuts on Downman Rd.

Came here for date night tonight, was seated outside near the pretty garden area. The waitress wasn't the friendliest And didn't seem to care too much, didn't introduce herself or suggest anything just asked what we wanted.
Ordered the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer .,,,, I don't suggest you order theSe I feel like they came straight out of the SAMs club box in the freezer with the usual marinara sauce. Not impressed.
Ordered a pizza to share Split hAlf and half veggies vs meat. The pizza look delicious and tasted the same both of us were really impressed and enjoyed the pizza. Definitely recommend the pizza to anyone who stops here.

Sunday brunch was the goal.  We needed to power up prior to finishing up our holiday shopping.  I gotta admit I was pretty wowed by the amount of space this place has to offer.  Love the atmosphere.  Feels like your in a hotel restaurant of a 5 star hotel.  We started of with a 2/5 star mimosa. Sorry, it just tasted cheap.  I could seriously make it better at home.  We placed an order for the beignets first because it takes about 15 minutes to make.  I ordered the 3 eggs, hash, and wheat bread.  The bf got the chicken and waffles.  My hash came out room temperature.  Just disappointing.  I would usually send it back, but I just let it go. why? IDK.  Everything else was so-so.  I had a tasted of the waffle and they were actually fluffy and moist.  I was expecting it to be hard and tasteless.  OMG that's just a horrible outlook.  The bf said chicken was decent.  So 15 minutes pass and we finally got our order of the beignets.  What a waste!  I don't know what everyone is raving about.  These were pretty disgusting.  Even with the 3 accompanied sauces and the one cinnamon dip it was still bad.  If you want real beignets then you should check out woodbury station cafe.  The best I have tasted locally.  I would like to try this place out for lunch or dinner, hopefully it gets better from here.

Not crazy about Bamboozle. It was just okay.

What I do appreciate about Bamboozle is the variety on the menu. I also like that there are small sized pho so if you're looking for a quick bite you can get just enough before or after any downtown activity. The help yourself water station is cool too. I also like the restaurant's proximity to Curtis Hixon Park.

What I didn't appreciate is that it took a long time to get food and boba drinks. I also didn't that I the food was as tasty as an authentic Vietnamese restaurant. The broth in the pho lacked flavor. I liked that I was able to get a beef lemongrass banh mi, but the French bread wasn't up to par. The boba drinks weren't as good as what you can get elsewhere either. I could barely taste the taro in my boba smoothie.

All in all I would probably come back if I was in the mood for a small soup when downtown as opposed to tacos or anything else, so I give it a 3 star despite not being blown away.

Steak and macadamia nuts. Nuff said!

Kidding. 

It took me 11 months to write this as my 400th review. A special number for a special restaurant. HubbyStanks and I do steak for the Anniversary wherever we are and since we were in town he took me to Bern's. 

For dinner I ordered THE best steak, chateaubriand medium rare. It melted in my mouth. No one talks about the carrot side, which doesn't look like much, but I love it as much as the onion rings. The macadamia nut dressing for the salad is a dream come true. Macadamia nuts are my favorite nut. the French onion soup is delish. You get a whole lot when you order your steak. The experience, including impeccable service from staff who have been with Bern's a long time, isn well worth your dollar.

You must tour Bern's at least once to really appreciate its fame. The kitchen is a machine and the wine cellar is truly iconic. 

The dessert room is a must. Again, macadamia! Macadamia ice cream is always on the menu and is fine alone, but there are desserts featuring macadamia and the ice cream. Coffee is a must with dessert...if you're not drinking wine of course. The regular coffee is made in the same coffee machine that's been around since Bern's inception and makes it delicious. 

A wonderful place to spend a special evening.

I really wanted to like Tom + Chee. I've had the donut grilled cheese at events and I thought it was pretty good. Unfortunately the concept of this restaurant is better than the taste. I actually ate at a place in downtown Denver last summer with the exact same concept, but it tasted a lot better. 

I loooove grilled cheese and I make a mean grilled cheese (and many grilled sandwiches) so I really expect a grilled cheese restaurant to do a better job. 

The sandwiches aren't cheesy enough. The bread isn't as crisp and buttery enough. The tomato soup isn't tasty enough. The salad is basic.

I give this 3 stars because if it were closer to me I'd still come for a convenient lunch. However, I'm never going to drive all the way out to Saint Pete and pass all the wonderful restaurants to the Tyrone neighborhood just to get a mediocre grilled cheese sandwich that didn't blow me away.

I try to only indulge in the Brazilian Churrascaria experience about once per year so since Bull Grill opened recently it's been on my to-eat list! 

It's a lot smaller than the chains, but the service and meats are up to par. The salad bar spread is smaller, but the quality of the items on the bar are really good and kept clean and presentable. My favorite bar items was the paella, hearts of palm, black beans and the cabbage salad.

I think it's a great alternative to the chain in town and I would recommend it to anyone wondering if they should go. The food and the service is fantastic. Some meats I liked better than others. Surprisingly, I liked the chicken and chicken hearts the most! The Parmesan crusted steak was just okay. The other beef options were tasty. The lamb was melt in your mouth delish.

What I think should be changed:

1. Add more salads & veggies to the salad bar. Way too many mayo based salads as opposed to actual veggies.

2. More lamb choices. Was there for almost 2 hours before a piece of lamb was offered. Would be nice to see lamb chops and a leg of lamb.

3. More than one cheese on the salad bar please.

4. Tea shouldn't be charged refills.

5. The price point should be more like $23 for what you get. 

6. The 12% service charge is unnecessary and will probably get people not to leave a better tip since you assume people won't leave one. My family usually leaves an average of 20%...more for great service and less (15%) for bad service. So the service charge addition is insulting when the party isn't 8 people. I'd be curious to know if this was only imposed on my family.

7. Pass the chicken hearts more often. :)

I'm rounding up on 3 1/2 stars as I think it's a decent spot with positives that outweigh the negatives. 

I've only had lunch here and I say it's a good bang for your buck. If you happen to be in the area it's AYCE good Indian fare. We've even taken our children here and they liked the selection too. The saag paneer is very good here, curry goat is always a meat choice and the naan is hot and tasty.

It's attached to a gas station, so that can be off putting to many. If you're like me, you realize that you find some of the tastiest foods in locally owned hole in the walls...even local convenience stores. Soooo this convenience store decided the best use of square footage would be to place a small restaurant inside! There are about 4 tables and room for the buffet. There's even a sink to wash your hands in the corner (they probably had no choice, but in glad it's there).

The biggest negative is parking. Since this gas station shares the Westshore mall parking area and kennedy is a busy street, parking can be a pain.

Since I don't find myself in the area during the work week as often as I used to I don't see myself going out of my way to eat here, but if the same restaurant were close to my home I would frequent it. If I am in the area the choice to eat here would really be based on if I can find a parking spot or not since there are many food choices in the area.

I'm glad I didn't review this place the first time I ate here. I wanted to make sure it wasn't just one good dish, or a good day. I had to come back several times over the course of a few months to make sure I wasn't dreaming...that I didn't have to drive to the east side of Tampa to get a decent taco. 

The tacos aren't just decent they are fantastic and the Sopes are out of this world. I go for the ribeye and shrimp dishes. The sauces are spicy and delicious as well. 

Here you can get an agua de Jamaica that isn't so tart that you can't drink it. It's a bit sweet for me (by nature they all are). 

The staff is extremely friendly. The joint itself is tiny since you dine in the front room of an old house. The seats fill up fast if you're dining in. 

I have only one complaint. It's not this way all the time. I guess I should expect this to occur every so often by now. This has happened at every taco place I've ever frequented so I won't dock a star for it: I go to squeeze a cut lime onto my taco and it's dry as hell.

The food looks decent, but we never actually got to try it due to the service we received when we arrived. The service started out fine, but gradually progressed from very disheartening to atrocious. 

Although we didn't have a reservation, we were told that a table would open up in 20 minutes, to which we gladly put our name down and patiently waited for our seats. Twenty minutes later, an outdoor table opened up and we were given the option to sit there. Since it began raining and there were no parasols, we agreed to sitting there as long as we could move to the next available indoor seats once they opened up. We were even willing to take seats at the bar, if those were going to be available sooner. 

After sitting outside holding our umbrellas, it took at least 15 minutes for our server to give us menus and the server never came back to take our drink order. This was 1.5hrs after we initially put our name down. Meanwhile, a table of 4 which came in after us and sat at the other outdoor table was already receiving their entrees. At that point, I walked into the restaurant to ask about our MIA server and saw two open seats at the bar, which we ended up moving to (these seats had been vacant, but no one had come out to let us know as promised). While we were sitting there, the bartender never made eye contact with us and left us with dirty glasses and graying guacamole stains from the previous customers. After a while, I politely asked the bartender to remove the dirty glasses and stains, but the bartender acted as if we were bothering her. 

Having worked as a server in busy, high volume restaurants for 3 years during college, I'm pretty understanding of delays if I can see good effort (good communication, hustling, a good attitude under pressure), but this was not the case. I don't mind waiting, but we were very hungry and I would have liked to know if we'd have to wait 2 hours so we could decide whether to get food somewhere else. We could have had an entire meal somewhere else during that time, but instead we ended up having to go to another restaurant near their closing time, which was completely unnecessary. Despite that, the other restaurant's staff was friendly and attentive. I'll definitely know where to go next time I'm in the neighborhood.

Not sure why the good reviews.  My daughter picked up chicken soup for me bc I was sick.  The soup was bland - pretty watery, no seasoning at all.  The matzo ball had no taste.  I'm guessing it sat in water way too long.  I've eaten there before and frankly, it is not  good.  Being from Chicago may slant my opinion some but they need to use some seasoning I their foods,

Delicious burger - I had a cheesy green chile cheeseburger. Plenty of cheese! It  would've been better on a pretzel bun, the bun it came with crumbled horribly. Not sure if the bread was fresh or maybe it was toasted a little too long. I ordered a pitcher of back 9, which really needed to be sweetened. Our waitress brought us simple syrup after we asked for it. The tea was completely unsweetened, which was a little unexpected. We had a large party, but our waitress really took good care of us.

The food isn't all that great but I have to admit everything seem very artsy. The place looks amazing and the way they decorate their food makes it look good. However, everything tastes bland and every dish was merely the same. It's a bit pricey as well compared to La Thai.

Just in case no one has caught on yet, Nam Phuong has switched owners some time in the past few months.  I didn't think there would be such a noticeable decline in their food so soon after the change.  The original Nam Phuong team has permantly moved to the other smaller Nam Phuong, now renamed Nam Son.  (16th and Washington)

I never thought the smaller Nam Phuong/ Nam Son was that great but since the change, the food there has gotten a lot better.  They have Vietnamese hoagies there, which is a definite plus.  Actually, the menu is almost the same as the Original NP with a few more items.  However, it is a smaller restaurant, in a shadier neighborhood, with no liquor license.  But hey....it could be the Vietnamese Tiffin.  I guess it depends on your priorties, better food or bigger restaurant.

The service in both places is spotty however.  Neither the new owners nor the old owners have figured out how to correct this issue.  You get what you pay for I suppose.

Today we went in for brunch, we were met by the hostess who seated us near the rear ( which was fine ) but once the waitress came over the entire meal was just '' painful '', by that she was rude, because my wife had to use the rest room & just was seated when she demanded our order, she was miffed that we asked to given us a few moments, She bought us unsweetened  iced tea that had a after taste, the cheese omelet was over cooked, the home fries were burnt, pancakes were small by other restaurant standards, this place has been around for a long time but with what we saw we will never be back because we do not like being rushed through our meal when the place was pretty empty so there wasn't a back-log of people waiting to be seated. All good things must come to an end ......... sad

Been here a few times since it opened and few decent restaurants were here but with progress more similar places have opened. And as a result the quality of the foods served have suffered for the sake of stockholders profits. Their salads and breads are ok but the entrees are loaded with salt and ( honestly ) taste re-heated from being frozen ? Too bad causevthey could be so much better.

The thanksgiving turkey burger is pretty good. The patty is thin but moist. I like the addition of butternut squash in it.

Fluffernutta is a disappointment. I didn't taste Nutella, no marshmallow fluffs. one side is grilled but not the other side . I won't order it again.

I had Caesar salad with crunchy haddock. The fish is perfectly cooked with crunchy crust. The romaine is fresh

The coffee eclair is my favorite. The lemon tart is perfect, and so is the chocolate tart, which was recommended by the chef. Definitely get the brioche almond French toast. The traditional and chocolate financier are highly recommended, very light and addictive.

Cash only but there's an ATM in the restaurant. 

This place isn't spacious. Tables are close to each other. Came in on Sunday night and it was packed. I made reservations through Google, so convenient.

The complimentary blue corn chips is served with red and green salsa

I started with cactus salad. It's very delicious. Cactus is perfectly cooked, fresh and not soggy with perfect amount of olive oil. It's served with very mild cheese cut in very small dice. It's a good appetizer.

Salmon in lemon sauce is served with creamy sauce with rice and fresh steamed broccoli and sliced carrots. Salmon is on the well done side so it's a little bit overcooked. The lemon is subtle but perfect compliment to the salmon.

My husband had tuna which is special menu. It's served with beets and sugar cane. Since it's Christmas time, it's decorated with a poinsettia. No wonder I  noticed that the poinsettia in the kitchen was bald by the end of the night. My husband really enjoyed his entree.

For dessert we ordered lava cake. It's served with strawberry ice cream and diced mango. I was very disappointed when I cut the cake because I didn't find the oozing melted chocolate flowing down from the center of the cake. It's basically only a warm chocolate cake. That's why I took a star down because it's definitely not a lava cake.

Service was great. The waiter gave great descriptions on the specials.

Nice presentation of the food too.

Very trendy hangout place. Most of the tables are communal where you share a long bench with other people. You can hangout at the bar or outside. Menu is very short. You can overlook the brewery from a glass door at the back. You can have tours of the brewery. 

Bavarian pretzel: don't get this. It's not Bavarian at all compared to Brauhaus. Very hollow and chewy crust. The mustard is really good though

Green salad: very fresh 

Ahi poke: fresh fish and served with sesame and macadamia which give crunchy texture. I mixed it with my salad to make it poke salad.

Pickled veggies: very fresh, has cucumber, beets, cauliflower, and carrots 

BBQ platter: this is the best meal. Sausage has perfect smoky flavor, brisket is very tender and melts in your mouth. The corn bread is soft and crunchy. The cabbage slaw is good. It's also served with potato salad which a little bit too salty. The serving size is for two people. It comes with short ribs too. 

Service is great. Very friendly staff, food comes out fast.

You can take home some beer and merchandise on your way out.

The review is for delivery orders: 

Cauliflower appetizer: my favorite. It's creamy but not soupy. Dairy free. There's shredded coconut in it to give some crunchy texture. The cauliflower is soft, just melts in your mouth.

Eggplant appetizer: it's soggy but the sauce is delicious.

Vegetable samosas: it is big.  The skin is fresh, not too hard, not too greasy. The filling has some spiciness. 

Traditional naan and paratha are fresh and soft when they're warm. Eat it right away and use it for dipping. I use mine to clean up the sauce of the cauliflower and the eggplant. Highly recommend

I'm not sure if it's possible but could someone address the issues with the soft serve machine (maybe the owner)?  Stopped by last evening for a cone and the soft serve was barely able to stand on the cone.  It was a sloppy mess. I don't know if it's a temperature issue with the machine but it's super disappointing to pay formal almost melted ice cream cone :(((( and this seems to be an ongoing problem at this location.

Our daughter works at KOP and we met her for dinner about three weeks ago after her shift and shopping.  We put our names at the hostess station and were given an alerting device.
