Over the years I've been there several times and as much as I want to love it I cannot.

It's too loud, too crowded and too darned expensive to park at.  I feel any place that requires me to go into a gated lot to park and then doesn't even have validated parking is just.. Meh.

Having said that, I've no doubt i'll be back because it IS a good place to go with your friends when you don't mind it being crowded and loud and you just want to drink a lot of beer and eat a lot of oversized appetizer plates. but the cons just outweigh the pros for me to keep me WANTING to come back.

Old Spaghetti Factory is the Better Half of the Yelp Couple's favorite place to eat.  Before I knew this, I made the mistake of complaining about the parking.  Now I go whenever she asks.

For the sake of this review, I will complain about Parking.

If you can't find a parking lot on the street, the closest parking is TEN DOLLARS.  Fortunately Spaghetti Factory is inexpensive and gives you a lot of food. This tends to soften the blow somewhat, but its still a cost for the overall experience.

On my most recent visit, we all had the pleasure of sitting in the "Caboose", something I had never done. Overall everything was on par with expectations, but the waiter seemed a bit distracted and not fully focused on the job at hand.  Also, the free ice cream may have possibly just arrived from the Arctic.  It was cold enough I was able to flip the bowl upside down without having it follow the force of gravity to the table.

I have no doubt I'll be back whenever my better half demands it of me.

Love their beans and enchiladas. Quality is consistent. I have eaten here many times since they opened. 

I am a fan and recommend it highly.

Delicious but so over the top. This is where you go on a date or out with a girlfriend to share a super rich piece of $20 cake. It's good, don't get me wrong, but it's a once in a while kind of thing.

I have a part-time job in South Reno, and we frequently head to BJs after work to let off some steam.  I'm not a sports fan, so the TVs aren't really my thing.  But I think of it as something of a sports bar/ restaraunt, so I don't necessarily think they're out of place.  (I know that's not how they advertise, but the TVs make it so.)  

I've had variable experience with the service.  They're always nice, but sometimes they're *very* slow.  We've had them forget to put in the order of one person or another at the table multiple times.  They typically don't charge for the meal they forget and add a free dessert when they do that, at least, but you'd think they'd do something to preven the problem in the first place...  It is loud in here during busy times, but it fits in with my thinking of it as a sports bar.  Not a good place for quiet conversation, that's for sure.

I do like the food.  I can't think of a time I've been disappointed with it...  The pizzas are wonderful (though they do take awhile; order a salad to start with!), the salads are great, the sandwiches are decent, and the pasta dishes are delicious.  Not a huge selection of desserts (who doesn't have cheesecake???), but what you can get is good.  

Be prepared for a wait if you go Friday or Saturday night!  They do sometimes offer samples of their food (typically pizza) when they know they're telling people long wait times; that's always nice.  I recommend trying BJs, but I'm only giving it 3 stars because service issues are my big pet peeve.

I ventured (in the rain, on my bike......uphill both ways?) to BRU for sips one stormy evening, and was very excited to check this place out after hearing great things.  Maybe it was the fact that I (and everyone else) was soaked, and stinky, and miserable... but this place seemed a bit too cramped for my style.  The place is long and narrow which forces everyone to squish past one another to get to the bar.  I liked how they had a side bar set up in the back, which helped... but not really.

After a while we were able to snag a table in the back, and we ordered a pretzel off of the regular menu (with gouda cheese, nom nom).  Not too sure what the waitress heard, because she brought us the regular pretzel off of the Sips menu... and we were fine with that considering the sips pretzel was much cheaper, or so we thought.  When we got the bill, what did we see?  We were charged for the gouda pretzel.  Malarkey!  The waitress apologized but basically said there was nothing she could do.  

Meh.  If the gang wanted to hit this place back up again I'm sure I'd tag along... but I'll probably take my german cravings elsewhere.

My 1st venture here was a tasty treat! I wanted a soup; but not pho. The Bun Bo Hue sounded good, as I was in the mood for something spicy. I was told it could be made w/o pork, so I went for it. Asked if I wanted the spice level toned down to which I replied "no." It was delicious.Very spicy yes!!! w/a nice lemongrass kick. Didn't care much for the tendons, and wished there was some more beef, but it was very enjoyable.The noodles(wheat) were thick and al dente. Abundant fresh herbs& stuff were a great addition.As was a side of dipping sauce; which was a great hot sauce w/ a dab of something in the middle, which can best be described as a nuoc nam paste.

The woman who owns  the place was very helpful and friendly. She was stuffing wontons as she explained the other soups on the menu.They all sounded great! Menu is small- mostly pho, banh mi, rice platters and 5 other soups containing noodles or wontons.

The place is small, but tidy. There are only 2 tables, so you may not be able to dine-in.They do deliver, but I'm too far away.

Looking forward to returning to try something different. This place is the real deal.

I was originally excited about my plans to dine at Table 31 because their website makes you think it's a great restaurant. Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed. From the bread basket & red pepper olive oil (the bread was cold and tasteless, and so was the olive oil sauce), to the vegetable dish (everything came fried even though it didn't say "fried" anywhere on the menu), everything was below average. The atmosphere is modern and trendy, but it was quite empty on a weekend evening for dinner...

Something is amiss at Pita Jungle.  That "something" is the service.  Today marks my third return to PJ since my original review and the service has always fallen short since my original visit.  I still like the Happy Hour menu and the great price on beverages but the service makes me crazy.  The server has forgotten items or gotten items incorrect on all three recent occasions.  Today was not an exception.  I went with a couple of friends after work (neither had been to Pita J prior) and we were ready for some yummy tapas and drinks.  We sat on the patio, which is a must in Tucson during the fall!  We were one of three tables on the patio and inside had very little patrons.  We ordered our drinks and food promptly.  The drinks came and were correct.  Our food arrived (my olives were forgotten) but we did not have silverware.  In due time, our server came and noticed we didn't have silverware.  She brought it and eventually my olives came.  Round two.  My friends ordered a 2nd drink but I did not.  Our server brought their drinks and emptied more wine into my glass that was not quite empty yet.  Weird. I never ordered a 2nd glass but yet was charged for the 2nd glass.  I may have eventually ordered another glass but I didn't at that point.  My friends requested separate checks, as we were paying with cards and the server put an additional item on my check.  Minor glitch which she corrected but I wish she would've corrected charging me for a 2nd glass of wine that I didn't request. Sigh.  It's a great HH menu.  I will stick by that fact and may return to Pita Jungle again but I'm not rushing back.

A friend and I met for lunch and selected Yokohama based upon a high recommendation from her co-worker. Neither of us had been here before so we were excited to try a new sushi location for lunch.

As we pulled in I remembered this location as a marvelous Cafe from years ago. The parking is limited in front to 4 spots with additional parking in the back. They have steps on one side of the entrance with a large ramp on the another side. This is an older, large, two story house with small interior rooms. Seating consists of several regular height tables and 4 high top tables.

Our server was top-notch and took our drink orders immediately while distributing two sushi and a Japanese menu.  

Each lunch category has 5 different selections to choose from. The Benton Box ($12.95) and Lunch Entrees ($9.95) options are served with miso soup, salad and rice. The Sushi Lunches ($14.95) are served with miso soup and salad. The Noodle Lunches ($9.95) are served with salad only. For larger appetizers they serve the Japanese favorite Bento Boxes. Tokohama also offers a 5 Vegetarian options and a large selection of Sushi rolls.

We ordered the 6 piece Veggie Tempura ($9), 5 piece Gyoza ($6 fried dumplings), Miso Soup, 8 piece Volcano Roll ($17) and Yaki Udon soup ($9)  which came with a salad/ginger dressing.

The Veggie Tempura had large veggie pieces deep fried to a light golden brown.  The homemade Gyoza, deep fried or pan seared, Japanese Pork Dumplings were my favorite appetizer. The wonderful house sauce was delicious on the savory deep fried pork dumplings. The salad was very fresh and crisp with ginger dressing and the miso soup was very flavorful. The Yaki Udon Beef soup, (enough for 3 if sharing) was served in a large, hot pot with sauteed veggies, slices of beef and Japanese thick noodles. The thick noodles are much easier to attempt with chop sticks. The Volcano Roll was luscious with different layers of flavors from the shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, asparagus and topped with cooked shrimp. The roll has just a touch of spice. The Volcano Roll presentation was in a foil sail boat shape. Adorable!! All of the dishes had such thoughtful presentations. Everything was delicious and we were so full after lunch!! But we didn't regret one bite.

Yokohama have two terrific rooms upstairs for larger groups and each room sits 14 comfortably. The rooms have large screen TVs and are equipped for Karaoke. 8 or more people are needed to reserve a room. They request reservations, or least 24 hr advance notification, in order to have one dedicated server. 

I look forward to returning to sample different sushi rolls, especially the Tsunami Roll. We both loved the food and the service was excellent. 

Lunch is served 11 - 2 p.m. Tuesday through Friday. Dinner is served 4 p.m. - 9 p.m. Monday through Friday. Saturday and Sunday dinner is served 2 - 9 p.m. Don't miss this little gem in Greenwood on Madison Ave.

We have become fans of Loco's Mexican Restaurant and often meet our friends here that live downtown. Street parking is available on 22nd Street or Delaware. As you enter the restaurant you'll see the carryout window. Turn left and go thru the door and you'll be directly in front of the hostess stand. The large, full bar is attractive and to the right as you enter. 

Seating consists of large booths,  banquette seating, bar and weather permitting, patio seating. Large groups could be seated on the banquette seating if all available.

The menu has a wonderful selection from the complimentary chips and salsa to jalapeno poppers, ten buffalo chicken wings to nachos with steak, chicken and shrimp loaded with toppings. If you prefer fries to chips try the Crazy Nachos with beef or chicken. The Guacamole Fresco is so fresh and filled with flavor. If you like Guacamole try this generous appetizer. 

The menu offers a lunch menu as well as the entrees we all love. Several versions of salads, quesadillas, burritos, enchiladas, chimichangas or 3 tacos with rice and charro beans cover many of the entrees. Fajitas and Loco's specialities round out the menu. The Chili Colorado is one of my husband's favorites. A Tilapia filet, Fajita Fish, Seafood Enchiladas or Cameron's de la Diabla is available for those looking for seafood. The Tio's Combo is popular with a chicken burrito, enchilada and chimichanga all smothered in chili con queso. The Seafood Enchiladas or the Enchiladas Ranchero are two of my favorites. 

The service has always been good and we've been well taken care of. If you love fresh ingredients, good appetizers and entrees, visit Loco's Mexican restaurant.

I dined here with a group of friends (9 of us) on New Years Eve and the whole experience gave me mixed feelings. We originally had reservations for 7 p.m. and finally get sat at 7:40. Not too happy about this, considering they sat smaller parties before us. The hostess looked more frazzled than I have ever seen anyone look! Now on to dinner... We knew things were not going to go well when the waitress screwed up our drink order. Coke and water for everyone. How hard is it? Things got better after this. Dinner was great. We all ordered hibachi and the amount of food for the price was well worth the hassle beforehand. We all left with full bellies! I would recommend this place based on the food. I will try it again but definitely not on a holiday!

Whether you're looking to sip on a cocktail at the bar, have lunch with a colleague or romantic dinner, Doris Metropolitan is undoubtedly one of the best spots in the French Quarter.

The warm and charming staff makes it a goal to ensure that every experience is one to remember, and you can tell it's not just a job for them. It's a lifestyle. Every server, bartender and employee I've had an interaction with genuinely enjoys being a part of the team and is thrilled to have you walk through the door. 

The bartenders are bar geniuses. I haven't had a bad drink. The summer cocktail menu is one you won't want to miss. As for wine drinkers, the selection is impressive and the servers are happy to assist in the perfect pairing for your meal.

The food - you'll want to come hungry. The server will bring a few different breads, three butter options and an olive oil dipping plate. The wasabi butter is my personal favorite, but it's all delicious. The Tuna Tar Tar is a must for a starter, but don't stop there. Get a few appetizers to start, perhaps the Artichoke Flower Salad or the Sweet Breads. 

No matter what steak you order, it will be cooked to perfection. If you're unsure of the best cook on a cut, ask your server and they'll be happy to offer a suggestion. For those not into steak, there are other options including chicken, sea bass and more. Share a few sides with your entree. My personal favorite are the Root Purée, Truffled Polenta and the Truffle Fries. No matter what you order, in my experience, you can't go wrong.

Save room for dessert. There are several delicious options whether your in the mood for a Mediterranean inspired dish or something very sweet.

After a year or so of being a decent  place  to eat.  This  place has gone right back down hill again.   The food was horrible with a lot of it lukewarm food.  The chicken was dried out. The beef was tough and lukewarm.   The place was a dirty mess. Avoid!

Oh the flavors! This place is fantastic- tried several different items on the menu to share; steam buns, pork dumplings, wings and the monster sushi roll.  Everything was so flavorful and fresh- I'm still dreaming about those dumplings a week later! The drinks are fun too- I had the drink with the layer of Nerds on top and although the candy was sweet the drink itself was very earthy- it was a great balance.  Can't wait to go back next time I'm in Tucson.

I am a fan of Chiptole, but this was definitely the worst experience I had. I walked in for a carry out. The staff did not great us, and only acknowledged us by stating that they were at full capacity. I understand they are doing the best they can, and have half the seats available, but with such a small restaurant it seemed odd that they had any seating open especially with how the line flows. Other customers were not following the flow signs that tell you were to stand for spacing. Once I ordered a bowl, and the lettuce had ice cubes in it, and I had a ton of ice cubes topping my bowl. They also forgot our drink, so we had to wait a bit for the cashier to come back. Overall, it was very disorganized and food was not the best quality.

"Their liverwurst is better than most sex I've had".--Actual quote we overheard from someone here.

Beer list is good and the wait staff is very nice and patient, even when they are busy, but not in a rush to go back. 

Pretty loud atmosphere, and the food menu is limited. Not looking to have 100 options, but just surprised they didn't have a couple more conventional options.

If I am going to do German, would go to Brauhaus Schmitz or Frankford Hall.

Just might not be right for me.

Sorry.  I'm done with this joint.  I love the crowds, love the worn out ambiance, I like being able to get cottage cheese on the side.  Good parking too. But it's over priced (14 dollars for a middling Rueben), the food is often tasteless (don't try the borscht) and the sides are lousy.  If you decide to get cake-- because it looks good-- ask which one is fresh because they will leave them out there for weeks.   Once great, now unremarkable -- Goodbye Shapiro's!  (Buy a tee shirt on your way out!  They really are cool.)

This place has the best overpriced food you ever try! 
I have come here for years and got egg and cheese bagel and it was always around 3$-4$. Today it was $9! I get no meat, no sauce. Is it going to blow my mind? Probably not! Will I ever come back here for any of my breakfast/ lunch/ bakery needs? Never! 
This is not inflation. This is just not ok.

This has got to be the worst Chinese buffet I have ever eaten at. I came here for lunch once and the food was cold. There were empty trays everywhere. Quality was horrible. Place seems to be clean and waitress was attentive. I gave it another chance and decided to come here for dinner thinking maybe the food would be different and better during dinner. EVERYTHING was the exact same. Same food. Same condition. Costs more. Empty trays and whatever was available was cold. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

First impression was great. Small local spot, good bar vibe. Food was amazing! Service was phenomenal! Sophia, the cute server, was very knowledgeable about the menu and didn't miss a beat. Probably the best tri-tip ever, and I happen to go on tues tri-tip special night. Will be back regularly and will bring friends and family. Jill, props and love your way.

My husband, brother-in-law, and our friend went her on a whim today.  Somehow the lunch plans changed from sushi, to pizza, and ultimately ended on this place.  NOT my choice, as seafood restaruants offer no variety for vegetarians, but I went along, figuring I'd try something new, and perhaps would be pleasantly surprised.

Unfortunately, that was not the case.  From the time we walked in, til the time we left, it was one dissapointment after another.  First, even though the restaurant was almost empty, we had to wait for them to clear a booth for us, even though there were PLENTY of clear booths, the hostess clearly *had* to seat us in a specific section.  As a former hostess and waitress, I get that, but I would never had made a customer wait just so I could keep the section rotation in line.  You seat the people, and fix the rotation next go-round.

As far as the rest of the service, it was pretty slow in general.  Our waitress seemed like a nice enough person, but just didn't have a certain level of professionalism I expect.  

Next, as expected, the selection of vegetarian meals was limited.  In fact, I found just one - the black bean and veggie quesadilla.   (Admittedly, it may be unfair for me to judge a place on this particular criteria, since their main thing is seafood, but it's my review and I'll judge how I want!)  When the question of what was included with the meal arose (that section of the menu said it came with a choice of fries, cole slaw, or a salad), she said that that particular meal did not come with that selection, rather "Spanish stuff.  Like rice and stuff."  When I got my meal, there was no rice or other "Spanish stuff" other than the quesadilla itself, and some pico de gallo.

The next offense was my brother-in-law's meal.  He ordered a turkey club, and specified no tomatos.  The club arrived with tomatos.  The waitress blamed the cook and took it back.  The cook clearly just removed the tomatos, rather than re-make the sandwich.  When my BIL called her out on that, she asked "do you have an allergy?"  It doesn't matter - he asked for no tomatos!  Then she tried telling him that the red stuff he saw on the sandwich was not tomato, but cranberry sauce or something.  Whatever.  BIL is, btw, in the restaurant industry and admittedly a tough critic, but the way she handled this situation was poor.

When it was time for the check, we had a long wait.  The next major problem was that she charges us for an extra appetizer that we did not order, and had to wait another 10 minutes for her to bring us a new check.  Ugh.  The manager did give us some $10 coupons to use, but I an assure you that we won't be using them.

I visited this place for a small wedding reception that was being held upstairs in the group room.  The room is available for rental, and it has two long tables, along with a few small square tables, and can probably fit about 20 people comfortably.

The décor inside the upper room is very drab and old, and not a place I would ever think of hosting my own party.  It reminds me of an aged party room at a Round Table Pizza parlor, where the walls always seem to be off white and the lighting is never good.

On other hand, the food they serve is not bad.  We had pre-made burritos and chips and soft-shell tacos and salsa available.  The burritos are large and stuffed full of refried beans and cheese.  It's definitely a mouthful and fills you up very fast.  The spicy salsa is DELICIOUS, and something that I enjoyed very much.  The chips are just your basic restaurant-grade tortilla chips - nothing to write home about.

Overall, the décor is nothing to celebrate, and falls far short of the normal expectation for a place where an celebration is taking place, but the food is the saving grace of this place and keeps the rating at three stars.
